Everyone made sure our stay was excellent. Very attentive, clean hotel, great pool staff. Good movies on tv in rooms. Awesome breakfast. The stone massages were great and relaxing and the service desk really helped me out with checking in for my flight when I had difficulty with the Chinese website
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
A very good property, good staff , excellent location, good choice of food in breakfast for Veg.
a lot of activity for children , foam bath on weekends major attraction.couples with children must stay in this property.
Price a bit too high

very hospitable staff, good rooms, excellent food.....a complete fun place. 
This was our 3rd stay at Hard rock, the kings club floor is awesome. The pool is excellent with multiple activities scheduled.

We just stayed for one night, we had a room with a pool view,the bed was quite soft and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was also excellent,plenty to choose from.There was also plenty of loungers alongside the pool. All in it was very good value for money,and if you bought anything from the souvenir shop there was a discount. I would stay again.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: A nice hotel overall, a little pricey however. If your planning on drinking or eating around the pool all day expect a Hefty bill. Saying that though the pool is great, very large and relaxing, more of a younger crowd and small groups. There is stuff for the kids though, basketball in the pool and things to do. Rooms are done to a high spec although some are a little small. Overall it's a nice place though and great location.

A great place to unwind, great Internet service, comfortable rooms. I hired one of the  the cabana's next to the pool every day, I could sit in comfort, have power for my laptop in a relaxed environment . Fridge next to me and i could lie back on the double bed with great views of the pool and scenery . Several restaurants and great food from the Hard Rock cafe.

After a very long journey from the UK we arrived at the Hard Rock Hotel in Pattaya, we had to wait 15 minutes before we could check in due to the lack of check in staff. When we finally started the check in process the member of staff who served me was so miserable she made me feel very unwelcome and uncomfortable. The overall check in process took 30 minutes and was like a sketch from "Faulty Towers", it was so unorganised it was unbelievable. When we finally got to our room I had problems with my air con, so overall a very bad experience, If I hadn't of felt so exhausted from traveling I would have gone to another hotel. The hotel rooms are a good size and the bed was comfortable but the service has been shocking at times, I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Location is very good, close to the beach, but not the sea view room. The rooms are fully equipped and the downstairs swimming pool can swim.Guard can speak Chinese, and he help us called the tutu car

We are a long time customers at the hard Rock Hotel Pattaya, we come here almost 2 to 3 times a year. Always love the pool, staff entertainment for kids the facility the hotel room. The location is great, HOWEVER for some reason the food has changed dramatically from the last year or two. BREAKFAST USED TO BE SO WONDERFUL AND NOW SO SO. THE PRICE OF BUMPED UP AND MORE MORE EXPENSIVE. The in room facilities like Coffee and  tea is used to be better now they use instant coffee. I love the staff so much that's why I go back there. The entertainment staff just superb my kids love them all and they're the reason why we must  go back to stay there again. I wish to hotel can improve their food standards.

Your hotel has a good location and decent facilities BUT when traveling overseas especially with young children safety is always top priority. Sadly your hotel fails in this regard. During my stay there was a fully drunk guest who started verbally abusing my 11 year son near the elevators in front of my wife and 7 year old daughter. When I asked him to stop he started threatening and abusing me. At this stage my daughter who was in a state of shock started crying so we turned away and headed to our room. I then immediately notified the duty manager who replied that they cannot stop people from drinking, it’s not their problem and basically there is nothing they can do about it, even though the same drunk guy still was roaming around in the lobby.  I understand that you can not babysit your guest but surely you can do something when they startharassing and abusing other guest. Even a 1 star hotel would show more care about their guest especially ones with young children. I will never return to your hotel again and would strongly recommend holiday inn or intercontinental resort instead.

My son likes the pool for children bery much. I came on Saturday and there was foam party for children at 5pm. Although it's windy but the water is not too cold. We will come again for sure. The deluxe city view is pretty for us, but only toilet door sometimes it was difficult to unlock.

Lovely place to stay 
Beautiful clean pool with lots of areas to relax, sun bathe. Clean rooms. Friendly hotel staff and restaurant was great. Directly across from beach. Walking distance to malls and restaurants

I will never regret staying in Hard Rock. This is the latest edition of my experience with Hard Rock beside Bali, Penang and many more.
The service is good from check in till check out. The front desk is so helpful. The bell boy named Rin is superb. He make transport arrangement for my family to travel Pattaya. Room is good!
Swimming pool is suitable for the kids and always a life guard on duty. 
Breakfast is average but you can't complaint more is there are serving different menu everyday during my 4 days there.
Will return when they have good room rates...
Well done to all at Hard Rock Pattaya and keep it up.

Good Point :1)Service 2)Location
Bad Point : 1)High price of Cabana(2,200THB/Day) 2)Very less bed at swimming pool 3)Very small kids club 4)Very small elevator 5)A lot of Ants in our room and it bit my kids
column4: จุฬาวิศว์ เ

column3: Great hotel for family stay the pool is super clean and fun a lot of activities from hotel , location is close to everything. The view from the room is fantastic.,for sure we will comeback again highly recommend!

We looked at a few reviews before we arrived about the hotel as we had stayed in the resort 4 times. We had been in the hotel for meals and the foam parties. 
After reading the reviews we where expecting the holiday to be a flop.
There was 4 children in our group 4,6.8 and a 12 year old. The children loved every minute we stayed at the hotel. We stayed for 3 weeks. The staff were the best they rocked for the whole time we where. They made the holiday. Every member of the hotel staff where friendly happy and always helping you.
The rooms where of good size clean and where all being done up. We had a seaview superior room which was lovely.
The location of the hotel is central and just a short walk to the department stores.
The hotel amenities where second to none 
The only down fall was we had to come home. No the foam party was a little busy and alot of young people where in the pool.
Overall it was a real good holiday and dont let some of the reviews put you off.
The hotel is good the food alittle dear you can eat out for alot less. Will be going back soon

Very nice stay at the hard rock hotel. Very friendly staff and a great location. The pool is active and always something going on. Always pool chairs available and never too busy. I would definitely stay here again.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: It was a memorable experience to stay in Hard Rock Hotel. I managed to get some collector's edition T-shirt for self and a loved one. Nevertheless the experience was a totally amazing. The friendly atmosphere and workers.

Cracking burgers and rocking tunes. My kids loved it and wanted to get a t-shirt each so we went along for them. We all ended up really enjoying it. The band was top notch and the setting is great. The drinks are pricey(especially the cocktails) so the bill was up into the 1,000's of baht but worth it as a one off night out while on holiday in Thailand.

I was told that the t-shirt Was free and the coffee cups to ,must have been a misunderstanding. The location is very good and the people very friendly. food was just fair and drinks where to weak .overall ok
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
On my  2nd visit .
Stayed there for a night .Location great ! Superior Rooms nicely decorated & equipped but small !
Staff very warm and helpful ! L
Place full of life . Good for fun lovers, lonlies , family ...all .

Plenty of fun things to do around the hotel. The buildings are a little aged but still well maintained. The free guitar for loan was great fun. Could improve on the breakfast selections. I had a great time at Hard Rock Pattaya.

A great stay over Wan Lai celebration time. The Hard Rock team looked after us well. The weather was scorching hot so the pool was very inviting. Hard Rock Cafe was up to the usual. High standards for food and cocktails I have come to expect

i travelled from Bangkok early in the morning. The check in process was very smooth and managed to get the room before 2 PM. While waiting for the room to be ready, we were able to use the facilities such as swimming pool. However, we couldnt find the way to the shower room. also, there are lots of activities provided such as muay thai, roxity kids club but we did not been informed during check in as this was my 1st experience staying in HRH.

Absolute perfection.    The room rates are very reasonable the pool is huge and there is live entertainment weekly by the pool.   The rooms are large and very modern  and the food is delicious.  The staff really make this hotel the best hotel in Pattaya and I have a long list of superlatives .  10/10 is the best description of this hotel .This really is a “home from home “ hotel that many frequent travellers like myself require. The spa and Muay lessons are excellent too as is the Hard Rock Cafe with live music every evening .Congratulations hard rock hotel Pattaya you do a wonderful job 😀. I will be visiting hard rock Bali soon .  I’ve also had a great time at your locations in vegas and Ibiza too .

Fantastic hotel for family's , 5 star swimming pool, breakfast was very good with plenty of variety. Close to the beach,walking distance to the shopping mall. The staff were very professional and went out of there way to make your stay a pleasant and memorable.

The joints of the tiles in the shower room were moldy. I felt the worst feeling when showering.It was a pity that the shower room was dirty just because the feeling was good overall in the hotel. I would like to ask you to review the cleaning of the shower room.

The whole team from Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya made this 50th official visit to Hard Rock Cafe and Hotel a unique, very special and memorable moment for me. Especially to highlight someone who was not correct, but the young lady at the front desk europe, i would like to say thank you again, for all that she has made possible for me. i am already in Singapore for visiting the next Hard Rock Cafes and Hotels, but none of them will remain in my memory like Pattaya, many, many Thanks for that and i hope i will see this beautiful place with all its fantastic staff again

Great hotel. We stayed for 3 nights. Brilliant pool and activities for children our son had a great time. Thoroughly recommended. Great location close to everything. The food in the barbecue buffet is amazing! Staff really friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

The best feature of this hotel is the excellent location. Located right at the center of the famous Beach Road and about 15 minutes walk from the hub of night life- the Walking Street, this hotel offers great facilities at a reasonable price. I stayed here during Songkran and the hotel made special arrangements for ensuring the best celebrations on the Beach Road by organising DJs and foam party. 
Rooms are very good with good interiors. Some of the rooms overlook the sea, which adds to the scenic view from the room. The complementary breakfast was excellent and very elaborate. Hotel has a very good swimming pool, part of the pool has been developed like a natural beach with sand and huts around it. Hotel staff was nice and cooperative. Overall, the location, cost and facilities make it a very good choice to stay in Pattaya.

Good spacious rooms with great ocean and Pattaya city views. The rooms are completely self sufficient with all amenities provided like cloaks, mini bar, snacks mini fridge, personalized welcome screen with great content on TV, in room safe, umbrella for sun or rain. The property has a huge swimming pool with regular pool activities. Buffet breakfast provided is quite scrumptious and has a large spread. Also on the property is the Hard Rock café where live band plays regularly with good rock music and takes customers requests.

Upon arriving at Hard Rock Pattaya I was a bit tired from the long drive down on the highway. I was very satisfied with the assistance I received from the door staff and concierge! I was soon reclining by the pool with a cock tail!! 
Cannot rate Hard Rock enough the room service was fantastic the poolside bar was great! 
Only down side was the distance to the Main Street of Pattaya.

I stayed here with my wife and 2 kids aged 14.  We had two rooms side by side. Enjoyed our stay here very much.  Front desk people very eager to help with any requests. Housekeeping great. Management always advised if there was an event on at the pool which may be noisy and offered to change room if needed. Rooms very clean with good tv selection. First time I have stayed at a Hard Rock hotel and Hard Rock them was great, having souvenir items on display (Elvis suit) and electric guitars on display which you can request to play in your room free of charge.
Pool area is excellent with sandy beach / rock pool feature. Had a couple of small slides for little kids.  Fairly big pool.  A little cloudy but I believe that would be from the sand feature.
Wireless internet for a fee. Breakfast was pretty good. Evening meals a little expensive. Hard Rock cafe attached to premises. Gym was one of the best hotel gyms I've seen.
Great location at hotel rates are priced really good.  Would definitely stay here again.

Hard Rock has always been same around the world with best swimming pools and staffs. The rooms we booked were sea facing and pool facing. The rooms were comfortable and big and also the showers. I loved the breakfast and location.
Foam party every Saturday is amazing for hotel guests at discounted rates. Although the drinks included and the guy who served was little rude and they only had Vodka.
But i would surely recommend this hotel for anyone who is going to Pattaya.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I've been staying at Hard Rock hotel since 2007 and every time I have thouroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff are really friendly and happy to chat and help anytime. The hotel is very family friendly and is very safe with 24 hr security. The pool area is awesome with good music and activities all day long. Every Saturday night there is a foam party which can be a lot of fun. This hotel has quite a decent gym which is free to guests and is ample for holiday workouts.
The hard rock cafe is a great place to chill and have a few cocktails before heading out for the night. They usually have a live band performing. The location is great. Walk across the road and you are at the beach, or catch a 10B taxi ride to Walking street. It's a short 5 min walk to Central Pattaya shopping mall which has everything.
All in all, you won't be dissapointed with this hotel. Shop around for a good rate.
Special thanks to Ann, JJ and Ralph - you guys rock!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We stayed in the Rock Royalty floor and used the lounge. The washroom in the lounge was deadly dirty. Their line of food was dissapointing. Breakfast was below our expectations. We have stayed here several years ago and remember the breakfast we had was better than this.

Arrived after a long trip within Thailand, and had an absolutely great night's sleep.
Business as usual for the next couple of nights, but overall enjoyed the stay. Looking forward to coming back again in the near future.

Simply, we love this chain of hotels. The room s are fabulously decorated with the sea view being worth the extra few pounds. Great swimming pool with fun entertainment laid on such as the foam party and water volleyball. The food was excellent by the pool and the breakfast was amazing. Great location on the beach road and very close to the bars and shops.  
Best thing about this hotel were the happy, smiley and very helpful staff who made our visit hassle free. The Hard Rock Cafe adjacent is worth a mention for having the best live rock band in Pattaya (The Moses Band) brilliant!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I think It need generally little more bright Lighting. Specially Entrance part is still little dark.  
If It is little more bright all guest get feeling more safety and comfort.
Other thing is OK for me.

Good clean comfortable hotel. Must recommend to everyone who is visiting Pattaya. 
Good pool and pool side entertainment. Joey and Roony they r good bunch of lads always smiling willing to help. 
Had some great pool side games with these lads. 
Drink and food is little more then the bats outside as this is a five star hotel. 
But one can only go out have meals outside. 
We had few drinks here everyday by the pool then ventured out to the bars. 
Nice quite family kind of atmosphere we loved it. 
A must visit Hotel foam party is the best one on Saturday👍🏼

Stayed for two nights and whilst nothing was bad it was …. average.   Check in seemed to take an age with even the minute details of the mini bar were spelt out – such as water in bathroom was complimentary but water in fridge was an extra charge.  And then we were given a room on a smoking floor despite answering the question about room choice three times that a non-smoking room was required.
Rooms are tired and showing their age, along with the bathroom showing signs of grubbiness.  Shower was poor due to blocked nozzles through lack of cleaning.
Breakfast was an … average choice, and incredibly noisy.  Although the staff were very efficient at seating, and clearing tables as well as ensuring the range of food was maintained, even pre preparing eggs and omelettes – a smart move.
Overall, it seems the hotel struggles to cope with the turnover and number of guests which seemed to be predominately families and Russians.  I would look elsewhere for a good quality hotel in town.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: This is the best hotel experience we have ever had. The people working here are the best, so smiling and friendly. The pool area is very nice, with activities for everyone and sometimes live music. Good breakfast and good food in the restaurant. All in all ,very good quality and very clean hotel.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Last month was our 2nd visit to Hard Rock Pattaya and once again we loved it especially the kids .The staff were so friendly and the location is great .The kids were entertained from morning to evening around the pool area .They also have a teenage kids club which they loved.  Will be going again in September.

Great resort located in the heart of Pattaya Beach Road and situated directly across from the beach. Just a baht bus away from Walking Street, The Shopping Mall, and many Seafood Restaurants. The Hard Rock Hotel is also very family friendly offering lots of daytime time activities to entertain children.

Very nice hotel in the pictures, and teh grounds, pool etc. are well kept.  That is all.  The overall hotel insode was very very poor.  Hallways had ripped and stained carpets, as did the rooms.  Bathrooms looked like a 5$ motel and were very dirty.
Kids in the hallways at all hours running, playing etc.  The real clue here is the clothes drying racks on the balcanoies, and the complimentary 4 boxes of condoms in your room above the coffee maker!  This is a poorly run hotel with terrible maintenance.  I suspect Hard Rock only licensed thier name to it.  More of a get drunk on the beach, pick up a Thai lady of the street and then head back to your room.  You would NOT want to take a girlfriend, fiance, or wife to this hotel.  One step away from being a brothel.  At least the bedding was changed daily.

We travel by car and there was nice parking, the rooms are okej, could be bigger but the pool area is excellent and the food selection on the breakfast brunch is one of the best theres also plenty of activitys for familys with children and helpfull staff for what you pay its Alright

there is a lot of improve possible at the stuffs mentality, special the people in charge needs to understand they are there to make the customers happy. prices for drinks and food are at high level, i guess a lot of guests prefer eat and drink outside as we did because of the big gab between.

From check-in to check-out, everything about this hotel is superb and will not hesitate to come back in future outing with the family. The rooms were cozy and clean with all the amenities you need, the food was very good, the view was fantastic and friendly and courteous staff. Overall, it was an excellent stay.

Stayed for two days with friends in this hotel which is famous for it’s signature style and ‘The’Hard Rock Café! We were greeted warmly upon arrival and got impressed by its plush main lounge which combines stylish rock and roll vibe. Although the property is not a brand new one but decently maintained. We requested to provide us all four rooms on the same floor since we were travelling with friends, there was some confusion among hotel front staff and we were made to wait for some time and finally approached with ‘king club rooms’ which had separate beds. We decided to adjust and requested to combine the beds which a hotel staff had managed clumsily. Leaving aside the initial hiatus we were very impressed with the size of the room, styling and thematic room decor. Each room has a Philips media player and the hotel provides free Wi-Fi access. The breakfast spread was impressive with wide variety of choices. But since it is a big 350 room hotel the place gets crowded if you arrive a little late for breakfast. The pool is huge with a nice layout with different experience sections. A portion of the pool has an artificial sand beach with huts but I personally liked the wide and clean portion of the pool which offers space for all even if the pool is crowded. The iconic guitar neck mounted beside the hard rock café’ was going through some renovation and it was covered with a canvas somewhat diminishing the appeal of the building facade. The Hard Rock Store in the lounge sells the iconic Hard Rock logo –T-shirt and collectible pins, perfect souvenir to return home with. We were touring most of the time and missed the opportunity of spending time in the iconic Hard Rock Café which normally offers quality rock performances live!
A nice experience overall but a little higher priced.

Perfect hotel! We don’t know more can expect. The pool is amacing, big and have deep and lower parts. Employees were very very very kind but not slippery. In the Pool is every day some activities and competitions also to adults. Atmosphere is relaxed, food is good and tasty. Hotel has its own Hard Rock Shop and Hard Rock Café and shop is in the same area, beside the pool. We can highly recommend this hotel for everybody, couples, families or singles.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Everything was perfect. Great staff, delicious food, lot of entertainment. We liked to watch The Unlimited every night, they are very talented. But your rooms could be a little bit better. Other than that, we had a great stay.

I am impressed by the rooms - really comfy beds, hot water available, a lot of space in the room, view from room was great and variety of movies available in the room. Breakfast was also really good, good spread :) Also, most importantly - great service by all staff there. I felt really welcomed and would love to come back again!

Near to beach, walking distance to Pattaya shopping areas, lots of activities in the hotel too. Avoid room near to the swimming pool otherwise please request high floor as the room sound proof wasn’t that good esp if you are party person and prefer more private time. Because there is a foam party on Saturday night , the loud music and party night night will drive you crazy. 
There are free movies (quite latest) in hotel room for you to kill time when raining outside. Nothing special for its breakfast, English breakfast and limited option. You may want skip hotel breakfast and eat out instead as there are many good French pastry and coffee shops near the hotel with nice coffee. 
Will stay at hardrock next time when visiting Pattaya, cos the location just too good, but hope to hardrock can have more promotion package!

My wife and I arrived Saturday evening and was taken to the 9th floor lounge to check in as we booked the Deluxe room city view. Checked in within minutes and went straight to our room. I must point out that the view was terrible with a generator making a loud noise. As we were there for almost 3 weeks next morning we called and managed to get another room this time pool/sea view with balcony which made a world of a difference. 
Room wasn't nothing special pretty run down which definitely needs upgrading, room window hadn't been cleaned for months. Balcony was nice but didn't seem like it was cleaned much. Bathroom steams as no ventilation and very poor lighting. 
No where for the ladies to sit and do make up as there's no mirror on table you have to stand in bathroom which is annoying due to bad lighting. 
With our deluxe room we got the free access to the 9th floor lounge which was pretty poor you get a few juice options that's if they've decided to replenish the fridge and a few cakes or a dry sandwich, we also had the evening free drinks and canopy at the soul lounge 6-7.30pm which was same everyday. Mind you they were good to us and ordered different options if asked. Live singing Fri and Saturday in soul lounge but other days it's the same music which became boring. 
Restaurant is expensive and the choice isn't that great. We didn't do the buffet but it looked good. 
On a Saturday they do a BBQ where from morning the pig on the BBQ starts slow cooking for the evening not good to see or smell if you either a Vegetarian or a Muslim it smells the whole hotel out. 
We didn't eat at the cafe so cannot comment but we did drink a few beers there which was ok. 
The swimming pool is great for all ages. Saturday 6 onwards kids pool party, they looked like they were having fun. 9pm onwards for adults we went once bit of a gimmick nothing to shout about. You can easily spend a fair bit at the pool bar as it isn't cheap but that's expected at all hotels I guess. They have fun pools game most days which was fun. 
The staff from front door security right the way to room maids were all so welcoming and always smiled with a hello and always willing to help you no matter what time. 
The location is great and the beach is across the road and walking street is a 15 minute walk or a 2 minute 10 bhatt bus journey away.
We were notified that they are upgrading the facilities so once that's done we will sure be going back.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
The location of the hotel is very close to bars and restaurants. The reception is very slow for 10 minutes, including a check-out with queues took a lot of time. My room was Handicapped equipped and slighty unhygienic. For example, the couch was full of secretions. No balcony and shower room would need to be renewed.
The swimming pool area is large and cozy and also well suited for children. The bar in the pool area is very expensive and, for example, coffee and VSOP cognac cost nearly 20 euros.
The hotel is old and should be renovated. We paid nearly 90 euros per night / room which is far too much compared to the level.

I get free upgrade from city view to seaview. 
The bed was comfy. And breakfast was good
Great tourist guide by hard rock staff (malik). Show us all halal food in pattaya and all great tourist place to visit.

Stayed 3 nights in a Rock Royalty Room w. city view on the 9th floor from the 2nd to 5th of March and enjoyed every minute of it. The room was clean with comfortable beds. It has a fully stocked mini bar and the TV system comes with a slection of free movies, TV shows etc. 
On the club level you have access to a lounge w beverage, snacks, sandwiches etc. all day. At night they serve free drinks and food at the lounge to enjoy while watching the sunset. The staff is extremely accommodating offering help with booking, transport etc. Had breakfast at the lounge every morning. They serve an a la carte breakfast cooked to order, has a selection of bread jam, cheese, fruit etc. You can have breakfast downstairs too but can't comment on that. All in all the lounge is a valuable asset and worth those extra Baths.
The pool area is stunning and there is a lot of staff making your stay as comfortable as possible. The Shack has a nice selection of beverages and food. One afternoon there was a live band playing and from time to time they even cater foam partys if that is your thing.
I worked out in the gym daily. It's basic, but has more equipment than your average hotel gym and it's well maintained. 
Didn't try the spa and only had a beer at Hard Rock Café so can't comment on their food.
The hotel is conveniently located next to the beach and within walking distance from restaurants, bars and all what Pattaya has to offer. In fact I was so pleased with my stay that I booked my next stay there before I left.

Every thing is very good BUT the rooms have no storage at all. No closets.  I was with my family for eight nights. We were very uncomfortable as far as storage was concerned. There were our bags all around the room which made it look bad.
Rest every thing is more than perfect.

Had a great stay. The only comment was the rather over energetic breakfast staff who kept taking everything away each time I popped to get something from the buffet (even my newspaper and magazine was taken which was frustrating as I was reading while eating!). That said, great hospitality and service. Many thanks

Perfect for kids or couples! 
Plenty to do or see, the staff were helpful and the rates were reasonable. Perfect location too if you have never been to Pattaya. If you don't know the place you are always pretty safe booking hard Rock they are always located well. No complaints
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: After three flights totaling over 30 hours of travel, and a nearly hour and a half drive from Bangkok's Suvarnabhumi airport, the Hard Rock hotel offered my family and I a very welcoming, comfortable atmosphere. The hotel is extremely well maintained, very clean, and modernly appointed. It gives off the vibe of a much more expensive property, and was an extremely comfortable multi-night stay. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an energetic, yet comfortable place to stay near Pattaya beach.

It was a enjoyable and fun stay in the hotel. Its makes me and my friends feel welcome and relax that we want to stay another night and return again for the next trip . Except that the bathroom has very less ventilation for the mist coming from the hot water and makes the bathroom felt warm and stuffy . There was also no plastic bag for the trash bin and we find it rude and inconvenient to throw the trash into the bin straight . We also did not have toothbrush , we request for it and they were fast to send it to our room :) We love the stay in the hotel and like to thank all the staff .

I literally mean it - out of whole "Pattaya experience", only Hard Rock hasn't disappointed, and made our stay very nice.
The rooms were clean, the breakfast was fine.
Massages - I definitely recommend all of them (well, may be not the "sticks" one, was a bit painful). In any case a lovely lady named Pim will be there to provide you with professional assistance.
Special thanks to Anne from Guest Service - she has helped to organize a birthday surprise for my friend. Very discrete, very friendly, very professional. Many thanks!
Pete was helping too. At a discussed time, someone knocked on the room door, and the housekeeping team brought in flowers and a cake, singing "Happy birthday". 
Many thanks for that!
Oh, and a personal recommendation: If you get tired to lie down by the pool and what some action, apparently there's wonderful Thai Box coach (Laks!) at the hotel.

There are a few annoying things like the hotel although part of the chain hasn't signed up for the loyalty program so one of the reasons for choosing this hotel immediately went out the window. Then there's the discount you get at all the bars and restaurants because your staying there except the Hard Rock Cafe. It's the little things that make a great hotel and location these guys are close but they charge a Five Star price but only deliver. A four star service. 
The pool area is very nice and nice touch with bands and activities in the afternoon. 
The rooms are nice and the beds and pillows suck you in they are so soft and luxurious. Over all a good place well located just need to lift there game a little bit. I also agree with others the checkin process was tedious and time consuming.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: i visited this hotel on 22nd may 2016 with my wife and kids. it was a holiday tour for us. the hotel is the best in pattaya the staff right from the desk to the service staff is excellent and cooperating. the property is very well maintained and clean. breakfast served is excellent but lags indian breakfast menu other everything is good. we booked a sea view room and the room is very excellent and spacious. the hotel has its own shops for shopping along with a great cafeteria. in a place like pattaya its very safe to stay in hard rock as you will find no type of nuissance goin around in the hotel like other cheap budget hotels. i would recommend this hotel to every traveller who is looking for a safe and good hotel in pattaya, kudos to the staff of the hard rock hotel, shall again visit there soon.

Your people are all very nice，we have a great time at your hotel，i will choose here by the next time.but There is no place to bask in clothes，and we hope that more variety for breakfast,so thanks for your service,we are grateful!

We reached Pattaya on 9th of April and stayed there for 2 days. Awesome Room and view. Happening ambiance and location. Very understanding and welcoming staff. Had an awesome experience. It truly lives up to its name. Thumbs Up to Hard Rock. Cheers.

This is a must place to stay.  Staff are excellent. If you get the chance to do the Kings Club rooms its very good value for money, it includes breakfast in private room or you can use the restaurant down stairs, you also have free snacks and sandwiches and soft drinks and cakes and tea an coffee,  a night you also get some food (buffet style) and free cocktails between 6pm to 7.30pm. Rooms are large and well equipped  and great views, its also right on the beach. Has a Hardrock restaurant and 2 other restaurants  and stunning swimming pool. We're going back this year.

Comfy bed, clean spacious room. TV quite old & lots of noisy Chinese tourists staying also!  Service very good and staff very friendly and helpful. Extras are very pricey so beware, especially the free water.  Can recommend the BBQ in the restaurant on Saturday night the meat is amazing! Overall its a nice hotel you can feel safe in.  I would stay there again!

my trip was there with my family. The staffs were nice and good service. I got free upgrade for the room that was so nice. the dinner buffet was cheap but less choice (i been there for the weekday so im not sure what if it is the weekend which is more expensive) the taste is just so so. the thing that i very disappointed was the sushi bar which is most of them were the veggie rolls, crab stick sushi.i recommended you should stay here but dont buy the buffet dinner .

The Hard Rock Hotel in Pattaya has been one of the most guest friendly hotels I have been to. The property is excellent, and the restaurants serve excellent food as well- especially the breakfast, which is a large spread of american and Thai specialties. 
The staff is extremely helpful and approachable and are always there to help you.
The welcome experience is the best I have ever had and so was the welcome drink- made with lemon grass- I guess!
This hotel is one of a kind when it comes to being child friendly. They have an excellent play area and activity center for kids, and an amazing foam party- every Saturdays 6 pm on wards- this is highly recommended if traveling with kids to Thailand. This is the only hotel which organizes a foam party for children as well as adults- worth staying at when in Pattaya
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The hotel is really outstanding. We enjoyed staying here. The swimming pool is one of the best pool we have experienced. Service staff were very cordial. Since we stayed there during Christmas, we could also enjoy carol and the cupcakes offered by the hotel. Its proximity to the beach is another advantage. Strongly recommended.

Like : -the pool, toilets, rooms and most places are very clean.
Like : -Staff are smart and friendly. They delivered their help to us when they saw us scratched our head in the lobby.
Like : -the complimentary free drum stick!
To be improved (compare to Bali Hardrock, herein "BHR")
-During our stay at BHR, room cleaning services done twice a day (during you leave your room)
-During our stay at BHR, we received a complimentary birthday cake (I stayed in my b'day mth) 
-in BHR, no extra charges for Xbox, computers in games room. 
-Not much non-chargeable activities available in the hotel, compare to BHR.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: spent 4 pleasant days inside and outside of the complex during Songkran festival 2019. the buffet dinner is great and the breakfast is worth an early morning wakeup. pool spectacular. staff very friendly looking forward to brining our son next time because this time it was just my wife and me
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Had an amazing experience staying for 2 nights!
Though the check in process was abit slow but well worth it when checked into the room! 
Loved the stay with awesome hospitality and service with a smile from concierge to serving staff. 
Natsya, jeab , rin n kin wer exceptionally sweet and considerate of my needs and help me plan all my adventure escapades smoothly by offering guidance and doing reservations
No frill and simple hotel with all d amenities pretty well maintained after these many years of being operational.
Need to add more things to try on buffet breakfast menu.

This was our second time staying at Hard Rock. The overall stay was comfortable and satisfactory.
The Hotel need to increase it's car parking area. Difficult to find a parking place. Add some more International channels to your entertainment package.
Otherwise good experience.

The first time , your staff give me a room , so not good for me , coz near the sea only , i booked is a seaview room , not near the seaview , and then , i call recepition want to change my room, at last , change ROOM1035 , so  good sea view room , thx!  But if next time , i hope the  first room is 1035 , coz make me disapported first , make me feeling not good !  i wanna see tbe super seaview ! Not the old builiding ,Thx......

I visited Pattaya recently with friends, as a diversion from Bangkok which was facing turmoil due to their unstable political situation. We were there for 3 nights but only went to HRH on our last night there - we went w/out prior booking and would like to experience jumping from one hotel to another. We regret it so much as we discovered HRH offered so much for us to do and a very pleasant stay indeed. That Saturday night, there was this famous foam party going on and for those who prefer something 'milder' you can just laze about in the huge tempting pool and listen to the music. 
Even if you come with your family there are a lot of things to do for both adults and children. Im suprised to learn the extend of services/activities you have around - spa, rock climbing, water games for kids etc. Another important fact was, it was very affordable with B2222 for deluxe garden view and B2700 (about) for deluxe seaview. Services were great with very friendly staffs (who were ever ready to assist) attending to you wherever you go around the hotel.
We enjoyed our stay so much that my friends and I were contemplating coming back to Malaysia and were considering to stay there for another day or two, except that all of us would be working the next day..  
Although people say Pattaya is another Phuket (and I have been to both), staying at HRH makes a huge difference to all of us and I would recommend it to anyone in a heartbeat. In fact, Im looking forward to going to HRH Pattaya again in the near future. Our unplanned visit to Pattaya turned out to be a memorable one, thanks to HRH Pattaya!!

This hotel is all you would expect from this franchise. Rather expensive for food and drink but lots of places to eat around Pattaya so you are never stuck. Rooms are nice and have everything you need. We were lucky to have a balcony, small as it was but at least it was one. Music loud at nights so wouldn’t like to take kids on holiday there. All the staff are very hardworking and friendly.

My Wife's friend suggested we all stay at the Hard  Rock Hotel as she had stayed there before years ago. She has said sorry several times for making that suggestion. I live in Thailand and stay in Hotels  in Thailand at least  monthly in our travels.   While the Hard Rock facility and property  is Five  Star the Mangement, Service, and Food Quaility we experienced is Three  Star, at best. We  booked direct, via the phone, Sea View Non Smoking  Rooms directly with the Hotel. We booked direct with no discounts to get what we paid for and still did not. No booking service for the Hotel to blame!  Arriving for check-In our rooms were not ready at the 2PM hotel stated check-in time. Told please wait. Sent my wife and her friend out to shop and see the sights while I waited. Around an hour later was given two rooms with No Sea View! Back to check-in counter finally after an hour and a half plus waiting given two rooms on, different  floors, with a Sea View. Second Room was Smoking it turns out we found out later when our friend returned. Bummer since she hates smoking and we Both Requested Non Smooking! The Lady Is an old Thai Friend who works in the USA and worked in several good hotels in Thailand before and was less then impressed with their excuses of why they booked and charged us for Sea View Rooms if they did not want to provide them! No good reason was given to her. I was not given any reason why rooms were not ready and it seemed rooms not being ready was normal on a weekday as there were serveral 
of us all  waiting. Ordered a drink at the pool bar to kill time while waiting with
and was  given a glass with the booze and a side of "plastic bottle  of water" . Almost 20 USD for one drink and service like a BeerBar! Server had no idea how it should be served.  Zero class. The Hotel Sea Food Buffet was of low quality. The Beef Stew and yes that was the only Beef Dish and a main dish was terrible. No Pasta, the  Chicken Satay dried out and over cooked to the point they were not edible.  The Sea Food was Old and Crab Small. Service with with less then in a Smile in the Land Of Smiles. I write this before the Buffet Breakfast and Check Out as the decision to to Check Out and never return has been made. What a wonderful property it could be and what a poor value it turned out to be. Sad as the Hard  Rock  could be so much more!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I stayed in this hotel only for one night, but i really get good experience here. Even the Price for food and beverages in the Hotel is not to expensive. Breakfast also good, and the Hardrock store also have many various souvenir. Behind the Hotel you can find beautiful beach and they have good swimming pool too. I really enjoy stayed here, easy to access entertaiment center also in pattaya.

The hotel exudes warmth and has a casual feel. Staff all over the hotel grounds are all great except for the check in counter whom i find a bit hhmnn.
Rooms very good with soft bed and pillows. However, they charge me extra mattress for the third person when there is no space to put the mattress on. Anyway,free breakfast comes with it.
Buffet breakfast is great i love everything and waiters are very promt and corteous. 
I asked for a birthday cake for my son and they gave me a slice room delivery i appreciate it.
Pool is great. Tabu club is a great way to enjoy but there is a charge of 200 or 250 baht so we didnt get in.
At the back of the hotel is where you will get a ride to almost anywhere else in pattaya and even in bangkok. We just crossed the street to the beach and walk to the left to find the mall and all kinds of food that would make you drool.

We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights on the way to and back from Ko Chang island. If I were to ever come back to Pattaya (which I dont want to visit ever again) I would stay in Hard Rock. It is a very nice hotel located right in the center by the beach (which we never went to, its too dirty). Rooms are pretty clean and comfortable, WIFI works in some rooms only but at least we had it. The pool area is very cool, they even have the fake beach which compensates for the real one across the street. Breakfasts buffet offers a good choice of pretty much everything you will want :)
Try to stay for a saturday, they have pretty fun pool foam parties every week!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Stayed there for a business reward from the company I worked for. Room, cleanliness, beach, location, all perfect! Enjoyed the swimming pool so much. 
However, for me 4 nights stay there is enough, I don't feel like staying there again. No issues about the hotel or service, it's just this kind of elite hotel is lacking of chance to get new friends, people are not so sociable, and after a while I got bored. Not for a backpacker blood like me.

Everything was very good. I hope that every Hard Rock Hotel is so fine like Battays HRH. Maybe we start to visit anoter Harc Rock Hotel in word.  Especially your pool area was so fine that i have every seen same one
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Fantastic hotel. Very friendly staff. The room with seaview was excellent. You can choose free movies on the tv. Breakfast has a lot of variety and good quality. The pool is great. The gym is well equiped.

The hotel room was more than good, very clean, excellent facilities, comfortable bed etc. the room balcony had beautiful views of the roof of the building next door, awesome! However the overall concept of the hotel is flawed, check in fast and efficient with empty smiles from the staff. This hotel is for families not solo travelers like me.
I booked the room to be with my golfing friends, the price is high, the equivalent of 113$ which for Pattaya is expensive, breakfast not included , this would be another 10$.  I drank a bottle of water from the fridge which I was charged 36฿, in a nearby shop is 10฿, a very high markup.
The decor seems somewhat dated, I am a 60's lover but the hotel over states this, it's 2016-wake up to that.
The swimming pool and facilities are excellent again perfect for families but if I had spent many thousands of pounds to be in Thailand I would want to venture out of the Hard Rock environment.
Not for me, much cheaper and as good hotels in Pattaya with pools etc

Great pool, great location, great food and decent rooms. Right in front of the beach. Friendly staff, especially the people who suggested and booked local trips, wait staff at all restaurants in the property. The people handling the hotel reservations could have been more welcoming and friendlier.

Stayed at the Hard Rock hotel while visiting customers.  Nice room with good views very clean.  staff was always smiling with tips on where to go if needed.  made use of both the gym and pool and bother were exceptional.

We just came back from a 2 night stay with HRH. HRH never fails us in our expectation.
The room was comfortable and clean. Check-in was smooth despite checking in at the late hour. The breakfast spread was good. HRH has very good pool activities to keep everyone in the family entertained. We really had an awesome time at our maiden foam party with HRH. The life guards at the pool were very vigilant keeping their eyes on every child in the pool.
Near Festive Shopping mall where there are a lot of restaurants to choose from.

Excellent breakfast buffet! Nice ambience and perfect location close to the beach.
Free phone provided to guests- nice touch indeed.
Decor reminds one of the rocking 60s and 70s
Polite staff.
Would definitely recommend!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Great place, with excellent location and amenities. This hotel is just by the beach, can choose to walk along the beach during sunset or just enjoy the pool. Its very near to central festival mall and also the traditional market. The night market and street bars are all around. It is a good place to enjoy, relax and shop.  The hotel facilities are awesome, the rooms are very comfortable. Possibly the most comfortable bed I've stayed in.
The staff in the pool also organised some very fun games to play. 
Will definitely stay again if I come back..
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We stayed for two nlghts . Amazing place to stay . Room was excellent.swimming pool was very good and big in size.  Spa was expensive. Breakfast was of high standard. Menu contained many veg options . I suggest this hotel for persons going pattaya with family.

Indians stayed both side of my staying room.
They talked very loud and my sleep is invaded continuously.
Also they used door stopper to achieve visitng rooms each other, and they are not well awared about the noise of the sounds made by hitting door stopper and door.

We stayed for a day. Amazing hotel. Pool is really good. Lil club is also nice. We can leave the kids in the club.  Rooms are clean and big. Nice view of beach. Facilities are perfect. Cabana for 400 guest is too less. Beach is just cross the street. This place is also quite active with water sports. And for the people who wants relax, this is for you. Away from the madness of pattaya night life. 3 kms away from walking street pattaya. Overall I would like to come again.

Hard Rock hotel Pattaya - Good location and walking distance to the beach. Nice swimming pool for family with small kids. Breakfast is excellent. Dine in at Hard Rock Cafe pls mention your room no with discount too. Room is clean.

We loved our stay the hotel is spotless and a great pool with lots of sunbeds so no mad rush in a morning to secure one the breakfasts had plenty of choice all the staff are very friendly and helpful and cant do enough for you the only little snag we found was upon booking in the receptionist asked for a large deposit in case we used the mini bar room service or any of the in house restaurants we explained that if we did use any of the restaurants of room service we would pay there and then and the mini bar could be removed from our room this was sorted for us with no fuss :-) the hotel is in the best location right across for the beach and all the bars and restaurants are a short walk away but it is far enough away from walking street so you also have the peace and quite when you want it we will definitely stay again
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
My family stayed in the hotel for 9 nights over the Songkran festival and I can not fault the service my family have received.
Unfortunately 2 days into the stay my 6 year old girl developed chicken pox and we had to keep her in the room. The staff in the 'lounge' area couldn't do enough for us with multiple phone calls to the room to see if they could do anything or get us anything. 
I have to give a special mention to Nastya who is the assistant manager. From the moment I told her about my daughter she's been brilliant even finding and accompanying a doctor to our room to see my daughter.
It's easy to criticise hotels but you know how good they are when you really need them. EXCELLENT.

It was awesome staying at this hotel. Kids enjoyed the pool a lot. Beach is right across the road which makes easily accessible to water sports. You get boat to coral islands right across the road. Many restaurants all around. Alcazar show is walkable distance from this hotel. Rooms are spacious and its huge hotel with nice interiors. Staff are friendly and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

The staff were great and the room was very well decorated and clean. 
The pool area is really nice and the breakfast was great. 
The hotel is a really. Ice place to hangout even for a drink and during the day it is great to have the pool area as a place to cool down

Had an amazing experience @Hard Rock Pattaya. Foam pool party for kids made it more enjoyable. Rooms are very well maintained, property gives you full luxurious experience. Property is very well located near the market and overall very well maintained.

Our family went to this place with another family. Check in Friday Night & stay there 2 nights.  We booked as city view but the hotel staff upgrade us to be sea view.  So we can enjoy better view. Service here also very good!

This is totally different than all the hard rock that i have visited. Very poor management and i can only check in at 4pm which is stupid, if you cannot manage to clean the room in time, it only proves that your management is poor. room was not as expected. toilet is dirty, shower tiles are dirty and a lot of stain all over. I expected better from hard rock hotel. Guess Hilton will be my choice the next time i visit pattaya.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
As I’ve been here on 30 occasions over the last 13 years it should tell you all you need to know about the service, friendliness and performance of the staff.
Once again I had a fantastic time both with the family for a few days and afterwards by myself while my wife visited friends and relatives around Thailand.
I’ve never been disappointed here and I’d recommend it to anyone.

You requested a review, I have gave you one. Any issues I had, were discussed with your staff at checkout. As I have just told you, any complaints I had were discussed at checkout... I have spent time on your reviews before.. And for what ???

I have visited a few HRHs in Asia but the one in Pattaya has to rank among one of the best and old school ones. 
The feeling when i went into the hotel already gave me a Rock and Roll Feel and when i entered the lobby, the experience was complete and i was dead sure i was in a Hard Rock Hotel. 
Rooms are the usual hotel rooms but i was greeted with an amazing view of Jontien Beach of Pattaya. 
Breakfast was awesome and the hotel is located very strategically in the heart of Pattaya and just beside the beach which made it all ever amazing.
Highly recommended for families and couples alike.

The hotel is very focused on families and children, lots of kids running around. A good tip is to reserve a car park in advance as the car park fills up quickly on the weekend and you could find yourself parking out on the road...which is a long walk. Breakfast is like eating in a mess hall, very busy, people pushing to get to the food, some of the food was cold, however a good selection available. Bed and room is good, we had a sea view room, but had to strain to see the beach, more of a view of a construction site. Staff friendly and good levels of English.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Terribly expensive; food was crappy; only singha beer was available in draft (which was piss-warm); the room was EXTREMELY hot, making sleeping almost unbearable; TV didn't work at first. The only I enjoyed was the decent supply of free movies to watch.

As you would expect from the brand, this was a great experience from Check In to Check out. Excellent customer service, cleanliness, comfort and facilities. The Royalty Suite was a nice touch. Would recommend a stay here to anyone.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
We went to Hard Rock again for Chinese New Year holidays and this time we decided to try their kids’ suite as we have 2 kids.
We arrived quite late, around 2 a.m. and all I wanted was to put the kids to sleep. Check in was very fast, they had everything ready as we had advise we would arrive late. A staff took us to our room and almost at the same time another staff arrived with the luggage. They assigned room 908 to us, a nice number for Chinese people. 
I liked the fruit basket and the juice bottles and especially the milk that were on the table and that my kids drink as they arrived.
The kids got ready to bed, and my son turned on the lamp that was in the table and it exploded. Luckily he was on the bunk bed stairs and my daughter, who was going to sleep on the down bed, was not in the room. I was at the door and was a little scared by the noise as well as by all the glass that spread on the floor and told my son to climb to his top bed. We called to ask for someone to come and clean because the lamp exploded. They were very fast to send someone that arrived with another table lamp and looked around the room at all the glass on the floor and ask to use the phone. Almost after he put the phone down a “team” arrived at our room. The staff that had done the check in and took us to our room arrived also and when he looked around at all the glass he asked if we wanted to change room and we immediately agreed as it was quite late for the kids and would take some time to clean the glass from the carpet. They helped us change to room 936 and it was exactly the same as the other room.
This was an unlucky incident but everything was fast solved and luckily nobody got hurt.
The room is very nice and big and kids have their own space which is very good.
There are two toilets, one for the kids with shower only and another on the master room with a big bathtub and a shower compartment. 
The master room has a king size bed, a big closet to store the bags, with a safety box inside. There was also a desk and a flat screen TV.
The kids’ room is an insert in the “living room” and it has a bunk bed and there were two stuffed animals on each bed that my kids really liked and even wanted to bring home. Now, the bunk bed really fits the insert or maybe I should say the walls of the insert are built around the bunk bed and don’t go until the ceiling so that it can has natural light.
This room is recommended for kids until 12 years old, but the bunk bed is only 1.50 m long and my son is 10 years old with 1.52 m height, so he doesn’t fit well on the bed. The first night was quite late and he just tried to sleep the best he could in diagonal direction, but the other nights he slept in the sofa (long and wide). This made the cleaning staff confused and after that, they didn’t set my daughter bed (she slept on the top bed of the bunk bed), they just fold the blanket and left one on the sofa and the other on the top bed.
The entrance takes you passing the insert room and into the living room area which had a nice sofa, a round chair/leg rest and another chair, all very nice comfy. It has a refrigerator, coffee or tea kettle and cups, including two kids’ cups, X box and a flat screen TV.
My kids liked the X box but complained because there was not enough space as some of the games required they were far from the TV and they needed to be near the sofa and that was not in front of the TV but on the left side of the TV and sometimes it didn’t work well.
The room has two balconies, one in the master bedroom and the other in the living room, with seats outside, nice to enjoy the views.
It was also the first time we stayed in the King’s Club area, but in the main restaurant of ground floor provide much more variety of food, and we always had breakfast downstairs and not in the King’s Club Lounge. But we did go there two days at the end of the day for the snacks (very good quality snacks!) and it was very nice. Food was good and staff very nice. During the day, we sometimes pass there to have an espresso coffee and soft drinks.
Regarding Wi-Fi, my husband said it was a bit slow, not only on the room but in other parts of the hotel also.

We are so happy to have enjoyed a wonderful holiday in the Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya. My family and I had a very good time in this nice hotel.  Great staff, excellent activities and  impeccable services, make it an ultimate rock holiday for my family. Surely, we will visit this lovely place and meet our good old friends (great Hard Rock staff) whenever we have time. Keep rocking!!

It is not as good as expected under the name. But the staff is very friendly and helpful.
The room is very good. However, there are no washcloths from the second day onwards. 
The quality of the stereo system in the room is not good a very bad sound.
But I think I'll come back.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I am a member here for the last 7 years.  Great hotel, great staff, food is great.  High-end hotel.  My kids love this hotel and enjoy every time we stay.
Rock royalty staff is very helpful, espeacilly CS Manager.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: What a nice pleace. We had a club room with sea view. The room was really nice. 2 times a day cleaning. Fresh fruit and some cake everyday. This is really holiday. The spa was perfect. We could all day drink at the bar for free. The people know us by name and where so nice to my boy. It is a big hotel but it is feeling like a boutiek hotel. The pool is beautiful. There is always a band playing. We where there 7 nights and now staying at the centara grand admirrage. I would give the hard rock hotel 5 star+. To bad we have changed hotel because the hard rock was so much beter!

My wife paid extra to stay on the executive floor with access to the club level lounge on the 9th floor. My wife went to the lounge at dinner time but it empty and no food or drinks were being served. There were two staff members in the club and they both just looked at my wife and they said nothing. We found out two hours later by accident when we were looking for a place to eat that the service that we paid for was moved down stairs. At that time they were closing and the food was cold and picked over. They apologized for what happened to us and said they would send fresh food to our room. When the food arrived it was cold and looked like they just took it from the left over dinner pans. When I brought this incident up to the hotel agent at the club level express check out, she just said I'm sorry. No effort to speak with her manager to compensate for this incident. This is the reason I will not return. If Customer satisfaction is not a top priority for the highest paying guests, then I would not recommend this hotel.

Back to Pattaya again since 13 years ago, we choose 4-5 difference hotel at Pattaya, Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya was our final decision, and we made the right choice. Unique design and legend singers images, related display prop. Many good memories we found. Rooms with different topic. Swimming pool are awesome, big size and unique style, facilities enough for us. Don’t miss the breakfast buffets every morning, many choices and delicious. 
Of course people thinks that are the basic requirements for hotel does. But the most important that are hotel staffs quality, We are so appreciate that what they support and smile like sunshine. 
We will be back soon.

We checked in at the 9th floor and were treated very good. we were given a choice of juices, our picture was taken, and emailed to us after we returned home,  The room was david bowie, the towels on the bed were sculpted into an elephant...kinda cool.  The view from the 9th floor was great.  The pool was nice and towels were given near the pool.  Of course there is a hard rock store, and the hard rock stuff decorating the walls everywhere.  The staff was very helpful.  the beach across the street was nice and we rented a jet ski.  its about a 10 minute walk from walking street with nice little restos along the way.  We will happily stay there again!! The price was very reasonable too!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Staff have an excellent services even a lots of guests. Friendly for children and family. Lots of activities.Good food also good location. Althought not have private beach, but have artificial small beach in the hotel.

Stayed here on a business trip and conference (the hotel had excellent conference facilities) and I really liked it. The staff is great, all areas are clean and very nice decorated, the rooms are also just great. Pool and gym very nice, food also nice but a little pricy. I didn't see any show or anything so I don't know the quality there. 
The location, and Pattaya in general is quite without charm. No good beach, uncomfortable nightlife. So in that aspect I do not think I will be coming back. But the hotel as such was great.

Breakfast is delicious and the swimming pool is clean.
The staff is kind.
Soul Lounge Coffee Delicious and hard rock cafe atmosphere is exciting and good.
It is hotel which wants to go again.
See you soon again.

If you want to stay in Pattaya and do not want to go far from American luxury and comfort....the Hard Rock Hotel consistantly provides very clean rooms, high qulaity service and a sense of the familiar in a foreign land.  The hotel is beautiful and has great views of the beach.  It is also far enough away from the main stretch of bars to be able to get a good nights sleep.  The hotel is very safe and has security guards watching the entry points.  A good choice for business travelers.  The hotel also has special events such as foam parties and other events for the guests.  Only down side to the hotel is that it is more expensive than a lot of the other hotels in town....but as the saying goes: "You get what you pay for!"

Very nice stay, friendly staff and good facilities.
Room was very clean and spacious. 
Food was reasonably priced and discount offered in restaurant to hotel guests. 
A couple of free welcome drinks was a very nice gesture too. 
Upgraded on arrival to sea view.

room is very big, swimming pool is very nice , but car park abit quite far from hotel. all staff good looking and they also have service mind. when i'm booking room via website also have discount that's very good for sure will come to take a rest at there once again. :))

I stayed in the Hard Rock Pattaya for two nights in mid May. i was part of a large group of people attending an event and staying at the hotel that weekend. Check in was swift and problem free. The room was ideal for my needs. Plenty of room, a well stocked bathroom comfortable bed.
I attended a function in the hotel on the Saturday night. It was a buffet catering for approximately 500 people. The food was excellent and there was plenty of variety to suit all palettes. Service was excellent with plates being cleared rapidly and empty glasses being refilled promptly.
There were no surprises on checkout. The bill came to exactly what I expected. No nasty surprises or additions.
The only slight gripe I would have would be the lack of free wireless. It did not bother me the weekend I was there but if I had been on business I would have been a little miffed at having to pay 1500THB extra.

this hotel does not recommend halal restaurants. So many pork. Not recomend for muslim. one of the staff scolded me even though I returned the sauna key according to the direction of the other staff. I do not understand why this hotel does not have standard rules regarding operational standards and clear procedures that confuse customers. staff difficult to smile and apologize for a sign of modesty. even though hard rock is a popular hotel among tourists. I think management must train his staff for better service.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The reason we keep coming back to Hard Rock Pattaya is the staff. Every single staff member makes our stay awesome. I just wish the prices for food and drinks weren’t so expensive. I never really see anyone indulging at the restaurants etc as it’s too expensive and the exchange rates have dropped against the strong Thai Bhat. I hate to think how much food goes to waste each night from the buffet. Put the price down and people will go. Drinks are way overpriced. I don’t spend any money at the hotel as you can go to 7/11 and get what you need for a 10th of the price. Please consider this.

We went here one of the nights we were holidaying in Pattaya for dinner. I loved the restaurant, it's really cool and has lots of music memorabilia. The live band were pretty good also, and the food was very tasty. I definitely recommend a visit

My short 2 day stay in Hard Rock Hotel has been a great one,the hotel is situated perfectly near the beach, restaurants and "red light district (Not advisable for families with children below 16 to walk down that street) be warned if travelling by tuktuk (local motorcycle taxis) they are usually more expensive than proper taxis. If you are out for an adventure with a little wind in your hair then I suggest using the local pick up truck taxis which require you to sit along benches fixed in the bed of the truck (they are cheap during the day/not during the night) bargaining is welcome although don't push it if you can't get a good fare, they are abundant and there's bound to be one that will take you on. 
Back to topic! Get a hotel room facing the pool and the beach, sunsets are beautiful from there. The breakfast buffets have an amazing spread fusing both local and western palates. The staff are friendly, helpful and very prompt on request. They have a variety of activities for both adults and children alike, so dear parents fear not Hard Rock for kids are there to look after you while you escape with your significant other. The live bands during the evenings are a great way to unwind after a long day on the streets of Pattaya. I never stuck around for the lunch and dinner buffets so I can't comment on that. Rest assured whether you're with friends or family hard rock will cater to your needs (keep in mind however that you'll have to open your wallet a little wider for Hard Rock sake)
Ladies if you are travelling alone or with friends (which I highly recommend) be sure that Hard Rock has all the pampering you'll ever need.
Guys if you're into music Hard Rock caters guitars of your choice to your room for a free jamming session, they've also got DJ classes for you to attend.
All in all you are in a great spot and you won't regret it. Have fun!

Very good service and personell are always smiling and helpful. The location of the hotel is excellent with most of Pattaya in walking distance. Rooms are average but quiet and most rooms I have hade in my many visits have a very good view. Rooms with a smal balcony are perfect if you want to have some time for your self.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The four of us stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Our stay was so relaxing with all the great ammenities. Awesome pool. The rooms were very nicey designed and clean. All the staff were friendly and helpful especially the front desk manager. If u need anything. Hes the man to talk to. Thanx so much for making my stay a memorable one. I will be back again.

Very welcoming hotel and all staff are friendly and unpretentious. The pool is good and attentive staff that constantly keeping my beer supply full. The band at the restaurant was entertaining and food was generous in portioning. Hotel is located smack in the middle of the busy strip and plenty of local bars/restaurants, just flag down the local tuk tuk and off you go. Will definitely come back...

We feel very good, swimmingpool area was clean and the staff friendly. The rooms sea view are clean and confortable. The location on the beachroad cental, but quiet in nighttime. Music selection on the swimmingpool goooood

GREAAATTTT... definately, you can not go wrong the the property.. worth every penny and everything was more than perfect..every really went above and beyond to made our stay feel memorable.. and they did.
thank you,
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
First of all this hotel is supposed to be rocking, games in and around the pool are going all day long, therefore not expect the complete silence around the pool. The hotel is visited by many families so plenty of kids around.
The rooms are not the biggest, but with nice new furniture and big shower. However the windows need some cleaning and the whole outside of the building new colour or a proper washdown.
Breakfast buffet is good, with a nice mixture from asian culture into the american style with pancakes etc.
The staff is friendly and helpful. Communication is sometimes a bit difficult, since the lack of proper english. Speak slowly and avoid strong accent is the key here.
We were a bit disappointed by the "extra charges" for smaller games. There is a game room with table tennis and pool table and few playstation stations. To use this room you got to pay THB 250 per person and day. There is also a climbing wall for which you got to pay THB 80 per climb. During our stay we could not use the wall, because the staff was absent.
Overall a good hotel with nice pool directly located on the beach road. Central shopping mall or the famous walking street are within walking distance (10 min) or easy accessable via 20-Baht-Taxi.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Excellent location 
However, my previous experience in other Hard Rock Hotels was more welcoming whereby the staff are warm, happy, proactive..another thing was, my special requests were not delivered..but anyway, I still loves Hard Rock ^_^
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
The Hotel has all the ambience of a classy hotel minus the boring formal atmosphere( Thank God for that!!)....cheery and helpful staff,efficient,polite and trendy.....near the beachfront with easy access,great Rock memorabilias exhibited well,great view from the upper floors.......Definitely a must for all looking for a perfect vacationing place to chill.....everyone must stay here at least once in a lifetime...
And I am definitely going to be back :-)
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Finest hotel to stay in Pattaya..
Very Helpfull Manager at Reception Mr.JJ.
All staff was so polite... Except a thai receptionist...who were ride like..nd 
Just a little minus point was...
There was no indian dishes in break fast in all 3 days we stayed here... 
Rest all great experiences we had..b it swimming pool...b it foam party on saturday...njoyed...

Nice clean hotel with efficient staff. The breakfast was fabulous. It is located bang on Beach road with excellent connectivity to Market with local conveyance. Easy approach from both side of the hotel which is one way.

We love Hard Rock Pattaya and refuse to stay anywhere else. We usually visit twice a year and this is our ONLY choice. Keep up the good work. Thanks for always living upto our expectations. We look forward to our next visit.

We had visited this place in December. We sat outside where there is live music.We really enjoyed the music.It has nice ambience .But we wanted to go here for new year's eve but they don't allow children which is really a sad part

This was our fifth stay at the hotel in 2 years and was only meant to be for 2 weeks.  However, due to the situation with the closure of airspace we had to extend our stay by another 2 weeks.  I would like to thank Jorge for his help and support during this unforseen extension.  Without his support and the help of his staff we would have been in a real mess.  THANK YOU SO MUCH......... So, we stayed at the Hard Rock for almost 1 month and I can honestly say that I did not want to leave.  Whilst the bricks and mortar  could probably benefit from upgrading now,  the staff remain fantastic.  The Rock Agents are absolute stars and the Hard Rock should be really proud of this team.......they are the main reason we continue to return to the hotel.....Special mentions to Arm, JoJo and Sax, we love you!!!!!  Also Tuk Tuk from the Shack Bar, you are our VIP!!!!!
The only negative we have with the hotel is the cost.  It used to be very reasonably and competatively priced but now the cost has rocketed making it almost impossible for the average family (like us) to stay there.  Although we would love to return, it will be unlikely if the room rate remains the same.

I loved everything, the room, the food, the super friendly staff.... I really recommend this hotel. A very comfortable room and clean, great food both in the hotel and the cafe. Also a good location where I could find everything near the hotel.

we had been on a 4 week trip around Asia,For our last 2 nights we treated ourselves to a stay here on rock royalty level.The service we got was second to none.
the staff were great and the vip lounge where you get food and drink up until 10pm was amazing. The views were just to die for.
If you can afford to stay on the rock royalty level then i highly recomend you end your holiday in style.
Truly amazing stay,thank you hard Rock Hotel Pattaya.

Came here with a big group of friends from Bangkok for the weekend and we really enjoyed it. It was the second time we had stayed here and we were looking forward to coming back. The staff at the hotel are amazing! They were really friendly and attentive all weekend. From the waiters to the chambermaids and even the entertainers-they all had smiles on their faces and made sure we were having a great time. The beds at the hotel are extremely comfortable! It was one of the highlights of the stay! The breakfast and buffet dinner was extremely good with a wide variety of choices. The pool is well designed and fits lots of sun loungers. You can even rent inflatable donuts to lounge in the pool all day. You don't really need to leave the hotel if you've just come for a weekend break-the hotel has plenty on offer. Although I don't have children, the kids club here looked really good! The spa was also excellent and I had a wonderful massage. The staff were very kind and friendly.

I like a bit of an upper end hotel when I travel so, as a regular visitor to Hard Rock Cafes around the world, I thought I would try out the Hard Rock Hotel on my visit to Pattaya.
I have no idea what star rating they have officially, but this was one of the finest hotels I have ever used, and it starts the moment your taxi pulls up at the door.  The staff were universally friendly and helpful, the room was spectacular, and what a view!
