We can meet good friends which are your staff who always give us your excellent services. Thank you so much, we are very much appeciated and would recommend your hotel to other people.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Don't expect a brand new 5 star resort. But, it's very nice!!! Had a great stay and hope to stay longer next time. Close to everything. The pool and view are amazing. Breakfast was ok. Friendly people working.

Stay here when I fancy treating the family or I get visitors from the UK. Rooms are a bit on the small side & the furniture looks a bit plastic.
The good points, breakfast is buffet style, good & plenty of it. The pool is great. My daughter is 2 & spends most of her time in playing. The also have a lot of activities keep keep the kids amused. Across the main road is the beach, but the pool is that nice that you don’t even have to leave the hotel.
The Hardrock shop is typical of any other Hardrock shop, good selection of T shirts & good quality.
Tended not to eat evening meals in the hotel, but that was because I know of a lot of nice restaurants in the area  & was treating my parents.
The atmosphere is great, staff are always friendly & always seem to remember your name, regardless of how short the stay is.

Overall a great stay but some areas could be improved. Location is great and the staff are fantastic.  However it is far inferior to other Hard Rock Hotels, namely Bali. A little suprised to see smoking permitted all around the pool area, including the kids pook. Also reception was very busy in the mornings and evenings with ladies of the night. Also no mention on check-inn that the 4000 baht deposit will not be released for 2-3 weeks. Having said this, it was an enjoyable stay but some way to go to keep on par with other Hard Rock Hotels.

Visited Hard Rock Pattaya last week on an Annual Senior Management conference as we were easily able to enjoy the Hotel both in terms of business and relaxation.
The team there gave us all a very warm welcome and I was quickly escorted to my lovely room over looking the bay area.
The conference facilities were excellent and state of the art  and included a great new space called the Drum Room. A new room set over the excellent hard Rock Cafe which looks directly on to the beach.
The food was very good and offered a great variety for all and our end of Conference dinner and entertainment was of the highest quality. They even managed to arrange performers form the recent Asia's Got Talent competition. Superb.
I did not get time to use areas such as the spa, pool etc but they certainly looked of a very high standard.
Cheers to the whole team at the Hard Rock Pattaya; am definitely coming back with family next time

The stay was excellent. All staffs are very helpful and informative! They even sent a birthday cake to my room because it was my birthday. Hotel facilities are great, very good location, and most of all I love the sandy swimming pool!

Stayed here for 18 nights!!!! Pattaya wasn't the best part of Thailand to go to but the hotel made the trip a better one! The staff at Hard Rock are so sweet and extremely helpful! The room was clean and had a great view of Pattaya Beach. Usually I dont like to eat in hotels as it is more interesting to get a taste of the local restaurants but we ended up eating at least one meal in the hotel every day! Food was great! The salon is cheap and cheerful with great staff. The highlight was the foam party that they held every weekend by the pool! Thank you Hard Rock!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I ordered a queen but hit two small beds.  I guess no matter how Big the hotel they will give you what they want to fill instead of what you pay for. I had to call For my bag two times which arrived an hour after I checked in.  Room is nice overall.  View is nice. Television has damage so when the screen is most white you see mold. Buffet breakfast was excellent. Fresh eggs, full big buffet breakfast.  The rooms are overall well kept and housekeeping is excellent.

First time staying in a Hard Rock Hotel and we were not disappointed. Staying for 10 nights over Valentine's this hotel really made our holiday special. The food throughout the hotel was excellent, from the breakfast buffet which appeared to have everything and was refilled very quickly, to Hard Rock Cafe food, which you can order pool side, we could not fault it. 
My partner had a birthday and the staff even surprised us with a cake and card on the day to our room. (Thank you Hard Rock)
We were based on he 8th floor choosing a Sea View, King bed and balcony at the front of the hotel. Not all rooms have a balcony or a King size bed, worth asking for on the booking comments and on arrival if needed, the staff were very helpful. We booked direct through their website....
http://pattaya.hardrockhotels.net
Choosing their 10 day early bird offer for us was discounted from other websites at that time and worth checking. We also emailed the hotel with the odd question and had a quick response.
I used their guitar Pick service, choosing a guitar for our room. Your credit card is required as a guarantee on any damages which you check for on arrival and return of the equipment as expected but an excellent service and unique service for a hotel.
The spar facilities were also excellent and when using the pool you can use their towel service and sign towels out with no charge as long as you return them instead of having to use your own, which made things a lot easier for us.
If choosing a Saturday night stay at the hotel there is a foam party with loud music from 9pm-1am. This happens only one night of the week so don't be put off.
If I had any small negative to our stay, it would be as a cider drinker the hotel did not serve any cider, but we found this to be a common thing in most bars in Thailand ..but hopefully they will catch up soon. We found a couple of Irish bars like Mulligans and Rosie o' Grady's have Magners or Kepplers in stock if you look for it and don't mind paying extra.
Overall we felt this was an excellent hotel and we would definitely stay at a Hard Rock Hotel again. 
Thank you to the Hard Rock for making our stay truly Rockin'
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We love it to stay in this hotel.great service and the big swimming pool is amazing.the breakfast was very good and a big choice for anyone.the hard rock hotel make a unforgettable staying for us.thanks to the team.you did a great job
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
all others are good
note: I stay for 5d4n
except for 1) I requested a toothpaste as forgotten to bring, and given a full set which is nice
but after 1-2 days when toothpaste is used up, is not refill back the toothpaste
2) if there is a brown type (fur) of blanket (not the white one), it will be great, as that kind of blanket is warm and will keep ones warm

hard rock hotel rocks...
its location is the best..
right in front of the pattaya beach...
awesome swimming pool..
great ambiance..
execellent rooms..
good food...
overall execellent experiance

The Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya is our second home! We stayed for 42 nights in Dec and celebrated Xmas and New Year Hard Rock style! A special thankyou goes to Ann, Paris, Chanel, Somo, Gifty, Brenda, Patty, Gina, Boy, Eve, Natalia, all the pool boys and Kin the bellboy. Additionally Chatchai the security man was always a pleasure to run into outside the Hotel. 
Loved the Kings Club with the personalised service from the staff. A special mention to Chanel that was kind enough to organise our breakfasts when we were running late. And Somo that made our cocktails to perfection every time and made sure our glass was never empty! 
Looking forward to returning again in December, until then Rock On! 🤘🤘

Absolutely fantastic hotel and staff are very accommodating look forward to my next stay. Going when it was Songkram was the icing on the cake and anyone who is looking to travel to Thailand must try to experience the festivities, on the actual day the main beach road is closed and the water festival takes over, you do not wear good clothing as you will be saturated, no issues as the weather is always hot, also the music playing from all the hotels and pubs adds to the atmosphere and everyone is dancing in the streets.

Everything are above average, especially the location.
However, the swimming pool disco party lasted for the whole night, and the sound insulation in the room is terrible. Can't sleep well for the whole night because of the loud disco music.

We went with our 3 kids all 6-8 years old. The staff was SO friendly to them. Made it a great experience for them. There were plenty of fun activities organized for the kids. The pool is incredible. Right across the street from the beach. Good American places to eat at nearby, plus a huge mall. Cool, comfortable rooms. We would go back in a heartbeat.

The staff in Reception and Front desk are nice & helpful. The check in process was fast, they helped me to solve problems during my stay.
The room is clean and tidy.
The pool is huge. The Rockers arranged various water and poolside activities everyday, they're really amazing. 
The oil massage therapy in the SPA is also excellent, the therapist possesses professional technique.
I'm sure it's a fantastic hotel and i highly recommend it to all of u.

Had a great stay at Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya... Actually travelled in Nov 2011.... did bookings directly on hotel website...got a decent deal....good location...great amenities and superb experience....great place to go..
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
2 Yrs 2Months later my 2nd visit to pattaya and my 2nd stay in HARD ROCK
Man , the location is perfect ... the crew is none other than rockstars . always smiling and cheerful ready to pump the air with excitement .. 
keep the good work on guys ..

The Hard Rock gave used to louge  9 floor for my family and have many facilities in hotel ,your service very nice , but I think indoor hotel should not smoke . Because I walked pass my floor smelled too much.

Initially, I was put off with the idea of staying at the Hard Rock Pattaya, I couldn't have been more wrong.  The Hard Rock is a fantastic resort, the staff really are peerless, they are a team of true professionals...nothing is a problem to them.  The pool area is a true sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle that is Pattaya.
The breakfast is second to none, fresh fruit, an assortment of eggs, bacon, hash browns and various Asian dishes....very yummy.
Recommend you stay on level 9, no noise and great outlook over Pattaya.

We come here every Songkran as we enjoy the ambient here.  There were lots of activities and DJ music by the poolside, thus making the place full of energy.  The hotel is packed with guests who are here to enjoy the festive celebrations thus making the place even very lively.
The rooms here are very clean and the beds are very comfortable.  The employee here are also very friendly and nice.

I stayed for 5 nights at the hard rock hotel in pataya for business training. The location is superb, near the beach and within few mins reach of the main attractions. Cleanliness and staff attitude where top notch. The food was a little expensive compared to general food prices in pataya, however it was very delicious. The gym is nice, equipments were not new, but in good condition and suitable for full workouts. I have tried the massage at the SPA which was very professional and relaxing. I would definitely stay there if I have future visits.

Every aspect of the stay from the time I arrived on the 27th of March until check-out 10 April was absolutely amazing! I have stayed at the Hard Rock before and this time was extremely enjoyable. Very friendly & professional staff! I love the property!

Good service all staff we love this hotel same home Friendly staff, children like to stay here. Like home Have a safe activity in the pool area. Do not get tired of delicious food and all staff good service

Central location on Pattaya Beach. Lobby area is a little dated and check in was slow despite not being busy. Rooms are comfortable, beds excellent, and shower room adequate, although a bit dark as it's all coloured in black. What a shame they removed all the balconies and created larger indoor floor space, the views out to see are great especially from the higher floors.
Pool is excellent with plenty of sun beds, on Saturday they added at least 30 extra beds to cope with higher demand. Pool area can often be noisy with music, pool games and groups drinking.
Breakfast was OK, but I would have liked more choice, the cooked options were consistently cold as the heat lamps seemed next to useless.
Nice outside area to eat/drink on outside deck by Hard Rock Cafe, but the prices are exorbitant, and well in excess of any other venue in Pattaya, 699baht for burger and 399baht for cocktails - other hotels are far cheaper and often have happy hours, Hard Rock Hotel only has 1 hour on Saturdays at pool bar.

Very satisfactory room - clean and very spacious though the aircon is a bit too cold for us. Good service and relaxing environment. Very good for chilling and relaxing. Will strongly recommend to friends and family.

We very happy to stay at hardrock . 
Staffs are very nice.
 A lot of activities here.
We enjoyed swimming pool which we could hear the music under water (It's amazing for us).
Lovely sauna and stream place was very clean.
We will come back again !!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Stayed at the hard rock for 2 weeks and it was lovely!! The massages are fantastic, the only thing i didnt like was when i went to pay and i looked at my reciept and it said that the VAHT ( the tip) was already included but when i asked then they said it goes to the hotel which when i asked the front desk they said no it goes to your massage lady. So just be careful, i guess. The view from the 9th floor lounge was fantastic. If you spend a little more and you get the privlege to use the 9th floor, free food, free drinks, free snacks all day! It was worth it! 
Fun fact: every room has condoms in the fridge.

We spent three days in Pattaya, when the Red Shirt political stuff was going down in Bangkok and our meetings where canceled. It was crazy to say the least. We found a cool friendly oasis of relief walking into the Hard Rock Cafe and meeting Joe. When you go, hopefully you'll be greeted by the coolest kat in town. He knows everyone, where to go, and speaks perfect English. Topped with his dreads, huge smile; knowledge of rock n' roll- he's a genuinely fun guy order a beer from or go out on the town with as a guide. He'll probably become your friend.
The Hard Rock is also a great place to start the night with some great live music before hitting the hardcore walking street. I highly recommend it.

Great service. The swimming pool bar was a hit. I really liked the cold room and sauna. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. As it was my sons birthday they put a complimentary hard Rock cake in the room as a surprise. They have plenty of free activities for kids and also paid activities such as rock climbing and kickboxing. My only regret is that we did not stay longer.

Although the name of the hotel (Hard Rock) does not sound family friendly, in fact, this hotel is great for family, especially with kids
They have a great pool, not just a simple pool, has different sections and depth, kids will love it
Room set up is really "rock", using lots of dark color in every aspect, if you are looking for soothing eye view, this place may shock you, nevertheless, I appreciated their setup need to be related to the hotel theme (they have black color slipper used in the room!!!!
Staffs are very friendly, always helpful, great Thailand smiles!!
Cost are more affordable as compared to others. Worth considering.

I was in Bangkok on business and had couple of days free to spend some were around so, I drove to Pattaya with my wife. My first stop was Hard Rock Hotel where we checked in without prior booking arrangements and the warm welcoming service was just the start at the reception's check-in counter. We had a sea view deluxe room with beautiful interior design, very comfortable bed, wall to wall window, a balcony overlooking the sea and the great swimming pool. Hotel amenities were great and very clean, the staff were genuine, helpful and very friendly. Breakfast and dinner were buffet with nice variety of international cuisine. Great music, great atmosphere and great decoration. Overall, we very much enjoyed our stay and we do recommend this hotel grossly.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: i wasted my time with both check in and out. the front desk team take time too long time . They need to change all system about check in-out urgently.  i haven't got this situation with other hotels at all. Also the desk employee is very impolite and unfriendly especially the name is ANN or JANE who has sarapao on her head .   She doesn't  serve customer, she want to fight with customer.  Customer service is not her proper  job.  haven't seen the person like this in hotel front desk.   Hard Rock good location  and renovated as good, but the first face we've met in hoel was the  worst experience.  i will never visit Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya definitely.  I haven't write review for hotels i've used before, but this hotel, i use my time for this for letting customer and manager of hotel recognize it.

The property is awesome with slides and swimming pool. The views and accessibility to the beach are good. The rooms and bathroom is also good. However the reception and restaurant staff is not at all courteous  They have No patience and lack basic service knowledge. Not Hospitable at all.

The room not refresh in evening as other hotel do you could make improvements to the service so more people will be attractive and the security every time you come in evening with your lady must report to reception
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The Hard Rock Pattaya is a JEWEL!  Would highly recommend to all.  The staff were friendly and very helpful.  The rooms were clean and the buffet breakfast was amazing!  Thank you for making our stay memorable!

Rooms are super clean and cozy with enough lightings. The staffs are always ready to help. Even if you want to get the bathroom cleaned twice or just wipe the shower area. They ready to help. Pool is the best part of the property and Rock Spa is a great experience. There are lot of offers also for the same on daily basis. Food nd beverage prices are very competitive and quality is great. Overall the best property you could stay in in terms of luxury and location.

i think thatbreakfast is fool, cuz menu is not variable than other hotels
 but bubble party was great, and sofa near lobby was inpressed to me   facility is not so cleaned i 
 think and smells around the hotel is bad

This is an excellent property in a good location. Walking distance to main attractions/malls. Rooms are very good with a balcony. Staff are very good. Buffet breakfast was a huge spread and excellent. Pool is a big attraction of this hotel.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I had originally booked a room after the Songkran water festival.  "After" because things can really get out of hand during the festival.  The day before my arrival I learned from a friend that Songkran lasts longer in Pattaya.  I was scheduled to arrive on THE big day of what in Pattaya is called the water WAR.
It took me several emails and threats of bad reviews, but they finally rescheduled my arrival for one week later.
About the hotel itself:  Very nice.  The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful.  The rooms are very good and comfortable.  The breakfast is one of the best you'll find anywhere so be sure your room rate includes it!

nice and clean room 
safe hotel with good security 
nice swimming pool with good activity , and very good for kids
restaurant have good collection 
price very good 
nice check in and check out 
friendly staff

Was there last week.  It truly rocks.  Very happening hotel - lots of activities.  One can be in the hotel and not miss going out.
The staff is helpful - there is a language issue though - but thats true for most of Thailand.
Rooms are smallish and we did miss the Balcony (The refurbished rooms do not have balconies anymore).
The Saturday night foam parties are to die for - rocking!!
Even though we did not go with kids - it is a very kid friendly place and they organize a lot of activities to keep them busy.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Great place, right on  the beach road, great staff and food, lovely sea view from the room. They have maintained their property very well. Most of the places and other good hotels are just walking distance away. Room service was also very good and prompt.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Now 2nd time at HRH Pattaya ! Only good things changed But rooms soon need a face lift and 
the Real Hard Rock feeling seems to been gone replaced by family ! 
Need a littel but more Rock'n'Roll ! But super staff relaxed feeling but more Rock'n'Roll...
I'll be back 
All the best Simon

We visited the hotel in January, 2016. This was our 2nd stay at the property. The ambience and the lobby is fun. The rooms are big in size with good view of the ocean. The staff at the Reception as well as the Housekeeping and restaurants is very polite and helpful. The property is very conveniently located on the Main Beach Road, Pattaya with the beach just across the road. Had a great stay. Thank you.

This was my son and I 4th visit to the Hard Rock. Doesn't get any  better than this., rooms clean and comfortable. Staff was the best. Great pool atmosphere and 10 baht ride to the walking street. Nastya at the front desk was the best for helpful information. The rooms were spacious and the beds so comfortable. Will always stay here.

Hard Rock is a very very very x 10000000 good Hotel for children.  There are many activities available for children, especially the foaming party, big ball ball ......All the staff are very friendly and helpful.  The room is good.  The breakfast is good, too.  The swimming pool is excellent, my children loving it.  The hotel overall is excellent.  We must choose again.

This was my 4th stay here and I love coming back. The hotel is so well designed. The rooms are clean and spacious and the beds are comfortable. Great choice of places to eat and room service is brilliant also. The highlight is the pool, it's like a small river with a man made beach. Constant activities for kids and grown ups from water basketball to canoe races. The rock spa is also really good, very professional and their work is great. Gym is also fully equip.

After spending a few days in the almost jungle-esque village in Nakhon Sawan (as well as the City) it was great to arrive somewhere that my girlfriend and I could just put my feet up. Upon arrival though, we were told that our room wasn't yet ready and asked if we would accept a room on a smoking floor. I informed the lady on reception that we would be willing to look at the room but also that we had already been wandering around Pattaya for 4 hours waiting to check in. She asked us to sit down and then after just a short time returned offering us an upgrade and an apology. Upon entering the room we were amazed. The shower was huge, the décor was beautiful and the bed was large and comfortable. The fridge was stocked full, and the carpet felt beautiful to walk on. The porter brought our bags up promptly and left without looking like he expected a tip... which made me call him back and tip him more than I would have originally. It was then on to the pool area, which had beautiful Cabanas, was very clean and had staff constantly walking around read to fetch your drinks or food. Every time you would pass a member of staff you would get a smile and a nod at least. We found that the staff, including security really made our stay even more special. I've never had an experience like the Hard Rock in Pattaya and cannot believe the prices are as they are too. I wouldn't recommend anywhere else to stay in Pattaya!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Check and upgrade your members. It's first time to visit Thailand. Lots of things are scared at me including your hotel. but your members who work at the couter, are kindly to me. it' just like a robot.

We stayed at the Deluxe Seaview room from 26 to 29 May. The room was spacious, well maintained and with the view of Pattaya bay. The negative point was the abandoned hotel next door which can be a sore to the eye. Services were good in particular the Front Desk (Mr Boy) and the restaurant crews. Kids love the pool as well as the Kids Club. Location was great as it's closed to all the attractions like the walking street (20 minute walk) and Tiffany's Show (15 minute walk). Otherwise the songthaew could get you to anywhere from 10 to 20 baht depends on the distance.

Noisy (bicuz of bad soundproof, i could hear sound from corridor)
Wet and smelly bathroom(no fan in bathroom, no door at shower booth)
Convenient location. (pattaya beach road)
Has a nice pool.
Has hard rock cafe.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
So impressed in their service, set up for a super customer experience.
We check in with he big tour group and long Q at the lift. Front Desk Staff took us to the staff lift to avoid the jam. I got a reserved car park fir the whole 4 days stay.
Breakfast/Afternoon break is free if you stay in club level.
Restaurant 5/5
Staff/Service 5/5
Food 5/5
Free Wifi

Was a pretty reasonable hotel.  If you’re into the hard rock theme , then they did a great job.  Comfortable beds.  
Hotel looks a little older and I think the dark hallways were a little different.  
But all in all was a good stay.  
Pool was great As well.

This is the right place if you would like to stay in Pattaya, and you don't wanna be in the midle of the action, but  you can easily walk to Walking stree, 2nd road...... I stayed in the  hotel for two nights with my family, because we wanted to visit the Sanctuary of truth. 
 The rooms in the Hard rock hotel are renovated and are simply cool and the beds are very comfortable. The breakfast was Good, but i have had some better breakfasts in Thailand.
The most amazing thing about this place is the swimming pool, you can realy chill during the day, or be a party animal at the eveninigs. We realy had a great time at the pool.
The seafod all you can eat buffet at the evenings is simply value for money.
i would certainly stay here again.

Hard Rock hotel is one of my favorite hotel, it is very close to Pattaya beach and rooms are very comfortable / clean. Big range of dinning options within the hotel. When you are in Hard Rock hotel don't miss to visit Hard Rock cafe ,they play awesome live band especially, Rock .............

Hadn't been back to the Hard Rock since 2012's major renovation, so this was almost like staying in a completely different hotel.  In spite of the chaotic scene in the lobby, we were checked in quickly and with a smile by the very efficient JJ.  Loved the new look of everything, including the room. Simple, yet elegant, and spotlessly clean.  OK, so there were no towels, but they were brought within seconds.
Decided to have dinner at Starz Diner after a busy day, and were impressively attended to by Franky and Godji, in spite of the seeming non stop arrivals of large tour groups that came, ate and disappeared within a matter of minutes.  The food was better than we remembered, by the way, as was breakfast, when the equally attentive Zane took care of us.
The hotel facilities are still great and very well maintained.  The Hard Rock hides its true age very well, in what should be a lesson for many aging hotels around the world!  And the location is of course fantastic.  But as wonderful as the property itself is, what truly makes the Hard Rock Pattaya stand out is its terrific, hard working staff, always ready with a smile, always there to help.  Most impressive!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Room was relatively clean, cleaning services were polite, everything was up to standard. However, mushroom Jacuzzi edge was sharp. Overall, absolutely enjoyed my stay there. Would return again on another trip.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Overall an excellent stay, the service was amazing, rooms great and the beds very comfortable.  Great location for exploring and getting to activities.  The pool and area is also top notch!  Perfect for an afternoon swim and drinks at the pool bar.

Hard Rock Pattaya Hotel is full of positive energy. Is what you expect when you take your family for holidays. Superb infrastructure (the best swimming pool in Pattaya, the best Spa, the best music, great room recently fully renovated, plenty of activities for kids, etc) and a excellent team supporting all in a efficient and friendly way.
Thanks, we already miss all of you in Hard Rock Pattaya

The location is good just opposite the beach. Rooms are guest friendly with all amenities. Breakfast provided was okay and the food at the restaurant is good and not expensive. The pool party on Saturday night was a lot of fun. Overall good experience
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
After reading many good reviews of this hotel, I chose to take my family there this weekend. To take the good things first. This hotel is a fantastic hotel, you get a truly international feeling when you stay there, and it does not feel like thailand at all (I mean this in the good sense). The rooms are nice, the food is good, and the swimming pool and foam party for the kids is really the best in the area! BUT.
I do NOT expect to find used band-aid in my bed. this is truly discusting, and took away the magic of the clean room right away. The bed was replaced within 15 minutes, and that is good, also the management listen to my complaints the next day, and said that this will looked in to. but one of the "stars" in my ratings was taken away because of this.
Also, their pool, like mentioned is very very nice, and perfect for little kids who want to have a good time. But their two life guard stations are facing the deeper end of the pool, and not a single life guard faces the 3 slides that are in use by all the youngest people there. My 3 year old, was going down one of the slides by her self, only to smash into another older kid walking up the slide... the crash took her down, and only because I rush to the scene did she not go to the bottom of the pool. They have a rule against running up the slides, but no life-guard or staff to enforce this. also since so many kids play in the pool with out supervision, I think they should have one staff looking at this area of the pool alone. and I have told them this. I took 2 more stars from my review, not only because this is dangerous, and we had a bad experience, but also because their pool manager gave me excuses, and did not see this as a problem.  later another manager told me that they would look into this, but that remains to be seen. 
I would have gladly given 5 stars for this hotel experience, but sadly I can not. I am not sure if I will go back. 
some other notes:
-going to the pool I asked 3 different staffs where I can find the towels... not one of them could help me, only another guest helped me.
-getting service at the pizzaria is quite hard, I had to walk to get help all the time. but the pizza was very good. 
-if you are lucky you can park in front of hotel, otherwise you have to park in what looks like a landfill next door. (see photo).

Hanger for wet swimming gear is needed at shower booth or at balcony.
Shuttle bus(ban) to bus terminal will be very helpful for tourist from Bangkok.
Swimming pool needs to open earlier like 6 am.
Access road(entrance) to parking lot from Sukhumvit road will give more convenience.

A bit of American in the heart of Thailand, is what is the Hard Rock hotel Pattaya!
Very Centrally located, on the beach road, with access from both parallel roads, and convenient to drive to and walk around till late in the night. They have rooms both city and sea facing with small balconies, which I really loved inspite of the fact that we had a city facing room. But openable doors to a balcony in a hotel room is so rare these days, that I would go back just for that! Fresh sea breeze, sunlight streaming into the room early in the morning...it was really nice. Only if we had a upper floor but smoking rooms are on the third floor, which we wanted so we had to do with that!
Service/staff is efficient and understated. Barely managed to reach for breakfast after the late night, but it was worth scrambling out of bed for! I still cannot understand though why resort/holiday hotels in a town like Pattaya, which wakes up in the evening would close breakfast at 10/10.30!!!
Design is a bit sixties/mid-century, black and walnut scheme, stands out in its style! At a time when all new hotels are beginning to look the same with lots of steel and glass, and you forget the hotel soon after you have left it, the Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya, stays with you much longer because of its stylish design and airy rooms!

located in a quiet place. staff is friendly and helpful.
if walk out fr hotel main entrance, to the left have some nice seafood restaurant with reasonable price.
pool is nice but is for kids or some activity.  
got  7-11 in front of main entrance of hotel.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Very very nice hotel with gigantic pool. Kids will definitely enjoyed the pool. Awesome services from friendly staffs. It's a must to stay in the Kings Club floor as you will be well taken care of. Stayed in the kids suite with spacious room. Kids love it. Hotel is very near to shopping area and restaurants. My 4th stay here since 2003 and will definitely come again.

We stayed in Hardrock Pattaya for 3 nights . Its a very Self sufficient hotel.... its very child friendly and all in all a total entertainment for children ( various activities for the kids around the pool area) and for the Adults....All available at one place. Breakfast is very good and a large variety  and staff is very friendly and helpfull  . Rooms are very neat and clean. but it is far from walking street....

Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya again for our family outing. This hotel is always our destination paradise of all occasion. We love the activities at the pool, our kids suite is always our selection. My kids really crazy of thier own suite. They have their own bathrobes, private bathroom and games. Would reccommend to all family with kids, worth for money. Service staff is always out of thier way to serve us. Polite and friendly, compare to other 5 or 6 star we experienced, Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya is better. We reccommend Pizzeria, my kids really like Pizza there, especially ' Margarita Pizza' is Superb.... We will defenitely Come Back for our next vacation.

Good service,food,pools and other cool activities!Perfect for coming alone,with pair or with family.Seven Eleven and Family market are placed near,so you can go there without buses.But the nearest beach isn't very clean.So,4 stars for this hotel-very little.

Marvellous hotel ideally located within distance of Central Festival mall, walking street, beach and many more! We stayed at the Rock Royalty Level as it include benefits such as personalized breakfast from the menu, complimentary juices, milk,and snacks, as well as free flow of cocktail in the evening everyday. Shout out to Som-O, Isra, Paris, Gift, and Patty who have made our stay in RRL a memorable one. 
The soul lounge is an awesome place to hang out and chill at night. There is  live band on weekends.  Staff Mac and Tony was helpful and knowledgeable. 
We are very impressed by the concierge team as their service provide were consistent throughout our whole stay. They greeted the us warmly and were very knowledgeable in providing information to us as and when needed. A shout out to X, Green,Charles, Steve and focus.

Excellent lofation,excellent service,huge pool,persnoni service,
vew from the room to the sea
the team of entertainment are professional
the team of the recpetion very  ptofessional with smile always. of course i'll be back.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Everything about the hotel was Hard Rock. The ambience, the staff. But, the reception staff need to understand a lesson or two in customer service. Just plain arrogant. The property needs to understand that most customers, being tourists, are tired when they arrive at the hotel (flight to Bangkok, drive to Pattaya and the weather). So please at the very least smile, or not be nice to, when you are checking in a customer.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Nice hotel to stay. the staff were very friendly and good. Good location as well as the room view. the pillow are too soft and thin. the staff especially the room attendance is good. he attended guest request. I am very happy when received a letter which advising my depart from HRHP to Bangkok. That was extra mile service.

This year it was my second time @ Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya, for good reason that is. The facilities are clean and modern, the rooms are great and functional. You probably won't find much friendlier staff anywhere, it's thailand after all. Even the security guards are funny guys.
Most of all, check out the pool. It's where you will spend the afternoons with cold beverages when the temperatures rise toward the 40°C mark.
And when you do, you might see Pinky, the girl who hands out the towels at the pool. Say hi from "Mister Pizza Burger" for me, will ya?

Great location, very clean, room great with the city view balcony. Would love to come back again. I tried the free bass guitar in my room. The pool area is perfect with shaded trees to protect me from the sun. Pool area nice and clean. The only thing is that the wooden outdoor flooring burns my feet after leaving the pool.
the breakfast is great. the room is nice in blue color but it's so small space. however, the foam party is really great.

We traveled as a group and found this hotel beautifully, located in the heart of Pattaya beach road. Good food, nice swimming pool,Excellent service and what else you need !!! If you are traveling for business, I would highly recommend to stay at this beautiful hotel.

Hard Rock Pattaya, must visit and stay hotel in Pattaya, hotel is designed completely as per the name, one should stay min 2-3 nights, best part of the hotel of sat live music , swimming pool, 
Rooms size also very good, swimming pool facing room are more good, but size will differ from other basic rooms, breakfast not good for vegeterians, and yes perfect for non vegeterians. Property have enough common areas to explore, drinks are also reasonable in rates.
Beach access is just opposite to back gate.
Didn't find any flaws.

This was the second time that I have stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Pattaya.
I like the location in Pattaya in that it is far enough away from Walking Street, but there is still a lot of restaurants, beer bars and other forms of entertainment around Central Pattaya Road.
At the moment, there is construction going on next door but you can't stop progress.
Rooms were spacious and the hotel was in very good condition.
Next time, I probably won't upgrade to kings club as I very rarely made it to the cocktails in the evening.  The beer bars around Pattaya were a better option in my opinion.

Been there for meeting, nice hotel with friendly staffs. I like the special check-in at floor 10. Food is good. Beautiful swimming pool. That's a pity that there is no private beach.
The room is clean and tidy, but rather small. If the staffs can be quicker, it will be great.

1, had booked a bed room (because there are children, fear of falling bed), Cheka in time to say no ...! Helpless 2 bed rooms are no problem, I want to arrange a high floor of the house, said no (Results arrange the fourth floor, and what the landscape is only one of the four points, four points, one with sea views, Hotel Pool View 4 of 5 stars 1 One of woods scene four minutes, really thoroughly disappointed!). 3, to the night to go out to eat the night market to shop over and over again, each car must go out on their own, I personally think is not very convenient!
Although many shortcomings, but to help us move baggage Simon very enthusiastic!

Family friendly hotel. All staff are energetic and very eager to offer assistance. Stay at kings club room really add benefits as my kids can enjoy tidbits and food at the lounge. Staff also is helpful to find transportation for us to go around pattaya. With a very good rate also

I am an American and wanted to stay at a more American style hotel. I was traveling on business. I was deciding between the Hard Rock and the Holiday Inn. (chose Hard Rock) But my one coworker stayed at the Holiday Inn and loved it. The one thing the Holiday Inn had that I would have liked to see at the Hard Rock was a 24/7 gym. or even if the gym opened at 5 or 6am. The fitness center (gym) opened at 8am. Since I needed to leave for work before 8am I was running outside in the 90/100degF heat. 
Other than the gym times, the room was very nice and comfortable. They have lots of outlets to charge your devices and the room comes with 3 500mL bottles of water. The shower was nice but i couldn't get the rain style shower head to work right. The cell phone they give you was super nice perk and honestly a deciding factor for the hard rock. The phone has excellent data connection and you can take it with you on your travels to make local phone calls (think taxi or restaurants) and it has maps on it (so you never get lost). 
If I travel this way again, I might choose the Holiday Inn only because of the fitness center. But I am a runner and take my training seriously. If I was not towards the end of my training, i would definitely stay at the Hard Rock again.

I know my hotels and you wont be disappointed at the level of Thai hospitality extended here. From the Bottom up...6 stars out of 5 for service, attention, promptness, efficiency. Hotel way over priced by Thai standards and a little..i mean very little needs a facelift ...and rooms small...but overall great stay. The food in Pizzeria outstanding ( Thai Chicken rice and pizza)The hard rock food in restaurant sub par.I stayed in King club away from kids...and there are a lot of them.

Me and my family stayed for 2 nights at Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya. Upon arrival the staffs at the lobby are very friendly and hospitable, they're smile is really welcoming and they offer for assistance. Really big Thanks for Ms.Anne (Guest service manager) and Ms.Brenda (Front Office attendant) for assisting us for checked-in. Very professional and gorgeous. Ms.Paew (concierge) helps us to book tickets and limousine to go to cartoon network water park, she's very kind to us. The room is very nice and cozy. The very beautiful view of beach and pool with sunset is really cool. So many activities to do in this hotel, really amazing! The buffet breakfast was awsome. We ate dinner at Hard rock cafe, the staff is very cool especially Mr.Joe (restaurant manager) he's really awsome and cool guy.. He goes around the cafe to entertain and talk to all the guest.. I will surely come back again in Pattaya and will stay again at Hard rock! I will recommend this hotel to my family and friends!

The Hard Rock Hotel is situated close to the beach and town. There's security staff that have posts and patrol the grounds and the staff is very cognizant of who is around the property. The Hard Rock brand is known for being fun - which is brought to life with the hotel's foam parties. Combining the two give you a sense of security which allows you to have a good time.

Stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for 8 nights whilst stranded due to the volcanic eruption.  Heard so much in the British press about foreign hoteliers profiteering during the crisis, NOT the Hard Rock.  They couldn't do enough to help us, gave us a very good deal on the room, including breakfast, the management were FANTASTIC, especially Gorge.
Apart from the good deal, we were attracted to the Hard Rock because of its luxurious and modern appearance and superb facilities.  The atmosphere within the hotel was superb, exactly what you would expect from a Hard Rock facility.  Everywhere was spotlessly clean and the food was excellent.
What topped it off was the staff, every one of them.  They were incredibly friendly and extremely helpful, always with a smile on their faces.
I would definately stay at the Hard Rock, Pattaya again and would have no hesitation recommending to friends.

Next time use it again~ Thank you!! 
I hope everyone will be happy by then.
I want to visit Pattaya again soon.
다음번에는 조금 더 좋은 뷰를 제공하는 룸에 머물 수 있었으면 하는 개인적인 바람과, 항상 하드락 호텔 사업이 번창하고 건승할 수 있도록 바라겠다. 
굿바이 하드락

Service was great, massive pool wonderful, room was spacious, very clean & comfortable. 
Good food although a bit overpriced. 
I was staying here as part of my honeymoon. My wife & I were very surprised that the hotel is dominated by little children on Friday/Sat & Sun... It's more like a Disney hotel in Florida. 
All the staff were fantastic & overall we had a great stay.

Great stay! We booked the family room on the 9th floor which included a separate room for the kids with bunk beds which they enjoyed. In-Room entertainment was a bonus, with movies on demand and an x-box console for the kids to enjoy. Private access to the King Club room for breakfast and any other time we required was awesome. Thank you to the friendly and efficient staff for making our stay a memorable one!

great value , great service at the cafe and also great location, i would absolutely be retiring only to this resort was very secure and felt like didn't have to sleep with one eye open . on top the staff were really nice as well .
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
A fuss free welcome with some courtesy extras in the lounge. Clear explanations of what we could do with our package. 
The room was as expected but the x-box didn't work we called the housekeeping twice to fix it. The game provided was pretty poor. 
The restaurant and bars were great. 
We took advantage of the kids club, but feel that as we were spending money in the spa as a couple that this service should have been free. 
The children were very happy with the pool and its recent upgrade.

Enjoy the food in the breakfast , lunch and meal in the first floor restaurant . The receiption always helpful on the information . The deco of the lobby and room are good ! With this cool theme leaves us a very good impression !

Great for families and solo travellers both. Incredible pool. And if you staying over a weekend then DO NOT miss out on their signature Saturday Pool Party. Loved it..
A stones throw away from the beach a but a lil far out from walking street. All in all a remarkable property to hibernate and have a lot of fun, at the same time.

This is the second time i stay here.
Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya is always a certainty.
Always very pleasant to use the huge pool
I had ordered a double city view room and kindly I was given a room with partial sea view
All very well
I will come again here

Great location , good hospitality , Very friendly and helpful staff. Hotel was clean and well maintained. Privacy  of the house guest is highly protected. All are systematic and well arranged.  Rooms are spacious, view getting better to higher floors.

As often as we stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel, never disappointed. Friendly staff, clean and very helpful. Great management and awesome manager Mr. JJ.
THANK YOU!!!
It's a fun place/ hotel for the kids also adults. 
Shopping mall walking distance only 10 mins or even less. 
For sure we'll return back and stay here.....

Room was clean and comfortable. Wonderful to have great music wherever we were in the hotel. Great pool and activities............... shame did not have the time to spend at the pool though. Good value breakfast - decent spread though airconditioning could be better in the coffee house.

Hard Rock hotel is an excellent Resort in the heart of Pattaya. The caring staff as well their hospitality is so nice.
The pool is so great for kids as well as adults. We enjoyed our stay her so much.

Stayed in hard rock hotel pattaya for 3 days. Expectation was really high but it's an average hotel. I started in deluxe room with a balcony, not every room has balcony, luckily i got one. It was really really hot during my stay in pattaya, the AC doesn't seem to be working when the hot is terrible. Actually I don't know which one to blame, the heat or the AC. But hotel stuffs were nice. We asked for a baby cot, they gave it even though it came after 50 minutes. The corridor was too dark, swimming pool was big and clean, enough pool chairs/sofa. Buffet breakfast was a mixture of continental and asian food, satisfactory. My expectation was really high because hard rock is a big chain name, but I didn't find anything special, the biggest problem was, i think rooms and washroom were too small. After placing 4 luggage's and a baby cot, there were hardly any space to move.

I live in Pattaya, 1 time monthly,go eat sea food buffet with wine,beer,water incl. The food is exellent,people are friendly.With easter will go eating special Happy Easter restaurant Starz Dinner, Only i have the go closing taxi (Sonkran).😭

It made me feel comfortable during my stay in the hotel. The room is large with good sea view.
And front desk provided good services too. I will select this hotel for my next visit to Pattaya and recommend it to my friends.

Staff are very nice, polite with good service mind. She willing to find 3 non smoking rooms for us because our group had 6 kids. She serviced many groups at the same time with smile. Snack and food at 9th floor lounge is great. Nice sea view as well.

Our family enjoyed this hotel very much and has came back here for more than 10 times already.
The rooms were clean and spacious.  The employees here were well trained and polite.
The quality of the buffet breakfast was good too.
Our favorite is the swimming pool as it is very big and lots of different activities to do.

All the staff are friendly and attentive. It is in a central location and has good facilities for children. Worth getting a Rock Royalty packgage with executive lounge access. 
Only negatives were that the TV was not very intuitive to use and it was noisy until about 12:30 on Saturday night.

This hotel is a 5star category property situated in central pattaya just 1 km from walking Street. The property is a sea facing property so one can spent evening hours on the beach front this hotel is having swimming pools for adults and kids. Staff is very courteous and obliging. I reached pattaya at 10.30am in the morning my booking was from afternoon but they voluntarily gave me the room immediately without any questions. My whole day was saved because of this and we started exploring pattaya. Breakfast menu is huge but as I belong to Jain community the only thing we could eat was fruits hot milk and corn flakes . If they improve a little bit on this front like  providing vegetarian  Indian breakfast at least 2 items then I would say that any body visiting pattaya should not think twice if you are booking a room in hard rock pattaya. The rooms are big and superbly maintained. Lastly I would say that pattaya rocks because of hardrock.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Great place, friendly staff.. hat a good view to the oacen. Hotel is next to the beach. Love this place. Hardrock Café next door, there is an ATM just outside the hotel, very comfortable. 
Nice Pool area. Food at the Hotel is very good, they do barbecue outside.
Nice restaurants along the beach, not far from walking street.

Very good hotel where you really feel welcome. and always happy and friendly staff. The quality of the breakfast is also top notch. There is no place to clean. So a completely frantic stay from the time you come to the journey again

We stayed for 2 nights at Hard Rock Pattaya recently from May 16-May 18, 2018. Nice property, big pool, excellent SPA, location and hospitality from Staff. The breakfast at the property was well spread and had few indian dishes also.

Well, our room with sea view was pretty wonderful.  Reading the reviews one was the "dirt lot" in the view.  The hotel next door went out of business and their pool and dirt is unkempt.  Not sure how Hard Rock can be held accountable for this...although I do recommend purchasing the lot and expanding the Hard Rock.
     Room service menu was extensive and the Madras Curry was top level great!
poolside service was excellent.  Drinks were mixed well.  Pool not overly busy.  A slight problem with people dropping towels on beds all day even when not there but we managed to find a spot without problems every day.  Just the best seats taken sometimes for most of the day without people coming back to them.
     Pool party on Saturday night was pretty awesome.  
     Location is fantastic.  1km from walking street.  many eateries and pubs within 5-10min.  once you figure out the 10baht shuttles on the street transport is no problem.  Taxi drivers gouge you for 200bht from walking street back when very late night...but really...that is $7usd...and you can walk in 20min should you not wanna pay.
     Cannot mention enough how nice the staff was.  Security guy sees you coming and presses elevator door for you.  everyone holding doors for you, service you actually don't get at some 5 star locations.
     So yeah, great bang for the buck.  food prices reasonable.  None of the problems faced in any complaints.   Only issues...left our door open and a bird flew in and snatched food off the counter...twice.   so seems he has it down.   And the part of the pool nearest beach had a lot of gnats and flies. Had a faint smell of refuse.  Did not notice that second day so think related to garbage day or similar?
     We'll certainly stay again next year's vacation.
     The hotel arranged car service is fairly inexpensive however you can walk up to the road near the 7-11 and the taxis there will get you to BKK for 1200Baht, 1500 if you need the mid sized car...just walk up there and tell them what time you wanna leave and they come right to the hotel door.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
arrival was total chaos! at the front desk, five staff were running around like headless chickens, trying to check in to many guests at the same time.  we were passed between three receptionists before one of them realised that we had booked the kings club floor!  told to wait (and wait a bit longer) before finally, between the three receptionists one decided that we should be escorted to the 9th floor. first impressions,, not so good !!
well, what a wonderful welcome on the 9th floor. Absolutely spot on!  Fantastic welcome, professional staff, friendly, and so pleased to see us!  perfect!!
book a kings club floor!  worth the little extra, and the service is fantastic!  the GRO's are wonderfully friendly, ever so helpful and such... could not do enough for all guests (including a very rude and large family with three kids who had the GRO staff running around for sandwich after sandwich after sandwich.. unreal!)....
breakfast fab, cocktails (arrived late each day as been out) were a great also, but there are some greedy guests haha.. but as included, well that is to be expected l guess.....
sadly, the swimming pool is in need of a very good deep clean.. the centre of the pool has debris on the floor, dirty tiles and the sun tan oil is present on the surface in parts of the pool areas...the locker rooms could be a bit more cleaner too, some stronger disenfectant cleaner would not go a miss to give it the shine/freshness as last time we stayed there.
the resort could do with a good big cleaning day - walkways to pools, stones in the pools across from sunlougers to the spa/shower rooms etc.. but overall great again..
activities galour; the construction work on the famous guitar was nicely covered up and no noise at all, so no worries there...
fabulous, will be back, but GM, please congratulate your kings club team.. first rate !!!

So a week before leaving for Phuket and Bangkok we changed to staying at the HRH in Pattaya, and we absolutely loved it! We arrived in Bangkok on the 19th so it was good that we got out asap!. Everyone was so nice and friendly at the HRH, we got up to our room quickly and the luggage soon followed. We had a pool view room and had 2 double beds which was great! The rooms are small but there was still heaps of room for us to spread all our shopping around. 
Breakfast was fantastic! heaps of variety and on 2 days we left before 6:30am so they made us breakfast boxes with a sandwich, water, orange drink, some pastries and fruit. 
The pool was awesome! With a beach section and a trampoline in the middle of the pool. Saturday night's foam party was so much fun! Thankyou to the Thai government for lifting curfew just in time! Also on the Friday they had a pool party and all the staff came our and were dancing to YMCA, quite entertaining.
It's walking distance to Central Festival and Royal Garden Plaza shopping centres, and also a Big C if you want groceries. 
The only thing I didn't enjoy was that the lobby had a very strange smell... Not sure what it was but after a few days I sort of got used to it. 
I would definitely stay here again, and almost certainly on a saturday night to go to the foam party!

we enjoyed our stay here at the hotel. typical hard rock set up. great food and friendly staff. excellent pool area to hang out at with the family. centrally located so easy to get around. the beach area in front is not so clean but we stayed in the pool area which was fine.

It was my first time staying in this hotel. What impress me a lot was about staff behaviors. They were very delighted and helpful especially ‘Rooney’ who always supported our activities and brought us big laugh and smile. Cheers :)

I stayed 20 more times at Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya.
very nice, very comfortable. All staffs are very kind and smiling. 
It was good to stay at 9th floor and it was convenient to use Rock Royalty level.
I hope I want to stay with my family again.

Relaxed feel, nice surroundings and staff very friendly. Room great, hotel spotless, food  very good only  negative not many rooms have balconies.
Pools  very  nice and across the road from the beach. Spa, sauna, steam room and gym of high quality.
Would recommend.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Rooms were clean, new comfortable, pool is great, people very friendly and great for kids. Food very good and very modern. Well located, near walking street but not to near. Beach front also. Overall great place for families.

This  Hotels door mat reads, "We Welcome All"..! Its a pleasure to stay here, from check in to check out. Good service, friendly staff, delicious meals, if there is an issue, its addressed ASAP! I had an excellent room with a beautiful view which I requested, really enjoyed the " Battle of the Guitar " evening, nice touch. It was nice to see business, family and friends welcomed. This always adds to a comfortable hotel experience! Bottom line, nice hotel and excellent stay....keep up the good work!

I should say the newly renovated rooms till the fourt floor r really good & rocks ..... Thay r really spacious & well furnished .looks damn good ...But misssed the faom dance since its on saturday only & we didnt know about it earlier .....The staffs were very courteous & helping

We had our best time in HR. The staff were very supportive. Ambience was lively. We love the huge pool. Most of our time in HR, we spent in Pool. Activities arranged by pool team was very good. We loved foam party. The view from our room and balcony (823) was outstanding. Food was also good.

Great location. Prompt service. Excellent swimming pool. Great roadside bar. Breakfast full & delicious. Rooms are comfortable and spacious. Overall, excellent experience. Will definitely come back.Thank you.

Stayed here on 22 April 2016 for a night. The place is fantastic! The bell hop Charles was very helpful, friendly and informative! From the time my taxi reached the hotel, my stay was pleasant! The room I was assigned was upgraded as I am a memeber of the HRC rewards club....a very pleasant surprise. 
The amenities were more than adequate with bathrobes and toiletries supplied adequately. The bed was so so comfortable and for once I managed to get a really good pillow to sleep on!
When I checked out the next day, the feeling I got was....should have stayed for more than 1 night! Definitely will stay there again!

This hotel is very close to beach. It has very nice swimming pool, gym, several restaurants: Classic Hard Rock Café and BBQ Restaurant. Food is reasonably priced and fresh. Services are very good. Housekeeping is very clean and environment friendly.

Nothing special, room was okay, blood stain on the sofa, free wifi for 2 devices only , around 15 mins walk to central festival. The pool is nice and huge . 7-11 is just opposite the hotel. Breakfast was nice with wide selection (rice, bread, thai style noodle soup, fruits, yoghurt , cereal, waffle and so on). Staff friendliness need to be improved
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: A very well managed Hotel with great staff everywhere...We had a networking event and dinner in the ballroom and our guests were very impressed. I have not heard one complaint so great work by the Hard Rock team!!!!

— - -
We arrived at the hotel in the morning and was informed that the room will be ready at 14:00. We came back and waited for 30 mins. Got the room at 14:30, coz our room was double checked by head of cleaning department. Ok...
No toothbrush kits provided, I found out that you need to ask for it. Seriously??
WiFi username and password given was available for 1 day, but my booking was three nights. 
No door between wet and dry zone. I did a mess. 
+++
Room is ok, not big but not so tight. 
Breakfast was normal, nothing is outstanding. 
Staff was friendly. 
Well, I won’t come back and I wouldn’t recommend this hotel. 
With this much room charge, you have more alternative choices for example, Siam at Siam or baraquda or Siam bayshore

A very very good hotel for family & couples! The bed is very comfortable,staff are friendly. Very attentive housekeeping, they come to your room just 10-15mins after you call. Wide range of food selections is buffet breakfast served. The jacuzzi is simply awesome! Overlooking the sea and passer by. The Pool is nice, but not as great as Hard Rock Bali. Hard Rock Bali has a kiddie pool that could occupy kids whole day. Lil' Rock was charge hourly at 85bath per hour, which isn't great either. Hard Rock Bali practices a 1 time payment upon check in. In room wifi was also chargeable at 400 bath for 24 hours usage.

On the last day after i checked out, i cant contact the transporter (to airport) due to my thandphone cannot call out. Your front guy, Mazlan assist me to call the transporter (i have booked earlier) and the car arrived 5 minutes later.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The best hotel for family and couple also.  My kids love here. Friendly and helpful. Good location,  nice swimming pool and activities. Great breakfast and great benefit for Rock Royalty room type.  All the best you are!!

Many rooms and many tourists. Very noizy and poor amenities in a room. No toothbrush, no beach sandals, no terrace. And why do we have to speak English but not Thai language with some staffs in this hotel though this is in Thailand? Some says "sorry, I can't speak thai". So funny.
This is just American style hotel in Thailand. I couldn't feel anything about Thailand while I stayed in this hotel and I felt like I was in another country but not Thailand. My thai gf also said the qualities in this hotel is not 4 star. More than3 but less than 4. I won't choose again cause I want to feel "I am in Thailand now" while I am in Thailand.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Bad service with the reception. Have only one reception at the front line. No bellboy at night that i stay at the hotel. But overall of the hotel is ok, clean and comfortable except the service is bad.

Stayed in March 2013 and I could not have loved it more! The staff were fantastic!! After two days everyone knew my name and looked after me in every way. 
The cafe was as expected and gave me the best options for a fussy eater, as I am.  
Will return for another small break soon. 
Thank you Hard Rock!!

Staff very fair and helpfull. Great swimming pool. Climbing and Thai boxing lesson for children or adults.
Beach not clean and very noisy on morning due to hundred of fast boat., but the hotel has sand beach swimming pool.

Stayed at the Hard Rock hotel situated on Beach Road Pattaya for the first time April 2019 and I am already looking forward to returning.
Our party of 8 people stayed here for a total of 3 weeks and I can’t think of a single thing I could fault or would change.
The hotel is exceptionally clean, has fantastic facilities and is topped off with amazing members of staff. Every member of staff we seen were always extremely polite and very friendly and I’d also like to give a special mention too all the pool staff( Sax, Tat, Hop, Quito, Dennis, Thomas Wut, Artie, Joey, Paul, Mike, Rooney) for the work they do throughout the day, from the games they play etc and the effort they put in too making sure everyone is enjoying their holidays, they are a credit too Hard Rock and have made our holiday one to remember.
Also a mention too Patchy and Takumi for being great in their roles.
Highly recommend! Will 100% be retuning next year(already counting down the days).

We ended up staying at the Hard Rock hotel while in Pattaya which is located deep into resort row there. The staff is friendly, the amenities are good, the rooms are your typical Hard Rock style rooms with rock and roll themes.
The pool is awesome, the have cabanas next to the pool as well. Also the restaurant inside is fine. It's just a short walk from the beach across the street and there's lots to do and see while there. Such as take a boat to turtle island and such. 
There hotel is a short walk from a bar/club area as well which attracts lots of single men because of the services offered by many of the locals. The beers are cheap and the food is good. Be aware of all the people offering services along the beach path at night! lol!

It is the best hotel  and it is in the heart of that place .  This  hotel provides different activities for everyone to join everyday and has bubble party in the swimming pool every Saturday.   After staying you will feel more relax and become more younger.

It will be good if can offer more free activities for kids instead of fee per hour chargeable. Welcome drink for guest. More tea bags for guest. Should learn from Novotel. Hard Rock Cafe food standard low.

Excellent location with good staff who speak English and are ready to help. Really enjoyed the swimming pool and would highly recommend that guests should be informed to sit on a towel in the sauna and remove their slippers when in the sauna. The steam bath smelt a little funny. Our overall experience in the hotel was fabulous and the little things mentioned above will not deter me from revisiting the Hotel again. We really cannot wait to come back to HRH Pattaya!

Very good Hotel
Nice SPA
Nice Composer Suite
Nice Pool
Nice Cabana Service
Nice Pool Party
The party is very good, but the party has a flaw, is that we are very dissatisfied, my husband is very unhappy. In the party in progress, my husband had wanted to use the most quick way back to our Cabana number 11, but the hotel staff is impolite and very impulsive to stop him not allowed to climb on the Cabana, Face expression is also very bad, we are residents, why not use a friendly way? Why use the impolite way to ask guests to return along the way Cabana! The employee was so disappointed and dissatisfied.
Hope to improve this situation.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
We only stayed here for one night
After coming back from Koh Lan, before leaving Pattaya. The location of the hotel is good & they provided us with free parking.  Check in was quick and efficient.  The room on the 5th floor was of a pretty good size, clean, with good amenities and a good view over the beach. We both slept well.  We had a drink at one of their bars and watched a band. The band was quite reasonable, the drinks were expensive.  350b for a glass of wine, 300b for a strawberry lemonade. Breakfast was pretty good.  The grounds, and the swimming pool are also very nice and you are conveniently located on beach road.  Not far from market stalls, bars, restaurants and Central Festival shopping center.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I stayed at the HRH Pattaya for one night in a Composer suite (room 924) with my wife and 2 kids. Mainly chose this hotel to experience it again after a few years and because of the kid activities and the Kids wanna Rock rate included breakfast for 2 adults and 2 children plus 2 hours play time in the Lil Rock play lounge so seemed like a good deal compared to others like Holiday Inn and Amari.
Arrived just after noon and at front desk they checked our passports and than we were escorted to the lounge as the Composer suite is on the King's club level which now is called Rock Royalty floor and rooms. Took a while to check in at the lounge as there is only one person working at the desk and there were several people checking out. But my kids raided the cake spread after the long trip so it wasn't all bad :)
The lounge itself is all right. Sandwiches, soft drinks, coffee, pastries and some cakes all day and cocktail hour from 6-7:30pm. It is not very large but was never very busy either so was ok.
We were in our room by 1pm so early check in and also arranged for a late check out at 2 pm included in the Rock Royalty room rate.
The suite itself is quite large with a huge sofa in the living room that can comfortably sleep 2 adults and the bedroom has a big king size bed which i found very comfortable. There is a small toilet near the room entrance and a larger bathroom with a shower and a very big bath which takes forever to fill up :)
There were also 2 balconies one overlooking the pool and has a sea view. The other looks to the side toward Central festival/Hilton and all the way down beach road towards walking street.
Also all per per view movies were free so that was nice. Not sure if all rooms or just some offer this for free.
The Pool is really nice and has a small beach and you can rent some cabanas on the beach side of the pool for 1000 per day. My wife just went down with kids and sat on one of those and without asking they started bringing drinks and just later did she find out it was a 1000 charge. It's ok we used it for the whole afternoon but should have been told this before the free drinks are served so she could make that choice.
I do recommend this for families as both adults and children have plenty to do. Lot's of things do require some extra payments and are not included in the price like the kids lounge, floaters for the pool, ping pong, pool table etc all are about 100 per hour per person.
I also visited the hard rock cafe that evening for dinner and at about 22h there were only 2 other tables occupied so i kinda enjoyed that as i was expecting a crowd and it to be loud.
The breakfast was both served at the Lounge and downstairs at the Starz restaurant. We chose to eat downstairs as the selection was bigger but also a bit crowded but not too much to make it uncomfortable.
That day still used the pool and checked out at 2pm which was also done at the lounge so my kids could have some more cake before we leave hehe
Overall i'm quite happy with our stay and actually might come again next week. The plus were the staff who all spoke very good English and very friendly.
I guess if there is something i would mention the door of the shower (room 924) does not close very well so water gets out. Also if you use the shower head in the bath the water will be everywhere. And perhaps a bit longer check in at the lounge which took about 30 min could have been done at the reception in less than 5 but you do get free cake ;)
P.S. There was a mix up with the rate i booked so once my wife wanted to use some of the perks included in the room rate they just said now she has to pay. But a quick visit to the front desk and some intervention from the Foreign lady at the front desk it was quickly fixed. I just recommend to bring out a print out of your reservation or email on your phone so you have some proof that you actually booked the rate and room but that goes for any hotel. Honest mistake that was taken care of quickly.

all of staff that we meet they're very good manners, kindness and also remember our name and room no. especially staff at Starz Dinner.  our family like this Hotel and we will be back here in the future.

Hard Rock hotel is a super property, centrally located and full of friendly and Cool staffs. Book the sea facing room to enhance your experience. Swimming pool is really awesome. Lot of events take place kuch nai this hotel with adds to the charm of property. Thumbs up !!

Wonderful pool, friendly staff, immaculate rooms and good location. Great for families or couples. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend to anyone who has to travel to Pattaya. Buffet breakfast was extensive and delicious too.

Good memory come back. Hotel staff are as thoughtful as usual. The big swimming pools is clean with nice view. It is kids' heaven. The buffet has more varieties, western , Japapnese, Chinese and local cusine. Barbecue is delicious ! One of gate at Hardrock Cafe can lead to Pattaya beach.

Such a perfect hotel in town, very convenient going out but  you can have a very good quality of sleep from proper soft bed and high quality of bed sheet, blanket and pillow.  Plenty of food in breakfast.  Good taste and quality. Have FULL MEAL and REST here.

This hotel is one of my top three favorite hotels in bangkok. At first, it seemed like a crowded and noisy place but after all, it wasn't. I had my best time there in the swimming pool. There are about 4 swimming pools, and my favorites was one of the kids swimming pool which had sand instead of the ground and slides, and the other one was the big swimming pool. I liked the big swimming pool because instead of just swimming in the water, the hotel staffs would set up a game once in about 30 minutes. For example, there was bingo, and people would just gather up and EVERYONE could play. My favorite one was walking on wiggly steps from one end of the swimming pool to other end because I got second place and they gave me a prize! Also there was soccer(with hands). There is a pizza restaurant near the pool so I got to eat pizza while swimming. The pizza was awesome!

I recently spent 10 days at the Hard Rock Pattaya and enjoyed my stay there. The hotel is nice, clean, and has an awesome pool. I had a group of about 25 people and the hotel staff had no problem getting us checked in quickly and without issue. Here are some of the things I liked about the hotel:
The rooms are very nice. I guess the place had been recently renovated, and I must say they did a great job. The bathrooms were very stlyish and had an awesome and huge shower. 
The hotel restaurants facilities were nice and offered enough variety to suit most people's tastes. Each morning a breakfast buffet is provided and had sufficient variety that I was not bored with it by the tenth day. There is also of course a Hard Rock Cafe attached to the place, but I rarely ate there. My friends and I actually spent most of our lunches at the outdoor cafe downstairs by the pool area. Their pizzas were very very good. Drinks by the pool can get pretty pricey, so we often just raided our minibars since they were significantly cheaper. BTW, a 4 pack of Sing Has only cost 128 baht across the street at the Family Mart. 
The hotel had a sufficient amount of entertainment as well. The staff there would organize pool volleyball and pool basketball games which were a lot of fun. Be warned though, if you beat them they won't actually buy you drinks even though that's what they wagered. But it was fun nonetheless. On Fridays the hotel throws a foam party. The one I went to was a lot of fun, but I think that had much to do with the tons of Russian girls that were staying in the hotel. Either way it's worth checking out. Just don't go until about 11pm when the party really gets started.
The guest here tended to be younger and more fun people to be around. This was a favorite hotel for families. In contrast the guests at the Marriott tended to be more older fat guys and their Thai girlfriends/boyfrieds, and fewer people in the 20-35 age. 
Things I did not like about the hotel:
The location of the Hotel is fair. It was quite a walk down to walking street, but still very easy and cheap if you simply took a baht bus. Otherwise you can walk through a gauntlet of vendors and bar girls trying to get you to buy stuff or visit their bars. On one instance we literally had girls jumping on our backs trying to get us into the bar. The place is real close to soi 6, though, if you don't feel like heading to Walking St. The shopping near the hotel was pretty decent, but know that the prices are generally better at the stores away from the beach area. My favorite was the location of the night bazaar (which was also open during the day). They seemed to start out with better prices and were more willing to haggle there. 
The internet was very difficult for us, and was not what I would expect at a hotel of this quality. Firstly, you're only issued one code for the internet. This means you can only have one device at a time on the internet. Not a terrible thing, but still annoying. Add to this with the fact that the internet was down about 20% of the time during my stay. It seemed that just when it was most critical for me to get onto the internet it was down. The staff blamed it on Pattaya's internet being unreliable, but I stayed a few days at the Marriott and had no such issues. 
All in all I would stay at the Hard Rock again if need be, but would prefer the Marriott if I had the option.

we enjoyed a lot during our stay.  opposite is beach , just crossed the road and we are in the beach.  good hotel nice environment  and  we enjoyed the hospitality.  food is  good  and breakfast really very nice.

as brand Hard Rock, expected ultimate service excellence, but sorry to say disappointed. Ordered Fresh lime, where served Artificial Lime Powder .. No Water Offered / Beverages served after food / we were in a group, half of the friend while finished their food half was waiting their food to come.

We spent 13 nights at the Hard Rock Hotel. Well what can I say, this place is amazing. The staff is lovely and always a smile on their faces. From the moment we arrived to our last day they made our stay so welcoming. The room we had was a sea view deluxe with balcony, the views are amazing, especially watching the thunder and lightening storms. The rooms are kept so clean, by the maids every day.
