The staff were incredibly helpful, of not in particular was Paris on the front desk - she helped me a great deal with my future bookings at the Hard Rock Hotel when I am due to come back in September.  The breakfast buffet was incredible and had such a wide variety to cater for any taste.

Overall is good, a bit not happy with the slow service for every of our requests.
Good location, walking distance to Central Festival and Beach side.
Pool party is happening, Food quality is good and acceptable.

We r late for pool foam party but still can catch the games. Our children played happily.  Also there are lots of food stall outside hotel. Shopping mall, big c within 10 mins walking distance. Very convenience.!

Poor area was the best the staff very friendly always happy. Best location jacuzzi was our favourite. Rooms very comfortable beds were the best so clean. Can't wait to go back to the hard rock in December
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I swimming pools, hotel locations, beach accessibility, and various restaurants  good.
I liked playing games for the kids.
Water polo for adults was also fun.
I want to visit again.
However, it is necessary to designate a non-smoking area.
hardrok hotel many children visit, I hope will consider for kids health.

It does feel like coming home - facilities, services, all spot on, and above all the staff are mostly still the same and recognized us immediately. Isn't that what hospitality should be all about? Pattaya is changing, they've cleaned up the beachfront which is good, and it's an ever-so popular destination for shopping, beach and the more adult-oriented activities. Will we be back? Most definitely - who doesn't want to 'come home' every now and then?!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I stayed here for one night and I simply had a blast. There are a lot of activities within the hotel and the foam party was just amazing. I would surely comeback here. Also the GRM named Ann was really helpful . I had a great time talking with her , not to mention she is really beautiful.

Tha huge pool, the team ,the give you filling like big family.evry things you ask the smile to you and happy to help.
The room very comfortable the pool very clean.the barkfest very good . I am sure i come again next 9 time :)

I stayed at the HR for my birthday. I booked an ocean view room but I was given a corner room. I inquired to be changed but was told nothing could be done. I had better expectation as it was my first time at the Hard Rock. Hotel location, security, pool area and spa are great!
column7: Thousand Islands New York, New York
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Is a perfect holiday, the room and the location is good for me, but the balcony is small for me, because I like to stay in the balcony.
If the air conditioner outlet can be tuned to the best, because the outlet is facing some sleep on the bed's head.
May be next time i'll try the Roxtars Family Suite.

It is the second time I stay with Hard Rock.  I am feeling well with this hotel with their friendly staff, nice room and facilities.  Good location and reasonable charge, which I think is one of best beach side hotel in Pattaya.

My first trip to Thailand and hardrock hotel pattaya makes it perfect!! I stay there for 10 days and they still makes me want to stay there again.
I love the foam party!! Proffesional and friendly staff, cool hotel.

Service is good, Breakfast has fresh various food,stay on Rock royalty floor with access to lounge has more benefit. location on beach and close to big department store. I like Saturday night party foam.

Nice pool and live band. Good breakfast and location. 
When you go to Pattaya to visit, Hard Rock Hotel is a great choice.
In addition, the location is excellent and won't disappoint you and your family.

After one week Bussines trip in Bangkok ,me and me wife usually come here for 3-4 relaxing days, before going home!
We choose this hotel because of it's great location,nice staff,very good entertainment at the pool area all day,nice new rooms,nice spa,best value

Had a ball at Hard Rock. Started the mid morning in the pool with aqua aerobics and cocktails…. huge fun !!! Rooms were very small but clean, tidy and funky. Breakfast in the Captains Club was awesome and private unless you like wholesale buffet?? Not us !!
Plenty of opportunity to go to Crab Island or any other island to do water sports etc…but we prefer to shop and sit by the pool.
One night to a lovely seafood cafe where we picked our fair and had it cooked for us and it was very inexpensive in AUS $.

Booked in here, after moving from a bad hotel.

I knew exactly what to get here. A stylish resort hotel. Friendly staff, lots of variety in bars restaurants etc.

The room was big and spacious and comfortable. The only issue was that the curtains seemed a a fraction too small, and allowed a little bit of light in.

I ate in the retaurant, the food was tasty. Nothing extravagant, but tasty.
The pool was lovely, lazed around it for 2 days. They should probably look at changing the sun lounger matresses to something water proof (so they can be dried) or alternatively store them under cover during rainy season, so that they can be taken out or pout away when the rain comes, It wasn't that nice lying on a damp sun lounger.

When I arrived there was a bit of a damp smell in teh corridor leading to my room, but they seem to have noticed that themselves, and it was gone by the time I was leaving.

My big problem with the hotel was the concierge - I felt he was trying to screw me and kept referring me to more expensive options of transport I was asking for. I asked him to book me a taxi to the bus station, but he informed me that 8 hours wasn't enough time to make it to the airport, and he could get me a minibus direct to the airport for 1500 baht. I used a direct public bus direct to bangkok for 100 baht!

The conciege should be an honest guy who can help provide direction and information, I felt this guy was just trying to refer me to expensive services he knew, maybe he was getting a refferall fee, I felt this let the hotel down, and showed it in a bad light.

Bad hotel my family didn't enjoy the stay and only after we moved to holiday Inn we felt our self in vecation.
The room is very bad and very noisy, we didn't like the decorations and it was a bad desesion to stay here.
The breakfast was limited only the eggs was good .
I wouldn't stay in this hotel again and neither recommend it to anybody.

I stayed hard rock hotel pattaya 2 nights with 2 little sons.
They were very excited  all day at very wide swimming pool and at a bank bed of Kids suite.  They had stayed with many fun.
However, during the poolside events, the volume of the music and the microphone is too large, they was scared.
I thought it will be better to reduce a little more volume.

My family and I (kids are 7 and 3) stayed at the hotel for 4 nights last week.  The kids suite is great and provided us the extra room needed.  The buffet breakfast, while busy, was still enjoyable and had enough choices everyone in the family.  We used the kids club twice, once was the whole day and I was a little disappointed in the activities available for the kids.  Given the costs you pay for the kids club, I would have thought there would be a greater amount of crafts and activities being offered to the children. There is a strong preference for watching dvd's and playing playstation games rather than playing toys and doing crafts.  The pool area and the activities around the pool are great for kids of any age.  The sandy beach area is shallow enough for our 3 year to stand up and splash around.  There are mats and other pool equipment available for rent.  The water slide is also great for little kids but they will need assistance getting up the steps.  There are afternoon activities including games and the best was on the Saturday afternoon when there was a kids foam party as well as staffed dressed up as super heroes doing balloon crafts.  We had meals at the Hard Rock cafe and the pizza restaurant.  Both were good meals although a lot pricier than what is available around but reasonable for hotel prices.  The staff at this hotel were great, from concierge right through to the restaurant and housekeeping.  All in all we had a great time and will be back again.

This was the worst hotel in Thailand. Employees do not laugh and say hello. The attitude of conversation is unkind. I think it's a very serious problem. I feel like customers and staff have changed. It is a hotel chosen because of swimming pool. But after using the swimming pool, I had a problem with my skin. I do not want to use it again
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Large pool, professional staff and excellent amenities.  Thoroughly enjoyed my stay.  It is conveniently located within walking distance of many restaurants and bars. The property is secure and the room very clean with surprise nighttime fruit and sweets.

Found room amenities were not well equipped when we first check-in,  no hand towels , face towels and toothbrush were found in the bathroom.   Need to call room service to get them.  Also the chairs put at the balcony were dirty

As captioned, I didn't like the hotel. 

To begin with, before our trip, they took ages to reply our email queries. When they replied that asked us back if our package comes with complimentary entry to Cartoon Network Amazone Water Park when we asked if there is complimentary transport there. Obviously, the staff who replied doesn't do her homework to check the package we have booked (reservation no. was provided to them).

Upon arrival, the hotel didn't look to us that it is well maintained. It looks old and room floor passage way ceiling is low. This gives a suffocating feeling when walking at the room floor passage way.

At check in at the VIP conceige, we asked for a Non Smoking Sea View Lil Rock suite but we given a smoking room instead. When we asked the staff who escorted us to our room, he said ours is a Non smoking floor. We later found out at the lift,which indicates that Level 10 is a smoking floor. So, we feedback to Ann (the lady who manages the VIP conceige). She then apologized and explained why our request cannot be fulfilled. We accepted it.

On another occasion, we asked the night duty VIP Conceige staff (not Ann) about the opening hours of Lil Rock. She gave us wrong info.

Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya, may I request you to train your staff well to provide guest with right information of your hotel? This is extremely embarrassing for your entire hotel organization! If they are not sure, please tell guest that they will check and get back. Please do not give guests falseful info. No guests will like being skirt around! 

Room housekeeping. The housekeeping didn't come for turn down service on Day 1 and 2. Likewise, for usual morning room make up on Day 2. Again, we have to feedback to Ann. If the housekeeping miss our room the first time, we can understand...but thrice? 

X box in room. Lil Rock suite comes with X box in the room. Ours was out of order on Day 1. The repair man came twice separately on Day 1 and 2, so repaired twice but can't be played again after 15 mins so my boys eventually gave up playing it.

Waiting time for food order at restaurant. OMG....it is way too long. The waiting time is almost 30-45 mins and it is during their off peak hours. But strange, the room service for food is efficient regardless when you order.

On our 2nd last day there, we asked for kid's room slippers. They came and gave us adult's. When I told them that it is not right. The guy told me that they do not have spare pairs. We feel that this is fishy cos' how can a hotel that cater for families run out of kid's room slippers? We went to the VIP conceige and requested for it. And, we finally got our request. This, we feel that staff is plain laziness to get the request right. 

Hello, shouldn't Hard Rock do regular maintaince for their amenities and not give guests inconvenience to keep requesting and feedback umpteen times during their stay? What kind of a holiday is it when guests have to worry about such things?

Lil Rock. Nothing is exactly organized at the Lil Rock. Kids just go and play X box and toys. This is unlike other hotel kids' club that we have been to, which organized games and activities for the children. And, at Lil Rock, you have to pay for your kid to enter. Luckily, our package comes with complimentary 2 hours daily use so we didn't have to pay.

Both our toilets are smelly. I keep smelling urine on and off even though it has just been make up! And, they give adult tooth paste and brushes to children!

Complimentary Wifi.  The wifi is unstable and cumersome. Example, in room you may be logged out 2-3 times. As such, we have to log in several times a day in the hotel. To make things worst, this Hard Rock hotel issues password in a small piece of paper. So, guest will have to keep the paper. Else, you won't be able to use the wifi when you lose it or you will have to request again from the reception counter.

As for location, we feel it is not that accessible too. Central Festival Mall is about 15mins walking distance and the flea market is a distance too. The only convenience is to the beach which is just across the road.

Last but not least, when I asked for a cup of cuppocino at VIP Conceige. Your staff said "OK. I will get it for you." but didn't see my order served when I waited for 15 minutes. Your staff were talking merrily away among themselves when I was waiting. Eventually, I made my own cuppocino. What kind of hospitality is this?

Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya is definitely not worth the price we pay for this holiday! This is a hotel that does not pay attention details and guests' needs.

Will not recommend anyone to stay here!

We headed to Pattaya from scratch, no fixed plan or booking made ahead. So if you're about to do the same,  please don't hesitate to check into Hard Rock Hotel.  Price is reasonable for around 3500 bhatt per night, wifi and buffet breakfast included.  Has huge and fun swimming pool which is a good option if you dont feel like going to the nearby beach. Its also a 15 mins walk to the famous red light district,  Walking Street, where local shops and malls can be passed by. They have designated floors for smokers and non smokers which I think is great. Live bands every night at Hard Rock cafe for you to really have a Rocking Stay.  :)
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: They take care of the safety of the guests. Good rooms and stay. Service was great. Break was ok. Location is great. Staff is exemplary and very liberal on the guest policies.. Recommend for the travelers

Everything about the place is great. Beach is just across the road, nice swimming pool and pool bar, sauna and kids water slides and play area. Breakfast is also good. You can take tuk tuk, taxi or even bike taxi just outside the back gate of hotel to any place u want to go in pattaya. Lot of restraunts, bars and shopping places are just within walking distance from hotel. If you are in night life, that just in next lane  right from back gate. Walking Street also nearby you may walk along the beach 15-20 minutes or just take tuk tuk. The staff overall is good and helpful. We enjoyed our stay in Hard Rock and will surely stat if we are coming to pattaya :)
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Service was poor. Check in really slow. Restaurant and bar prices really very high for the quality of food and drink provided. Rooms dated and central aircon lets smoke into non smoking rooms. Staff not sure how to deal with it. Brand is basically tired and dated and the whole experience needs an overhaul.

We love this holiday. Your staffs are very friendly . Thank you for making our trip memorable. We will definetaly recommend to friends and family members to go Hard rock Pattaya. Thank you again to Hard rock hotel entire team
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Stayed one week in the Hard Rock Hotel, Rock Royalty level. Definitely worth it, nice big room with lounge access, free soft drinks all day, in the evening cocktails, beer wine and some small food. 
Pool is nice, lots of activity but no obligation to join anything... 
Ordered free Fender guitar to my room, great experience. 
Breakfast is good and international, Thai and western food available. 
Sleep was also very good. 
Staff in general is fantastic, very, very friendly and helpful. 
I will surely come back after pool renovation is finished.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Great experience,, all the staff is so nice, the pool is great the breakfast is delicious, the room is spacious, Pool events and party were so much fun. I will stay here the next time I am in Pattaya, no doubt about it!!

I have spend 2 nights in this hotel in this June. This was my second visit as my first visit was in 2012. The hotel is nice but compare to my first visit the service level has gone down. Overall staffs are friendly except the reception staff. The staff who spoke to us on arrival was not courteous at all. Overall I like the hotel and would like to come back soon.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: My family and I have a great time there. I love this hotel very much. That is my third times stay in this hotel. I will  recommend my friend this hotel. The  location is very  convenience. The  swimming pool is big and  beautiful.

I stayed 4 nights in this hotel since I have a business trip in Chorburi. the staff is very nice and speak much better English than other hotels I have stayed before. the location is very good, close to market and shopping area. However, their housekeeping should do a better job. the floor is dusty, the shower is broken, I got insect bites
and the air-condition is too noisy.

only a leak in communications, what came out, that we celebrated 225th AND 100th milestone in other Hard Rocks. All others went out well. We just left earlier than planned and booked tru 3rd party because of conditions and prices. Strange...

Your hotel service is very good, very satisfied, one day my birthday, your hotel gave me a birthday cake, when I returned to the room, really surprised. You are very attentive to the waiter, so the next time to stay here. But there are some unpleasant things, other room smoking, central air conditioning scattered to our room, this really really affect others.

Perfect hotel in pattaya beach, the staffs have full of excitements, ready to serve guests with full hearts- perfect room and swimming pool with activities- what else could i ask more? Really worth to stay
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I decided to try Hard Rock Pattaya. travelling is Asia for over 20 years i had never stayed in a Hard Rock hotel, so i decided to give it a try in Pattaya. Mistake...... Although all facilities at the hotel are real nice, good rooms, good pool, actually most facilities are real good but in the hospitality business the most important factor is to make guests FEEL AT HOME and that is totally missing here. The bottom line is that they do not really care about hotel guests because if not you there will be someone else coming for the brand name and stay there. Plenty of potential visitors. They welcome the tourists that visit the hotel for a meal or drink, that's the goldmine.
It started with a 20 minutes wait for the luggage which arrived after 2 phone calls. 
Pool : as a hotelguest you have to pay extra to stay at the pool gazebo (ridiculous), the towels are a mile from the pool and there is no sign so you can pick them up before you go to the pool and the poolboy just says the towels are over there in a tone like 'go get them yourself'
Elevator : there was a guard  who was asking something in Thai and wouldn't let me in the lift at 11pm. A Thai couple helped me out and it appeared he wanted to see my room card. Isn't it possible that he would learn 1 single word englsih being "room card' or a word close to it.... 
Breakfast : it is quite handy to put someone at the 'eggstation' who has no idea what a fried egg sunny side up is (sarcasm)

I have run large factories with 800+ employees all over Asia and i always taught my staff some very basic English or at least some important words. Taking into account that many. many hotel guests do not speak Thai, i find it an ommission of hotel management that not even 1 word of Englsih is spoken/understood even more surprising if one takes into account the percentage tourism represents in the GDP of Thailand. 
I heard from friends that the Hard Rock in Bali is a few classes better then the one in Pattaya, more hotel guests oriented  but for me once is enough since i am old fashioned, i like if an attempt is made to make me feel at home.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I like the location and the swimming pool. About the meal, We love the BBQ buffet very much. I would reccomend HardRock to my friends. It really a nice stay without any reserve. I will come back next year.

I stayed at the Hard Rock hotel for a couple of nights when in Pattaya to see what it was like. The check in staff are brilliant - very efficient and friendly. The hotel is themed throughout as expected and really the experience is a bit like being in a rock museum/experience.
The rooms are well appointed with good fittings, plenty of space and a beautiful bathroom.
The hotel is fairly pricey for Thailand however if i was staying for a week or less I would probably book to stay here again.... If it's anytime over this you're looking at around £1500-£1700 for around 17 nights or so which can be a bit pricey -especially if you're travelling on your own.
The hotel is guest friendly - just ensure if you're on your own you book a double room and then leave any guest ID at the front desk....
Also be aware there is a room deposit of around 2000 baht which i suggest you leave as cash as this will be returned the same way. - if you pay via card they admitted it can take upto 2-3 weeks to be refunded.

We just come back from our trip to Pattaya yesterday, so everything is still so fresh in my mind. I am glad with our check out process, it was fuss free and the staff at the lobby helped us to call a tuk tuk and recommended us to take a bus back to Bangkok from North Pattaya station. That was a plus point and was very helpful!

On the other hand, check in was not as expected. Staff on the front desk was quite slow, and we had to bring our luggages and stuffs to our room ourselves (not too sure if this was they it is done here as she only sent us to the 9th floor lounge to get our key) which i expected for it to be kindly sent to our room just like other top hotel in the region. This is a small little thing, but surely will make guest happy.

Breakfast choice was limited on the 9th F as we only could order 1 main, but the other dessert, salad, and bread was in the buffet. (again, we expected a buffet for the mains).

Nevertheless we love our room on the 10th floor with sea view and a nice panoramic scene of Pattaya. Room was clean and amenities were complete. It has a king bed, sofa, desk, tv, and mini pantry. Bathroom amenities were lovable as well.

Location wise it was great on the main road, we could walked to several eateries like Mantra and Leng Kee. The beach is just a stone throw away. They had live music in the evening, so for those who love some drinks and nice music, look no further. Swimming pool was big with kids pool and basketball pool ring available.

Oh and we accidentally left our charger in the room, the staff (Miss Eve) kindly emailed me just now and i hope to get it sent to us soon. That was really helpful as well! (:
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Close to everything and the buffet is outstanding!!! Typical Asian bed, so not the most comfortable but anything is better than Italian beds haha! Nice staff and really great service. If you're into staying in and just enjoying what the hotel has to offer then they have everything you need, and on top of that the Buffett is not outrageously priced like so many are. Which is strange because the selection is quite nice!!

m mr lim.
On June 13, 2019, when you checked out, you claimed an unreasonable surcharge. It was a bad manners, and I was very uncomfortable. Please improve. I am very angry.
For a long time, I used Singapore Sentosa and Pattaya Hard Rock. But I was very disappointed with the people at Hard Rock Hotel.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: My 1st and 2nd stay have been 5 years ago. After 5 years, my good memories of this hotel come back immediately when I decided to stay in pattaya again.  This time my kids have grown up a lot and we decided to stay in the composer suites. The softa bed in the living room is long enough to convert to two single beds for 1 adult and 1 kids, and the king bed in the bedroom can sleep at least 1 adult and 2 kids. If you are a family of 4, I would recommend booking the composer suite rather than 2 rooms. The composer suite comes with the lounge benefit such as daily refreshment, laundry, etc which worth the extra money.  The pool has been slightly refurbished and is still excellent with different programs during the day to entertain both adults and kids. It would be better if lounge users are entitled the free use of water mats and tubes in the pool.  I would definitely come back for my stay in pattaya next year.

i like the swimming pool and their service is very good! 
and the hotel is clean, and i liked the TV that i can watch some movie. and you can get 10% discount at hardrock hotel. but i couldn't buy drinks there i don't know why..  If i go to Pattaya again, i go this hotel again.

We initially booked to stay at this hotel for 4  days but loved it so much that we extended it for a further 2 nights.  There is nothing not to like -- from the amazing pool to the spacious rooms, Hard Rock hotel ticks all the right boxes.  Every member of staff made the effort to enusre our stay was memorable.  Their high level of service and happy smiling faces were a pleasure to see.  The pools is one of the best and great if you have kids like us --- they have a huge separate beach pool(with real sand!) and water slides.  The service by the pools side was great too -- quick, attentive and always friendly.  Both my husband and I had massages done at the spa which was excellent -- they offer good deals with discounted prices which was great.  The therapists were professional and well trained in their field.  The hotel location is ideal to explore Pattaya -- lots of places to eat and shop.  We just had to cross the street from the hotels back exit to the busy, lively beach promenade.  A couple of nights we ordered in room dining and the quality of the food was exceptional -- and all served with a smile from the friendly Ryan from room service staff.  The buffet breakfast is always busy but the staff handle the crowd well so we never had to wait to be seated -- a bonus with 3 hungry kids!   There are a lot of asian items on the buffet along with made to order eggs, pancakes, waffles, cereals etc.  The only thing I would have liked to see was a better choice of fresh fruits that Thailand is renowned for. The rooms are spacious with comfy beds and were cleaned perfectly every day.  The downside was the small size of the bathrooms -- the shower area while spacious left little room for anything much else and the lack of having an exhaust led to a very steamy room.  Another slight negative was the dim lights in corridors which we felt could be improved on.  But overall a wonderful stay at the Hard Rock -- wish we were back already!
column7: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates

column3:
It has been my N times to Thailand with my family.  Whenever we travel this lovely country, we would definitely spend sometimes in Pattaya for a simple reason -- staying in the Hard Rock Hotel and meeting good old friends/staff there.  

The greatest part of the hotel is the pool area.  It is well designed, magnificent and fantastic, not only for children but people of all ages.  Everyone has fun with the water games which are always well organized. Hard Rock staff, in particular DJ Sax, Quito, Khanchit, Boston and many….., are all very kind, helpful and super friendly.  If you like water games, team activities and social gathering with people from different countries, the main pool is definitely a must stay location during your stay in Hard Rock.  

Hard Rock Pattaya is one of the best I have ever been to.  It is the center of entertainment for everything, and somehow successfully target singles, families, children, and everything in between.  In short, it is fun, relax, and simply the best! I would recommend it to anyone without any hesitation.  

Looking forward to coming home again!

Very nice and fun swimming pool, Fantastic Kids foam party in the evening, Nice staffs and Very  comfortable beds. Kids sliders do not slip and are quite slow. A bit sound loud from foam party until late night.

We were super excited to be here, and Hard rock did live to our expectations! Located in Pattaya's high street, a 10 minute Tuk-tuk can drop you to the walking street!

Rooms were pleasingly clean, with rock band still frames all over, pillows too had guitar embossings! You also get a good music system in every room, connect to your auxillary cable and rejoice that you're at Hard rock!

There are lot of parties and activities that happen on and off, one must visit the website and plan accordingly! 

Over all, quite fun!

I always choose Hard Rock Hotel when I have to Travel to Pattya . I love the theme hotel which have fun charactor. This hotel located in a center of the town.staff are good in service. this time i choose club room type. I've no need to go outside to eat at all because they serve all the time and the food is awesome! Not only that but you can enjoy cocktail,wine,beer free flow for two hours too :) only thing i want theme to change is the decoration because they not renovate the theme for many years and not make me who travel here many time excited anymore but if you are a person who travel here first time i think Hard Rock is a very good choice for you.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Nice hotel, comfortable room, great pool, friendly/helpful staff. Bit of a walk to main nightlife area, but can take a 5 minute (depending on traffic) truck taxi for 10-20 baht per person. Room prices were very reasonable.

Value for money, beautiful sea view, polite staff, wonderful breakfast. Goods in the store too pricey. Should consider having a halal food outlet as many Arabs frequent HR HOTELS too. Appreciate it if wifi access is not limited to just one gadget. if there are 3 people in a room, what then? Would definitely come back.

I liked it all very much.  Great interior, everything is imbued with the spirit of music.  Friendly and smiling staff.  Very varied and delicious breakfast and dinner.  Nearby is Hard rock cafe.  The hotel has a Rock Shop where you can buy souvenirs and clothes with the symbol of Hard rock.  I recommend Thai massage.  I recommend everyone to visit this magnificent hotel!

The service at the bar in front should be improved. The male staff are AGGRESSIVE to the guess and they provide two standards. 
I have been there with my boyfriend and they treated me like I am asking for the free drink comparing to how they welcome the group of Thai customers. Yet I am Thai and went there with the white guy and I could feel how discriminating and ignorant the staff are. 
I have been to many different Hard Rock Cafe and it was my idea to went there. However, I am very disappointed and they made me afraid.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
the hotel was very strategic place infront of beach the room was very clean n nice .. the staff was very great and friendly im enjoying stay at hard rock
hotel wish me to come and stay at hard rock again

My very first experience with Hard Rock hotel Pattaya was 15 years ago. Recently get to stay with in this beautiful hotel again, this time round I've brought along my boys and stayed for 4 days in their Family Suite.
Although it has been 15 years ago, but other than the interior decorations has changed quite a fair bit, all other conditions such as service attitude or professionalism of the hotel staff remains the same, just as wonderful and excellent as before.
I would like to summarise my review or comments by saying: "From the very moment we stepped into this hotel, the wonderful feeling and positive experiences started and it lasted all the way till we left".
- The hotel environment is clean and quiet.
- The staff are friendly and always ready to serve.
- Breakfast at the Executive Lounge was marvelous.
- Pricing for this particular room type (family suite) is also reasonable.
- Location and scenery is definitely one of the best around that area.
- Security Officers are also doing a great job in keeping the hotel Safe & Sound.
Once again, I would like to express my most sincere appreciation to the Mangement & Staff, because we have really enjoyed ourselves. We will definitely be staying with Hard Rock hotel Pattaya in the near future.
Well done!! Keep it up!!

I stay 1 night in Hard Rock Pattaya and unfortunately only 1 night. Because I enjoy the environment.
Good location, big swimming pool and also good party pool at Saturday night. Reception staff also so helpful.

We stayed here last October in a kids-suite with kings club access. We have stayed here a few years ago as well and had a great experience again! Wished we could have stayed longer!! Everybody is soooooooo friendly!! We had a very welcoming arrival by Ann (guest relation manager)! She is the best!! Great pool with lot of activities!! The pool attendant made me smile all day!! They were the best. Kin, the bellman made us smile all day! He was so friendly and happy!! Steve, concierge helped us out great with transportation and tours!! Breakfast was super with lot of International and Asian choices!! Eggs made to order. Staff here also great, especially Gino! He made my day every morning!! We only used kings club for drink and snacks in the evening, only wished they did not move the cocktail hour to their bar downstairs instead of the kings club room.....Room had a bunkbed for 2 children, seperate shower for kids. My daughter loved it!! Absolute pre is that, as parents, you have some private space as well!! We experienced a power breakdown during cocktail hour but ALL staff stayed calm en professional! Even one of the managers came to us to ask if we were doing fine!! Only thing they can improve is the internet...Hotel is right in the middle of all activities in Pattaya but you don't notice this when you are in 'the resort' .We come back again soon!! Can't wait!!!

I though this Hard Rock Hotel was suitable to stay with my kids as artificial beach, water activities, water slides, kids club and family foam party were available.  But I found I was wrong finally.  I strongly recommend family with toddler DO NOT come here!  It is a disaster.
The shower there was a nightmare for kids.  They only provided rain shower head.  Parents would understand how terrible it was for kids.  I called the customer service and told them I preferred a room with “normal shower head with a hose” for my kids.  The answer I got was normal shower or bathtub was not available unless I paid a lot to upgrade to a big suite.  How ridiculous it was! I only wanted a bathroom with normal shower but not a super expensive suite.  The staff then said they could only send me a plastic baby bathtub, which was obviously not suitable for 2.5-yrs-old.  However, I did not have any option.  The staff talked to me over the phone was gross and threatening that they could not do anything more if we did not pay to upgrade.  I did not want to argue with them in front of my daughter.
When I received the bathtub, I was shocked that it was old and cheap.  The plastic was soft and thin.  I suspected if the plastic was safe to apply with hot water.  (I am alert to baby product and I only use branded baby product with certification.)  I was very disappointed with their service and the cheap tub they provided.  
Apart from above, the hotel was far from a 4 stars hotel.  The staff there was unhelpful and unfriendly.  I could never see a smile on their face.  
When we arrived the hotel at around 4pm, we were the only customer at check-in counter but it still spent us more than 20mins for check-in process.  After check-in, they gave us 3 glasses of welcome drinks.  I was carrying my asleep daughter and therefore I asked my hubby to take the drinks upstairs.  When we passed the check-in counter, a receptionist with red hair stopped us and said we were not allowed to take the drinks to the room.   She was rude when she spoke to us.  It seemed that we did something very wrong.  I told her politely that I could not drink it with my sleeping baby.  She did not give me any response and even did not look at my when I talked to her.  How considerate they were to ask a mum carrying a sleeping baby to enjoy their welcome drinks at the noisy lobby!  
We had reserved a Sea View Deluxe Room.  But 90% of the view was building and only 10% was sea view.  It was a cheat.  I stayed at 5/F but I could still heard the loudly music from the pool party until 1 a.m.  The water in the artificial beach was dirty.  I could see lots of branches, insect and rubbish in the water.  The restaurant was crowded.  There was little room between table and table.  I have emailed them dozens of times before my trip but I could never get any reply from them.  Overall, it is not a 4 stars hotel and it does not worth the price.  I am so regretful to stay there.  It definitely spoils a precious holiday I should have with my family.  Do not go there if you have kids!

The Hard Rock Pattaya is a fun hotel resort at a great spot – directly on the Beach Road. I stayed there for 4 nights in May and had a great time inspite of some major hiccups. If you are lucky enough to stay at one of their sea-facing, top floor rooms, you’ll also enjoy a great view of the Pattaya Coast and all the fun (foam parties, games) at the beautiful XL Swimming Pool below which I consider the largest (if not one of the largest) that you’ll see in Pattaya.
The front office staffs are mostly cool and friendly. A special note to JJ though for helping me out and upgrading my large group to sea-facing, higher floor rooms (I had booked 2 rooms). I got a jasmine infused welcome drink, cold towels and welcoming smiles - fairly typical of any Hard rock hotel. 
The rooms are decently sized with the purple color theme prevalent all through out the room and the hotel. The bathroom was also good enough but the beds and pillows were not the best of my liking. The room had all other usuals – LCD TV with enough premium channels, pay per view movies, a music player, alarm clock, safe, coffee maker, toiletries, umbrella, etc – all that you would normally expect and more from a Hard Rock hotel.
Room service and housekeeping were a different story. Our requests for refills for the in-room tea and coffee sachets were constantly ignored – almost like telling us that “we only give you 2 sachets of tea, coffee, creamer and sugar per day so, don’t ask for it again until the next 24 hours”. Many calls later with still no response, I just went ahead and bought refills from 7/11 and used it for the remaining duration of the stay - not bothering the housekeeping or the room service again!
Breakfasts at the main restaurant below were quite good with enough selections to satiate your morning hunger pangs but their lunch and dinner buffets need improvement. My first lunch and dinner buffets on my first day was a delight – with tiger prawns, fish, lamb and an assortment of continental veggies but I was disappointed to find almost the same menu, almost verbatim in my repeat visits.
It was also especially sad to see the awkward faces of many of my fellow guests at the hotel – Malaysians, Indians and Muslims of various nationalities who seem to be aplenty there (compared to typical westerners or Thais) – not relishing the buffet selections at all due to the presence of many Pork selections and the mostly continental style of the menu. I remember seeing one guest actually complaint about this to the manager but strangely it seemed to have no effect at all and the menu with the over powering presence of pork was present on all days. One evening I did see Chicken Tikka and Mutton Biryani in the menu but it was awfully bland - nothing like I have tasted anywhere in India or elsewhere! No doubt, none of the Indians I could see seemed to enjoy them either!
I once had a Chicken Pizza and Red wine at their Pizza joint near the pool at around 9 PM with a friend. I had also asked the hostess there for some regular drinking water but after serving us 2 glasses of water, she curtly reminded me that I had to buy a bottle or she won’t serve us any water. Not in the mood to question her, I simply ordered for a bottle of some super, expensive Mineral water – Evian, I guess. 
The Hard Rock Café was a much better affair with much better service than I expected with nice bands in the evenings but they ruin the fun by closing early. Even their other restaurants inside the hotel including the main resto close too early by Pattaya standards. The buffets open and close early in the evening - if you go like 10ish in the night, the buffet is almost done! Pattaya is a fun city and it’s full of life all night so it’s a little perplexing why Hard Rock of all hotels should close so early! 
I am a Hard Rock fan and I will certainly go again but I hope it’s high time; the folks behind the scenes wake up to what guests want and cater to their needs than the other way round!

We loved it as there was a stunning room with lots of kids activities to do (sand part/games/floating balloon), great rock rooms, the famous Hard Rock Café and friendy staff. We will return for sure in the near future!

It has been a long while since I last visited Pattaya. I was arranged to stay at "Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya", due to my one-week long conference. And, it was indeed a pleasant yet enjoyable stay. A hospitality desk was set up for our speedy check in and out! The service at the front desk is beyond excellent! Great job! The buffet spread for the breakfast is also very rockilious though the air-condition is not strong enough (i guess that's the feel of a resort hotel). The team that organized our team-building game was simply awesome! A great experience, indeed! For the room, it is spacious; clean yet cozy. Loved the sea view from my room as well as the rainforest shower (loved those mini-amenities) though I experienced a few hiccups from the housekeeping! But, I guess you just need to speak to them slowly! Overall, one of the best hospitality services I have had received, till date. Well, the hotel is also a stone throw away from 2 shopping malls - Festival Mall & Big C Store! And finally, a must go place in Pattaya - "Walking Street", a mere 20 baht tup-tup van ride! You would be amused.

All staffs sine guard > Reception >Maid> Restaurant >Life Guards at the pool.All are friendly and warm welcome every visit.We love activities at  the pool Food & Drink are good Close to Central (10 min walk) and Terminal 21(30 min walk) We like to walk just be careful to walking alone at night.

Stayed at a Rock Royalty seaview room. Room was adequate and well cleaned everyday. Had breakfast at the 9th floor lounge on some days and Starz Diner on others. Quality and selection were good enough for us. Food at the Pizzeria was very good! Hard Rock Cafe was fantastic. Had dinner and drinks there a few of the evenings, and had fantastic rocking times with the band and crew. Two thumbs up for Hard Rock Pattaya!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: stay here many times , good breakfast, swimming pool and party always , reception with Chinese speaking staff, no toothbrush and paste provided on room...great smell on corrider of room floor. stay everytime in pattaya.

I stayed there with my family.The theme ROCK is evident all over - right from the reception to the corridors to the restaurant and to the rooms.The entrance is a bit narrow.The room offered a panoramic view of the beach.

Good restaurant, beautifull hotel, this hotel have larger swimming pool, arc swimming pool with many colour lighting at night. The Hard Rock Hotel where you could enjoy and relax in your vacation. The landscapde is very beautiful. I'm really like many taste food in Hard Rock.

Hard Rock maintain their clean image in Pattaya with this hotel.  Everything is as you would expect of this 4 star brand and the only outstanding area would be the pool area.  One let down is that the inflatables, pool side toys etc need to be rented.... this is my opinion needs to be re-looked at.

Great Hotel. would definitely stay there again. must have the biggest and best pool in Pattaya. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel grounds are very clean and kept very tidy. the food was great and selection on the menu was great. especially Breakfast.

Our recent stay at Hard Rock Pattaya is a blast! SInce we have brought a lot of work with us, we can only be at the hotel. Good thing we get the Rock-royalty level which enable us to work at the lounge while waiting for our room while enjoying soft drinks and snacks. The item in the minibar is expensive but you can just walkover and grabbed drinks from the lounge instead. The dinner buffet is so-so except for the whole roasted pig which is totally awesome. Room is clean and shower is  ice. Bluetooth speaker is provided and a vinyl player is avialable upon request with nice collection of vinyls to borrow.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Excellent location.excellent staff.good facilities.only one thing Indian menu should be changed at least after 2 days.rest all ok.one of the best hotels our family ever stayed in any part of the world.

Next time i will stay at Hard Rock Hotel only. Value for money, clean, big enough, many thing offer inside the room, still got free movie to watch over the TV. I wish i have extra time to go for sauna and steam session.

Spent 4 nights at Hard Rock Pattaya. The location was excellent. Great experience and excellent service. Special mention to Simon who went all out to help us. Thank you so so much! Will definitely visit soon.

Highly recommended.Superb ambience excellent room good service.Easy accesse to the beach centrally located.The cafe staff was very helpful because my son was not well.They took good care thanks to putter for his excellent service 👍

Loved staying at the hardrock in Pattaya. Everyone is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a feast with western and Asian specialties. Great pool with swim-up bar. Rooms are spacious and clean. Loved our stay

It's a new clean and comfortable hotel which we stay for few days .Its quite disappointed the pool was close till Oct and we didn't notice when we booked at July.They recommend us to have sunbath at the beach just in front of the Hotel ,and you knows that is different

We were a bunch of 6 girls staying at the property for 4 nights. The warmth and the courteousness of the staff, and the comforts of the sprawling property made us feel very much at home! I'd highly recommend this property to everyone.

The Hard Rock Hotel in Pattaya is at a great location - it is right on the water front and has some great views. We had the Ocean view room, and it did not disappoint. 
The facilities re also very well rounded. The pool is awesome, and had a kids area along with some fun activities like basketball in it. The gym and spa are great too. We also really liked the ambience of the hotel, the decor and the lounge etc.! 
The issues we had were more related to service and the cleanliness of the room. We had cockroaches in our bathroom, and even after complaining to the room service at 9.30pm at night, no one showed up to address the issue till the next morning. I also saw cockroaches the next morning in the dining area. Now, Pattaya is a tropical location and bugs are expected, but cockroaches in your room or anywhere near food - that is a no no! 
Further, when we ate at the Hard Rock Cafe, I left my spectacles there and when I went back later to check, the staff was very unresponsive to my queries. Needless to say, I did not find my spectacles. :(
Not all staff was like this though, the front reception was very warm and friendly - they also helped us book tickets for a show we went to. 
Overall, the experience was average as a result.

Room very clean
Room TV with great selection of movies
Breakfast is great
Service is very good
All the staff are truly friendly
Location of hotel is nice
Price of the room is affordable
Overall experience - Fabulous
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We had one thing in mind when we came here - to relax. And we did. We stayed at the Rock Royalty Level and my kids love the breakfast there - they had salmon teriyaki for breakfast everyday during our stay! Room was a bit smaller than the one in HRH Macau but we still love it.

- Friendly staff, especially the guard at the lift.
- Room is clean and spacious for family 2 adult and couple of small kids. 
- Location easy to access...in the centre of all the amenities. 
- Nice breakfast with varieties.

I think Hard Rock is the best in Pattaya, in the heart of the city but the rooms are very quiet behind the main road. Staff is friendly, although we have to wait a bit for the check in but they do offer a welcome drink with a smile.
This is a very big hotel, they have many rooms and a huge swimming pool. I think it is a good stay , room is clean, big enough, a good shower and they provide free wifi. 
The only funny thing is, they upgrade us to a sea view room which is the same for me, the window outside is dusty, I can only see a cloudy sea and a grey sky.
Overall it's a nice stay, I will come back if i will go to Pattaya again.

No free wifi or ethernet at this price.  Plenty of guests that are there for 'one-night', but probably more family-friendly than other cheaper hotels.  Reception/concierge is helpful and friendly.  Location is good, but a bit too far from walking street.

I stayed at hard rock hotel pattaya only for 1 night since we've stayed in bangkok for 2 nights. The standard room itself was superb and i believe deluxe or suite would be much better. They also provide baby cot for infant for free.  Kids love the swimming pool at most but too bad we're not able to enjoy foam party as the foam party is only on friday night. The location is great, within a walking distance to beach, shops, restaurants, bars, etc.

Staff very pleasant. I just point two items that hotel must consider to improve. The breakfast should be more international and a free shuttle to the pier should be available in order to help clients to take boat to the islands.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
We stayed at the Hardrock hotel Pattaya over the weekend of my husband's birthday.  All we got was this tiny tasteless chocolate cake as a complimentary which i had to inform about my husband's birthday at the front desk and the staff was very reluctant to acknowledge it.  Very disappointed, wish we have stayed somewhere else.   There was nothing rocking about the hotel.    We didn't think it was very worth it comparing to the other hotels nearby.
The room was tiny and carpet has strain everywhere.  The toilet was not very clean and very run-down.  A lots of works should be done to the room.  The bedlinen and pillow cases had strains on as well.  The bed was not comfortable.  
The activity was somewhat entertaining.  The staffs were friendly and made the activities more enduring.  The foam party on Sat night was fun, but the cleanliness of the pool was very bad.  Cigarette butts and other garbage were out  floating around in the pool.  
Breakfast was average, but not so crowded.  The location is good, very center.
Overall, not as impressive as advertised!

It was an excellent stay again at Hard Rock, Pattaya. Friendly and Lively staff, always with a big smile.Every single request we made was efficiently taken care of....It was a group of 8 with 8 single rooms. Will return next year.

Hard rock hotel Pattaya must be very beautiful place and they got very kind staffs. Everything was perfact. but, the bathroom was little bit shame. Because of its old style and there was no bidet.
That was a really little bit shame.

The Hard Rock Hotel is right across the street from the beach and within walking distance of the famous Walking Street. It is also within walking distance of a couple of local shops and stands and I never even hopped in a cab my four days there! It has it's own pool and a separate waterpark type place for kids to enjoy. Highly recommend!!

Our family has been visiting the hotel for many years as we loved the energetic vibe of the place.
This is our first visit since October 2019 and Covid outbreak.
The hotel and the rooms were very clean.  The Covid preventive measures were put in place and we felt very safe.
They have renovated and upgraded parts of the pool area.  By the way, we always enjoy our time in the huge pool and the slides.  They also organised poolside activities and games, which made the place very lively. 
We have always enjoyed the wide selection of food available during the buffet breakfast.  However during this stay, we have noticed some of the Western selection like cheese, cold cuts, french toast, etc were missing.  On the other hand, there were more Thai dishes like sticky rice, grilled meat, etc.  It would be nice to see the Western selection come back again.   
Overall, it was still an enjoyable stay and we look forward to our next visit soon.

Staffs are very good services. I  booked connect rooms and bring only one  card of room which was lock inside. Staff came to support us immediately and try to open the room for us . I like to every staffs say hi with customers when they met . For the restaurant , every staffs are very good services . They bring us to the table and ask us to anything that they can support . For the swimming pool , I like every game that staffs lead for customers even i didnot join them . But i think that it is very fun and made customers happy.

Light and easy hotel stay with friendly hospitality at an affordable price.
-Friendly reception and prompt help provided when needed.
-Above average food quality.
-Suitable location that is accessible to some of the basic daily convenient shops.
-Fitness center operating hours is a bit short. It will be good if it operate between 6.00am to 12.00midnight.

kids near my room very noisy very early morning as I made a complain  ,, people smoke in none smoking level also in elevator area people are smoking , rooms are small the food value kind of high price ..

Enthusiastic staff,made this weekend break enjoyable.The hotel is slightly tired, but on the plus side is located perfectly.The quality of food at breakfast and dinner was pretty good.Beverage prices are in need of guest incentive, ie happy hours.The pool area is excellent, and the pool staff are hard working and polite.I found it excellent for this 4 day break from Bangkok
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Location is very convenient just cross the street and you go to the beach, Room is nice with a very good view of sea, Swimming Pool is very big and very clean, Breakfast has variety of food, Good service from all staff, they are very helpful

Rooms are good, breakfast is ok - but it is not extraordinary. Service is good.
What is not really amusing is the deposit you have to make. But they do not tell you in advance when booking that you have to book a caution of 250 Euro on your credit Card. At the reception they told us it will be credited in approx. 4 weeks after departure. This is not funny at all.
And the second thing is that everybody has to obey the rules at the pool (e.g. not diving) - but not the Russians. The guards neither say anything no do they anything when Russians do what they want either at breakfast or at the pool. This is not correct and not fair against all other nations who spend their Holiday there. We will never visit this Hotel again.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
simply just awesome..from the people, facility, events..room is wonderful..better than some of the other hrh in malaysia..my own view..too bad it was raining most of the time..
will definitely come back to hrh pattaya & make it a routine

The Hard Rock Hotel in Pattaya is a tad expensive, but weel worth a visit if you are interested in rock or, more sprcifically, if you are interested in the Thai take on western rock. The whole concept is taken to and beyont the limits, making the whole thing quite absurd. Fun absurd, though! All the staff will greet you by "Have a rocking day!" and the waiters will dance and sing "gagnam style" to the live band at the café. The level of detail is extreme; everything at the hotel has a rock theme in one way or another. It was all good fun, but two nights was more than enough. As this is Pattaya, there is of course foam parties on saturdays. Fortunately, we missed this. The food was good, the rooms spaceous and clean, and the pool area was nice.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Hard Rock Hotel look good and good service .We  will be comeback again and hope will good contract  because we confident Room and Service quality by Hard Rock Hotel and overall activity by group good completed.

I was pleasantly surprised by the themed design of the hotel.  The hotel was clean.  The service of the staff very good.  I wanted extra towels and it was delivered within 2 minutes after I called.  The service at breakfast was very warm and friendly AND the food served was good and fresh.  I was not happy with the pillows they provided (2 thicknesses) but was too tired too call them and ask if they had other thicknesses.  The location was convenient and the hotel had ample parking.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Reception and service are very nice. my family very happy during stay in the hotel. But Bed  is dirty they are  many dust under pillow  and blanket. also Glass is not clean  still have lipstick mark on it's.

The overall hotel is well maintain but need to upgrade. Good for family stay with a lot of activities during the daytime especially for children. For people that come for business stay, a good business lounge where they can have meeting and relax as well.

Hotel with a hard rock feel 
Rooms have all you need including some
Laundry included (helpful on long business trips)
Always something happening 
Can be a bit noisy (especially when there is a foam party)
Function room (drum
Room) is really great - lots of natural light and cool layout 
Food great
Staff helpful - nothing is too much trouble

Good Things
1. Great Mattress/ Bed Quality
2. Decent View
3. AMAZING breakfast (Don't miss this even if you are partying all of previous night) - great selection of Thai food including western stuff - don't miss the noodles in bsoup
4. Probably the best pool in Pattaya + best pool bar - we missed the Foam party but some of my friends who were there said is was better that the rubbish on walking street
5. Access to beach - just across the road - can't spend the entire day chilling
6. Fairly pleasant and helpful staff - the hard rock atmosphere helps - English speaking is a bit of a challenge for some of the staff
Things that can be improved
1. Weird design of the bathroom - the shower has some kind of a tiled bathtub that you need to step in and out of
2. There was no water at the time of check-in in the bathroom - came in around a couple of hours
3. At US$ 160 a room per night (twin sharing inclusive of breakfast) I thought it was slightly overpriced for the quality of room we had
4. Construction work/ renovation was on - the drills were really really loud and heard all across the lift shafts & rooms

An interesting property, right next to the beach with interesting rooms. My room had a huge Elvis poster next to my beds head rest. A lot of interesting memoribilia spread across the hotel premises, it is like living in a Rock & Roll museum. The pool is huge with interesting activities for children. The hotel has a Hard Rock Cafe also. The buffets were sumptuous.

Have a lot of fun with my children in the new pool. At the king's club so good. In the room so big and comfortable. My family like to relax at the Hard Rock Hotel. We will come back again. Love Hard Rock.

Booked in the hotel for a 5 day conference late August. The staff have arranged everything perfectly and the keys for the room was ready to go upon check in and there was no time to waste but to hit the pool. Great pool and great food and beverage selection and games conducted by the pool staff. Had some of the best food in my life here, let it be local, Indian, Chinese or Western, everything was perfect. The rooms are big and clean, fantastic job by my housekeeper as the room was spotless clean every single day. Coming back soon with my wifey for a leisure trip.... Thank you guys for the great hospitality.... You guys really rock......

This wasn’t the best hard rock I’d been to! The room size was a bit small and there were a lot of very noisy intimidating guests who dominated the area. The breakfast buffet was good but very very hectic! Good location for the walking street but wouldn’t stay again!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The Hard Rock Hotel is by the beach, and it’s easy to navigate:) service staff tend to be friendly and extremely helpful. Buffet breakfast was comprehensive and quite delicious. It’s near shopping malls too!

Over all the  experience was fantastic and I will be back on the 6th of November for another 16 days. Hope that it will be the same staff there when I return as they made it a memorable stay in the hotel every one of the crew where helpful and curtesy  at all times.

Had a great time at the Hard Rock Hotel in Pattaya. The rooms are basic, but the rest of the hotel is really special. The pool was incredible and the pool bar was a particular highlight! The food was great and the staff very friendly and helpful.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Well locatedGood Vibe.Little slow in service-  I asked for fixing my sink which clogged water, was unresolved.I wanted smoking room- never got shifted to the same. i was told my room had balcony- but it didnt. ALSO no guest allowed- on check in I was told we can guest for few hours and not be charged, but the shift changed and they informed us 1500 Bath for guest.VERY GOOD FOR FAMILY TRIP GOOD BREAKFASTcomfortable rooms corporative support staff

Hard Rock is well situated and has everything we could have expected for a Hard Rock Hotel and the staff were amazing. The room service was prompt, tasty and good value. The buffet breakfast was superb. Very clean and modern.

Only a little bit sea view from sea view room because there is a new hotel was built in front of hard rock hotel, and the to reaction was slow, no teeth brush, overall is good, we will stay hard rock next time
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Hotel staff and facilities we're very good right on the beach front,bit a walk to walking st but only a10bht taxi down, the breakfast was not up to the standard I was expecting from a hotel of star rating

The service from the moment I stepped in the property was great. Everything was clean, food was great and service people were all very friendly. The room size was large for the price. Only issue I had was my ocean view was mostly of the abandoned hotel property next door, not very attractive to look at.

I loved everything about this hotel. The hotel is themed on hard rock, and they have done it very well. Whoever designed the hotel deserves a pat on the back. Rooms are tastefully decorated, spacious and very clean. Breakfast buffet spread is excellent, and food is very yummy. Staff is very pleasant and helpful. Beach is just across the road. 
There are two reasons due to which I have not given this hotel a five star. 
1) Although I had booked a sea view room, it was more of a quarter sea view. The window directly faced the pool of the adjascent hotel. Also, there was no balcony. I found this a bit disappointing.
2) No free internet, and using internet was pretty expensive. Same with laundry.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The room was nice and clean. The meeting (Cavern) was good but the projector needs to be improved. The picture were not too sharp and on the last day of the meeting we encountered issue with the projector

Hard rock hotel is almost over 40 years in Pattaya. The facilities and the room are still keep in good condition. The room is big and clean. Location is acceptance and it nearby the beach. What I'm really like for this hotel is the pool party on every Saturday night! Wonderful! 
Strongly recommend family trip as the kids will love the pool indeed!

Everything that u should be deserve..u will get it all from  HARD ROCK HOTEL PATTAYA . Especially the Staff.. they're very warm welcome and friendly that made me so impressed But i have only one thing that noted to u ... U should be chsnd the Live Band in HARD ROCK CAFE.. the vocalist had a bad voice and when he sang the  english song, his accent very poor and he can't remember lyrics ,too
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The service is very good, the food is delicious, the view is beautiful. There are full service for need of guest. Only one thing to comment is the smell of cigarette in the way to the room that the hotel should improve.

The Staff are amazing and helped make our stay in Pattaya even more enjoyable.  The rooms were spacious and spotlessly clean with nice sized bathroom. The beds were extremely comfortable and the Hotel is very quiet at night. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice.

Perfect location and also great team of staff and helpful not forgetting good breakfast.The room was clean and well informed if there is any activity that will go in the night. Was surprised with the birthday cake .

We were extremely happy with the hotel. The staff were so friendly they could not do enough for you. The rooms were cleaned to a high standard with really comfortable beds.The pool area was large with fun games arranged by the staff. If we return to Pattaya we will ddefinitely say at the Hard Rock Hotel
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Firstly, it is my first attempt to stay in Hard Rock Hotel in Pattaya. A bit pricey to my standard as there are many other choices but I am glad to give it a try. There are 12 of us in the family and youngest is 16 yrs old, while the oldest is 73 yrs young.
Very friendly and everything you wish for during a holiday stay are there for your picking. Rooms are not that big but it is cosy and comfy enough. Water pressure can be better and the rest are just simply superb. We have this guy called Simon (Thai) and he is so very helpful with all the transport arrangements. As we are staying for 5 days, without any hiccup, Simon just being there to assist us in activities and transport arrangements. Thanks Simon and I will never hesitate to recommend him to any TA travellers to look for him in Pattaya for any arrangements.
Next is the breakfast! Was okay and food almost the same for the next 5 mornings. Fresh and yummy as always when it come to Thai cuisine. The continental spread is okay and fresh too.
Swiming pool is their trademark and it is clean especially the changing/bathroom/toilet. Everything was there and well done to the crews in maintaining it clean. 
Food served around the pool is good as well and the pool bar serving loads of drinks. Music blasting away and we had such a wonderful time in the pool after an entire day out and about.

The staff were friendly. Greeted almost every time with a hello or a smile. Even though the hotel has been there for a long time, the facilities are well maintained.  The location is strategic to obtain local Thai food and hawker food too. Convenience stores and shopping mall are within walking distance. The pool is cool.

Great and friendly staff. Always good service.
Stayed at HRHP every year since 2006, so the staff recognize us.
Like the rooms with balcony best. Dislike them without balcony.
A little dark in the bathroom, so could have been more lights.

Before I select the Hotel for the family trip, I will focus on activity that I and my family can spend time and join activity together as well as the quality of service and Absolutely Hard Rock is our definition.

By far one of the best hotels. 
Location – perfect.
Staff – Perfect
Rooms, Property, Accessibility, Check in & check out – Just perfect
They have one of the best swimming pool & super amazing parties. Beach facing, walking distance to market, supermarts & Walking Street. Breakfast was sumptuous and with lot of variety. A MUST TRY place in Pattaya.

Only one hamburger was posible to order in advance. I thought i payed for 4 in advance. Bad experiense, got wey expensive at Hardrock café. Checkin personal could have asked about check for burger was given to family of 4. 
No skum party as we hade expected upon booking.

The environment of the hotel is excellent. The location is near to the beach, we can walk to the beach. Only the acoustic property of the door is not very good. We can hear the noise when people walk through.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Myself and my spouse arrived there one day late for our bookings & any other hotel would have told us to pay again for the day lapsed but not Hard Rock reception when it was explained it happened due to oversight while booking thro internet . They happily accomodated with a smile and made us comfortable . It was really a Welcome Gesture from Hard Rock . For 3 days we were there it was all a homely stay . Vast property , must be the biggest hotel setup in Pattaya on the beach road extending up to main road at the rear end of the city. EXcellent food & beverages - including our Indian food . Breakfast Buffet leaves nothing more to desire. Would love to be there nxt year for a longer stay. God bless the staff of Hard Rock Pattaya.......Chander Dhanda , [-]
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
This is the second time we had our Annual global Distributors meet at HRH, Pattaya as we like to call it very fondly and We had book approx. 30 rooms with 2 day conferences and 1 major event at the Hotel itself . 
the very reason we came here for the second time was because of the stupendous successful event we had last year. 
The place is a mecca for people like me who love music 
HRH put an extra zing ! to every minor detail that really left our guests from 18 countries in awe...they loved it so much that many of them extended their stay . 
HRH, Pattaya- you ROCK!

1st i had a terrible stay at a walking street hotel, but than i saw the hardrock walked in and i knew i must stay here...after i checked in the world was great again....also the cafe next to the hotel was a nice experience, excellent staff. i was alone but never felt like.

Hotel is good, Clean, and beautiful but unfortunately when we were there the pool is closed for maintenance, however we got Cartoon Network Amazone Water Park as a compensation. This is very good, receptions always look busy
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Spent 14 nights here in Oct/Nov 15. Great hotel with fantastic staff. Rooms were fab, with one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Breakfast in the restaurant was buffet style and was really good with something for everyone. The pool area and pool were fantastic and the service there was top line. 
All in all, a great place to stay!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
nice staff 
great food at discount price 
free room upgrade but bed and bed sheet are not clean enough
not very crowd guest which is enjoyable for me
nice band at cafe too
should have buffet at special price
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We would like to Thanks K.JJ for provided the best service and hospitality while we stayed at Hardrock Hotel. We totally in love with the breakfast buffet. Swimming pool is clean and fun(especially the foam party).

I've been there for several times
Always feel warm with the hug of rock
Love the night at Hard Rock Cefe too
Food are great and clean
and lots of activity to joy and get fun with
Hope to be there again soon
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Took my daughter of 5 years old and we didn't have to go out  as everything we need we have it in the hotel , need to improve in activities but general it was fine , got disappointed with the BBQ on Sunday at 730 PM , there was no FRESH meat and it was early ...

I spend a night this time.  usually we come to with my company's staff. This year we had some problem. now almost done.so I decided no we decided to come again with our company's staff.That's why come back only a night stay.only stay a night but I enjoyed.

1) The kid pool party is so Fantastic and exquisite !!!!. My daughter loved it.
2) Dinner at Starz Diner is forth worth and it is free for my daughter, excellent !!
3) Breakfast is so yummy. Especially, a crispy beacon. I love it.
4) Finally, all of your staffs are very friendly and service mind.
We will be back to u again soon.

Once my favourite hotel have fast gone downhill. During my checkout the lady at the reception if I had consumed anything from minibar which is ofcourse a textbook question but after that she asked me if I had taken anything from room. I reply negative. then she asked itemwise..coffee mugs.. lamps..any memorabilia...anything from the bathroom. Ridiculous...she has no right.I was utterly offended. Was my only fault was that I was an Indian...still wondering..but will never be back to this hotel again

Hard Rock Café at Pattaya is a good location, and we can go every where by foot and vans.
Unfortunately, the conditions of shower was not good because it was difficult to control the temperature of hot water...

This hotel is equipped with the most complete gym equipment, near the beach front, the City’s best music and dining venue, Hard Rock Cafe Pattaya offers classic Southwest American favorites including burgers, wraps, ribs, cocktails and Rock ‘n’ Roll.
Great American breakfast daily with quite similar variety of choices though.

Stayed at hard rock with 3kids at the newly renovated 9th floor kings club.  Kids had a bunk bed and nice couch and adults had own room in room called the kids suite.  Rooms very clean and spacious complete with xbox and ocean view.  All the staff were great.  Would do it again

Very nice hotel in very good location on beach road , the swimming pool was amazing &  friendly stuff , clean , very safe & great services. 
The rooms was little bit small & no sitting area in the room , it will be perfect if have small sofa in the room .
For sure I'll come back only for this hotel in pattaya

We were on honeymoon. And very satisfied with the hotel. The room is big, clean, and comfortable. We stay there for 3 nights. At saturday there is a foam party at pool. The swimming pool is very large. The breakfast was delicious and there were a lot of variety. Location is near central festival shopping mall. Which a lot of restaurants there. Outside the hotel is beach already.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
This hotel is well kept, the staff very friendly especially in the restaurants and reception.
I found the staff around the pool a bit full on but I suppose it is just in line with the theme of the place.
The pool is excellent and the beach area is great especially for kids who love playing around and sitting on the big boulders.
I was dissapointed to discover the bottom of the pool to be quite dirty with  lots of green stuff growing between the tiles on the bottom of the pool especially around the  tiled Hard Rock Sign.
I also found it dissapointing that with the water being non-palatable that they charge guests for any ice ordered from room service.Interestingly enough it is not mentioned anywhere on the room service menu that there will be a 59 baht charge for ice.
I also found it interesting that for a four star hotel called the Hard Rock Hotel that there was not one potato dish on the breakfast buffet for the whole time we stayed there.There were three different rice dishes , congee(two types),chicken or pork rice and japanese rice. Sausages were also scarse only appearing once during our stay.
I joked with my partner that prehaps they should change the name from Hard Rock Hotel to Hard Wok Hotel as they were definately not catering to all guests.
The rooms were on the small side as was the bathroom.We were orginally in a delux king room which had a northerly aspect but changed to a delux twin with a southerly  view (more interesting) and actually felt that the twin room was larger as it had a large bench under the bathroom window(which opens into the main room) which the king room didn't have. the rooms were very clean and well kept.
On the friday before we left they were setting up for a function around the pool at about 3pm. This involved removing at least 60% of the sun lounges which were stacked on top of each other out of the way. The pool was open until 10pm for hotel guests and when  I came down at 3:30pm there were no sun lounges available as most of them were stacked away and the rest occupied. The cabanas were empty but you had to pay 400baht to use one,so several of us had no other option but to lay our towel out on the sand area around the artificial beach area which reminded of my childhood visits to the beach.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
The housekeeper so bad, unhelpful,  blackface. The light is too dark in the room
Lobby staff is more nice, always smile .
The swimming pool is excellent, very relax, but the poolside party only on Saturday.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I stayed at the HRH Pattaya at the end of August 2011. I don't know if a hotel can claim anonymity to be a one of their selling points- but the HRH is exactly that. Completely unremarkable. 
Food was borderline bad at breakfast, i must say- and there is general confusion surrounding it. On the day i checked in, i was told that breakfast is open till 11AM, only to take a walk to the Starz Diner and be told it closes at 10:30. The staff are exemplary- polite, courteous and seem friendly. But for the sort of money paid for the stay, i would've expected a helluva lot more.
Overall- there was nothing that offended me. To say that is slander. But there is not a single thing that i would recommend the hotel for to a friend.
Mark I
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
When you are talking about Hard Rock Hotels, immediately all of your standards are upgraded and anything very good turns into a simple "good"
I think this is the most difficult part to rate a Hard Rock Hotel.
Decoration of lobby is great with memorabilia. 
Corridors are a little bit dark as they are black painted with purple lights.
Rooms are good, but doesn't makes you feel staying in a HRH as special decoration is only 4 small frames with pictures of rock stars (in my case Keith Richard and Santana) and a small guitar on the pillows.
