Very nice hotel at least 5-8min to walking street by songthaew(transportation thai bus) breakfast is soso ok but the swimming pool is big and love it.. some event going on time to time. And had pool party on saturday. Room was good and bed was comfty

I enjoyed my stay here.  The room was very comfortable and I loved the pool area.  Breakfast was very good too.
the restaurant was pretty standard for Hard rock restaurants around the world.
On Saturday nights they have a pool party and foam party with DJ.  I thought this was a bit overrated.  It was mainly a couple of groups of Indians walking around looking for prostitutes which aren't available at the hard rock.  they need to take themselves down to walking street.

Staying at the Hard Rock was a slice of paradise. My kids love staying here. My son was made to feel right at home. He formed a solid bond with Tat, Mike and Joey from the pool. Every day heading  to the pool was his highlight. Thank you Hard Rock for employing such amazing people.

I had a noisy stay at this hotel in pattaya.
The hotel was under reconstruction when i went there and they started 7 o clock in the morning with drilling over my room,very bad when you come home at 5 in the morning.
Even though the reception said they would start a lot later.
Swimming pool was BIG and good,drink prices very expensive the food i never tasted.
Good stay but i wouldnt stay there again.

The best hotel on our family trip!!! Thank you for leaving the hotel's swimmimg pool with precious memories of my child. I will definitely use this hotel on my next trip. I hope to meet you again !!!!!

Maintenance of steam (glass door not able to close fully) & sauna (not working) facilities not up to mark...both are not in full working conditions.
Need better signal (eg., waving flag or bell for service) to request service from Shack Bar...waving & shouting are not effective ways.

Only had 1 night in the hard rock after visiting the cafe a few times before, great vibe, nice food and a beautiful place surrounded by nice areas to eat and enjoy some of the nightlife. Would reccomend highly.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: for this trip I go with my family after our boy and girl done their exam. I plan to relax and enjoy same as every time. Hard rock hotel is first choice of my family. thank you for good trip. see you soon.

Centralized location, live band, friendly staff. Food came quick and the drinks was good. Kinda on the expensive side but that’s a typical American restaurant. I will stop back on my next trip to Pattaya.

Great only could not use executive benefits as we couldn’t fit in so was a bit of waste in that aspect could only get in once with our 5 night stay, other than that great and we bought a cabana every day that we loved
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Hotel was clean , modern and to a good standard, the swimming pool was shut due to building works however the beach alternative which was offered was dirty and polluted, it would have been better to offer a neighbouring hotel swimming pool to share. Also the cost of drinks was very expensive with  Jack Daniels and coke costing £10 (430 baht)

It is hard to give an objective review of the hotel given that Pattaya is one of the most desparate places I have come across. Do yourself a favour and give the city a miss - unless of course you want to go on holidays to a place where 80% of the people there are male sex tourists.
If you do decide to go then the Hard Rock seems to be one of the more reasonable places to stay in the city and is located on the beach about 15 minutes from Walking Street. The Hard Rock is quite family friendly which is good as Pattaya is definitely not a place you want to take your kids. The pool is big and has a kids area with slides and shallow water. The pool is surrounded by cabanas with king sized day beds which can be rented daily. These are great for taking a break from the sun or a midday snooze. 
The hotel and its rooms have been recently renovated but it is obvious it is a makeover not a total renovation. That said they are clean and comfortable but small. The whole hotel had a feeling of being a bit small. 
We booked a Kings Club room as we specifically wanted some extra space and a balcony - as indicated on the photos of this room type on the web. As it turns out only some of these rooms have balconies. We did ask to be moved and they did try to accommodate our request but the rooms they showed us were smaller than what we were in originally. After a lot of messing about we were given an upgrade for the last couple of nights to a family suite which was nice and I would recommend it to families. However, it is very expensive and I don't think it is worth the extra price. The Club Lounge is on one of the upper floors and you can have a drink or snacks there throughout the day. There is also a cocktail hour in the evening. 
Overall, we have stayed at other Hard Rocks which we would visit again but in comparison Hard Rock Pattaya was a bit under par and we wouldn't rush back here again.

Spent 2 nights, drove from Bangkok, the hotel is quite easy to find, but be careful the parking space is very limited. Could be a nightmare, it even prevented us to go out to a restaurant outside to avoid having to struggle for parking space.
The hotel a good size pool. The buffet is correct but not excellent. Reception, c/in and c/out could be better organized.
The rooms are spacious, stayed on 3rd floor. Be careful on a foam night party the bass could be bothering if you wish to sleep early.
Overall good, but I would not go back there, there are better choices in Pattaya or Jomtien.

I have stay in hard rock hotel for 1 month, and ghey provide a good live band show by 99 band from indonesia, and they perform very good music. Every day entertainment was great.
Service was great, i means the laundry, spa, swimming pool and the cafe as well
Good weekend entertainment like foam party was great
this is something unexpected... i really love the hotel services and the room decor....

nice staff and delicious food.bed very comfortable. near beach.We can see many super star music equipment and dress.swimming pool have white sand,very beautiful.we get upgrade room service.through window  of room,we can see some of sea.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: #NAME?

Stay at pattaya for a night and went to hard rock. Well, it was a right decision i guess. I had a great time with family over there. Close to pattaya entertainment center. Breakfast was great and all the staffs are very helpful. Hard rock cafe is great, although there was none played because of Sunday evening

We got the executive lounge package, not really worth it. A little bit better breakfast selection at the lounge, but other than that you just get some very simple snacks and drinks there throughout the day and some cocktails/drinks daily 6-8PM. 
Rooms are nice but nothing extraordinary. The buffet dinner was OK but nothing special.
Although we had requested nonsmoking rooms, we were put in smoking rooms. They upgraded one of our rooms to a suite and gave us a free dinner for 4.
Nice swimming pool and fun pool parties. Bring your ear plugs if you plan to sleep before 1AM on the weekends since the poolparty goes on til late and it's loud!

View from room 4 star
Vegetarian food 2 star
Pool   5 star ( 7am to 10 pm )
Location 5 star ( road to road,  one end on beach road another end on back road main market ) ,    7 eleven just opposite hotel entry from backside )
Lots of activites for kids, 
One of the best option in pattaya to stay.

Stayed at another hotel down the street and was disappointed. Enjoyed this one so much I extended my stay 2 days. The room service was great, clean hotel, fun atmosphere. great location. I will be back

As a long term fan of the hard rock franchise, I was delighted to book two nights at the hard rock hotel at pattayamduring my recent far east tour. In fact... It was an excuse to gontonpattaya otherwise I wouldn't have bothered!
The hotel itself is fine, however for the money there is FAR better available in pattaya. 
Checking was friendly enough although the broken English didn't help resolve basic questions. That is being a little picky, as afterall, being in a foreign country, it would be ignorant to expect English to be spoken perfectly each time. That being said, hard rock generally employs staff who are fully conversant and often multi-lingual, however this time fell short.
The room was ok. On check in there were no double beds left, just a twin consisting of 2 queen beds. Nothing was offered by way of compensation - no voucher for the shop or even a checking cocktail - all of which are more than in the bounds of what should be fairly easy to provide.
The bathroom was nice althought the shower was lacking in pressure - albeit a nice rain shower head - very little in the way of pressure...  The toiletries were lacking, and there weren't even the usual vanity items such as cotton buds etc which you would expect from a hotel at that price tag and especially one which provides a "rockstar" experience!
The room itself was spacious, and quirky, although attention to detail in most cases was extremely lacking.  Furniture was showing signs of wear and tv was surprisingly small.
Food... Food was excellent. From breakfast throug to the HRC. Cannot fault it at all, however the cocktails were not upmtomthe usual HRC standards.
We stayed on Halloween and were looking fwd to a kiss tribute act. What can't say? I have never been subjected to such an awful din in all my life (I served my time as a roadie)... They we simply awful and couldn't hold a note. That being said, the place was crawling with tv cameras and local press... For sme reason, these guys were being classed as celebrities... In my opinion, stick with the house band. Although a little jumbled in terms of set and style, they we pitch perfect and entertaining.
The pool area is exquisite and the facilities for kids and teens are second to none. There are a couple of other bard in the complex which are well appointed and have a nice ambience.
Spa treatments amazingly expensive - around 5-7 times more expensive than the private spas less than 100m away!
Would I stay again? Definitely not. Would I stay at a hard rock hotel again? Maybe...
Bottom line is if you are looking for a hotel representing the hard rock ethos, I wouldn't bother with this one unless you have kids. There are many many superior hotels in pattaya for the same or less money.
However if you're in pattaya, please check out the restaurant. Food cannot be faulted!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Excellent property and recommend for family. Good location, clean room. Great breakfast and buffet dinner. Had one issue on meal price I agreed online found different. However stuffs cooperated nicely and resolved.

Enjoyed the place and the hotel too. The swimming pool is good and just renovated. Everything is nearby and convinent. Food is good. Nice sea view and nice pool. Will come back to visit again and enjoy the pool.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I have stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in Pattaya man time.It is always a Good experience to stay at the hotel. Staff are frendle and accommodating.Always smiling. My Best recommendations.RegardsHenrik

Spring for the kings level and never spend a dime on food. The buffet, pool, rooms everything was fantastic. This is my second time with the Hard Rock and as always this group money all my expectations
GREAT SERVICE!! thanks guys good job I'll be back!!

I found the staff very nice, looked after children very well, and were professional. Place was however, extremely expensive compared to other hotels. Room was clean but really rather small, and family friends with children were asked to pay a huge amount just to spend an hour with us, at the private pool. Expensive I'm afraid.

The staff was very helpful. The rooms were clean and all was very well organized. The breakfast was amazing and had so many different varieties. The  kids really enjoyed the pool as it had many different slides.

I was there for one night only but everything was fantastic.
Location is very good, just in front of the sea.
Personnel was very frendly and helpfull
room was perfect in all the aspects and Always very clean
I'll return for my nezt trip over

My wonderful vocation pricing & location was perfect as well as not too far fm bkk . i will come back in coming months . My family like hard rock especially my kids so happy with nice pool and pool games !!!!

Dear Mr. I am supposed it is auto-emailing system. But, I want to leave my feedback on your service. The facility is better but you might know we found some big bug on the table. But, you team treated this problem with great support. But, If I were you, I will trace our status with new facilities and mood My other case in danang of Vietnam with Pullman resort is the vice president and general manager was coming to me and discount for 1day (I stayed villa for only me) ‘and serve the dinner. It is very and quite impressed treatment. And, we have still good relationship and my all friend is coming to the Pullman with my recommendation. And, I also linked him to my business member. If you want to change something to star in your hotel, I think you need to treat them beyond their expectation. If not, they will keep compare it with their first and last experience.

I believe many thais receive same service as me. We arrive hotel without security guard telling us that we have to park further so we have to drive back again and park. When we are at the counter, no one offer help to carry the luggage (maybe we are thai and dont look rich, sorry to be discriminate). We carry our luggage there alone without anyone helping and we need to wait for 40 mins (we are there at 5pm) for the room to be cleaned. We try enjoy it by not complainting about the service. Then in the morning while we are taking picture together and went to the jacuzzi, the moment we are stepping down to the pool, a security guard blow a loud whisper at us and tell us that we cannot enter. Making all the tourist people look at us and we have to tell the security guard that we stay in here. And we went to the breakfast, the room is stuffy. Staffs do not give good service, everyone is so busy, not even a greeting just tell us to find a seat ourselves. I'm kind of surprise when i'm telling my thai friends about this, they say we are not the first. Well, maybe this hotel is for the foreignors but not the thais then. First time and Last visit. NO MORE.

I never regret to book this Hard Rock Pattaya. I have one night using Rao Tiew Duay Gun promotion for Thais promoting domestic tourism. Since the booking process, K Fluke helped me with prompt response, informative and yet very professional and that made my stay really smooth. The club room on 9th floor this trip is such an amazing choice if you're looking for great space with stunning Pattaya beach view from your room. The check in by K Ning's team, K Ann and Nong Gift are superb, no doubt why a lot of Thai and international guests chose this beach resort destination. The pool is a must visit too, K Sake and team entertained me whole afternoon, I loved the vibes of pool activities plus great and unique designs of this lovely pool, great for your Instagram shots/posts. Hard Rock Cafe's moon deck bar is the best, the view, the band that plays both great international and Thai repertoire. Breakfast is the best in town, delicious and easy going, pool view helps you to feel more appetite. Always great choice for friends, family and your short trip to escape busy Bangkok 😍

As always staying at Hard Rock hotel was a great time. There was nothing to complain about and the staff is always eager to make sure you have a fantastic stay. Superb breakfast spread, attractive promotions and great rooms keep you wanting to come back. Keep rocking Hard Rock Hotel.

we was not informed by the hotel that the pool is under renovation when we do the booking. was told only on check in. my holiday mode is deeply affected without the pool and lanscape relaxation. that is the purpose i come pattaya and chosen hard rock.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Initially had thought the Hard Rock Hotel would appeal to only younger travellers but pleasantly surprised to find travellers of all ages groups..... 9 to 90 😊.to and all ethnicities 👍  The deluxe rooms are an adequate size and comfortable with a double bed.  Ours had a balcony side ways facing the sea.  We were staying on a Bed & Breakfast basis and we were pleased to discover breakfast is served up to 10:30 a.m...  useful for those  UK travellers that are jet lagged 😴.  A very comprehensive variety of food is available for breakfast for all appetites.......noodles and rice, traditional British fried breakfast, indian curry and samosas or pastries and cereals.  Staff very helpful. Dinner is also served here...a choice of open buffet or choice from the a la carte menu.
There's a beautiful pool which has rocks and sand giving the illusion of being by the sea. Staff by the poolside restaurant were also very friendly and kind as were reception staff on our arrival.  Staff were always happy to assist from the doorman up to the bar manager.  The Hotel has a Saturday night poolside party free to residents with a live group which attracts paying guests from other hotels... the pyrotechnics are incredible. Guitars and photo memorabilia of the rolling stones and the Beatles adorn the walls. All in all this is the best hotel we have stayed in in Pattaya.  There's something for everyone young or old. The beach is just a short walk away. Can't recommend this hotel highly enough

the location is good , near the beach and shopping area , also have the swimming pool , so inconvenience  , i will come back next time , also have the club for listen the song ....etc , and then the breakfast is so good !!

Good service   good foods  good children swimming pool  beautiful swimming pool    good locationbut not  good  normal room   narrow room    deluxe room  The room should have a double bed. breakfast  and  buffet dinner   thai food  less

A hard rock theme hotel. The rooms are small but comfortable and  well furnished. The pool was good with lots of activities ongoing for kids. The location was comfortable, right on the beach. The view from the room was pretty good. The breakfast was also enjoyable. Service was pleasant.

Preface:  I like the Hard Rock brand.  I stay at the Tahoe and Las Vegas properties regularly but this experience is worth commenting on if you are planning a stay. 
*There is good and bad about this property and I will mention both in this review.
First thing I noticed as I arrived on the property to the check in and onto my room is the number of ads offering additional services for sale.  You literally can not look anywhere and not see an ad for a promotion, a service, something for sale.  
The second, and I find this very strange.  When making reservations, if you log in with your email address the same reservation jumps in price.  I mentioned this to the staff and was told that should not happen and was likely a temporary error.
*I checked every day as I was very curious and this occurred each of the days I was on the property. 
The Good:  
- They have an awesome Steam Room, Sauna and Cold Dip pool set-up.  It is often empty so a great place to relax. 
 
- Having lockers to rent free of charge while at the pool is great addition. 
- Wifi coverage on the property is excellent and should be highlighted as a job well done.  Better than the Hilton down the street.
- Bar staff is excellent.  Consistently interacted with top notch bar staff and managers.  A+
Summary:  
Hard Rock Pattaya is a safe place to stay with a nice pool and friendly service staff.  It is not set-up as a relaxing resort to get away from it all, but rather an example of a customer being thrown through a sales and marketing funnel while on their vacation.

Every staff in the hotel are very nice, helpful, dynamic & cheerful.
Very great & large swimming pool, many games & activities which can stay for whole day.
Have fun in the foam party on Saturday night.
Will definitely stay again in next year.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Very nice and enjoyable stay.The swimming pool facilities and activities are the best I ever met. Sat night pool party are fun and memorable. I wish the party can extend longer. Location is convenient . One of the best hotel I ever stay in holiday

I recomment all to stay in HardRock Hotel when visiting Pattaya..its a beautiful comfertable property..Very centeraly located in the heart of the town..on the walking street next to the ocean.All ficilities are available near it..one can just walk to the Ocean and the market.Love to visit again ..

The hotel is very beautiful and full of small details, from the way the cleaners clean your room to the pool bar staff serving your drinks. 
Pool was nice and refreshing, places to sit with shade and sun, which was good for my family. 
I would like to give a big thanks to Eddie, he served us in the breakfast buffet and was so helpful and friendly from the moment we walked in.
To anyone staying here with any questions or in need of help, he is the guy to look for, thank you Eddie, and all the other staff for making our holiday great!

Super comfortable bed, decoration, good staff, good food, great location.Hotel theme that very uniqueOverall highly recommended property.Nothing to say… all good. I will book here again on my next trip to Pattaya

the top place to go. superb location. awesome food. nice ambience. Highly recommended place to go especially if you have a small kid. easy access to the beach. lots of watersports activity just outside the hotel.

The hotel is located in the middle of the beach road, right opposite the beach, very convenient for travelling to outer Islands and shopping.We booked deluxe sea view promo  with free wifi and breakfast for 3 nights.The internet was very slow.The room  was nice but a little on the small size   we could see only a part of the sea from the room window. The pool is the biggest in pattaya and if your travelling with kids they have a loads of activities for them as well as for the adults.Overall very nice atmosphere, very friendly, lots of fun activities, ocean view, big swimming pool, food are superb... love to come back again. Also, they have very limited English TV channels on the days  only 3 or 4.

Hard Rock Hotel carries a brand name, and thats what attracted us to book two rooms at Pattaya. The location is across the road on Pattaya Beach which was good actually. While my fellow traveller was all ga-ga with the name and fame, I found the place lacking decent service standards. Here is how:
The check in was a prolonged affair and I had to twice tell the receptionist to speed up things after a long ride from Bangkok. The staff was almost non-challant while welcoming guests like they were Martians. The front desk girl kept asking for a deposit even after paying for the entire stay which i always do at all hotels. Then she refunded back the deposit when I handed over cash to her, like she was checking whether I had money with me or not
The breakfast again was a damp squib. Not a lot of variety. When I asked for a cup of coffee, again the staff conveniently forgot and I walked out without a cuppa
Check out process was again disheartening, when the counter staff tells you: wait we will check your room even after 20 minutes of informing the guy, to settle the bill, are guests there thieves? And in the present digital world even if the guest walks out stealing a few things of the mini-bar, the guests credit card can always be re-charged.
The last nail on the coffin:
We asked the concierge to get a taxi for Bangkok from outside the hotel gate, he promptly refused. What guts the man had. What is a concierge of a hotel there for? I remember in Singapore, where a concierge went out of the way to even book a Grab Cab for me, and here the guy has the gall to say no to a guest. That shows the training and the top management of the hotel's attitude, how they train their staff.
Well, we walked with our bags around 100 metres ( a first ever in an international trip) and lo and behold, 5 taxis were standing right outside the hotel gate.
Well, the rooms are ok, the hotel has nothing to boast about except for its infamous foam swim parties. 
So for the price, please stay away from this place, honestly it sucks !!!

Very good hotel for 4 star category. All recommend. Holidays are more expensive than in simple hotels, but cheaper than in the Hilton hotel. Clean, cozy, delicious breakfasts. I will probably come to this hotel again.

Great hotel with great staff specially the following thank you for the great experience and services I will recommend and come back because of these people specifically Ciara, sax,Quito,keng,willy,tiger,sumo-o,Chanel,Paris,Anna and nastiya
Thank you so much

Could ask for more from this hotel of choice in Pattaya. As a frequent visitor to Pattaya, this hotel must be the hotel of choice. From the prompt response to my queries of alternative arrangement in view of the pool closure to the flawless coordination in the hotel itself, the hotel never fail to surpass my already high expectation every time round. Special mention to Chana, whom assist to coordinate our visit to the Cartoon Network theme park. My kids absolutely love it. Thanks for the wonderful hospitality. You and your team have done the Hard Rock brand and also Thailand proud.

Nice to be greeted by bellman when we came back to the hotel after a day trip. However, I think the English needs some improvement. He meant to ask, "Did you have fun?", but instead asked "Are you funny?". Well, but good effort there.
I tried to book the Cartoon Network package via the Hard Rock Hotel website, but there was a problem with the website and it just didn't go through to the payment page so I had to call up directly to book. The first guy who attended to my call said he will send the payment link to me, but I never received it after a couple of days. I called up a 2nd time and the lady who took my call did send the payment link and I completed the booking. I requested that she send me information about the CNW shuttle bus timing and she said she would include the info in the confirmation email. It wasn't and I also wasn't advised that I need to make advanced booking for the trip to the waterpark. I almost didn't make it there, but the front office staff managed to make a last minute booking for me, which I appreciate.
Overall, it was a pleasant experience, but I think the communication needs improvement.

No Rock music at this Hard Rock. Despite mentioning this at the pool every day I was subjected to pop, rap and country music. Only heard 2 songs you could class as Rock on my entire trip. This would put me off going back
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: This was our second visit to your hotel and I have to say I will definitely be back again. The staff and surroundings make you feel like your back in your second home which makes your stay there even more relaxing and you're  treated like king and queen. The Rock Royalties package is definitely worth the money.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Always stay here in Pattaya. Simply the best place on the beachfront.
Quality rooms with great staff and service and the swimming pool is huge! 
Been here about 20 times now over the last 12 years and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone whatever kind of holiday you're on.

It difficult to switch/select shower head.
There are 2 types of shower head, one at the wall and another one is overhead.
And the problem is too difficult to push/pull. (Room 718). Please check it out.

The hotel has aged and it’s obvious, but still the rooms and service are fine. The foam party is nice if you don’t mind the noise. After all this is the hard rock if you want quiet stay at the renaissance. 
Great location for nightlife.

Me and my family (boys 4 and 6 years old) stayed here for two nights. We stayed at a "Kings Club Executive Room" with a separate bunk bed for the kids - and they loved it (not to mention the xbox in the room)! The room was very spacious, nice and clean and on the 10th floor (nice and quiet). 
The staff was very friendly and easy-going and the restaurant both on the 9th floor and the ground floor is really good with nice food and service. The pool area is great and so is also the staff working around the pool. 
I can also recommend the Kids Club. I can also highly recommend the Kings Club Lounge on the 9th floor - the service is superb and the staff is brilliant.
The only bad thing I can say about the stay is that Pattya as a city is not really that nice - but this has, of course, nothing to do with Hard Rock Hotel.

Again very relaxing stay at HRH.
Great Team, good Service, clean room at all times, great Pool, customer care very high,
Many guests from the world!
Good place to start your Trips to other places - whatever you are looking for.
Pattaya is not only Walking Street for sure!

Required more improvement in the bathroom area. Toilet area has no enough space and the faucet in the wash bacin was not properly functioning. Aside from that the staff are friendly special mention to the staff (life guards) at the pool area.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
It's not bad. Location is good. I like the swimming pool. The room with the view of the waterfront has a good view.
The service mind of the staff is good. Breakfast was delicious. If you have a chance, on weekends
I want to stay.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We have a great memorable holidays in pattaya.. great breakfast provided.. the room is very clean and my son joshua have a great stay at the hotel.. he enjoy the hotel beach and pools.. rest and sleep well through the night..

We stay in Room 335 on Aug25 and 26 for 2 nights 3 days. On Aug26 before 7:00, we were woken up by the sound of fire alarm. I immediately went out and checked the corridor. It was so silent, the sound was only rung inside our room. I called your hotline, your technician came. He apologized to us and fixed the problem but we could not sleep again. Frankly speaking, your swimming pool and breakfast are attractable.

just have to experience it to know the feeling ..the room had speakers n radio to listen music to...thers lot of rock history  to see n have fun ...the pool is the best ...esp when you see from the room ...its breathtaking....

Good service & staff always smile. Food in cafe also nice, Serve fresh food everyday.Room very clean & daily staff clean the room.Location of the hotel is very strategic. Next to the beach. Good view , sea view.

veri relax ~ veri good place , room veri clean , air con veri cold , this veri important. my husband veri scare hot . breakfast veri taste , room service veri good . if hav chance will stay again , and recommend to friend .
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: A hotel for hard rock, grunge,metal fans. A fun joint and the staff were courteous and cool. The breakfast spread was excellent. And the people at hard Rock cafe made us very comfortable. Thanks again for a great stay

It was our Company's overseas Trip & around 200 plus of us stayed here with lovely memories.The Hotel is lovely & lively with excellent location & very very friendly & operative staff.
Rooms were superbly arranged ,well maintained & clean with nice ,quick service.The food was also of gr8 Quality .The Beach was just around & beautiful pool too was inside.
Overall The Hard Rock can be rated ...TOO GOOD .

I stayed here for business. The hotel is close to the center of city and the beach is close by. 
Room: Spacious and clean. The view is not great as the room I had was facing the buildings. The room is more for modern design and does not have much resort taste.
Restaurant: I had a buffet dinner. The varieties of the food is ok only. The food was not really fantastic. The service is acceptable.
Facilty: They have the huge pool which is relaxing. The facility is well maintained.
Overall, the hotel is quite normal, not really the beach resort type.

Excellent renovated property bang on beach and action.rooms are good.breakfat lavish.wifi complimentary.pool are is too big and it's soul.and price wise it won't make a hole in your pocket.overall you will love it.and above all it has no competition.the newly hilt on is three times costly.

Hard Rock Hotel is top! good rooms and good Service.
This Hotel have a nice pool and the location was nice.
The hotel is in a good location and is easily accessible by taxi. We had a nice view to the sea and could come back to the hotel well at the clubs. We had a great and nice time at the hotel.

I stayed in Hard Rock Pattaya in Septemeber with my family for birthday celebration. I had also wrote a review about this hotel expressing my disappointment, and their General Manager Jorge had read my review thoroughly and taken some follow-up actions that amazed me and made me feel confident in staying in this hotel (and hotel chain) again in the future. 
Honestly, the hardware of this hotel probably not the best, but their service may be is the best in Pattaya. Their follow-up actions far exceeded my expectation, showing they are really care about and treasure each of their customers. 
I love the style of this hotel and that was the reason why I booked it in August. Jorge, because of your warm-hearted follow-up actions and care towards my family, Hard Rock Pattaya would definitely be my only choice of hotel in Pattaya in the future!

I had really high hopes for this hotel, but must say i was a bit underwhelmed. We were travelling as a family with an 8 month baby and a 13 yer old boy and although the hotel put a lot of activities on for children, ours were probably both too young and too old to enjoy it.
We had a seaview room, which although could see some of the sea, it was actually overlooking a closed hotel next door. 
The breakfast was great though, the quality of food excellent although the restaurant was extremely busy.
The location of the hotel was good, and staff quite professional, especially on the front desk. 
I think i would like to come back in a few years when our baby is a bit older and see whether the activities that the hotel put on could make the stay more enjoyable.

Actually 3 months ago I stayed in Royal Cliff Grand hotels. when I compare with two hotels I can say Royal is the best. interms of service, cleaning for everything. I did not find food in the breakfast, they organized according to others contry meal. So next time I will not stay this hotel.

Nice, warm welcome, Rooms okay could be renovated, breakfast could offer more Fresh choices.
Room was close to Elevator therefore quite noisy Environment, would have wished the Option to choose the room Location.

My stay at the hotel was great. I have no complaints whatsoever. Five star service, the staff was excellent. If I take another trip to Pattaya I will stay at the same Hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

The decoration is great as usual, great service, good location and tasty breakfast
I have asked for a smoking room, it's smaller than I expected but clean and cosy 
with balcony which is awesome! 
love the little note which says "please move your butt out for smoking!" LOL
hard rock cafe is full of joy every night with limited space
it will be great if it can be bigger.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
There should have difference counter for check in and check out. As I need to Q for half an hour during the check out. The girl at the counter is keep talking on the phone.
The location is good, nearby can get a lot of foods

Excellent in terms of service, cleanliness, facilities, location and rooms. Great Spa and Pool. 
Suggestion: Could do a bit on sound proofing in the rooms; only for those who'd like to wake up in the afternoon ;)
JJ at the reception was a saviour to get us rooms at the last moment.

Great experience staying here. Warm welcome and friendly help from check-in and security staffs. Good facilities. Breakfast is ok. 
Unfortunately, swimming pool is under renovation. I hope to visit the hotel again.

Stayed for two nights. Fab room. Eat at the Hard Rock Cafe excellent ribs but cocktails a little expensive. Breakfast excellent also evening dinner buffet. Reception area with all the musical memorabilia worth seeing. Disappointed could not get Internet access. Would recommend this hotel.

I have stayed in Hard Rock Hotel frequently and everytime I found its excellence clubbed with never fading hospitality. Starting from reception staff to room conditions, there is very less scope of giving them less credit than perfection. You can enjoy pool and all other attractions are not far away. Go for a swim in beach,  come back and relax in pool. Pool bar is another good thing in the hotel. Overall a nice experience.

This is the fifth times that we went to  Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya. All things are good as always and make my family very happy and surprise. Family suite sea view is great. All staff are very friendly and serve us like we are their family.

The best hotel I've stayed in Pattaya, it's very clean & classy. The room I initially 
booked wasn't available upon arrival, but without any hesitation, they gave me a free upgrade to the Kings club, happy daiz!!! Excellent customer service, the reception/staff are very attentive, polite & dedicated to your wants. Hard Rock overall is huge, they've got a massive pool, plenty of eating areas & a classy Club, plus it's family friendly, loved my stay, I'll be back soon, thanks guys👍🏾

Every crew was very kind and facility was very clean and well-condition.Very clean and comfort room. Large bathroom.But the hall turn on the music 24hrs. It was annoying when I slept nearby door.Good design hotel.

This place is very nice and I impress in your Style your team 
Every staff attentive and have service mind. 
Everyone has identity 
Buffet has high quality , BBQ buffet is very delicious.
At first we stay with other hoto but we join to Hard Rock Cafe  and we enjoy with music and surprising with the band, thry are 
very good and be expert. And finally we joined the cafe 3 times in 2 week!
View from our room no.829 is 
nice and the room is very clean, not far from elevators. 
The pool is big and have many activities whole a day yeah!! That's good!!
We love here and we plan to come back again surely.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We stayed at the Hard Rock in Pattaya as we had an event in the area. We had a family room which was great with a lounge area, separate curtained off bunk beds for the kids, two bathrooms and a comfy bed. This is not high end luxury but a good solid four star with some really nice amenities and touches. The executive lounge floor was a welcome advantage, the hotel is casual, relaxed and fun with a great pool area for kids. Lots of activities going on and a good team around the pool that are friendly, diligent and focused on the safety of the guests. A very mixed group of guests but everyone seemed happy, relaxed and enjoying themselves. The only issue is the noise when they have their Saturday night pool party, it is extremely loud and the heavy base and DJ can be heard from the rooms, if you are there on a Saturday with children, i would recommend you get a room away from the poolside and be aware of the noise. I slept fine, my son slept fine but my wife was kept up by the noise. This is not a complaint as we were aware of this before booking, merely a statement of fact.

I stayed just 1 night in the hotel. 5 days before I stayed with them I had a bad experienced with thier staff about my reservation, but then It was one of the best services I ever had. You wouldn't need to leave the hotel because there has a lot of activities to do. Unfortunately I missed the foam party cos I stayed on Friday night :( . Staff were all very professional, since the first step to the hotel Reception, Security, Bellman, waiting staff at the restaurant and Lifeguard all very very friendly, especially the front office manager Khun Tanya was excellent. Rooms are great, good size, well set up, clean and very livable but there should have spray hose in the bathroom. there are many choices of movies that I can watched in the TV if I'm boring. Breakfast was amazing in terms of variety and quality. The pool area looked good and very big, also steam room and sauna were perfected. I would love to come back at this hotel again.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: room was clean and comfortable .. there is movies saved in tv and you can watch them anytime you want... . the team was very friendly and helpfu .. ill book this hotel again in my next trip to pattaya ....

we were staying at Montien Pattaya .The food there wasnt all that.
Our room overlooked The Hard Rock Hotel and i was eager to try one of there Steaks;
!st time i had hamburger & Chips quite good.
A couple of Days later had a Steak again it was ok
But had to try
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I have used this hotell several times now and expect good service. This time the pool area was under reconstruction, but this was not disturbing to me under may stay at the hotel. In general the room I had during my stay this time, was the same as many times before. This time the cleaning could have been better and also the daily filling of the mini bar. Unfortunately my room did not have a balcony / terrasse as I have had before. This gives you an stunning view over the pool area, Hard Rock Cafe and the beach where you can relax and enjoy the day.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Typical of a hard rock franchisee hotel..different in styling and influenced from hard rock music..great pool to relax and courteous staff.rooms are good but please ask for sea and pool facing deluxe rooms.breakfast buffet spread is limited

The room was beautiful when we FINALLY got into it!  We arrived just after noon to be told we had a TWO hour wait!  On an earlier visit Reception had told me if the room was ready at midday we could go in.Eventually we upgraded to floor 9 and had no further complaints.  We will be back in THREE weeks.

rooms so comfortable and very cleaning ,services is very good , and have more choice drinks provided , and Hard Rock pattaya is middle of the city , very convenience of ours to going to anywhere ..........

It was great to stay in a hotel were the staff are genuinely friendly and enjoy their job. 
Meals are large and worth the money,  overall facilities are great. 
The beach is across the street and lots to do nearby. 
Would highly recommended to all ages.

This hotel has a nice swimming pool! i like it! The hotel room is clean! however, it would be better if the bathing area has glasses to block the water because the bathroom floor is wet and slippery after bath.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The hotel is very nice. Beautifully decorated rooms. Excellent customer service. A large swimming pool with plenty of activities .Breakfast is very varied and of course the food is very tasty. Without complains except for a bit of confusion at check-in. We highly recommend it.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Leisure stay for weekend in Pattaya Break from very busy life in city of Bangkok.Definstely go there many more times in future and next time go with a big group mainly all my staff in Bangkok.I have 60 staff j

We understood that we reserved a room through Agoda. Our room was quite old and the bathroom was not as good as we used to stay. This is not our first time here. We always had a great impression on the staff and the room was pleasant on the 7-9 floors. This time we were treated aggressively by a semi-male staff at the reception when we found out to stay on the 2nd floor. We  asked for a higher floor but the response was unpleasant.

It was a pleasant 4days stay though it didn't meet the expectations...not that awesome for the price we paid
POSITIVES
1. helpfull staff
2. Beautiful pool n bar
3. Very good location 
4. Pool view n sea view rooms
5. On the beach road very near to the malls n shopping area
NEGATIVES 
1. Room size was very small
2. Expensive food... one can find cheaper n tastier food at other places outside 
3. No ventilation in rooms. .. we had to wait for about an hr to get rooms with balcony 
4. Very small bathroom, no bath tub, no handwaterjet with toilet seat...

Stayed at Hard Rock hotel in Pattaya for 3 nights. From getting there to leaving had a wonderful time every single staff I walked past was so polite and couldn’t do enough for you. Food was also recommend the charcoal burger was a bit sceptical at first doesn’t look to appealing to eat but was amazing. Only regret is that I did not stay longer. 5 stars for Hard Rock Pattaya. Thanks so much for some great memories will be back

I whole' heartedly wanted to thank Hardrock Pattaya for an extremely memorable holiday. The moment I set foot on to the hotel, its culture was immediately reflected by the fantastic music and the very warm welcome. The staff always delivered above expectation.
Hardrock hotel Pattaya is extremely well managed. Its is by far and away the most well run hotel in Pattaya and probably Thailand. The staff are extremely professional and have the hard rock culture embedded on them. It is rare to find hotel staff with a culture like the ones at Hardrock. 
The check-in and check-out process were extremely efficient. The rooms were delightful, could have been bigger but acceptable non the less. The view from the deluxe room made all the difference, one of the most beautiful views in Pattaya. We were 7 people and since we were regular guests at the hotel, Mr. Ralph & Mrs. Ann upgraded all our rooms to the deluxe. Hardrocks gesture of kindness to old guests makes all the difference.
Hardrock has one of the best pools in all of Thailand. The staff at the pool ensure that activities are run all day long. You will get to play stuff like water polo and water volleyball. Kids also get to play special games like water balloons among others. The pool has entertainment for everyone regardless of age. You can't be at the Hardrock and not have an awesome time.
The food at the hotel is highly recommended. The burger at the dinner is by far and away the most delicious burger I've personally ever had. Their Tom Yom is also phenomenal. As for breakfast and dinner buffets, the food was good. The cuisine was mostly international. The Staff at the dinner and buffets made all the difference again. You won't wait to look around to find someone to help you, it was very well run.
We went to stay at the Hilton after the Hardrock and it was evident from the first moment that Hilton was understaffed. The staff weren't as professional as Hardrock, they also weren't as efficient and as effective. Kudos to the management of Hardrock for making the place what it is today. I personally preferred Hardrock Pattaya over Hilton and will be back. 
Special thanks go to Mr. Ralph for making our stay memorable, he tried his utmost to make our trip phenomenal. Ms. Ann also deserves our deep appreciation for making us feel at home, Hardrock wouldn't feel home without her, she went out of her way to make us happy. Third, I wanted to thank Tanya for her hospitality and for the effort she put in to make us comfortable. I also wanted to thank the entire Hardrock team for our stay...THANK YOU HARDROCK!!!

We had fantastic during our stay and Ms. Ann (Whitney Houston) assisted us and gave us her best service, arranged my surprise birthday to my better half and she is very approachable too! More power!!!

Staff are friendly and helpful but the hotel is musty,  smelly and dated.  Not bad,  exactly,  but much below the standards of similarly priced hotels in Pattaya. 
Breakfast is expansive, but made unbearable by hordes of other guests and the constantly playing rock music,  which is far too loud to be considered background music. 
The housemaids cleaned the room well,  but never refilled the tea & coffee,  nor provided additional water.

The reception girl who came from Taiwan is not friendly to Chinese from mainland which makes me uncomfortable. The housekeeping team is good to keep my stay in your hotel quite nice and the shop has something worth buying from.

some facilities must improve or fix its. Connection room that hotel provide its look for very old person not for 40-50 years old. I happy with team at swimming pool look like they all pro. others good.

This hotel is dream land for me.My dream came true!When I entered my room I saw many picture frame.There are rock stars.Keith Richards,Santana,and more.On the tv there is Deep Purple.Song was Smoke on the water.

Asolutley brilliant Hotel. Buffet breakdast in excellent. Pool games and surroundings terrific. Very central with massages across the road on the beach. Am going again in 2 weeks and staying Hard Rock again. Can't beat it.

it is located beach road.
hard rock swimming pool is the best thing in pattaya.
staffs are very kind to customer.
and room facilities also good.
the bed is convenient for sleeping.
i recommend thus hotel.

Trying to make money with everything. Need to know local prices otherwise they will charge you 3 times more.
You‘re not receiving hotelpoints when booking was made with an Agency.
Felt a bit like second class people.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Poor food quality and service very slow in buffet restaurant. Pizza OK but not the best. Burger restaurant the best but very quiet. Location OK but not a great place for families this location. Adults only area really.

Try and get seaview room. Food delicious and well priced. Excellent staff, and very friendly. Thank you to Kim at reception, lovely lady and can't do enough to help you. Sax at poolside, lovely man. But all the staff are helpful.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
my second home in Thailand,
every body works hard to make you feel at home
Friendly staff, very honest, I actually left, by mistake the safe in the room open and no body touched any thing. great rooms, beautiful swimming pool,

I enjoyed my stay at the Hard Rock in Pattaya. I was greeted with a cup of lemongrass tea, there was a bunch of great memorabilia, and it was right on the beach close to pretty much everything. The staff was fantastic too.

I'm not satisfied Not worth the money lost Sea view room but not the room, almost invisible Saw the old swimming pool of the abandoned hotel next to it instead The room doesn't have a bathtub. Morning symptoms are few to choose from.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Stayed last weekend for short break, was upgraded to executive floor with the access to the club lounge. Surprised !!! Coz im a returning fan. Was greeted " welcome Home" yes !! Come back home ... Room was nice and sea view through Pattaya hill ( how nice they are) the club lounge is the best, all staff are friendly and all you can drink. Can't forget my Gin tonic at the sunset cocktail. Seafood corner provide for guest to enjoy, there is no need to go out.!!! The activities at the pool arranged for family, they are all happy as i can see from their smiling face. Overall stay was fantastic. Can't wait to return back !!!

Been here for business and have to take my kid with. Room and service are nice. My sons love kid club " lil'rock. ". Kid club staff have very good take care my sons. Dinner buffet in dinner Is so so .

Hotel has most everything you need. Nice pool area. Restaurant dinner is a little pricey but has everything. Free breakfast has everything and comfortable area. Room very clean and modern. Floor near bathroom is a little icy unless you lay down some extra towels. Good location on beach road just north of Soi 7 I think. No microwave which I really like though. (warm up leftover food and my coffee). Staff all very nice and accomodating. Bed was just a little hard but still very comfortable.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Decent stay this time, my 5th visit to this property. I pick the Composer suite all the time as I was upgraded to this suite on my first visit, Good call ! I like the privacy element of this suite with good sea face view. Only odd design item is the sharp edge of the bath tub that invariably hits your knee as you turn from the bowl after relieving yourself. they need to blunt the sharp edge... Minor item though.

This is my second time I stay at this hotel. The first time I went was in 2011, hotel rooms have been renovated and looked great. Bed was very comfortable. I got the room the over looking Pattaya sign, which is fab!! Entertainment in room was perfect so I could watch fake DVD I bought from Bangkok!  Staff are helpful and very friendly. Spa was fantastic. I was overwhelmed by BBQ dinner- roasted suckling pig was very delicious.
This year stay, I found a few new looks in different areas such as dinner room both in-door and out-door. I must say it's nicely done and looks much better than last year. I'm impressed with hotel's constantly improvements. Compliment to management!!! Keep up the good works. I love new tear & wear in room especially new towels. They are really nice and soft. Staff are as lovely as they were last year. One staff actually recognized me, amazing!!! - she did serve me every morning for my entire stay last year- I tried new Spa package, it's excellent and reasonable. My husband and I booked treatments three days in a row. Other thing I love about this hotel is entertainments - family and child friendly! I enjoyed watching children having fun joining activities at the pool. Staff are great entertainer.... I look very much forward to my next summer visit.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Brilliant time again. All the staff are friendly, from the reception staff to the maids. Would like to thank receptionist Eve, who helped us out. The bell boys, Sax the pool staff. Food excellent as usual, rooms always tidied and clean. We even spoke to Jorge the manager when We where having our morning coffee, who is a lovely man. Staff could speak good English. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Can’t wait to see you’s next April all being well. Keep up the good work Hard Rock Hotel.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I recently had a 5 night stay at the Hard Rock staying in one of their Kings Club rooms and I could not be happier with my choice of hotel.
On entering the hotel lobby you are taken back by the decor and the rock memorabilia which is positioned throughout, there is definitely a fun and funky feel to it which is carried on throughout the hotel. 
My room was no different, with its black bathroom and red colour theme throughout the bedroom. We had a small balcony and our view looked out to the city, next time I would go for the sea view. Personally for me I think the rooms could be a little larger having just come from a hotel in BKK which was twice the size for less money, but that's just a personal preference.
The pool area is fantastic with a huge pool and the beach area is a nice touch. The cabanas which you can rent for 700 Baht are also good for just chilling out and watching the world go by. I have to make a special mention to the guys who work in the Shack bar, really good fun and nothing is too much trouble they took the time to speak to everyone and make them feel part of the good atmosphere around the pool area. It should be noted that construction works are taking place next to the pool area and next door to the hotel, which could spoil the tranquility that some maybe looking for.
Food at the hotel is to a very high standard, as you would expect, however, it is on the high side price wise; so if you are on a budget this might not be the place for you. The breakfast selection was vast with every nationality catered for. The Soul Lounge is also another cool place to chill-out on an evening before heading out, again the price is on the high side compared to bars outside, but again you pay for what you get and the service in here and drinks selection is what you are paying for.
We did visit the Hard Rock Cafe one night and found it to be far too loud, we couldn't even talk to one another across the table, this was a shame as we had to take our drinks outside.
Wifi throughout all areas of the hotel is very fast, in fact it's the best I've ever experienced whilst staying in a hotel in South East Asia.
Taxi from the hotel to BKK Airport was booked direct from the hotel and cost 2600 Baht, bit step but as I've mentioned you pay for what you get. The car was clean, well maintained and even had wifi available, which I thought was a really cool touch.
Overall our stay at the hard Rock was fantastic and i would definitely return again in the future.

Me and my wife stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. This hotel is absolutely magnificent. The drive up us to the lobby it's feels so royal. Breakfast is classy. The hotel is so close tp terminal 21 shopping mall and beach. Next stay is already bookmarked.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I stayed at Hard Rock when I first visited Pattaya in Aug,11. Location is good and just 10 mins walk to Central Festival and night market. Renovation is need to improve rooms and  bathroom as well. Nice room views and comfortable lobby, helpfull staff, breakfast meet level and swimming pool is good. Couple and friends are situable relax stay HRH, if family with kids I think still need more facilities.

Stayed for 2 weeks at the beginning of November. Checked in fine no problem, receptionists all speak good english, very helpful and polite. Bags were delivered to the room. Room lovely, very clean and modern, a few quirky features like the carpet and the lamp. Lots of extras I.E stocked minibar and fridge, dressing gowns, umbrellas and t-shirts all available to buy. Check what you are booking as some rooms have balconies and some not. Hotel itself very clean and well maintained. We had the breakfast which which was lovely with lots of variety, either english, continental or asian. Food and drink in the hotel a little pricey compared to outside, but you are in a chain hotel. Swimming pool huge. Lovely kids pool with a sandy bottom. There is also a swim up bar. The entertainments team usually do some games in the afternoon, but plenty of beds to laze around if you so wish. The hotel is across the road to the beach and there are ample bars and restaurants on the hetel doorstep. Couldn't fault this hotel at all. Would definitely use a Hard Rock Hotel again.

After a long drive and arriving at your Hotel. I can honestly say from the Security at your boom gates till the time I drove out the following day. Everyone of your staff could not have been more helpful or Friendly. Well done!

If you have child, you should stay Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya.
That's because they have many kid's activities, kid's room and swimming pools.
I think that It will be very interesting for your child.
Of caurse, they can provide cleanliness room and kindness support.
Anway, we are looking forward to visiting Hard Rock Hotel again.
Thank you all of "Band Member"

Good hotel with great swimming area and best staff. We are very appreciate to stay their. This is our third time within this year. We will comeback for sure. Saturday BBQ dinner buffet at Starz dinner is delicious.

Everything was so perfect!! Especially pool was great and activity was so fun!! I will choose hard rock hotel if i go to Pattya again!! Thank you all! I never forget these happiest moment!! See you next time!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Even though swimming pool is maintenance, others are excellent. I got the room early when I arrived pattay at 10:00, it was very nice for us as we were tried.
Moreover, the breakfast was delicious. Nice sae view in my room.

If you don't mind the rock star high price, this is as much rock star experience you ever get. Great hotel, great room, great pool and great staff. 
The foam parties are mind blowing. Let your hair down and let's party HARD. 
If there is any downside would be the lack of wi fi. But rock stars are too busy partying to go online, right?

In reality, this could be any good 4 star hotel - only a little decor shows that this is actually a Hard Rock Hotel. We stayed in a club room for 1 week and the room as such was really nice except for the total lack of store space. Our room was on the 9th floor (non smoking) at the end of the wing (room 906) with a small but very nice balcony with city view (over the reception). The balcony was actually the best feature of all for us. There was a good, but quite dark, modern bathroom with all amenities we could wish for. The room was quiet and the air con worked well although we only used it on a few occasions. The beds were quite hard as usual in Thailand. The TV had a feature that showed our current bill - do not look at it - we had a shock as the bill was 4 x the correct amount after two days. A print out at the reception showed the right amount though.
The club rooms have access to a lounge on the 9th floor (where you also check in and out) and the lounge was a very pleasant surprise. We had breakfast there every day to avoid the crowds in the downstairs breakfast restaurant - and in the evening, they offered free snacks and drinks. Normally, an evening event like that can be a very boring affair but we actually enjoyed the busy buzz and the very good service in the lounge during happy hour. We sat outside every night on a balcony overlooking the beach road which was very nice. A club room also offered us a 15% discount on food and beverages in all outlets of the hotel which was a nice feature.
The pool area was under re-construction which we of course accepted but even without the construction site, the pool had a strange layout. The pool is very large with a "beach" on one side with cabanas for rent - which we think is very strange in a hotel. The swim up bar is situated so you have to go under a barrier to the "beach" side or walk through the sand. If you sit at the tables at the pool bar to have your (quite expensive but good) lunch, people may be playing basket ball right next to you and you will experience splashing and a ball hammering against a board right next to you. Not very inviting. One day during our lunch, the staff set up a basket ball game while we were having lunch so we had to move. Strange - because the pool is huge so why does it have to be right next to the pool bar??
Besides the construction work at the pool, there is a large construction going on next door so at the moment, there is a LOT of noise at the pool. And we are not that sensitive to noise. There were many mosquitoes at the pool - also during day time - and we had a lot of stings until we realized where we got them and put on some repellent. 
The pool bar serves the best Wagyu Burger we ever had - expensive but amazing!!
The location of the hotel is fine - the baht busses make it very easy to get around (although they circle because Beach Road is a one way street). It is also easy to just walk out the door and grab something to eat - there are plenty of restaurants nearby. Try walking North to Gulliver's - a nice restaurant with outside dining.
We did not use the spa - we went to have the "spa menu" but it was extremely expensive. We guessed that because there was no pricing in the leaflet in the room which is never a good sign. Around 1500 THB for a Thai massage was too much for us.
Service in Hard Rock Hotel in general was really good - especially in the lounge. But the personalized feel, we did not get. We expected more rock and less water/children activities so we would say that this is a great family hotel but nothing special to us "old" rockers.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Was there in Sept 2011. hotel was undergoing renovation so it's a bit like staying close to a construction site. This is our second time since 2007 and they have refrubished the rooms. We stayed at Deluxe (comes with two queen bed) and it's nicely done up. Carpetted floor instead of the previous tiled floor. Room facilities all as other HRH, comes complete with toiletries.
Other areas; lobby, pool side, diner were all nicely done up but lack the original HRH atmosphere. Place is clean and organised.
We did not dine in hotel at all except for breakfast, which was slightly lower than average; limited choices of hot meal. Overall service was I'd say 5/10 for a hotel in Thailand. Reception and concierge knows very little about happenings in Pattaya and was unable to help us much in that area.
Husband had planned a surprise birthday celebratin for me, however it wasnt much of surprise anymore when they delayed delivery of the birthday cake by almost an hour.
Another downer of our stay was the Saturday night foam party. We got the pool view room and therefore was very close to the pool where they held adult foam party on Saturdays. They music was extremely loud and it didnt end until 2am, which was bad for us cuz we had a 3yrs old who was trying to sleep but kept awake by the noise.
PS : Li'll Rock was lousy, lousy. Half of the room is actually a store, which I think is dangerous for a children to be around. And they don't have basic stuff for my boy to play with and yet they charge 80baht an hour. We got an hour FOC from our room package.
We moved out of the hotel after two days to Holiday Inn.

Our room had no shower, only a space for a wheel chair and I had to hold the faucet above my head and shampoo with one hand. The bathroom had no plug. Had to style my hair without a mirror next to the bed. Our view was NOT the beach, but a dirt lot. They sent me an email saying they would have a birthday cake waiting for me, but that never happened either. There was NO entertainment or music (even though it was Pattaya Beach on a weekend). Basically, OLD / BORING / Overpriced!  Don't go there!  They is a Hilton near by.  I don't know how it is, but the outside looked nice.

Thank you Hard Rock Hotel Pattay .We spend good time every days.The pool was fantastic.We were able to participate in many pool games, receive merchandise, and have an exciting day.But,Room seems to need renewal more.We will next holiday again in Hard Rock Hotel Pattay .see you soon.

This place was great.  I really only have one complaint. They were able to exchange my dollars into baht, but when I left they were unable to exchange my baht back into dollars. The hotel was very clean and very modernized and looked new. The pool was undergoing renovations so that was out of use. The breakfast buffet was excellent and had a lot to choose from. However it did end a bit early.

Swimming water seems to be a bit cool compare to our last visit early of the year 2018. Food at the restaurant is excellent and very suitable for children. Staffs are very attentive and friendly working at every corners, well done. Manage to let my kids enjoy themselves in the kids club, very good, they enjoyed it. The only problem is from the room, the room seem like not as clean as it is, lots of rubbish under the bed.

Visited here in November what a wonderful hotel room 831 very large room fantastic view of the beach, they didn’t have a double room so they put us in this room and pushed the two large beds together..so ginormous bed 😆the shower is big too, if you normally take a hairdryer don’t ! Theirs are really good in the room I was a hairdresser and have very long hair and theirs was perfect for my hair. 
The staff are amazing so helpful can not do enoughp, breakfast is ample lots to choose from, we booked in and had the bbq meal one evening that was really good too and you get a slight discount on price if you are staying in the hotel. 
Swimming pool is great very large and quite warm, gray pool for children lots for them to do. Nice sun beds . Don’t worry about the pool party’s there was one there when we stayed and wasn’t that loud even though our room was right near the front of the pool where they hold it. All very Civilised. 
Beach is just across the road nice beach too and the beds to hire are only 100 Bhart which is around £2.50 . 
You get a clean towel from hotel every day which you sign in and out for, so no need to take a beach towel you can use theirs. We went on a early morning trip the hotel provided us with a lunch box which was very nice too. 
All in all we would definitely go back especially to this hotel, we have never been to Thailand before but the people are so welcoming and lovely they can not do enough for you and are all smiling all the time. A wonderful Country and Pattaya whatever people say we thought it was great , you can go to the busy part or stay where it’s s but quieter . My husband wasn’t that keen on going, he totally changed his mind and loved it ..also got some suits made at a shop on the main road and I got some trousers and jails jackets they were really good worth a visit ..just make sure you have enlightened space in your suitu😆 . We will return definitely in s couple of years time.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Most of the staff are very friendly and helpful.  Swimming pool is clean with nice environment.  Location of this hotel is convenient as only 15 minutes walk to Central Festival.  I will recommend to my friends to stay here .

Everything is good, location is near the walking street, only need to take around 15mins for walking. Is quiet at night and easy full to sleep. Overall was very good experiment in my trip. No smell in the room, and the staff very nice.

Unfortunately there was no pool (renovating) and the variaty of food and beverage in the buffet and in the lounge was lower than normal. E.g. there was lack of orange and apple juice.
But it was all minor issue but just something that is normally better.

Stayed here for two nights in October. It was a good stay overall. My request prior to my stay was attended to promptly and the hotel rep was reasonably responsive to booking site's chat messages as well as email. The check-in is smooth and pleasant. No hassle. Room wise is not bad at all. Nice décor with a good size bathroom. My room has a balcony that faces outwards towards second road. Not much of a view, but nice to have a balcony. It was nice that the hotel left us a plate of fruit upon our arrival.The TV channels are limited but they do have a good selection of movies. Nice room overall... quiet on the 10th floor. Walkable to many places nearby.

Our 1st time visit in pattaya and we love to stay in HardRock Pattaya.For sure we will comeback again to stay and bring more my family member to stay in HardRock.Friendly Staff, good food, great pool for children.Very strategic place, easy to go everywhere.

Please clean on Front side entrance & No gatekeeper ........Please take care and Best of Luck in future booking. we recommend this hotel family as well as friends also . this time we don't have time to see all rooms but we can see next visit see u all hotels.

Normally, when I visit Thailand for business meetings at Laem Chabang, I stay at Hotels at Pattaya. Till recently, I used to stay at the All Seasons (which has seen better days and completely avoidable these days... I will probably write about this separately). In the last 2 visits (one was only for a few hours), I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel. 
The place really rocks!! and is lovely. The rooms with its theme backdrops of singers (mine had a huge poster of Elvis) and the corridors (on all floors), receptions, dining areas with guitars, curios, dresses belonging to different musicians are wonderful. For a rock fan like me, the music on the TV was awesome. T
The rooms are tastefully decorated, comes with a fully stocked bar fridge, a music system, internet TV and a nice bath.
The hotel has 2 entrances - one from the beach and the other one on the opposite road. Has a beautiful spa with steam/sauna/cold pool with a massage (obviously!) center and big outdoor pool.
The breakfast menu is extensive and includes food for vegetarians as well! The evening buffet dinner at the restaurant comes with seafood (and unlimited drinks).
However, this is NOT a hotel for business visitors. There is NO business center and the Hotel really cannot cater to a business meeting. I had a personal emergency and to get a photograph scanned during the night took almost 2-3 hours, with the staff not really knowing what to do.... But the staff, are very helpful, courteous and they did the best that they can...
Overall, the Hard Rock Hotel in Pattaya, rocks!

We visited the Hard Rock hotel for two nights with our four kids and had a blast. My kids loved the foam party on Saturday evening and my husband I loved the full moon party later that night.  The hotel has a very fun atmosphere that caters to families and singles.  The nightly buffet is great and all four of our kids were able to eat free. I never write reviews but had to in this case because of the excellent customer service I received. Several days after going home to Bangkok, I realized I couldn’t find my iPad. I called Hard Rock and they were able to locate it and had the hotel’s driver personally drive two hours and drop it off at my house for a nominal fee. We will definitely be coming back!!

From the moment you arrive to the end of your stay you will be looked after as if no one was there. Things happened behind the scenes that made me feel safe and comfortable. The staff are all well trained the food great and music my era.

The hotel is well-known brand hotel. That is why it is not necessary to say more words. I was completely satisfied while staying in it. I have got much music, sun, water pleasure, tasty food, comfortable sleep, very nice views from the balcony, convenient location,etc.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Very happy to visit you,6-7 times we stayed here and we will come back again!!!❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️ And thank you for dinner coupon at Starz diner , the pretty staff tell us because we visit here many times,she give that coupon for us ^_^
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Very good hotel. Full day entertainment and activities. value for money. very good location. on the beach . walking street near by and buffet breakfast is awesome. overall a highly recommended hotel to stay in.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Everything is good. Maybe in future can provide Halal breakfast section as well. Sleep is good. Gonna repeat again to stay at this hard rock hotel. Please give more promotion to the guest like special discount when come back again to stay.

Nothing wrong with the Hard Rock if you like to party - and this is the crowd the hotel is intended for. When we checked in, we were not given wet towels and welcome drinks like the other guests. But we got free parking and an upgrade, even though my Hard Rock Rewards VIP membership had expired. Walking to the room, you could hear loud screaming from a Pattaya bar girl "at work". After all, Walking Street is only a 15-20 minutes walk away and even the hotel mini bar offers condoms ;) The room was nice. Nice rain shower but I would have preferred a bathtub. We had a non-smoking room but it smelled of smoke so we called housekeeping. THey offered us another room, but twin beds. We wanted king so we stayed and they sprayed. But only in the four corners. I tok the spray from the guy (no training) and showed him how to do the job properly. Funny: The "pool view" is not the Hard Rock pool but the neighbor hotel (Montien?). Tried the breakfast one morning and it was nice, big choice and a lot of Asian foods. Also, most guests were Korean and Japanese during our stay. The beach is acrosss the street but coming from Koh Chang we did not use the poor beach of Pattaya. Why would we, because the pool area is great. Huge pool. The staff offers animation but leaves you alone if you tell them. The only complain is that this hotel is not part of the normal franchise and will not give you Reward points for your stay or anything you buy in the hotel or souvenir shop. Same as in Penang and Bali, this hotel is independently owned. I don´t like this as it does not make sense. Imagine being a Hilton reward member and don´t getting points for your stay at certain Hilton hotels, would not be acceptable either. For a reasonable prize I would come again.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
-All staff are nice and friendly. 
-ABF was good and variety of foods. 
-Close to Central and beach
-café was good for food and music and staff was nice with our kids.
but
Our room smell very bad from the drain in the toilet.

We're frequent visitors to Pattaya as we both have friends, and in my wife's case family who live there.  Normally we stay in the Citin Garden in Pattaya Tai but this time fancied a change which was in fact a good move.
First impressions: very favourable.  
Lasting impressions: pretty good too.
I love the "rock" theme and the guitar collection.  Reception area is very swish and comfortable.  Staff attentive, efficient and helpful.  Our room was not particularly spacious but more than adequate and very clean with excellent view.
The buffet-style breakfasts are great with an unbelievable range and quantity of food to satisfy almost any taste.
Outside, the pool area is plenty big enough and the imitation sandy beach under the palm trees is a nice touch.  There's also a smaller upper pool right alongside Beach Road.
If I had a gripe I would say I disliked the noisy organised events in the pool area.  Entertainment staff bellowing through mighty amps throughout the day spoiled the potential relaxation the pool area could offer.  If you wanted solace to read a good book in peace.... forget it!  However, the laid-on entertainment is good for kids.
Bar prices are bit on the steep side so we drank at other bars.  
Yes, we'd stay here again and I can recommend it.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hard Rock Resort. The staff are excellent, the facilities are very well maintained and the morning breakfast has a great variety and quality. We will definitely be back.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I've stayed at hotels around the world and there is no other place like Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya. The music memorabilia is really cool but what sets this place apart is the staff. Absolutely amazing service. The Pizzeria had this Larb Moo (spicy Thai salad) pizza which was out of this world. Too bad it was only the special of the day. I'd come back just for the pizza if this was on the menu! Was planning to stay there for the 15th Anniversary but unfortunately it was postponed due to the passing of HM King Bhumibol but I'll definitely be back once it's rescheduled.

Given we were their for a week during mourning of the King so their was no music and limited events. 
Beware this hotel is basically a budget hotel with a big badly designed pool and beautiful clothing of  Elvis, Madonna and James brown, etc in the lobby . 
Above the lobby are small noisy rooms, along black painted hallways and extraordinary badly painted murals of the beetles and beach boys on elevators lobby .
