Slides were a plus point for the kids though the landing point was a little high off the ground. Free style pool was good for a swim, drop by to have a drink by the pool bar yah :)
They have a mini Rock Climbing facility (free at certain timings), gym, kids corner, adults lounge...and the beach is right at the door step for the various sea sports!
Will be back to stay here again if in Pattaya as its 10 mins walk to Central Festive Mall and amenities.

We had a good stay at the hotel overall. the staff was Friendly and helpful. breakfast was good, so was the food in the other resturants. my son had a good time in the kids swimming pool. the only downside is that the room is showing its age, paticularly the aircon in the room was fixed at certain temperature which can get quite cold at night and when requested to fix, the hotel technician failed to provide a solution.

We travelled by car from Bangkok airport, which was fairly straight forward and took just about an hour or so. Once we got into Pattaya the traffic started building and seemed like the regular urban Thai city. The GPS actually led us to the back entrance of the hotel. We had to drive round to the other side where there was a security check on the car before we entered. There is limited parking, but they do have an overflow car parking spacing. 
We were greeted and the staff quickly helped us with our bags and took them into the lobby whilst I parked up. Check in was friendly and easy. We were given our rooms just before noon, even though the check in time was 2pm. The room was nicely air conditioned, had plenty of space for luggage and a decent sized bathroom. The view overlooked the hotel pool next door, which can be easily mistaken for the hotel pool. 
The hotel pool is a great place to relax with one side made into a beach like area. Plenty of games and equipment around the pool area for kids and family to enjoy. A number of dining outlets to choose from, which are affordable (because its Thailand). As it was our honeymoon, we were given 2 free drinks at one of the bars in the hotel. Breakfast can get busy,  but there is a good range of food. One of the better breakfast selections I've experienced in Thailand.
Overall, its a pleasant hotel to enjoy a short break, whether as a couple or family. Its right in the centre of Pattaya and many places well within walking distance. So a good location. The hotel is clean and staff are very friendly and helpful. The concierge desk can help you book a range of activities from golf days to tickets to Cartoon Network Land water park. Highly recommended for a 3-4 day stay in Thailand.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Rock and nice stay.  Very clean room and environment. Sauna eas nice bonus 👍🙂  breakfast was allso awesome.... location is peacefull but good...rock rock... only prices on poolbar were expencive. Ovet 10 eur/ erin is otettu much in thailand. But that is not a BIG problem 🙂
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I stayed in the Hard Rock Pattaya about 20 times. I absolutely love that place, excellent service, good rooms, fantastic pool, withe many , fun activities for adults and children.  Staff are friendly and helpful day and night. Just  fantastic nothing less.

Tell us how you liked the room goodshuttle bus requestPlease ask the guest for better benefitsFree of charge for guest in case of bubble partyThe same goes for the evening buffet. If you give a discount to the guest, you will not have to go out and eat.

Check-in was fast. The staffs are great. quite a big lobby with restaurants and rock shop inside. room was a bit small.bed was comfy. toilets are good. clean. did not try the breakfast. stay for a night only.

This is my 3rd visit to the hotel and it is still as good as it was the first time I visited. Actually even better, service is great, the staff is welcoming and friendly, the restaurant by the pool is a little pricey but delicious. The hotel is well located and well priced. Taxi to the airport in bangok is about 1800 Baht if you ask for a private car, and about 800 Baht with public Taxi and takes less than 2 hours.

Stay here a lot on business and family breaks. There is a consistency in the great quality of service and friendliness of the staff. Well worth a choice for a  family vacation. Also a great location to be based in Pattaya.

Comfortable hotel - room has all the amenities- tasty breakfast - checking was quick and cheerful. Checkout takes longer so plan accordingly. They had to check your room before they check you out. Otherwise everything else was perfect.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We spend 5 days in this hotel. The check in is fast and effective. The front office staff Bew, Ralph,  Ann, Suni, Summer, Fa, all of them are nice and helpful. The room is clean,  tidy with trendy decoration. The facilities of the swimming pool are suitable for children and adult. There are many activities everyday. We enjoy staying in the pool, chating with the staff Quest, Villy, Sek, Tiger, Quito. I also enjoy the breakfast in Starz Dining every morning, Kings' Club gathering and the SPA. I really want to stay longer on our next trip.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
We went for a week in Nov13. Very nice hotel in Pattaya, nice descent sized rooms, great pool/atmosphere, perfect location, descent gym/spa.
But I would avoid Pattaya as a destination – average beach, nightlife is good for a few days (Insomnia, Differ, Hollywood etc.) but is a bit tacky, not very clean streets. If you do visit, of course it is worth staying at resort like hotel with a  good pool – as the beach is at best average.
Phuket is a much better destination, better beaches, good nightlife (not as hectic as Pattaya, but still plenty of choice and variety). I preferred food in Phuket better too, and given its location which is better for Island tours/excursions etc. Sriracha Tiger zoo is worth a visit, approx 1hour drive.

This is a hotel for familes, so if you are looking for a party hotel this is not the one. 
Rooms are pretty small, very expensive for what really is a 3 star hotel with a music memoriabilia theme. Location is great as its right on Beach road, Soi 5 I think, a 20 min walk from Walking street.
Staff is very friendly and cool, breakfast is half-decent, pool area is nice, gym is pretty good and big. Hard Rock cafe slightly outside on Beach road is good and the staff is very cool there as well. 
It was just ok for me, definitely not worth $140-180.

Checked in yesterday, december 19 2016 for 1 night to celebrate our aniversary... asked for a late check out and there was no problem... hotel staff are super friendly and i like how they will actually greet you and offer assistance to you... the room was nice... we got the sea view and it was superb... only had a minor issue with the tv but im okay with it... i also like how they make activities to the hotel guests... very very nice and homey... the receptionists are very nice... i also like to cemmend khun boston for a job well done on the guests... he was in charge of the games for the guests... we saw how he interacts with the customers and he is very very good... we are definitely going back here...
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Me and My girls stay at Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya ( 22-30 December 2013 ) at Producer Suite. We are have a wonderful time and warm welcome from Guest Service Manager and her staffs. The room and king's club lounge are very nice. We would like to thank you all staffs to give us very good service and we will go back again in the future.

I'm not expert english. First time i contract information to check out all staff greate service and take care. Special @hardrockcafe very very good. I hope soon go back to hard rock hotel and cafe pataya long time more than last month.

Rooms were very good but their Facebook page said that the countdown party included 'spirits'. When we arrived the only 'spirit' available was whiskey. Blatant false advertising. When we asked to see a superior our request was ignored.

The location was good. Great pool for children. One halal restaurant nearby as well if you need halal food. Central Festival mall was within walking distance too. However, try not to walk outside with yr children to avoid the clubs along the way.

Rooms were ok (not super clean, but adequate)! The staff was friendly! The pool was nice! Breakfast was very good!
But: the Pizzeria was far too expensive for the lunch they offered -- that was not ok!

Just stayed at the hard rock for 10 days. One of the best hotels I have stayed at. Rooms were awesome. Great location close to beach and you can catch baht bus right out the front. Close to everything. The staff there are some of the friendliest I have every come across and always happy. 
I just like to thanks all the staff there for making it such a great holiday. 
I will be back again
Fish

Hard Rock is a very good hotel in my trip, good cleanliness, service and facilities, so I enjoyed the six days life in hotel; I think that he will be better if could provide more selections for breakfast.

We had only bath towels no any other towel in room. , sink was broken and top shower button too. Asked shave kit , brought by stuff when i start shaving i feel torturing and no choice but continue.
I like concept and your hotel this is why i come 3rd time .hope you can deliver this comment to right person

room, facilities, staffs are so excellent. I stayed for 10 nights and everything was good, one thing i couldn’t find toothbrush as room amenity but lucky i prepared from home. food very delicious but still i couldn’t eat much because of many non-halal foods

This has to be my favorite hotel in Pattaya. Perfectly located close to all that is interesting, a new upgraded swimming pool with underwater speakers, super friendly staff and my favorite tunes playing all day.

We stay here every year, this is the first stay after renovation of swimming pool, the pool is still huge, surprised with the new jaccuzi, also enjoy hearing the music under water that was newly equipped. The staff around the pool are energetic also bring us fun and happiness.
The check in was fast, all staff are nice,  friendly and helpful. 
The buffet breakfast is delicious, the staff efficient.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I stayed at Hard Rock Pattaya in October 2012 for several nights. I had a connecting room with a friend and we both had the 'Kids Rock for Free' package. The rooms were lovely, very clean and had ample space to put up two travel cots (supplied by the hotel) for my twins. My 8 year old son and my friend's daughter had a great time at the pool, joining in all of the activities and playing in the Kid's Club. We hired a cabana for the day which was perfect with my twins and well worth the money. Only 400 baht for the day and this included a few soft drinks and beer (unfortunately they wouldn't let us exchange the beer for coke). For a few nights, this is a great place to go to escape from Bangkok if you are an expat. However, there were a couple of downsides:
On one night there was an extremely loud function with Thai karaoke outside near the pool and restaurant area which was right below my room. I phoned to complain and was offered a room change but this was not at all practical at 9.30pm with twin babies who were asleep and a grumpy 8 year old who couldn't sleep due to the noise. Thankfully the party stopped about 10pm. The second downside is some of the clientele at the hotel. Being located in Pattaya, there are certain types of tourists that visit the area. When relaxing in the cabana which was located by the pool bar, a group of drunk Australian men brought their prostitute 'girlfriends' into the resort and kicked up a big fuss when the pool bar attendant told them they couldn't bring their visitors into the resort. When he went off to get help, the men noticed us and loudly started talking about how I was 'octomum' as I was putting my twins into their buggy. Also, on the day we left large tour parties arrived (possibly Chinese) full of rude people who barged in front of my son and friend's daughter while they were waiting in queue for food at the buffet. At this point I couldn't wait to get out of the place. 
The hotel itself is great, the facilities fantastic and the customer service excellent. However, the clientele (and the noisy function) have put me off of returning again.

Room is newly renovated, nice and huge swimming pools with sands, comfortable beds, staff are friendly with 5 star services, location of the hotel is easy to assess. Hotel rate are affordable. Will stay again!

Let start with if you want a cheap meal then don’t visit this place but if you want a fantastic meal then do visit as you won’t be disappointed. The service was fantastic and all staff from the manager down visited our table to see if anything was wrong or if we needed anything. The food came out hot and very tasty I have to admit its the best food we have had since landing in Thailand 12 days ago.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Location of hotel is very good and easy to go to the beach. There are many services inside the hotel and I like foam party the most. The room is clean, comfortable, and so cool. However TV inside the room has only soundtrack and subtitle in Chinese. Please consider to set subtitle in Thai.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Arrived by early morning flight to Bangkok.. Drove down from Suvarnabhumi to reach the hotel at 8 in the morning.. Was given one room immediately.. Second room by 10 AM.. Superb buffet breakfast.. Complimentary sauna and Steam, excellent location, dinner with live music at Hard Rock Cafe with best of grills and cocktails.. Overall it lived up to its name.. Coming back to Pattaya and staying here for second time.. Found a reason to be here another time..

The hotel looks generally good, and the pool is awesome.
However, the staff was very rude, the Internet was crashing every 2 minutes, rooms were a bit smelly and most rooms were smoking rooms. 
We came in with some girls and the hotel staff tried to rip us off to pay 1500baht per person, although they were not remaining over-night, and room price was 3000baht per night...
Hotel facilities were extremely expensive in general.
The location is not very good, although it's near the beach, it's extremely far  from the walking street where all the action goes on.

As the title suggests, we had a few hiccups however I am not going to go into details as these were overcome and made-up for by some amazing staff and I would hate for a few small issues to sour an otherwise great review of a great resort (especially as the staff tried so hard to correct these, which is all any customer can ask for).
The Rooms Division Manager (I think her name was Angkana) was the shining light of our stay and made our time truly memorable - she should be acknowledged by the executive team for her outstanding customer service and for taking the initiative to ensure her guests not only enjoyed their stay but changed our minds from possibly not wanting to return to absolutely making Hard Rock Pattaya the only resort we will stay in when returning to Pattaya. Nastassia in Front Office was also very, very helpful and we were impressed by her professionalism and her great attitude; she always followed up on requests and clearly has a great future in the hospitality industry. 
I would also like to acknowledge the incredible team in the Rock Royalty lounge who looked after us so well, they were absolutely amazing with our son and that is something any parent cherishes. A truly beautiful group of young ladies (Gift was particularly friendly and helpful). 
Gina, Tipzie and the team in F&B (inc the supervisor, whose name which I cannot remember) were also so great to us and made sure we were looked after at every meal time. Also Quitto down at the gym was kind to our son who just wanted to put on some gloves and pretend to be a Muay Thai boxer! He even allowed him to pretend spar with a real Thai champion! It was a lovely experience. 
Thanks to these teams/people we left with wonderful memories of our time at Hard Rock Pattaya. Please thank these people on our behalf and let them know they are the ones who make your resort truly great and without whom we would not have had the memorable stay that we did.
The kids' area with waterslides is fantastic and our son enjoyed them a lot. I might suggest opening pool area earlier than 10am. I know it's Pattaya and nothing opens early but anyone who has had kids will know they wake up A LOT earlier than 10am and it is hard to keep them distracted till 10am when they are so excited about getting in the pool and having fun. I noticed life-guards there earlier than 10am so common sense would suggest that you turn the slides on a bit earlier (9am is a good compromise). On more than one occasion I noticed small children unaccompanied by parents in the kid's area of the pool. While I know it is not the Hard Rock's responsibility to monitor children (and it shouldn't be either) and your rules do state parents MUST supervise their children while in the pool, I would suggest your lifeguards/pool monitors having greater oversight of this area and then approaching parents who are not supervising children properly. Personally, I cannot fathom why any parent would leave their children unsupervised in a pool (of any depth - it's completely irresponsible) - it takes only seconds for children to drown (just look up secondary drowning for some horror stories!) but again, this is not the fault of Hard Rock, just a public safety warning as I am from Australia where swimming can be dangerous (because our beaches and waves can be tough - just watch 'Bondi Rescue' to see how many tourists misjudge our beaches!), all Aussies learn to swim at a young age and have a great deal of respect for the water and its dangers.
We also found charging for kids play area a bit exorbitant. The Hard Rock in Penang did not charge us and had some fantastic facilities for small and big kids available. Given the comparison between what was offered (for free) in Penang and the tiny space with very little for kids to do (at AU$24/day) Pattaya offers, we felt it was very poor value/money (we understand charging for food, however). It's ok if you're a parent who just wants someone else to parent for them while they enjoy themselves but for us, it is about entertainment for our son - it's his holiday too, after

good service. Bathroom blind issue solved immediate after highlighted.
The room was clean and tidy. the room is comfortable and air cond was cool all day.
We like the welcome drinks very much , enjoy in Hard rock café with live band . Good.
Room with free movies , best choice for whom want to stay in room.

I stayed here for ten nights as a solo traveller, I found the staff to be helpful and polite, they helped me out with a late checkout for no extra charge which was appreciated. The included breakfast was really good and the pool area one of the nicest in town but I found the prices for food & drinks just too much for me to stay and enjoy sitting around the pool area, which was a shame 235 baht for a can of Heineken that's nearly $10 Australian dollars each ?? The gym was pretty good I used it nearly every day and the wifi was good also, I would recommend this hotel for families and people who don't drink much.

We are mature couple travelling without kids. The room fit us well. Breakfast  was average, need more varieties. The pool was excellent and manning by the friendly staff. Not to forget the lively band performing at the cafe. Next trip will be with the kids.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: This place is situated on main beach road . Great place to explore pattaya  with family.can enjoy seafood ,beaches. Great shopping place,local thai food etc. hotel rooms are well decorated .service is good. Rooms are neat and clean.

Kids club feature was very good as we could leave our daughter there for a small fee and have some more relaxing time by the pool. The only thing was tahmasebi we had to leave the hotel to eat out as we eat halal food and hotel was not providing it. It would have been good to have halal food option at breakfast and dinner. Also we will go back to hard rock if we go to Pattaya as this was our forth time in Pattaya and by far hard rock was the best hotel.

My whoel family and I (total of 12) always stay in Hard Rock Hotel whenever we go to Pattaya (technically every year). My daughters love staying in Hard Rock Pattaya since its opening. At the entrance, Tedz recognised my daughter and greeted us witht the biggest smile. Ana has always been a great guest service manager with a great smile and warm welcoming attitude to my family. My daughters always feel like it's their second home. This time I've met Boy at the check in counter and he was helpful and nice. Move on to the pool, my daughter and neices noticed the changes with the facilites but the staff is what makes them go back to it. Quito, Golffy, Villy, Sax have always been friendly. My sister, daughters and neices went to the Spa and was greeted by Pim who had a charming personality and gave clear explanation to the treatment. Then we spent our christmas eve by having dinner at the Starz diner, Takumi was an excellent F&B attendant. However, there are always improvements needed as the rooms are not as equiped. Things such as air con wasn't functioning well and the cabnet door of the fridge may cause injuries are details to be foucsed on to enhance it's quality. "Hard Rock Pattaya never disappoint" I would say since it once again made this christmas trip a remarkable one.

Excellent pools for kids and adults. Some pool and pool side entertainment activities during for kids and adults everyday!  Especially on Saturday, the events are more excited, including the family foam party in afternoon, my kids really enjoyed it.The hotel's restaurants provide a variety of food choices at reasonal prices.My wife and me loved the coffee scrub & massage SPA, it was very relaxing! The masseuses were very professionals.

Christmas Eve dinner. Pre-paid for 5 adults, 4 children free.  Cool so far.  Arrived 5:50pm, 10 min early for 6pm start. Fair enough.  Still doing staff meeting at 6pm.  A bit mixed up when trying to order a drink, nobody mentioned a free drink of wine (mulled wine) was included in the buffet.  Drinks arrived.  Great long island, and draft beers cold.  After realizing wine was included, ordered 5 mulled wines.  Wine comes, abysmal.  Cannot drink.  Good for car washing though.  Made a fuss (in Thai), they changed 1 wine straightaway to a draft.  Cool.  Still ordering long island ice teas by the glass, willing to pay. At that point, a manager noticed my fuss, and immediately changed all wines to drafts.  Great service.  Christmas buffet was ok, but turkey and ham spectacular, limited desserts.  Gravy a bit of a project.  Nice show by the Father Ray Foundation, bless their hearts.  All in all? My kids loved the ambiance.  Special thanks to K. Joe (Manager) and K. Toom who went out of their way to make it right.  This is what separates Hard Rock and continues their business success in Pattaya.  If you're willing to pay for it, Hard Rock delivers quality, even if it takes 1-2 tries.  Thanks crew, my kids has a wonderful if only bumpy Christmas dinner.

It was a mistake to choose this hotel. I expected something similar to Hard Rock Chicago but not even close. I mean, yes, it's the same franchise and the same style but the hotel's not been renovated for a while and the feeling is not good. Furniture in the room is scarce - no chair or sofa with a coffee table, no luggage rack. Outdated stereo in the room with no Bluetooth connection. Terrible view from the window (it's not the same for all the rooms of course but it was for mine). Friendly personnel is the only thing I can commend.

Nice hotel, great person. The only inconvenience sometimes cleaning of the room was done after 15: 30.Varied Breakfast menu, the restaurant is renovated.The neighboring hotel "Imperial" closed, if it will make repairs that may have problems in the rooms facing this hotel.

Located on the beach road in South Pattaya, facing the sea, this property is a gr8 place to relax & unwind...
Loads of beach activities are available across the road including Jet-skis, Para-sailing, Banana boat rides & swimming. The hotel also has a big temperature controlled pool.
The food is pretty good & mostly traditional American. The salads & chicken bites were outstanding. Rooms are not so big as one might expect but comfortable enough. There is live entertainment in the evenings. Street shopping is accessible few meters away from the hotel & the famous "walking street" in the night is aboout less than 10 minutes walk.
Overall, a wonderful experience..!

Out of my many visits to Thailand , this was my only second visit to Pattaya and this time Pattaya made sure i come again. After staying at Hard Rock Hotel, i will not say no to coming back to this beautiful resort,  could not explore much of it but whatever we go to know was awesome. Rooms were clean, big size, big beds, nice Mini bar, A music system for you to dance through out the day and a balcony to relax. In room service was quick, staff very very friendly, Nice massage room, Gym, Awesome breakfast set up. Pool is cool place to hangout and have few cocktails. Over all a place highly recommendable and enjoy the entertainment they have at Cafe.I am coming again.

The name speaks for itself.They have one of the best hospitality. Restaurants, pubs and rooms are too good. Very close to the beach shore.
Walking street is just close by.
Would recommend staying at this place anytime.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We Stayed in rock royalty room, lounge was perfect with amazing service and views, breakfast buffet is super and their pool/slides and activities make it perfect for families. Highly recommend Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya.

The hotel has a perfect location by the beach. Had sea view from the room and watching the sunset from the room can never be wrong.
Since it is a part of the Hard Rock concept you know what you get. Service minded and English talking staff and lots of cool music memories placed all over in the hotel. There is also of course a Hard Rock shop (2 actually) and a restaurant connected to the hotel.
The pool area is very niceand a great place for relaxing and getting some tan.
The breakfast didn't have a huge variety of food compared to many other Thailand hotels in same price range, but we had no problem to eat good and get full there. Good start of the day.
I have no hesitations to recommend the hotel and we will for sure be back here !!

Everything was great!!! The room was clean and well kept, the staff was very friendly NO bad attituds the hotel is close to everything, across the street from the beach. My wife and I will be back.. ROCK ON!!!!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I stayed at room 336 and found many ants on the red desk. I tried to clean but unfortunately the other ants came out again. On the other hand, the Hard Rock Hotel is valuable, nearby the beach, swimming pool is excellent, the breakfast is also good.

It was a unplanned stay but due to some unavoidable situations, we needed to stay late to finish an important errand and driving home was quite late and thus we found this Rockin Hotel that suits well the occasion

This was our second visit to the Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya, our first being for 1 night in October this year. As we live in Bangkok Pattaya is a nice distance to come away for a long weekend and staying at the Hard Rock really makes it feel as though we are on holiday, even though we are only 2 hours from home. I only booked the hotel at about 1pm on Saturday, I rang them directly to check for availability and they sorted it out promptly.
All taxi drivers know where the hotel's so getting a taxi from the bus station is easy. If you get a shared songtaew with others doubt multiple drop-offs expect to pay 20b per person, if you have your own songtaew it'll be about 100 and takes about 10 minutes.
The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful. They did at first require our passports for check in but as we live over here we didn't think to bring them. Although slightly worried our weekend was at an end before it started, the staff were able to easily retrieve our details from our previous stay and that was sorted.
On both visits the rooms have been nicely decorated, spacious and clean. Due to our late booking though we did have to accept two single beds, although they were massive! The beds and pillows are also very comfortable.
People say The Hard Rock Cafe is expensive. It is in comparison to Thai food but it is no more expensive than what I would pay in England for a good meal.
The pool is a great size with a good amount of Sun beds. There are lots of activities that go on throughout the day too and opportunities to win a free glass of beer (for adults) or soft drink (for kids) which goes down well with most guests. There is aPpoolside bar too and staff who walk around with menus so you don't have to leave your seat.
The gym is well equipt and usually quiet. They provide towels and water too.
All in all another great stay.

i book for suite room , the room very big, clean and view nice to ocean
swimming pool very nice, my children very happy to stay in this hotel 
overall is ok, my kids want to stay for long day 
i will come back to stay in this hotel

I love the guitars and pictures of the stars. The hotel is very comfortable and clean. It’s a bit loud so it’s not a relaxing hotel but it’s worth to go there. The pool is nice too but has less shadow.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
This is a great hotel, very simpel.
I went with my friend on arivel we recived a warm welcome, but you get used to it in Thailand, check in was very quickly done.
The hotel itself is beautiful the pool is huge and looks like a lagoon, alot choise of food;
The room was very good, the twin beds here are almost as big as two double beds, nicely decorated with huge posters of celebritys on back of the beds and a nice sound cd player to play your cd's.
Location of the hotel was great about 5-10 minutes walking to the walking street.
only downside here is that you pay 900 baht if you want your guest to stay with you, but i heard that alot of hotel are like that so...

I stayed 4 nights at the Pattaya Hardrock Hotel for a business trip combined with a private week-end. This was my first time in a Hardrock hotel, and I enjoyed it. Hotel is well located, central, close to the beach, safe and in a quiet neighborhood. It looked like a good family holiday place. Rooms were comfortable, well isolated and with good sleep quality. Breakfast was various and correct. There was live music at the restaurant in the evening, and a pool party on the Saturday evening. I am sure that there are cheaper places around (our daily rate was 2,800 baht including breakfast) but probably not at that level of comfort and safety. Slightly annoying was just the free wifi limited to 2 units.

Rooms are less than average (small and very tacky). We made the mistake of not specifying a Non-Smoking Room and the room and hallways positively reeked of stale cigarettes, but my children will tell you "best place ever!!!" 
The staff were amazing, nothing was a problem and the boys in the kids club were falling over themselves to entertain the children.
Whilst we were there my husband was sick for almost our entire 3 night stop - I think he must of eaten something bad in bangkok. As a consequence  the children and myself took full advantage of the hotel facilities enjoying massages by the pool, swimming, the pool bar, room service  and the kids club. The kids loved the childrens Saturday night foam party and the Nintendo Wii was also a big hit with the older ones.
I have three children aged 9, 8 and 3, we only stayed in Pattaya for three nights of our 3 week thailand holiday yet for the children it was one of the biggest highlights of our trip.
Cant praise the staff enough for their efforts especially with our rather shy three year old, who by the end of our stay was giving them cuddles and climbing all over them.
I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who is not too concerned about luxury rooms but is looking for a fun experience for their children.

This hotel looked extravagant on the outside but on the inside it was just another room.bed was a tad too soft and pillows abit old.balcony was tiny.
Bathroom was small, shower was ok.aircon was good.overall it was abit of a disappointment for the price we paid..
Over $400 for a standard room.not worth it in my opinion.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Me and my boyfriend originally only booked 4 nights, but ended up staying an extra 6! had such a good time. the staff are super friendly, the rooms are big and the sea view is amazing, brilliant to watch the sunset. the pool area is so amazing. there are activites on all day so if you are bored you can join in, or you just laze by the pool. the foam party on a saturday night is fun too.
the hard rock cafe next door serves amazing food, big portions! i recommend the california club sandwich! its massive for the price!!
would deffinately recommed this hotel, just bring lots of money with you!!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I picked a non smoking room with sea view, to a cost of 200 USD/ night. The bed was smelling cigarette smoke and when stepping out on the balcony there was a huge tree right in your face. I got the feeling that I was bothering the pool bar personnel when trying to order from there.

a lovely hotel in a great position on the beach road in Pattaya. Has a fab pool area with great activities. a nice layout in the hotel with loads of memorabilia and a lovely bar. rooms are good with nice linens. we had a lovely stay.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Okay just back from a vacation at Pattaya and here is the fresh feedback before I forget the little bits...
First the Excellent bits: The highlight of this hotel is undoubtedly its swimming pool. The beach pool is great with slides, wading pools, enough beds and some reserved wooden cabins too. 
The good bits : The hotel is in a great location bang on beach road. Close to the beach great views of the ocean. The lobby, lunge and the cafe are great for any rock music fan. Its got some great memorabilia and lovely decor.
The Not so good bits: The room was however a let down. Once you get into the room you could be in any hotel. Nothing in the room makes you feel like you are at hard rock. All the decor elements are at the public area and mainly around the lobby and the cafe (for which you don't need to checkin)
The bad bits: The room has quite sub standard facilities. We were upgraded to what they call kings club and private floor. It was very basic with some basic bathroom amenities, tiny rooms, basic furnishing. Even mosquito repellent was available for sale and not complimentary in the room. If this was kings club god save the common rock and roll fans.
Now the horrible bits: The service level of the hotel is pathetic. We had booked online through make my trip. When I turned up to checkin first we were not offered any welcome drink or and greeting. Our passport was collected and then made to wait for half an hour when I went back to enquire the lady said "oh check in right?" and asked her colleague to help me and walked away from the front desk area. The second lady passed this to another guy who finally started working and then said there is only one night booked for us and not two as mentioned by the booking. I showed them the receipts and he finally relented and said he will upgrade as there is no king bed with sea view in lower floors (which I had paid for so not technically an upgrade.)
The ordeal didn't end with check in ...through out our stay for the 2 nights and 3 days there was very bad housekeeping. Two nights in a row we cam back to the hotel late at night to find the room not done and the make my room sticker just hanging on the door . When my wife got upset the second night and called housekeeping the lady on the other end said its our mistake as in this hotel you have to call and ask for housekeeping and not just hang the provided sticker. Its a first I have heard something weird like tis anywhere in the world.
The service level was similar all over, at the pool, at the spa, at the shop. 
Over all a sad experience. I strongly recommend you stay in any of the cheaper options around the hotel and just visit this place for the live music and you have seen all the best the property can offer.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Overall is good. I think I've made good choice. The GYM, breakfast, pool are great. the room facility are also great! however, there is one day, the cup on the desk is not clean. (there is some white residue on the cup, a little disgusting to me.) the t-shirt confused me, I thought it was free gift. :)

i stayed with family for 3days. At the reception you can find collections of the biggest rock stars, Rooms are spacious and good. Gym and Swimming pool are good.Its located at the beach road which adds more attraction to this hotel.It also has weekend various events.  If u ask me this is a right place for you
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: One of the best hotel I have stayed and I must say this hotel is really hard rock... Great service staff and room is clean. Would love to be back again the next time around.... Look out for the pool as it is really nice.

Rock and roll titled pillows on your bed. Mugs and pillows with guitars logos . Pictures of your favourites bands live in your room. Of course all Come at a price. 
Found rooms. Very tiny though we stayed on the 10th floor with private key entry in the lift. Kings club rooms . Nothing kingsize but. Toilets dingy . No balcony. Small rooms.
Breakfast was extravagant. Even indian bits were added.
The pool was the highlight humongous and divided into a jacuzzi area, slides and a beach too added to one side .with a bar inside . Enjoyed the bloody mary served to me at the pool
But the reception was poor. We waited for a good half an hour to check in . They forgot to offer welcome drinks. Which they did remember later. 
Our booking was done online so there was a miss hence we got an upgrade .
The evening service has to be called for or else they don't turn up themselves. Strange
But there are a lot of little anecdotes memoirs and memorabilia all to look around .. Like a mini museum. Evening security guard needs a special mention. He used to salute to one and all, so sweet. 
Great view of the sea from our room 1015 . 
Beach walking distance though not on the beach property.
The coffee shop near the cafe' great place to relax at night overlooking the sea, yet private.
Overall good stay.
The steam and sauna strangely is unisex .
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: very expensive stay but a good one.A lot of hotels to choose from now so no need to pay these prices. The location is good and rooms are nice and clean.The staff were helpful and the gym was very good and a good place to meet new friends.

Nice service with really wonderful room. Breakfast in the morning is great.  Staff are helpful and friendly. Very good service everywhere and I love to come back next time. The swimming pool is big and lots of activities very fun and exciting. The hotel near the city so we can enjoy the night time very easy.

I arrive at hard rock hotel and notice that I have lost my passport. The staff was so kind to help to trace back by steps. Even though I did not find it, they were kind to let me check in without any identification except my credit card. The staff was very concerned about my welfare and at the end they found my passport.
I was also lucky as during my stay, it was the 4th Pattaya International Firework and the view from the hotel grounds was excellent.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
My first time I'm Pataya and Thailand 
I came without reservation, but I was luck stay in yours hotel with my friends ...thank you so much...
I like the room style...poor area and entertainment...the bar service , the room service , but A don't liked the dinner time restaurant self service ...Had little choice of food...
Another friend

My stay at HRC was memorable considering the fact that this was my first visit to Pattaya. Although this was a business visit, but I am sure to come back with family for vacation soon. The foam party was fun to attend.

Staff has a careless attitude. IRD is the worst experience. Guest concern is NIL. rooms are ok to be in as we were out mostly. Rooms are clean and so is the bathroom. Locarption is the reason for my rating.

Great hotel, wonderful and friendly staff, food was excellent and location to beach and downtown was convenient.   Only complaint was Pattaya itself.   Place wreaks of garbage  and sewage combination as well as trash thrown everywhere,  but what would one expect in a beach party town!  Still had fun!!!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
It was amazing that hotel
Had a great design and the staff were definitely friendly and helpful
If I can recall correctly in the elevator you had to use your room key to activate it
Pretty nice safety feature

we didnt stay in this hotel , we went there to attend the foam party which hold on Saturday nights at 21:00 the entry fee was 500 baht , the party was so crazy and it goes on till late about 3 or 4 am there is a bar you could buy all kind of drinking and prices are fare
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Overall very disappointed. Friendly staff around the hotel but standards have slipped. Food is ok but overpriced. If you eat at the pool be prepared to share your food with ants.  Rooms are clean but very noisy, especially when special events occur on beach road. The hotel has some good facilities for children but lots of late night visitors from local streets and bars makes it a little uncomfortable.  Don't waste time asking staff to organize things such as take away breakfasts, as it won't happen, no matter what they promise you.  They also accept room service orders from 6 year old, so be careful 🙏 Having recently stayed at the HRH in Bali, the standards here sadly don't match up but you can still enjoy your stay.

I though this hotel was quite average to be honest. 
- You did not need a room card to use the lifts, which is a serious security issue. There was not always a security guard at the lobby.
- The light in the bathrooms was dim and shadowy - a nice atmosphere but impractical for things like putting on make-up.
- The showers only have a screen that goes less than half of the way across, so water gets over the bathroom floor. Also no shelf for putting shampoo etc in the shower so it has to go on the floor - fine for me, but if you have hip or knee problems you might struggle.
- The body lotion provided smells awful - like insect repellent (I understand that might just be my perception)
- I checked in for 5 nights under a company guarantee, where the room charges were booked to the company directly, and they still asked for a 10,000 bht upfront deposit, which is excessive. If I paid by credit card, they said it would take "up to 20 days to reverse the charge". I paid by cash and it was returned no problem, but not everyone carries that much cash.
- I had a facial in the spa and they asked me to pay upfront, not at the end of treatment which is not normal. In the treatment room, there is a massive bright neon "EXIT" sign above the door. The bed I was lying down on made me look directly up at it - so bright I could see even through closed eyes! Very distracting and not at all calming. Of course you need an exit sign - am not suggesting otherwise - but there was another bed I could lie on, I could have lay on the same bed facing away from the door, or the beds could be turned 90 degrees to face the other way. I mentioned it to the therapist but she didn't do anything. I was also disappointed with the treatment itself - when I got back to my room I still had clay in my hair and lotion clumped on my neck. My skin has been super dry since - and I got the facial for "sensitive skin."
- The breakfast just had very basic options and only once all week did someone come to the table during breakfast to see if I wanted tea or coffee.
- The air con in the room was a bit nosy, not good for light sleepers. The beds were really comfortable though.
- TV stopped working on the morning I checked out. There is a very small list of TV options, however they have many free movies which was awesome and a great idea to cater for such a diverse clientele.
- A woman at reception gave me vague (and as it turned out, wrong) directions to the closest supermarket.
- The woman at check-out was quite rude and abrupt. However, the guys managing the luggage / concierge were super friendly and helpful. I also have to acknowledge they helped wrap a very large painting I got at the market to make it secure for travel, which was excellent customer service for an unusual request.
It was an adequate hotel to stay but still plenty of room for improvement.

Stopped here for 2 days on the way from Bangkok to Koh Chang.
Hotel is typical Hard Rock style as you would expect. The rooms are nice, bathrooms a bit small. Looking a bit worn in places. Beds are super comfy as Hard Rock beds are! We had issues with our TV as is quite common looking at the reviews.
The food is really good. Pool area great, staff are attentive.
Was worried about the clientele, but Mainly families and couples, they are strict about who goes upstairs thankfully.
Good location - not too far for a funny night on the town but just enough out the way.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: This is not the first time I have been in Hard Rock since my first stay and I found comfort in terms of location, cleanliness, availability of amenities and entertainment. I also do not forget the staff especially the receptionist eve.

I visited Pattaya on a korean holiday. Pattaya is the 11th but friendly hotel for the first time. The swimming pool was very nice and the breakfast was delicious. I would definitely stay here again if I go to Pattaya next time.

Rock Royale was def worth it - WAX  (turn table + LPs in room) and PICKS (guitar in room) made it fun. Exec club nice drink, relax and break. Christmas dinner in Cafe, superb - w/all the trimmings! Entertainment w/carols and band also enjoyable. Thanks!

We booked adjoining rooms as a family of four.  Both rooms were clean and comfortable ( we lucked out with ocean views as well).  Everyone from the bell hop to the pool staff were extremely friendly & helpful.  Breakfast was OK, it wasn't the most amazing hotel breakfast I've ever had but it wasn't the worst either. 
Poolside activities organised by staff every day were great to keep my youngest son entertained.  I would definitely use the Hard Rock chain again based on my experiences in Pattaya.

We've stayed at a few of these before so know the standard they set, firstly the room and pool areas were very nice and couldn't complain about the breakfast,
What let it down was the drink prices around the pool, no happy hour and lack of food choice from pool bar, I didn't see one person drink at the swim up bar, neither anyone eating around the pool.
We had just come from the Centara Grand and prices were much more reasonable hence everyone eating and drinking.
Just a minor point so in all enjoyed our stay here

Our Pattaya trip is perfectly ended today! We thanks so much for all the rockers giving us the memorable stay! 
.
The reason for our choice of this hotel is not only the facilities or price concern, it’s all about the energy & great smiles of their staffs 😃😃😃
.
We sticked  with Hard Rock for almost 2 decades, somebody in, somebody out, but that’s still my top favourite with no doubt!!
.
.
🤘🏻🤟🏻🤘🏻🤟🏻🤘🏻🤟🏻🤘🏻🤟🏻🤘🏻🤟🏻🤘🏻🤟🏻🤘🏻🤟🏻🤘🏻🤟🏻🤘🏻🤟🏻🤘🏻
.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I had pleasant surprised when I arrived at the hotel because the concierge greeted me with awesome welcome.  I had awesome stay at Hard Rock Pattaya. The new pool was excellent.  The breakfast, food and service was rocking as Hard Rock. 
My daughter enjoys the little rock club and the in house movies.

Stayed with this rocking place last year from Nov 16th - 19th. Jamie from the pool area, Justin Beiber again from the pool area ( who saved my daughter from an accident in the pool) and not to mention the kings club manager made our stay a memorable and pleasurable one. The brekkie spread was enormous with a lot varieties and on demand omelets. The rooms were clean and my family absolutely had awesome time with a lot of friendly and smiling faces. Khun Khap / Khao for a lovely experience. Will definitely go back to Hard Rock if we are in pattaya.

I checked into Hard Rock hotel with my family for 3 nights. Right from the help we got to get our luggage out of the cab to the reception greetings were amazing. Room was BIG and fantastic. My room locker had an issue. I called the reception and help was there in 2 minutes and it was fixed. Fast and effective service.
They have Big and beautiful swimming pool. One can spend hours in the pool. 
Hotel is at the beach road so you are at heart of the city. Step out and you have beautiful beach. You get all the bars and other facilities next to the hotel. Hotel itself has a very good restaurants and bar.
Excellent breakfast in the morning. 
Overall, we loved staying at the hotel and whenever we visit Pattaya again, this is the place we will stay.

Best location, safe, clean, lot of entertainment, good breakfast. Only thing we were not satisfied was balcony. It has terrible view and wasnt clean at all. We were at 9th floor. Club was nice and good value. Recommend that.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Rooms were very clean bathroom had all amenties along with cleaniness  the swimming pool was very large along with rids and games for kids  staffs present at hotel were friendly  location was very good with excellent connectivity to every happening places

I’m a guest on 10-11 Dec ‘20. I booked a Rock Star suite which didn’t know that it’s a room with kid’s zone. Unfortunately, we’re couple, no kids. So we asked for room switching and got one with lower price a bit. We asked hotel to give us some compliment and they gave us a voucher for some drinks. Finally, we were happy with the drinks and the room with superb location  and view. Thank you  that a hotel listen to our request  and helped us quickly. We had a great time there. We’ll come back again.

I always love to stay at the hardrock, but specially with the check in i was not happy this time.
Staying here for the 4th !!! time and no one seemed to check their records.
i would expect that this is done before to see the room preferences!
Also the information on Ctrip is not up to date, most of the hotel is non smoking already and ctrip still says non smoking rooms are NOT available.
Still can recommend the place but make sure to send your room request directly to the hotel before.

From the time we had checked in to the time we checked out the service provided was beyond comforting. I will without a doubt return to Hard Rock Hotel any chance I get while travelling. Friendly and amazing staff. The perfect accommodation.

Vant fond a better hotel in pattaya fantastic service and the best stuff in the world What ever you like to do just ask the stuff they help you to find boat trips or what ever you want to do Service 24/7 fantastic

It's a beautiful,well located hotel.
Problem  is ,that it's expensive.
If you can make the room charges less..it will be better.
In breakfast,there was very little options for vegetarians.
You should have more variety in breakfast keeping multinationality of customers in mind.
Over all it was a good stay.

Exquisite service!  All staffs always shows professional and better than our expectations. This is a beautiful hotel, pool with wonderful service and amenities. We had a good experience again at the Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
We expect to see many activities to be available for our kids, but seem it was lacking. 
Anywhere, all of your staff are friendly and ready to help whenever we need. 
My wife and kids are still happy with the 2 night stay with hard rock.

The hard rock hotel is a suitable for a family getaway especially for young children. It's safe and clean environment is great for family activities.The beach is just a short walking distance from the hotel's rear entrance.

We love the family suite with a proper bedroom for parents and a living room/kids' bedroom with their own full bathroom and bunk beds for the kids.  And did I mention an xbox with Kinect????  The kids LOVED it.  If they weren't exhausted from the fun activities around the pool, the Kinect would sure do the tricks for you parents ;).  for everyone. Besides the kids club aimed at younger kids, there is also a teen space called "Tabu" with things like the pool table. For a fee, you can leave your children with the staffs while you are enjoying being pampered at the Rock Spa.
One area I wish they can improve though is the dining choices.

Stayed for business – first time in Thailand.  Hotel was perfect – little cheaper than the Holiday Inn down the street.  I’d call it an upper scale from what I’m use to in the USA.  Breakfast was awesome – something for everyone.  I really don’t like Thai food however there are many western world options.  Room was clean, comfortable, and hotel services are top notch.  Only complaint would be the air didn't seem to change regardless of where I set, seemed almost too cold.  Word of warning this area (surrounding hotel) is R rated (not a place I’d take children).  Kind of a party / drinking atmosphere however I did feel safe everywhere I went.  All in all hotel was great and I’d stay here again.

Need to improve on food quality and taste
The location is superb.
Swimming pool is good but the hotel cannot handle lots of guest. They had no towels due to many guests using swimming pool. I find that silly.
The location of the hotel is great!!

Overall very disappointed. Friendly staff around the hotel but standards have slipped.
Food is ok but overpriced. If you eat at the pool be prepared to share your food with ants. 
Rooms are clean but very noisy, especially when special events occur on beach road.
The hotel has some good facilities for children but lots of late night visitors from local streets and bars makes it a little uncomfortable. 
Don't waste time asking staff to organize things such as take away breakfasts, as it won't happen, no matter what they promise you. 
They also accept room service orders from 6 year old, so be careful 🙏
Having recently stayed at the HRH in Bali, the standards here sadly don't match up but you can still enjoy your stay.

This hotel is located at the Pattaya Central beach and very strategically placed for tourists, most of the city attractions are at walking distance including the assembly point to the Coral Island trip, the hotel hosts a wide variety of entertainment activities within the premises and an ideal place to tourists travelling with family/kids.
Overall staff at the front desk are good but the arrival experience was disappointing due to some negligence of the front desk staff that resulted into us waiting for check-in 
 for over 3 hours, things were handled well by the the GRM once the same was escalated to her and over all it was a satisfying stay. Would love to be back.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Friendly staff, great location, well management ,clean and good service mind. All staff has service mind to take care of the guests with smile wheather it would be any situation.Very Appreciated.We will be there  again.

The loud music and talking and screaming in the microphone all day along the pool made it so unpleasant to relax this day. Waste of a holiday. It’s an entertaining hotel as a concept but there need to be a balance in some way!

The bath room still very small after decoration. swimming pool is excellect but the water not clean enough. Sauna room is great & free for room guest. The reception staff is helpful. locate in main street of city heart but need to take local taxi to Big C...shopping mall. Many many Russia & Korean guests inside the hotel.

A very pleasant experience, the pool was great, also the games at the pool very attractive, it made our stay more fun. I recommend the Jacuzzi area - a very nice view of the bay. Everything was more than we've expected! I will come back for sure!

Stayed here to celebrate our honeymoon and hotel gave us roses and some desserts for free which is nice. Rooms are clean and spacious. Pool is exceptionally good.Location is just infront of the beach and there is lots of Tuk-Tuk infront to bring u to the walking streets. 
Security needs to be improved. Noticed that security scanner in lifts are installed but it is not required for you to scan your room key to access floors which means everyone can use the lift. Security at the beach entrance doesnt ask or check if you stayed in the hotel, so everyone can go in and out easily. sometimes they werent even there.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I think the location is ok. It's near to the beach. Many small shops around. What make me the most memorable is the man who make banana pancakes in front of  the hotel. It's good and we eat whenever we go out hahha.

Excellent fun hotel. 
Part attracts both the good people and not so good people. It must be hard for the HR team to maintain their composure and smiles at times but mostly do a great job. There are a few staff with a bit of attitude. Their managers should recognise the constant pressure these staff are under and help them with practical tips, frequent rest breaks, support and understanding while maintaining the Very high HR service mandate.
Well done over a very busy time and Happy Rock & Roll New Year.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
We stayed at this hotel from 18th dec to 2 jan.  What a nice hotel. The pool is great and service from the pool bar team Jamie and top is brilliant. Nothing is too much trouble. All the staff were ever so friendly and rooms were always cleaned. 
The new year party was excellent with live music and resident entertainment team sketches. The food was amazing!!!
The only negative comment is that you pay for internet connection but unable to receive it to an acceptable level.  Nether the less, well done Hard Rock,  the most rockin' hotel in pattaya!!!!! 
Th
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Nice Hotel in a calm sade area great poolarea and close to the beach. Rom ok with all that you need o ly problem, be carefull showering or the flor will get wet. And IF you dont have a Opel relationship dont fortet to close the blinds between bathroom and sleepingarea😬
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Nice room with sea view and Pattaya Beach centre location.
Music performed in a wide pool was also good.
Next time I want to come back with my friends.
Thank you very very much for the kind Hardrock hotel staff.

If the house is built on the Rock it shall firm and strong.
Good service, nice location, clean room, except for some missing toiletries.
It is a nice welcome to Thailand where you get a mix of all cultures, yet you get the strong presence of Thailand.

Once again fantastic.  Had a great time.  Fantastic for families. Staff as friendly as our last stay some of the same staff still there.family room has heaps of room and our son loves the Lil rock room. Will stay again and again!

We were in this hotel for 10 days and we are really satisfied with the service of the hotel, its territory, food , entertainment programmes. Rooms are spacious with beautiful view. I will definitely recommend it to my friends! Thank u for good impressions.

As I have always maintained, this hotel is a wonderful place for all. The door mat clearly reads, " We Welcome All" and nothing has changed. From arrival to departure my requests were met and if there was an issue, it was taken care of with the business sense that you would expect from the Hard Rock Hotel chain.

I have stayed in many Pattaya hotels and usually the quality is very good. I have stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Las Vegas many times and love the brand so this time I thought I would try out my first Hard Rock Asia experience...
And it was AWESOME!
Firstly the service. It is impeccable. Very friendly and accommodating. Very informative and also helpful for anything local. I have stayed at a lot of hotels throughout Asia and it has become an expectation of mine that some of the service will be average. Not here.
The service here is awesome. This hotel reminded me why I love the brand so much.
BIG WIN!
Secondly, the hotel itself.
Amazing! Great foyer - always love the easy listening Rock music throughout - just makes so relaxed! Great room... not too big but really cool design with incredible ocean view and I would award them 5/5 for cleanliness! 
Very appreciative of the cleanliness, and security.
Amazing spa facility and awesome gym with a mini boxing studio and boxing ring included. The pool space is huge and aweome. In pool bar YES, in pool basketball hoop YES, awesome cabanas for rent YES, great poolside food and drinks service OF COURSE!
The hotel has a great lounge for evening drinks, it even has a beachside party deck with DJ's in the evening and on Saturdays they have the famous Hard Rock foam party!
Cannot fault this hotel for whats on offer!
Thirdly, the food and beverage.
WOW! best food I had in Pattaya was actually at the Hard Rock Pool Side outdoor Restaurant! Insalata Caprese and the Pepper Seared Tuna are to die for!
Everything about my stay was fantastic.
Highly recommended.
And I say this after staying at some other solid brand hotels too. Pullman Pattaya was nice but far away from the action, Avani Hotel is also lovely (formerly the Marriot) and I love this hotel also but for fun, sun, drinks and food - Hard Rock Wins! Plus the Hard Rock is slightly cheaper! Win, WIN, WIN!
LOVE IT. Definitely the choice if you want to party like a Rockstar, but also if you want a place for the family and kids to have fun.
Thanks for a great stay!

While welcoming was rather pale compared to my previous visit as there were no refreshments served nor any welcoming gestures. As we travelled long distance and had overwhelming long and tiring day^^.

Just very friendly and professional service throughout the hotel, security opening the elevator as we approached, DJ I think remembered us on second visit to the Cafe a friendly hi every time we walked by the front desk etc. Lots of little things that make you feel like a rock star
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Went back and visited this Hotel in December 2018 with family and friends. Stayed for 4 nights .. and wish could stay longer.. :) As usual, fantastic hospitality delivery by their staffs and lively atmosphere by the large-pool. Foods were awesome and centrally located in Pattaya. Highly recommended!

I stay at the hard rock every year - for the past 4 years.
I keep coming back as the staff , location and the hotel make it very relaxed.
Spent a lot of time around the pool - always something going on
-
Only disappointment was I couldn't have a pool view ( with balcony ) which I have had every other year - appreciate I did book a little later than normal and maybe not available 
-
Stayed 13 night so sometimes nice to know your loyalty is appreciated 
-
Really nice place to Stay

Went there for X'mas again. We keep coming back as it is always nice to go to a place where we feel welcome. Staff is always very nice and remembers us from previous stays. They also do very entertaining activities for kids, but now, most of the activities are on the weekend. It is quieter during the week. There's also less guests during the week.
Swimming pool was renovated and it is quite nice but on the basketball side I liked it more before. It look like a beach.
Rooms are nice and spacious but it's starting to get worn out and carpet is not that clean. Maybe it's time to start thinking about renovating it. Maybe not using carpet.
We were in a sea view room, two connecting rooms, and I love to stay at the end of the day, enjoying the sunset and reading.
Overall, we enjoyed our stay and will come back for sure!

Thank you. Thanks to you, I could have a great trip! Your service was good and cleainess and location was very good. However, I think massage and nail care service is expensive. If you lower the price, many people will use the service. Thank you.

Stuff was very friendly and Hotelarea good because you can go easy 2nd road and beachroad. About price per night you can think about because 120€ is not worth, sorry.... 70/80 is better 😉😉 Rock'n Roll forever 🤘🏽🤘🏽🤘🏽
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Good hotel 👍. Very good breakfast and good service overall. Booked a room with king size bed but ended up with 2 queen size bed. That was disappointing. The swimmingpool was very crowded. Clean and nice rooms.

A very impressive welcome by all the staff from the door man onward.
Check in was seamless.
When I went to my room,  that's when things went downhill.
I opened the door to see shoe marks still on the black tiles floor.
I informed a member of staff on the floor who quickly mopped the floor clean.
I went to inspect the bed linen and there were stains on the bottom sheet.
This is where I went back to reception and asked for a new room.
From this point on everything went great, the next room was fine.
All in all a good stay but finding a dirty room was NOT expected and should not have been like that , it was far below the HR standard I expected

Nothing to say every thing was perfect,room,restaurant,
swimming pool the place to be in pattaya in front of the sea (but not the best one).
The hard rock hotel very beautiful hotel where you feel good.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Great to spend this time with my friends for the forth time in a row over the last January. As always, we stay at the Hard Rock because of its facilities, service and location. Staff are always ready to help with any request

From the moment our taxi dropped us off the service was impeccable. All the staff are extremely friendly and helpful.
Although we had a view of the part of roof of the hotel our room was very nice. It was clean, spacious and contemporary. The beds were really comfortable.
The hotel is in a perfect location just by the beach and the pool area is really nice.
We had to leave for the airport early in the morning therefore the hotel arranged a breakfast box each. This is a lovely idea and all the food inside was fresh and yummy. 
It's nice that this hotel considers the tiny details...I definitely recommend the Hard Rock Hotel when staying in Pattaya.

This is my second stay at Hard Rock hotel in Pattaya and it´s really my favorite place to stay. Located in the middle of Pattaya city with only a short walk to the new shopping mall Central Festival. This resort lives their own life in this crowded city and offer a secluded place to relax and have fun. Around the pool is where everything happens and I must say that I admire the pool staff that try hard to activate everybody with different activities. Our six year old daughter really loves this place and especially the foam party. Friendly staff, generous benefits in Kings Lounge (the two top floors with a private lounge) and new renovated rooms with very soft beds (that´s not so common in Thailand). This is just the place to stay in Pattaya.

We stayed 3 nights in Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya and which was very beautiful. They have awesome rooms with very nice interior and very spacious rooms. The location of hotel is very prompt, the one side of it faces towards the beach and the other towards the city. 
The pool was just fabulous and very big, they organise pool events for kids which was very fun to watch and for adults they organise basket ball and pool volleyball which was fun playing.  We also used the Steam bath and sauna which was very nice.
The best attraction of staying in the hotel was the foam party which for which they charge 200Baht. It was the best party. The staff was very friendly in arranging a reasonable/economical transport for transfers and tours. 
Walking street is 10mins away from hotel by tuk tuk which charges 10 bahts only or if you wanna take the view of beautiful beach in night while coming have a walk with your partner which was fun. 
However everything was positive in hotel but one thing which was disappointing which was breakfast. I understand it is an American based hotel however we being pure vegetarian it was very difficult to find anything to eat in breakfast except fruits. I feel I should have not paid for breakfast while booking the room. Being in pattaya city I understand no much of food places for vegetarians. Over and above the hotel staff saw our travel cooker and asked us not to use which was very disappointing. We have been across various hotels in Asia but till date none of the hotels denied us to use. The housekeeping dept called us and said not to use and they will help us in cooking anything but that was not possible and we need to go south pattaya restaurant Saras to have food. I want to know the reason for restricting to use the mini cooker which doesn't consumes much of their electricity. 
One last thing our welcome was good however the farewell was very disappointing. No smiles or any kind of lines of come back again or hope you enjoyed the stay which any typical hotel does. Hard rock should improve on this. 
I would definitely come back provided few dishes being add in vegetarian.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Rooms are small and worn-out.  But staff are friendly and the pool is good!  Breakfast is not bad but of course have room to improve.  It would be good if the hotel can provide some special offer on spa, food and drinks.

It was pleasant experience to stay again with you 
Staff was cool and friendly and ready to cooperate during check-in or check-out, during breakfast 
Hotel is situated on the beach road which makes trip more easy and increase the pleasure

good swimming pool.good breakfast.this is a excellent experience.we stayed the hotel for two days,we went to swim twice,we played the water basketball very happy.but i didn't found how to play the rock music in the room.may be better if you can provide some classic rock music to welcome guests
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I was with my friends here in Pattaya in August 2016 and stayed at Hard Rock Hotel, Pattaya. 
We were expecting a crazy time while in Pattaya and it turned out crazier than we expected. 
The rooms were really amazing. The decors were great. The view from our rooms were even more amazing overlooking the Gulf of Thailand, the beach road in front of us, the hard rock cafe's swimming pool in front of us. It was as stunning as it could get. 
The staff were very courteous. The breakfast(the only food we had in the hotel) was great. Overall the service was really up to the mark.
Hard Rock Cafe has a saturday night party. It was the craziest party I ever attended. There was foam party, Pool party, played basketball in the pool, the music was amazing. In the end, they played a Punjabi Bhangra Song which was unexpected as totally nailed the party.
Kudos.

Everything ok but some rooms a little small but other than that all good will stay again. Staff re very helpful, pool excellent, location great for everything, Hard Rock Cafe is a little expensive on some of its food.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
They put me on the second floor and they were renovating the 3rd floor. Forget a snooze. 
I tried to book a decent rate directly with the hotel and there was no way. Book on line never book in Thailand walking in a hotel. They even lie to you and say they can't change the rate (which they did, but still paid too much). 
Internet is expensive. Breakfast is average. The pastries were amazing to be honest. Coffee was terrible and you had to flag the servers down to give you another half cup. You can never get frustrated with Thais as they are so nice. Pancakes and waffles were cold. 
My room was cool. Shower was nice, big and had power. View was 0, a field. 
Hotel is dated and it's time for a renovation and honestly, stop selling rooms next to construction. If you do, please tell us during booking or it's fraud as far as I'm concerned.

The best part of my stay at the Pattaya Hard Rock Hotel was the included breakfast buffet... such a wonderful selection and such delicious choices!  This would be the primary factor in choosing this hotel again, although I didn't care so much for the plastic edgy feel in the relatively small rooms.  The staff does a good job of keeping out people who should not be roaming around the hotel, as there is security at the front, back and elevator areas at all time.  The Kings Club has a nice offering at cocktail hour in the evening.  I had a nice stay but personally prefer a bit less hip hotel.  Perfect for the younger hip crowd and those who would enjoy a gorgeous pool area!

Location wise Perfect on the beach and near to walking street and malls 
Rooms are small compared to other hotels
Swimming pool is great kids had a lovely time
Hard Rock Cafe is excellent with nice view

Balcony area of room stinks a lot due to kitchen exhaust. Lot of noise of exhaust fan of kitchen. Beach facing rooma might be good, i got city facting on corner side it was looking right right above kitchen exhaust area.

I would like to share once again that Eve at the reception was incredibly helpful and always there when we needed her, she did her best to try to make our vacation the greatest! she has a very professional attitude and tries her best to give us what we want with a smile on her face!

You will feel the difference the moment you step into the premise driveway. Friendly staff who will remember your name, counter staff who will explain clearly the process and the cafe staff who will give you their best service and recommendations.

The front dest receptionist had shown the best quality of service with his politeness and helpfulness. We were so impressed and happy with your staff working attitude. However the toilet seat in our room was shaky and it is time to change a new one. There was also an incident when my wife was hit on the head by a ball thrown by your staff at the swimming pool. But i believe it was not intentional as it was quite dark during that time. Fortunately the impact of the throw was not very strong on my wife’s face.

Good location and nice pool for the kids. The staff are well-train, especially when looking after the customer who bring alcohol to drink from outside. They are like a shark and really watch out for your drink. However, we requested for early-check in but still have to wait for almost 2 hours. The good part is that there are guitars that you can rent during the stay. We really like this service and will return again soon.

our company stayed at this hotel only for one night and we received a great service from hotel staffs which is nice and professional. The hotel location is nice and, near the beach. The view is very stunning. Each room is very hygiene especially the bathroom. We love the food, they are delicious. We are all have enjoyed the party at the drum room. We thank you from the bottom of our heart for creating the great event, we are really appreciated it.

Reservation arrangement was have some uncompoterble. 
At the first day, missed arragement room type.
I had reserved room type for a king double bed, but arranged to two double bed room.
One day after, It was changed, but no return payment.

We went to Hard Rock from 20 – 25/01/2012.
This was my fourth time there and I know I will be back.
My kids love it, it is quite near to reach. We flight three hours to Bangkok, then we take a taxi to Pattaya and in less than two hours we are at Hard Rock. Taxi is THB1,500.00 but can take the bus, which is less expensive.
This was the first time after the renovation works they’ve made.
The first thing I’ve noticed is the new entry, and also the metallic decoration of the wall with guitars and animals. I just love it!
We stayed in room 726, a Deluxe Seaview and the balcony has been removed to make the room bigger. The table near the bathroom wall and by the side of the bed has been removed as well and it helps to make the room bigger also. And they put a table with 2 chairs in that area.
Under the flat screen TV the table has been extended and has a drawer. There is also a big and very convenient drawer under the place to put the luggage.
In the toilet, the bathtub has been removed and there is only a shower. It is nice, less dangerous and more spacious, but the water comes out to the bathroom floor when we shower. I like the big window/wall from the bathroom to the room that gives plenty of natural light to the bathroom if the blinders are open.
The kids club (Lil’Rock) I think is the same as before but know they also have a teens club (Tabu) that looked quite nice with things to entertain the teens like Wii, table tennis, a theater where they can make music, etc.
The Starz restaurant is different as well; all open and looks more spacious. Breakfast has some different items every day.
Dinner at Saturday night is very good and worth the price you pay. And kids bellow 12 years eat for free.
Now, there’s also a Pizzeria. We didn’t eat there, mainly because the choice of pasta is not much and they don’t have all kids’ favorite pasta: spaghetti Bolognese. So here’s a suggestion to improve.
The chairs by the pool were always occupied and I don’t know if there is less chairs or the hotel was busier this time.
I felt that there were less activities promoted by the rock agents than before, but, as always, the rock agents know how to entertain the kids and make the activities more fun. My son arrives at Hard Rock and loves to find the rock agents that always tell him “Welcome home!”
And we will go back!

I am writing this from the hotel. I checked in yesterday. My room booking was  for a king size bed since I have a 5 yr old kid but on arrival we were given room with 2 single beds. On insistence, we were told to change the room tomorrow since they don't have any room available now with king size bed. Next day we again packed our luggage to shift to another room. After checking in to another room in the evening, we saw large cockroaches in the room about 3-4. On calling housekeeping, they asked us to shift to another room. Now we have been given another room much smaller than the first one. Horrible experience after paying so much. Three more days to go, don't know what's coming next. Even the corridors are smelly. They had given us rooms on the smoking floor despite our request for non smoking floor. I am surprised that with such a brand, how can they be so hopeless!!!!!!
