Hard Rock! You guys really rock! By the way, I love the way your wake up call starts off "Good morning sir, have a rocking day", followed by a rock song!
It is also really nice to listen to rock music while having breakfast. The food was really good, by the way.
Not to mention, the band who played at the Hard Rock Cafe on Friday night (2nd Feb), was really amazing.
Can't wait to stay at another Hard Rock property sometime soon.

Fantastic hotel wunderful stuff great food everything is perfect i just find My New home recomend this hotel to everyone we was 8 person on this trip and we was spending 6 days at this hotel next time we stay for 2 weeks

This was our second visit to the Hard rock Pattaya. We are a family of 4. Two adults and two children. This time when we arrived the little rock staff remembered our kids from our last stay, and were jumping up and down to see them. This hotel has fantastic facilities for children the kids club is excellent. They even care for our 4 year old who has special needs. The rooms are looking rather rundown but renovations had just begun. Our stay this time should have been 7 days, this time our 4 year old got very sick and was in hospital for 7 days. All the staff were fantastic in organizing doctors, recommending the right hospital, and extending our stay for over a week, day by day. We will be back again for our third visit. Keep rocking HRP.

The best hotel we've been so far in Thailand. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel location is considerably strategic in the heart of lively Pattaya. We even shopped a lot at the Rock Shop.. Lol. Superb food. Generous portion. We had sooo much fun. Keep it coming.

The stuff is great in that place, the pool and sauna facilities are also very good and the beach is just over the street. There is music all around, even that there is no music starting in that moment that you are entering the room (little minus).

Whist the facilities at the hotel are OK and there appears to be entertainment laid on for Children, the rooms are very basic and small and certainly not worth the money.Food was expensive at all outlets and on Christmas night it was very limited, very disappointed that you could not get a piza after 5.30 at night.

We have had a great night year end party on December 2017. It was all started from zero until perfect night. Hard Rock provided variety of food & beverage selection, room decoration, light and sound. The most impressive issue is their staffs. Hard Rock staffs did a very well job. They always support any requirements from us. Even if it is sometimes difficult to handle us (around 200 people), but they never give up and strive to serve excellent service. Hard Rock is located in Pattaya downtown which is not chaotic as we first thought. It is located in a perfect area. The Hall of fame where the party was held was in good condition and tidy. Space is enough for 200 people. Buffet line was always filled throughout the night as well as the beverage. We would like to say special thanks to Khun Watcharapon, Toon, and Khun Patchara, Bew, who are our key contact persons and always figure things out for us. Finally, Hard Rock could be the very first choice if you would like to have a wonderful party.

I have stayed at the Hard Rock 6 times now!You cant fault the staff or rooms. Everyone is friendly and bends over backwards to help you.Has a great massive pool and location is the best.breakfast is good too.Even better if travelling with your family.

The first time i came with company for a couple year ago and i decided to come back for my family trip because the location and the hotel was good. The swimming pool is very big and it has great pool for kids also.

We had 2 different suites over Xmas and it was amazing holiday, The staff is very friendly and super cool whit the kids around the pool and of course much more. 
We always choose this hotel in Pattaya !!!
Peter Sweden

The most satisfied with the hotel is the large swimming pool, changing rooms and other facilities are very humane. hotel facilities, decoration are very new, rock theme, very clean and fresh, the service staff are both young and kind

The hotel is very close to the beach and famouse tour spots where I can get a taxi and the seongtaewoo. Also the suwimming pool was super great for family to relax till night. It was thankful that eeryone who work for the hotel was nice and make me comfortable.

I've been to the Hard Rock in Pattaya many times and have never been disappointed. Great staff with a rocking eager-to-please attitude, great rooms, great food, and the best swimming pool ever.  The Hard Rock cafe is a great place to eat and they deliver pizzas to the rooms for kids. Get a cabana for less than $20 a day and spend all day by the pool.  Lots of games and fun for the kids, close to nightlife for the adults.  Worth paying extra for the King's Club with special check-in and breakfast on the 10th floor.  Go for the Composer Suite if you want to treat yourself.

Was there from the 3rdFeb till 7thFeb. My partner and i was sooo happy and satisfied with the stay from day 1 right up till day 5!
Staff at Hard Rock is super friendly and make our stay feel so relax. Always with a smile on their face, warmth greeting. The Swimming pool is big and nice. Can never get bored with the activities arranged for guest. 
Breakfast comes with a wide varieties. Cosy and beautiful atmosphere. Rooms is gorgeous. The bed and pillows are soo comfortable. Houskeeping did a great job in making the room nice and clean. 
Compliments to staff Simon and two thumbs up to Kevin both from Concierge team for being efficient and helping us with the arrangments visiting around pattaya. Kevin gave alot of advices, trememdously good places of attractions which is not to miss out. We are really am happy with the service given by Kevin! And not forgetting Simon, always going the extra mile to make our stay in Pattaya a memorable one!
We are so satisfied with the Hotel. Like they say You can check out anytime but you can never leave! A definite come back to Hard Rock Pattaya just for the Hotel!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We came as a family 3 adults, first of all they missed our reservation so we had to wait almost an hour until they found it and more then an hour until the room be ready (at 4pm!!). Then they just add another bad in 2 people room so we don’t have even place to open our suitcases! All they had to say is sorry. So disappointed from hard rock!!! Feeling like kid’s sleepover.

Should improve the water pipe. That day I stay, noisy pipes at night. I like the service of the staff in the 9th floor. Good service people smile all the time. And what I'm most impressed with is the lovely chocolate cake for my birthday.

It was great to have on-board. The ambiance and the atmosphere was amazing. As well as the hotel staff are friendly and helpful, they treat you like a rock star. There you can get many facilities like sauna and steam for free and you can avail the rock spa facilitie also . They have a great swimming pool and children’s play area with some water slides . Their foam party on Saturday is must attain , it is one of its kind .

Nice location and good view. Loved the activities they had on Saturday in the pool area, the whole day until the foam party. Yea they have a foam party every Saturday night which is really awesome and had made my day!

I prepaid for their New Years Eve package for me and my girlfriend. The special event was outdoors with tables spaced far apart due to Covid.    When we arrived to the event with our prepaid tickets they denied access because we only had a picture of my girlfriends proof of vaccination not an original.  When I purchased the tickets in person they did not mention any of entry requirements.    What we suspected and later found out to be True as admitted by one of their staff members is they oversold this event and were looking for technicalities to deny some of their guests entry.    They had us stand outside the event for nearly 30 minutes while 5 of the staff tried to figure out how to give me a refund.  Once they gave me a receipt for refund we were able to enter their hotel
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
When I spoke with my friends in Pattaya I said we must book somewhere for Chinese New Year!  They suggest the Hard Rock , I was surprised but said “ sure, why not”. 
So we (the 3 of us) headed for the Hard Rock for dinner
We arrived early as it was a buffet! We were not let down, all sorts of food were available in an environment befitting the “year of the Rat” 
We had an assortment of foods. All with a Chinese twist, the various seafoods were delightful and the meats of the grill were outstanding!! 
We finished with specially prepared (to your own request) ice cream and fresh fruits
All washed down with a wonderful bottle of wine!
We know we will be back, the whole team at the Hard Rock could not do enough to make our night enjoyable!
Thanks all!

Everything  was wonferful .  The Staff was very friendly and accomodating in all functional areas.  Awesome pool.  The only problem was that I could not stay longer.
I would recommend that you allow this writing to be shorter

Looking  around  pattaya is good location.  Swimming  pool  is big  and  they  prepare  many  plan  to  join  us.  However  i  felt that  water  is  not  clean. When  i  arrived, swimming  pool  water was  looking  pure .  But  day  after, i  felt the  water  wasn't  change. I want  to  more  clean  water.
Room  was very  cold  though i  turn off  AC.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I'd have to say one of the best hotel/resort I have stayed at . Tremendous Pool , all types of activities for all ages during the day . Pool Party's at night on certain days .The service was excellent . Opposite of the beach . 10 second walk . Food was delicious . If you can afford and fine the right rate at this place . It's a must try at least once .

Beautiful Hotel!!!!!  Breakfast at the restaurant was excellent... service team during were very friendly and professional... They had an amazing games at the swimming pool area. We really enjoyed our stay....
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Just came back from a 5 night stay at the HRH Pattaya.Living and working in Bangkok I visited the hotel before with my two daughters 8 and 9 years old and had good experience When we arrived at the hotel we were welcomed by the hard rock staff and the check in was correctly and fast done by the foreign (farang) lady from the reception. She was firendly and helpfull. I told her it was my daugthers 8th Birthday tomorrow and she said their will be a small surprise for her at breakfast. So when we came to breakfast the next day the staff brought her a small Birthday cake and they all were loudly singing for her. My daughter loved it and I really appreciate the kindness from the hotel for this. The days in the hotel we spend the most at the big pool. There are lots of activities for the kids wich they enjoyed al lot. I personally think that the pool and the pool staff are the main attraction for the hotel. Pool guys were very friendly and helpfull for the kids.They always had time to have a chat or play with the kids while on the otherside they always put safety first. My special thanks goes to Tiger and Quito. These guys are simply amazing. Nothing was to much for them to make the kids and other customers feel good and had a good time. My two daughters Anya and Sabina loved them. If the management is reading this I should say give these guys a raise, they deserve it!! Breakfast was good and many choice. Even on crowdy times food was refilled quickly. Restaurant staff also very friendly and helpfull. My only complain is about housekeeping. There is a safe in the room where I put my belongings and cash, but I always keep some small change in coins on the table in the room. Before housekeeping came I had a lot of coins spread over the table and when they finished clean the room all coins were gone. I informed the reception about it and the guy looked annoyed that I complained. So he said to me that probably the housekeeping thought it was a tip!!! After 18 years living in Thailand and visited many hotels this is the first time that this happened to me. He told me to check on this, but I never heard anything. Furthermore the next day I left the room at 09;30 and came back 13:30 the room was still not cleaned allthough I had the make up room sign outside.... An other day when I was relaxing with my kids after breakfast in the room with my kids housekeeping was nocking on my door every 5 minutes to clean the room and they looked angry that I was still in the room. As I speak and understand Thai fluently and also my daughters we heard how they were speaking in very rude and bad language about us. So all together It was a great stay at the HRH and we really enjoyed our stay and my daughters cant wait to go back, but they should do something about the housekeeping...

Whenever i am in a hard rock area it's a must visit plaxe, i choose the buffer tonight very popular guess most be hotel guests but sure a lot people dining
Sushi bar to sea food salad lots heated trays food spoilt for choice lady comes round bbq meats very good fruit and dessert

Everything in this hotel is very nice .
Located very near to famous walking street and just in front of beach.
Lovely staff , helping & smiling always . I got a gr8 chance to attend d foam party which this hotel organise on every saturdays, it was awesome .
Breakfast was also nice .
The only negative was the room had lesser lights & it had no mirror in room to dress up .
Rest everything was excellent in this hotel.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
This hotel, in a convenient location of the tourist/resort city of Pattaya, Thailand, was quite pleasant. The pool facilities was quite extensive- big pool, beach chairs and a nice atmosphere, enclosed from the outside. The rooms were ok- high ceiling and clean, but not much of a luxury class. The shower was awkward in that you had to climb almost a meter ledge to get into it. 
Lobby was tastefully decorated with typical Hard Rock paraphenelia, definitely more interesting than most other hotel lobbies!
All-you-can-eat breakfasts were great- huge variety (got to try the fresh made noodles!)
Overall a good experience.

the hotel is really good and the staff is very nice and helpful, they provide excellent services. they let us check in and enter the room when we arrived the hotel in the morning. Besides, we love the swimming pool very much, they have different activities every day. the activities are very interesting. however, the design of the toilet room is not really good, there is a step when you go inside the toilet. my feet was hurt by kicking the step.

Sea view at central location, friendly services and 10 mins walk to Pattaya's largest shopping centre. The focus of this hotel is its swimming pool that offers both children & adults' foam bubble party, friendly pool-basketball matches, large plastic 'human-size air-filled ball activity and children rock fun-climb. Will come back again.

This is Luxury beach Resort. Location is excellent just walking distance from beach. Huge pool and decent gym. Staff service is very good. Room sizes are good for couple with kid. I suggest to take room with lounge which has beautiful view. 9 th floor is good to stay

The sound isolation of the room is bad, we always hear the noise from the guest passing by the room. Please consider to have the beach service for the guest. The beach outside gave me the bad experience.

Just comfortble Bed and good condition room
I was get impresive the arrange call taxi service
if i will go to pattaya then i will again get your hotel. 
even there restruren is really good food and service.

The team of the RockSpa is absolutely amazing. The room was big an very comfortable. I had my own balcony. The breakfast was very delicious and a great choice of food! The team around the pool area was awesome too!

Pattaya is perhaps  not the most charmig place to visit with your family,  but as we only had a week we wanted to make the most of it and choose Hard Rock Hotel bacuase of the fantastic pool! We had a great time with lots of activities and the kids loved it. :-) The Activity Team (Sax and some more guys) even got the parents on the move!

hi friends Hard Rock Pattaya is the most happening place in pattaya whatever you are alone, with friends or with family. the best place in pattaya for good memories. the most happening thing is there is "Foam Party & Water Sports" good rooms with luxury room amenities with helping & friendly staff hotel. Near to beach.

The location of the hotel is the best part as it is near to the happenning walking street and i right on the beach road; the room gave an amazing sea view. The room was decent enough (not that great) however the best part was the pool area. The hotel is higjhly modern and lively.
One of the major negative point was that is did not have a free wifi.

I stayed there now for the 3rd time, booked Rock Royalty Room and it was again fantastic.
Housekeeping keeps the Place neat and tidy.
only down point are the always occupied Elevators.
All Day Dining is just fine, caters mostly for the Chinese Groups.
Hard Rock Cafe serves very good Nachos and Ribs!
I like the Hotel Location.
Hotel is safe and secure.

all staff are friendly and helpful
There are many activities for us ind. kids amd big area for kid zone to swim (except we have to pay 100bht /hr for the kid room)
Breakfast are nice and variety of foods, fresh bakery bake at the restaurant that we love
This year in 2017 we went there twice and every time are nice

swimming pool is excellent!!
location is good(near the beach)
dinnings are good
i hope that every staff related the hotel explain about discount for hotel guests
i didn't know that, so i couldn't receive benefits of discount

We were here in october 2015. The staff is lovely. The breakfast amazing. The rooms are impressive. The pool very clean. Sauna and steam area is also very clean, hygienic and aesthetically very beautiful. Great breakfast too! Keep it up Hard rock hotel...u rock!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Beware, if the hotel causing damage to electrical items. Such as iPhone, they will go against own policy to try and get out of Not paying for it. Took picture of policy, will be disputing the entire bill with credit card company since they can't do the right thing and pay iPhine repair cost.

I stayed two nights with family and friends and enjoyed so much! My daughter felt it so cool to borrow a Fender guitar free of charge to play at night. All of us were fun filled with the foam party and playing basketball at the swimming pool. The location was good to walk along Beach Road or jump on Songthaew at 10 Bahts. My special thanks to Ms Megan. She was so kind to give her advice about night markets. Her recommendation to go to Thep Prasit night market added much fun for us. She was so helpful to bargain a taxi for us and reminded us how to get back. On the next day, when I asked her about Cliff restaurants, she recommended the Sky Gallery which was closer in distance. Her hospitality was really appreciated. However, one setback was the BBQ Buffet. The food quality and variety were beyond standard. The meat was too dry and the sushi was wet by water dripping from the cold cabinet on top. Anyway, despite the buffet, the stay was value for money overall.

Great location. Super wifi. Good food. Breakfast choice good increase. 
Amazing staff at the swimming pool area. Great games to place. 
Reception staff could be more friendlier. 
Singers at the bar were amazing.

I booked one SINGLE ROOM with THAI BOXING online. I also got an additional 2 bed room at check in. When we got to our rooms the double was fine but I was given a double bed room which I hate and no Thai boxing package with it. I went back to the desk to correct the problem and go figure....I would have had to wait for half my stay just to get up to the desk. Maybe they should put a line just for corrections and not full check in/out. I told the ladies I would return after visiting the cafe.I did...the line got longer! The ladies went to lay down in their room. I didn't want to disturb mine so went to sit at the pool for an hour. Went back to the desk....I gave up!  I was not happy! 
I am a rewards member also and this hotel is nonparticipating except for room stays. I have only been credited with one room stay when two were purchased. I asked about it upon waiting at checkout, I was assured the issue would be resolved. No it has not been taken care of as of this day. I am going to have to spend more time dealing with something that should be done upon checkin with the card I present to them. Who got my credit? Overall I should be happy but it seems the little irritating issues over ride all the good times. I get tired of being blown off and told it will be taken care of. I asked for it to be done in front of me....it wasnt and I fully believe it was done on purpose to American Visitor. I will not return.

Hard Rock is mainly vacation hotel and not so much business hotel. Overall the noise level inside and outside the Hotel is very high. Also during the night.
Majority of guests are at Hard Rock to spend their holidays.
The setting of guest is very high on Chinese, Indian/Pakastainian and also Russian.
The pool have been renovated here in 2016 but unfortunately this have not been very succesful. The number of chairs around the pool have been reduced and the access to the pool it self have been limited.

I stay for business meeting in the hotel. The meeting place is excellent for bigger groups. The hotel is clean and good organized only check out takes some time and also check in was not the fastest due to limited front office workers

I love the Hard Rock hotel. The location and facilities and staff are excellent. 
But when we checked inn, we were sent to a room which wasn't made up. This wasn't a great first impression for my dad who was staying here with me for the first time. 
I also thought that the tour desk wasn't very helpful and seem to be very commission orientated rather than customer satisfaction. For example, they offer two priced options to the airport but only offer the most expensive option until you decide it's too expensive and walk away. They were also not very good at arranging trips such as tickets to the Tiffany show where I wanted center VIP seats and was willing to go at anytime during my two week stay but they didn't seem very efficient in checking availability. They were just trying to get me any seat available and not trying to get what I wanted. They were also trying to force private trips to places rather than the offering group options which are cheaper. I know they are a deprecate company based at the hotel but you put yue staff in the Hard Rock uniform so I'd expect the same level of service. 
Other than this, I loved my stay there. If it was slightly cheaper, I'd stay there more often.

Service is in high quality for me. Room may small and breakfast is standard but it enough for me to come again. Security is also in high quality. Swimming pool is good and clean. Lot of activities to join.

As befits a high level of Hard Rock
Tastefully appointed rooms. The hotel is very nice and clean.
Room service and general service at a very high level.
Amazing pool and nice activities for children. Performances at the bar
And pleasant shops.
Varied breakfast and a general atmosphere of a luxury hotel.
you can play guitar for free in the rooms
in the canter of everything near the beach side
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Very clean room and very friendly staffs. The seventh floor was quiet with partial view of the ocean. The breakfast comes with the room costs and very variety menus. We will stay again when we return to Pattaya next year.

Really good hotel with very curtious and helpful staff.  We were in a sea view room, which was quite spacious and good bathroom with lovely rain shower.  Breakfast was good but not the best I've had.  We will most certainly stay again.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: A pleasant stay costing us B7020 nightly however there was no mention of poolside additional cost when picking up towels poolside of an additional B400 each guest and friends .... 3 adults   ( 2 paying guests ) cost us B1200 ... We only used pool once as this was rediculous after paying B7020 room charge daily... management need to mention this in their TOC when paying and bookingAsking other guest at poolside we found some paid some didnt .. ( hit and miss ) ....Luckily we receive a 10% discount world wide on HARD ROCK membership as this 1x Poolside attendance was deducted by the 10% discount

I had stayed here last year and now i stayed again here..cause i love this hotel Love the modern room,nice swimming pool and also its location..very near the beach and the central world mall..
Great staffs..the receptionists,concierges...

The shower is smelling very bad,bat (ie drain in floor). This makes me insane when they do it to the shower. i’ll turn it on to let it warm up and they next thing i know the water is ankle-deep. please get to the bottom of this because if i understand it at least i will be less annoyed

room was very small , Breakfast not international level 
And was repeated every day , friendly staff ,Easy access to town And a large pool but You tube for an hour for a 300 bat Received But I think it would be free or low cost 
The minimum service for passengers who have paid a lot of money
By the way The hotel was nice and lovely
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
We stayed from 10 feb ~ 13 feb. my wife birthday on 12 Feb, I'm disappointed there were no surprise came ,like a cake or drink? 
And the pool view rooms are all occupy for all Navy ? I'm wondering why we never get a room with good view, even friends of mind tried to book with pool view, not to see the view from the corner of the room edge.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
We stayed here for one week and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel.  The pool area complete with a man made beach was spectacular.  It was set up in tiers and offered a great view of the pool as well as the ocean across the street.
The rooms were pretty small, the bathroom teeny tiny but adequate after all we were in Thailand so we didn't spend much time in the room!
We could walk anyplace we needed to go but opted to take the rather inexpensive taxis to the main walking street as it was a bit out of walking range but the communal taxis or buses or whatever you call then always proved to be an interesting experience!
We would return to this hotel.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I had traveled quite a lot of places and stayed many hotels but Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya was the one of the best place to enjoy my holiday. I was informed at check-in regarding the renovation and noises but it didn't really affected me much. Food was great. Especially on Saturday nite's BBQ was excellent! And there were so many activities going on around the pool during day times and kind of cabaret show on Saturday nite was wonderful. Even I travelled alone but I never felt lonely as all the things happening and things to do around made me feel all the time occupied.

We stayed at this hotel for a few nights, after spending a great few days in Bangkok. I must say that I liked this place… but there were a few points that does not allow me to give this a full 5 star rating… hence the 4 point rating of my review.  So, here it is:  POSITIVE POINTS: + As usual, the Hard Rock franchise give you the feel of being among the famous… and in Pattaya it does not disappoint.  + Staff (with the exception of a couple of people) are extremely friendly, helpful and simply very pleasant. + The hotel is clean in every area… so a huge thumbs up to the staff taking care of this. + Room with a view over the sea is fantastic... NICE sunset from the 8th Floor. + Pool area is pleasant, safe and well taken care of. Nice array of activity… despite not having so many

I've been this hotel around one year before. At that time I checked in with Korean staff she was very nice to help us. So I spent great time with my husband and we decided to come back to stay again. I went here just few days weeks ago WITH MY VERY LITTLE BABY ONLY BORN IN 80DAYS. It was extremely disappointed. When I checked in the staff keep smiling say kindly BUT SHE DID NOT LISTEN ME AT ALL. I feel she never listens to me what I request. I only need bathtub but she gave me room without bathtub. When I went down to change the room she said they only have a bathtub in suits room. I understand and we pay more and upgrade to suits. And even she escorted to the room with my baby in baby car. She knows I have a baby. BUT SHE GAVE ME SMOKING ROOM. How come she can give us smoking room. When I checked in I already tell her I need non smoking. I didn't know smoking room when I just got that room but after I can smell from hallway and come to my room then I feel weird and I realized when I checked elevator there is smoking sign in 10 floor. Just before I checked out. Actually I believe her because we pay extra for the suits. Now I regret so much Better not believe her. And I also requested baby-cot since I checked in she said she will inform to bring us soon but I wait until 5pm still didn't come call them. They said will send soon. Around 10pm still didn't come WE REQUEST 3TIME THAN THEY BRING US. I never imagined 4star hotel do like this. And about wifi also since we checked in she never explain us how can use or where is wifi paper. I have to call again and ask them. I only stayed one night but made us everything annoying. When I checked out she help us and smiling again. It made us more angry. This time seems like she tried to ignore us with smile.  Her name is ANN. She told me she is manager. I still don't understand how came manager do service like this. I seriously don't want to go hardrock hotel again because of her. No More recommend anyone.

So much fun for the kids and royalty floor made us feel welcomed and we will be back.its not the first time we are staying in a hard rock hotel...but this hotel rocks.. breakfast was the highlight of the hotel as wel

this place really is nice.....couldnt get over how nice the pool area and food service is here. Well worth the money. Also getting to and from the hotel is a breeze with the sonkoaws available all day and night. Will stay again on next trip.

My holiday was very nice and comfortable in this incredible hotel!
All Stuff was super friendly, hazzle-free check-in & check-out, rooms very clean and in a good condition, breakfast was large with lots of variants and also food in restaurants was delicious. Pool area is fantastic and sea is only 50meters away! Location is great to easily move around the city. Everything in this hotel is perfect for amazing holiday, highly recommended! Thank you all Hard Rock Stuff (especially pool-bar stuff ;) ) , see you next time for sure! 
Br, Antti

The room is clean and the environment is beautiful. Also the guys are very polite there, the boy who send us to work impressed me just with several words such as 'have a good day', 'enjoyed your work' and so on. I have enjoyed my stay in Hard Rock. Thanks to Hard Rock's best services here.

Typical hard rock hotel. Nothing super fancy. Room was nice and clean. The restaurants are pretty good and they did have a cool bbq night. Breakfast is good with a variety of items. Get there early to beat the crowds. 
Loved the foam and pool party with cabana rentals. Fun fun. Not too expensive nothing like pools in Vegas for sure. All and all a good time.

For all 5 of us, we enjoyed the Hard Rock (HR) Hotel experience as it was the first time for all of us to visit a HR property.
The staff is alert and attentive, the front desk staff were great, speedy and helpful, the restaurant staff was always quick to provide the service asked. 
The rooms, we had 5, were all of great quality and nothing really to note about or of a concern.  
Easy access to Beach Road and Second Road, many eateries nearby too. Definitely a place we'll be revisiting in the future.

We had reserved 3 rooms for our 3-night stay during Christmas time.  Amongst which, we had specifically requested for 2 of the rooms be connected.  However, in our email communcations, the hotel explained that such a request could only be dealt with at the time of our arrival.  Despite repeated requests through emails since 6 months prior to our stay and that we had made it clear at the time of checking in that we would pay extra, the hotel was unable to secure a connecting room for our family, not even a night out of our 3-night stay.  That made a real difficult time for us as both of our little ones refused to sleep without seeing their mom.  The mom ended up running between rooms during the stay.We suggest the hotel to allow online booking of connecting rooms.  As the hotel is meant to be a family-friendly hotel, it is important to have connecting rooms be available for families like ours.Other than the connecting room issue, everything else was good.  The hotel may, however, consider to carry out a minor up-grade on the kid's activity room.

i like hardrock's pool& service.
but my room located nearby some facility(very aloud) 
even staff no any notice. 
i couldn't sleep well. 
anyway pool was great for child. there are have exciting activity.

Rooms are big enough, clean, except there is mold just bellow edge of sink, otherwise good service, good breakfast and choice for eating, position is a little far from walking street but you get taxi right away, but it is close to Bazar and shopping malls. Nice ambient... so overall good stay! Will return back when in Pattaya!

Had a great time at HRH Pattaya. All staff members took great care of me and we had a lot of fun during my short stay. Thank you all! 
Great pool, great food and and perfect rooms! Hope to meet you again!

the overall was very enjoy during the stay. the room, bathroom, breakfast, location, cleanliness, services, swimming pool are great. perfect if kids club, taboo and other water activities not for extra cost.

Location was perfect.  Food was awesome.  Kids enjoyed a lot at kids club and pool side. Breakfast has lots of variety with Indian options. Room Balcony had a lovely view of Pacific Ocean and city. Tuk-tuk ride was available just outside the property.

Great pool,and great service from the staff at the poolside.The atmosphere is very relaxed,with some soft poprock at the background.This hotel rocks and is hip.Rooms nicely decorated in rockstyle.Some standard seaview rooms still have a small balcony.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
The good 
-Yummy food
- truly amazing staff 
-Comfortable
- beautiful pools
-You get to tryout a guitar and rock out in the comfort of your own room even though we kept forgetting to do this then it was too late. 
The bad
- The hotels on each side of this hotel seemed to be shut down
- We were aftraid of crazy parties here and well surprisingly there were a lot of families but it was Chinese New Year at least there wasn't drunken frat boys everywhere
- we don't really recommend Pattaya as a good spot to visit. Yes I know this has nothing to do with the hotel just though I'd mention it.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We stayed here in September this year and loved every minute of it. The rooms were very comfortable and certainly not small as we were led to believe on previous postings. We spent our waking hours either in the pool, at the pool bar,out shopping or sightseeing. The pool and cocktail waiters are fantastic- especially Woody - say Hi to him. He made our holiday. The food around the pool and in the restaurants was great and well priced. The fire twirling and juggling night was fun and all in all we felt very relaxed after a 5 day stopover on our way to London. Just a tip for people who want to save money on food. There is a great supermarket which you get to by walking out the back and down the street into the town. It sells things so cheaply including things like salads and sushi.  You have to pay in Baht so take that currency with you.  Have fun - don't forget to go elephant trekking!

We had an excellent experience. Hotel staff  was very friendly  and polite making you feel that they were happy to see you
One area that needs improvement is the bathroom lighting. Other than that it is an excellent property
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Recommend for families. The rooms are clean. The pool is clean and well managed. There are multiple lifeguards at the pool at all times. The staff sets up good games at the pool side to entertain guests. The hotel is peaceful. The food is good. The atmosphere is relaxing. Good services including shopping malls, restaurants, massage, barbers are all nearby. The hotel staff takes good care of guests.

Hard Rock Pattaya is a great hotel with a fantastic location, just oppostie the beach and a 5 minute stroll to Central shopping centre. It is about a 25 minute walk up to Walking street but you might want to catch a cab when it is hot... 
Firstly the staff here are amoungt the best I have ever experienced. Really, you cannot fault them! They are all very friendly, accomodating and very energetic. Nothing is too hard or too much for these guys. No matter what time of day, they will greet you with a big smile and hello and they all speak very good English. 
The rooms are good too, the decor is a little dated but I believe they are in the middle of upgrading. They have plasma's, MP3 player's, mini bar etc, We had a great balcony view of the ocean with sunsets every night. However, the bathroom's are not very private... The doors are a little unusual and they have a pull together window/mirror over looking the bed and the bath is quite old with rough tiles. You really wouldn't want to use this as a bath. There wasn't much storage space in here either.
The food is good at Hard Rock too. The breakfast is very tasty with a large variety of pastries, cereals, cold cuts and hot meals. It can get very crowded the later you go so best to get in early. Unfortunatley for us, our travel agent 'forgot' to include breakfast in our package and we had to pay the extra but it was well worth it. The room service is also good, a large menu with a good variety of choices, their pizza's are sensational! They do a buffet dinner every weekend and the Hard Rock cafe is also good if you are after traditional American. I recommend trying their chicken bites and one of the salads. 
The pool is what makes Hard Rock thou. It is massive!!! And parts of it are shaded so no matter how hot it gets, the pool always stays cool and refreshing. They also have a man made beach and music playing. The staff host daily entertainment for the little kids (and big kids) so their is always something to do rather then just sunbake (like joining in the YMCA dance!). 
All in all Hard Rock Pattaya is a great hotel that stays true to it's American roots. I would recommend to any families or couples looking to experience Pattaya for the first time or anyone looking for something different!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Just completed my 7th stay in January at HR Hotel Pattaya.  It is a welcome retreat to the hustle and bustle of the streets of Pattaya.  The number one asset of this hotel is the staff!  They are always friendly, helpful and ready to make a holiday enjoyable and relaxing.  The best feature of the property is the pool and if activities is your thing they have fun games all afternoon.  For me, reading a book, enjoying a drink and soaking up sun suits me well and this is a perfect venue for that.  The rooms have received new flat screen tv monitors mounted to the wall - a nice recent addition.  Rooms are comfortable with fun HRC bedding.  The F&B areas are very suitable - breakfast buffet (included in most rates) offers a large variety of hot items, cereals, danish, fruit and all the expectations of a complete meal to start the day.  Health club is moderate in size but equipment is well kept and never had to wait to use.
Overall i think once you find this place you will want to "Keep on Rockin"!

My family and I go to Hard Rock every Christmas for the past 10 years, maybe. We love it, it feels like home! 
Since our arrival until our departure, everyone is so friendly and helpful! Coming back so many times, we know most of the rock agents like Willy, Sax, Quito and the ones we don’t remember the name now but still love them for making our stay always enjoyable.
Even the staff we don’t know like Patchy at Rock Royalty and others we know like Somo, Ana always have a smile and a friendly word and will go out of their way to help when needed (like when my son was sick).
The hotel location is great! Just across the road from the beach, a short walk to Central Festival, bars, restaurants, and shops. Usually we spend most of the time enjoying the hotel facilities as everything you need you can find there.
We stayed at rooms 823 & 824, two connecting rooms, very spacious and very clean, including the carpet! The balcony has a wonderful view, facing the sea where I can get my daily dose of Vitamin Sea just by staying there! It was particularly nice this year as the weather was colder than usual.
Toilet is big and clean with the amenities we needed. I read some comments about no toothbrush, but I forgot mine and they brought me one when I requested.
My daughter loves the foam party and the activities the rock agents carry on all day around the pool. My son especially enjoys the water basketball. 
They enjoy to stay at the hotel and just eat there by the pool, the charcoal burger is their favorite! Fajitas at hard Rock Cafe are another favorite!
We went to the dinner buffet on one of the days and the food is quite nice with reasonable price, and my kids (aged 12 to 18 years) only paid 50%.
Well, it was a great holiday and we can’t wait to go back again! 
I want to add a note regarding my friend (staying at room 602) that arrived on the day of her birthday but during the early morning and at the end of the day a small cake was delivered to the room. It was such a warm and nice gesture. She loved it and so did I. Thanks!

I wish that Check in and Front Desk staff could keep the promises they make. For THB 25'000 per VIP room per night I expect to be able to check in easily and that anything offered is supplied. Many times this is not the case with this location and its annoying. As a regular VIP Guest this is an ongoing problem.

This is our first visiting in HR hotel.
And my family have very big appriciate for every staff members.
Becasuse you are very kinldly and carefully for guest.
It's made us happy as new year holiday.
*Just one concerning point is...Pool water is a bit cold...

Great location, great staff, very responsive to inquiries. If you don’t have kids, have your room away from the pool, it’s very noisy all day.  
The food is average. Rooms are average size. Breakfast is awesome, great varieties.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: It was too cold in the room eventhough air-conditiner is off. I got the cold in Thai, still remained in Japan.And not water drink service enough.only one bottle per day eventhough first day 2 bottle provided.

I have now stayed in 3 Hard Rock Hotels and I must admit that there is very little wrong with the way things are done in this Hotel group.  If you are after a stress free time and not bothered with the stiff upper lip atmosphere that hotels sometimes exude then try these guys.  We went to Pattay on the 20th of December and stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in a Family Suite with Kings Club access.  Hard Rock has taken pains to ensure that children are entertained and for parents of a 5 year old and 7 year old this was magical as the rooms were kitted out with X box, toys, books, games, kids bathrobes ad slippers!  The pool, surrounding areas are well kept and clean and the pool activities keep the kids entertained throughout.
The stars diner was a little sad, but otherwise no complaints.  The staff are always smiling and happy, the service at the Kings Club was always good and they do treat you like rock stars.  We will be back!

A big thumbs up for this hotel. From the foyer to the pool deck and in between the staff were always helpful and enthusiastic and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were spacious, well presented and comfortable but be warned that if you have a room that faces the pool it will be noisy on a Saturday night due to the pool party that happens every Saturday. There is a great selection of food at breakfast but it does tend to get busy so best get in early. The pool is massive and well set out with a kids play area and semi swim up bar. Lifeguards are on hand to supervise and rescue should any swimmers get into trouble and the Hard Rock cafe has a good position overlooking the beach. Prices are in line with the * rating and this is to be expected but the friendly and inviting service from the staff reflects the money you pay. I can only recommend the Hard Rock and have no worries about staying here again.

All the staff was very friendly and helpful. My room was upgraded to the highest floor with a very good view of Pattaya Beach. The room is spacious and clean. The breakfast buffet offered varieties of food selection. The pool is great.

Overall the hotel is great and the only thing I would like to highlight will be the concierge service shall be improved.
I love the family suit room we have accommodated  which were really awesome and my children loved it so much.
We may consider to come back again.

5star hotel
5star staff
5star services
.....
Excellent hotel, buffet breakfast was very good. The staff helpful us to make romantic dinner. Room was clean and modern
Definitely  this will be my hotel for next trip to Pattaya
Miss you
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: wonderful days in my life !!The hotel is just in the right place and place in Pattaya. not far from the hustle and bustle of the street and yet nice and quiet at night and in the daytime. I slept on the street so not on the lake side, in the night was the exhaust system (blower) very loud. but with the patio door closed, it was fine again! Thank you for the nice hours in your house

We loved our stay at the Hard Rock hotel- it was right in the heart of pattaya; making central festival and several night markets only a short walk away. Being across the beach, the views were absolutley stunning-and with the brilliant band they had playing at the bar each night made it even more delightful.
The staff were very friendly, welcoming and helpful. Service and enquiries were responded to fairly quickly. 
The pool facilities were also great- and kept the kids pretty preoccupied. 
The morning buffet had some variety; which was nice to wake up to. 
The bubble party they had was also quite entertaining. They had one for kids/family- it was very well organised. Later on in the night they had ine for the adults too- along with a  dj; it was pretty fun. Id recommend booking one of the huts. 
We utlised the nanny service they offered for our kids and were quite pleased. Alongside that, the rooms were pretty well kept. 
Mr simon ,Mr X, supermans and soooo professional

Let me start by saying that I’m hardly your typical Hard Rock fan - I find Hard Rock Cafes loud and obnoxious, I wouldn’t be caught dead in a Hard Rock t-shirt, I don’t even like hard rock - so I was more than skeptical when a friend suggested staying at the Hard Rock Hotel in Pattaya. “They’ve broken the mold,” he said, by renovating and “re-mixing” the hotel into a plush sanctuary from the beachside madness that is Pattaya. What finally convinced me was a promotion that made the HRH’s nightly rate cheaper than my previous digs in the region. And I’m shocked to report that I really, really enjoyed my stay there.
Firstly, the newly renovated rooms are tasteful, functional and blessedly devoid of photographs of rock legends (yawn). The service was awesome, my ice seemingly delivered as I uttered the word. And room service did a damn good and affordable spicy Som Tum when I wasn’t in the mood to explore my beloved Thai food carts. 
Another thing: If I had kids there’s no other place I’d stay, given the myriad ways they keep little ones happy and out of their parents’ hair - from rock climbing to watersports to magic displays and dance-offs. 
I’ll confess I’m a fussy traveler and there were also many small things that impressed me, like the one big easy-glide drawer in each room that holds everything you brought (instead of the usual small drawers that I never use). Or the “Dial-0 Hotline” that connects you with any service by dialing zero. Plus, when I asked to open the locked window of my upper-story room to get some fresh air, they upgraded me to a balcony room. Bam! I'm sold. :)
Okay, there was a Saturday night when the music at the pool party kept me awake till 1AM, but that’s the same at any hotel geared toward a younger crowd.
Overall, while I may not be ready to wear a Hard Rock t-shirt, I’d definitely stay at the Hard Rock Pattaya again.

selected the two of us 2 night package which was fabulous
added to the usual room rate was
rosses for the special woman in your life
sparkling wine and strawberries
his and her hard rock t shirts
his and her spa treatment (which i converted into two single trips for the wife)
and a seven course romatic meal 
fantastic value for money  cant wait to go again
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: average stay and average service.  The outside air conditioning or kitchen machinery is so loud that my parents who are over 65 cannot sleep even at mid-night.  Don't know why you make the rooms this way and refuse to adjust rooms.

I came here with high expectations as it is Hard Rock Hotel... but alas... to my much disappointment it is not to up expectation. TO their credits, the staffs are very friendly and helpful. They even help me to print out some documents despite not being obliged to. The King size bed was pretty ok. And I love the Movie Channel. That's pretty much about it. The toilet was small with no door to separate the toilet and the bathroom so water get splashing all over the place and making the toilet wet. Room was poorly lighted. and the last straw was that one morning at about 8am, they were blasting the common music (the music playing in corridor) so loudly that we couldn't sleep! Outrageous!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Short stay in Pattaya to see some friends leaving here for many years.I always liked the Hard Rock Hotels and have chosen because of that this hotel.Have never been before in this hotel in Pattaya. I will also recommend to other friends.

The staff reception is always with angry face and not amability!! And my friends coming to hotel yo see me and the staff restrict the acces,, very bad hotel ...i be in siam@siam and is absolubty better them this..and more hotels , this hotel is sobre value!! We don't back ..

Stayed 3 nights in a family suite.   My children (4 & 7) were thrilled about everything, Saturday kids form party, bunker bed, swimming pool.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Great atmosphere, very happening hotel.  Superb location.

I choose to stay in clean rooms with city views. But no view at all
I chose Floors But there is so much smoke smell
Breakfast delicious and versatile
Overall, a great place for people who love fun. Not a pacifist Or a private holiday
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Location is very good. Staff members are really helpful. but the water in the pool was dirty. I didn't want to go in and soak myself. Please take care of it a little bit more. The number of breakfast buffet dishes was not diverse either. I think it was okay to stay 2 or 3 nights.

Best hotel in southern Thailand .good pool ,friendly staff and security ! Coming back in februari !! Breakfast is Very Good also so dont  hasetate to stay here when you Come here !! Hard rock café is also one of à kind !!

Nice hotel! Excellent staff! Good breakfast. Very friendly staff in the club lounge. Well organized animation in the pool area. Individual approach to each client. The room was clean and comfortable. This is the best hotel in Pattaya! We will definitely come back here!

GREAT PROPERTY, amazing pool and gym, Breakfast is good and staff is super polite. We had gone for a business conference and found this an ideal hotel. It is close to the beach and all the activities are nearby. We had access to their lounge which was also very nicely served.

I have stayed in Pattaya no less than six times over the last year and stayed at the other so called 4-5 star Hotels in the area Eg the Marriot.
If you want a nice hotel and not worried about saving 10-20USD a night then stay here. Everything is great.All the rooms and facilities are modern, and the staff simply the best. Don't worry about the extra walk to walking street. Plenty of Baht buses all hours for 10b. Also very girl friendly.

After a few nights at HR Pattaya, you forget your´re abroad. The location is fantastic but nothing compared to the excellent and exquisite staff. Congratulations Mr. Smith, muito obrigado, because you have "handpicked the best berries". Thanks a lot to the wonderful staff that work so hard where and when  we the guests are having fun and for the guests having fun. Ms. Eve, Super - Fluke, "Always there and smiling Tattoo Queen" Natasha, Aiwa, Kung, Saysy,Gloria, Jubl, Pookie, Emi, Chakrit, Frankie...etc. etc...Just to mention a few of them.
ขอบคุณจากใจ.
If you "Rock" so much in these times, imagine when the Covid is away...
JJ

Into the hall light look around the furnishings to make people very excited holding the phone has been patting non-stop, the waiters are very friendly, went to the room to open the door to make people very refreshing clean and comfortable environment, though not sea-facing rooms Do not know what it feels may be another feeling. Daily breakfast is very beautiful to watch do not know in the end where to eat from !!!! And it is needless to say that the dinner is light to have eyes full and think of every kind of good taste !! So next time And then where else will choose this hotel to stay !! Straight recommend a hotel !!!!

Under my TOP 5 from all Hard Rock Hotels worldwide. Typical rooms. Fridge, WiFi & good beds. Nice design. BIG pool, almost 70 meters long. Sandy beach at the pool and cabanas. Good menu. Lots to do for kids at the pool. Beach is across the street.

January 2019: perfect location, good large pool area, breakfast too expensive for me because I just want to eat some cereals and a cappuccino. Perfect hotel for families due to the kids club (daycare) and outdoor play area at the pool.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
very good service and also facilities. the location is good with easy access to the beach and also to the shopping area, The pool was excellent! the lobby was so ambience and overall facilities provided was good.
Kids really love the pool and enjoy it

My second stay at Hard Rock Hotel in December 2017, order a royalty City view room but upgraded at arrival to a spacious suite with sea view , and never regret . The view from the 9th floor was stunning and well worth the money spent for upgrade.
I find the hotel more like an institution which offer so much more than an conventional hotel, live music, excellent restaurants and the pool area was fantastic with ditto service .
The Saturday pool party (Foam party) was amazing  
The service including room cleaning was above my expectations . Always smiling 
I paid some extra for the Royalty option, but then you have free access to an lounge in 9th floor , and some food/fruit etc served during the day , after 6pm free drink(s) and finger food , well worth the money .
I find the food reasonable priced compare to quality (which was high) , drinks are off course more expensive if you compare it to an outside bar , but this is expected.
Solo traveler , but allowed to bring guest 
Been on many luxury hotel , Copacabana and Singapore but nothing beat Hard Rock :)
Will certainly come back (rather sooner than later)

Very wide pool is good to swim and comport. Also it is very easy to contact beach and big shopping mall.
But smoking floor(6th) is not good because I feel smoking smell even I stayed lower floor(5th).

The hotel is located in prime area..easy access to the market, restaurants etc...Nice view from the room..Nice balcony...excellent service by the help desk staff..Every saturday there is a foam pool party, which is free..Overall its an excellent experience..we had stayed there for 4 nights..

Stayed here at the family room during Easter break. The room is spacious with a double bunker for the kids.  However, it only fits if your kid is short. 
The kids loved it with lots of fun activities. The manmade breach and pool is very cozy.  It is walking distance to the new shopping center. Recommend for family with kids.

the new year calibrations party was outstanding for both adults and children , the food and services was world class. the crew at the hard rock hotel are energetic and make every one welcome with there friendly manner. this is the 12 time in 2 years that I have stayed  in this hotel and would recommend it to family's, couples and single people. the crew makes every buddy welcome.

Went there with my family (wife and 4-year old). Very nice hotel, nice comfortable room (a tad small, but no complaints). Hot water is **hot**, just the way it should be. 
The staff are super great -- very pleasant and helpful. I will go back to this hotel just for the service.
The food is superb. Lots of options. Cocktails and drinks are just the kind one would want in hot and humid tropical weather. 
***MUST MUST*** eat the chicken at the Hard Rock Cafe. It is perhaps the best chicken wings on earth. I kid you not -- I licked the plate.
***ANOTHER MUST MUST*** listen to the music -- live band, great singer and very lively atmosphere.
Only down side -- it is in Pattaya, not my favorite place (to put it mildly). But I will go to the hotel again.
PS: My wife is a singer and she loved it too!

This was the second time we stayed at the hotel and we were not disappointed. Perfect location on Beach Road for exploring the large malls or having a lazy day around the pool or beach across the road.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: we've been staying here for the past 4 years and definitely returning. the swimming pool and amenities are great, location is good. the staff is fantastic and honest. the kings club is a must and a special shout out to the hotel manager Ann who is a star.

This was my third stay in the last 12 months at Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya.
The staff are friendly and engaging.  There was not one time i passed a staff member without them greeting me with a "good morning"or "good afternoon".
The cleanliness and upkeep of the room was exceptional.
The buffet breakfast is probably one of the best i have expereinced in all of my travels.
It caters for all needs.....Asian and Western food in abundance.
The pool is huge, amazing and refreshing.
My only complaint would be the charge for wifi, but it does seem to be quite common in hotels in Pattaya... Other than that, i think this hotel is situated in an ideal location, and the glitz and "glamour"of Pattaya is only a short walk or taxi ride away.
I highly reccomend this hotel, and i definately will be back.

I've been already many times in Pattaya, but this was my first time at hard rock. The room was good, with some interesting feature you won't see anywere else (the sound of your stay voucher,...). But still, compared to other hotels in the same price category along Pattaya beach,  hard rock is not a star. Amari, holiday inn, marriott, hilton remain my favorite. I've chosen hard rock because the price was lower than my favorites this time. Concluding: you won't go wrong here, but it's not top pick.

Great place to do as much or as little as you want. The service is friendly and prompt, the food is great and the Spa is divine. The pool activities were fun and inclusive. Great holiday can't wait to return. This was my second visit and both times I can't fault any part of the Hard Rock, they aim to please..

i like your hotel. I was there 8 times per 2 years. But this hotel had construction every visit. Pool, rooms, pool...the same. And last visit it was the same! I don't know, when I coming to the Rock. thanks and regards

My kids love Hardrock pattaya. They like to play pool Activity when they were young. Now they still love to stay Hardrock pattaya when we have time to travel. Pool staff still remember my kids. My kids still remember them too

Very nice time. I dont have kids but if u do so much for them to do. Friendly staff and I absolutely love my cleaning crew. They were the best. Nice location and the amenities were awesome. I have stayed there a few times and might again when I am back in April 2020.

I have stayed here many times and it is always the same.Great staff/friendly, great,clean rooms and plenty of places to enjoy food or drink.The pool included as well. I always find this a pretty good value for the quality of the hotel and will be a long term gust for sure.Sign up for their discount card too if you go there often.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Perfect location. Next time I will bring my kids. Amazing pool area with o a lot of activities if you want.
Staff really observant and friendly. Breakfast ok for them except as usual in thailand lack of decent bread and cheese.
Only negative is the overpriced Rock Shop.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The hotel is at an excellent location directly on the beach. Plenty of secure parking is available. The rooms are big and have all amenities one could wish for. Check in/out is very quick. All staff are very friendly and helpful, you will feel at  home immediately

I had a chance to try Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya, they made my first stay the most impressive stay. New room after renovated , I can say it's the five star product!!! Shower is really cool and convenience. Bed is fantastic. The design is really Rock...I like it. All staff are friendly and eager to help for all needs. Would recommend to join the pool activities...really fun..music is all around... When I first arrive, they greet me " How can I ROCK Your WORLD..... Yes they will rock you!!! Thanks to all who ROck my stay ...

I visit Thailand a lot and have been a frequent guest of the hard rock for the past 8 years at least bi annually, It is extremely good value for families and the pool area is second to none, the location is superb and the only downfall is the quality of food during quiet periods, this put aside the hotel is run to a very high standard and the staff very helpful and friendly and I look forward to my next visit, I always get a suite on the Kings club floor and have had no complaints.

The property was old and almost every piece of furniture was on it last legs.  The rain drip shower was not working and  the one chair provided's frame jutted up into my upper hamstring.  On the other had the staff was very helpful especially the young lady in the gift shop near reception was extremely professional, upbeat and helpful

Hard Rock members have a real enthusiasm for the hotel, love all and serve all! Swimming pool has been updated, water quality is adorable. Grand view from the window. Front desk team is very nice. Good location near the beach.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I visited Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya in November 2012 with my family. This is not my first stay at the hotel. I am a frequent visitor to the hotel. However, this is my first visit after the renovation. My kids love the hotel because they keep them busy all day with activities in the pool and not to forget the foam party. The rooms are bigger and nicer after the renovation. However, they reduce the number of rooms with balconies in order to make the rooms bigger. This is disappointing as I enjoy sitting in the balcony and enjoy the view over Gulf. I always book sea view room and always getin a room with view over the pool and the gulf. This time, however, they gave me a room with no balcony and had side view of the sea. I protested, but they could not provide another room with balcony with pool and sea view the first day. This was mainly because they have much less rooms with balconies now. I was moved the next day with room with balcony and sea view although it was smoking room but it did not have any smoke smell.  Except for this inconvenience, everything was as expected perfect, top service, excellent food, and fantastic holiday. I highly recommend the hotel especially for families. If you are like me and want specific room, write to them ahead of time, probably they won’t disappoint you; they have excellent call center.

sadly the staff, rooms and breakfast were not up to much compared to the other hard rocks we have stayed at! 
Bar staff on phones while serving us, dirty glasses, raw eggs at breakfast, veggie food cooked in fish!!! 
I'm sure other people have had a lovely time here sadly this wasn't the case for us though.
Sorry hard rock
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: There are many hotels located nearby. The price paid for the hotel is not value for money because its services, facilities and  dining provided is under a 4-star hotel standard. I totally not recommend.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: There are so many activities you can participate in. There are live shows every nights which I highly recommend to attend. You can request just about any famous rock music and they will play them like original. Thank you all Hard Rockers especially Ann and Minnie!!

I and my friend stayed at Hard Rock for 3 nights and quite satisfied. Hotel was beautiful, nice decor. Our room was spacious, clean with a big bath room. Hotel staffs were friendly and helpful. But what we like the most in this hotel was swimming pool. Definitely stay here again.

Booked the hotel for just one night for 73 usd including BF, and later on repented for just staying a night.
The Hotel is right on the beach, just remember to take a exit from the pool side. Pool is also good which is dividedc into two parts: normal one and the one with the beach look.
We were upgraded to deluxe room and it was very nice with sea view and quite large.
Since we are pure vegetarians, many options of Indian restaurants nearby within walking distance.
Remember to take a tuk tuk for your local commuting, just wave a hand and they will stop and when you want to get down ring the bell inside.
Ripleys was great, we also did Flight of the Gibbons which should never be missed as it is real adventure over the trees and not frightening at all, Tiffanys was amazing with perfomances on songs from all around the world.
there is a Foam Party every saturday for 380 Bhat pp, not to be missed.
Pattaya is a nice place and Hard Rock made it more memorable.

What the staffs and workers' excellent performence with their services have impressed me at Hard Rock was not only they work hard as for a job but it represented a culture of humanity. The room was spotlessly clean,the activities around swimining pool were amazing.

I like you guys's best service for us!!
덕분에 너무 즐거운 시간보내다 갑니다!
밥도 너무 맛있었구 전반적인 부대시설들도 모두 만족스러웠어요!
방에서 보이는 뷰도 이뻤구요
서비스 마인드 만큼은 정말 최상이었던거 같구요
머무는시간이 적었어서 모든 부대 시설을 다 이용해보지 못한 점이 너무 너무 아쉽습니다ㅠ
다음에 꼭 다시 방문해보고 싶어요!!

I join the hotel package which included dinner buffet and oily massage 1hr, your staff provided  a good service in rock spa and good value dinner buffet in Starz Cafe. And your poolside staff arranged many activities for the guest, like water aerobics, banana boat competition, dancing and water basketball competition...

Room is very dark with poor lighting. bed extremely comfy although expect some noise from guests in corridor and pool party at weekend. Cleanliness of room could be better. Black bathroom tiles hide how dirty they actually are and my sheets had some blood on them.  I would have like milk in the room or creamer to make a coffee and somewhere to store clothes. for kids the pool is great for sure the hotels key offering. staff very friendly and willing to help and advise. I would stay again but not for a business trip.

Good place if you are out with kids, they keep them engaged most of the days. But if you are vegan or vegetarian do not join the buffet dinner (it's an all meat affair), same on breakfast as well. The spa is great!

This is one of the nicest hotels in Pattaya, the team were warm and friendly at all times and the service was incredible. Nothing was too difficult and they even took consideration of our pressing personal circumstances to tailor our stay. Overall a wonderful experience.

I have very mixed feelings about my stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in Pattaya. We had a nice check-in experience, but we didn't get the king bed as requested. Instead, we were stuck with two smaller beds and a little discomfort for a couple. We opted for the "Kings Club" room, and it was definitely worth the upgrade fee. We had a balcony, entrance to the Kings Club Lounge and many other amenities included.  Wifi is slow, and requires a login every time you want to connect to the internet. The food and drinks at this hotel were extremely expensive for the Pattaya area, and nothing exciting in comparison. The pool area is large, but the VIP cabanas are in the shade all day, and there are not nearly enough lounge chairs for people who want to lay by the poolside and relax. People acted like vultures, and play childish games reserving lounge chairs.  We found ourselves without lounge chairs more than once. Another complaint that I have is that the staff could not seem to understand that the names on the two separate rooms that were booked were switched. During check in they gave my brother my room and me his room. We tried numerous times to explain it, but the staff did not understand at all.  The level of English-language needs to improve to deal with foreign visitors. Charging anything to the room was a complete hassle, and we had to sit and figure everything out together during our departure. What a pain! We decided not to stay our entire time in Pattaya (an additional 6 days) at this hotel, and took our business elsewhere - right down the street to an even more centrally located hotel for less than what we paid at the Hard Rock. My feelings are very mixed, and I couldn't recommend this hotel.  Disappointed with the level of service we received for the price that we paid.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The hotel is very interesting, as the whole network of these hotels! good service, nice pool. Numbers below the tenth floor - small. Overall - good! The location is perfect! 4 *////////////////////////////////////////////////////
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The Hotel is beautiful. Centrally located opposite the Beach, Its a bit modern design concept hotel. The Rooms are good & comfortable. They have rocky pool area as well as a normal good sized pool. The Hotel staff is friendly & warm. I feel for pattaya its best place to stay. Its abt 1 km from walking street and u can take tuk tuks at 10 baht per person.

Rooms and service are great as is the location high end price for this hotel though. Pool area is nice but starting to look a bit dated when compared to other 5 start hotel venues.Overall expensive and you pay for what you get would stay here again if rooms were on special.

I had the pleasure of staying at the Hard Rock during the Christmas holiday.  It was a really great stay and the location was good.
Getting to the hotel from Bangkok was easy although traffic was heavy on this day.  I arrived about 4:00PM and check in was easy.  The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful. I went to my room and found everything in working order.  There was a sage big enough for my laptop.  The room included 2 bottles of water that was replaced everyday.  The wifi was fast but you could only use 2 devices on there system at any given time.
The bathroom was a little small but it was functional.  There was a window that overlooked the bedroom which was interesting.  Fortunately it had a window shade that you could close.  There was a walk in shower.  It didn't have a door, so prepare for the bathroom floor to be a little wet after your shower.
I had a seaview and the view of Pattaya and the sea was nice.  The room had a sofa enough power outlets for me.  Fortunately I brought my power adapter because not all the outlets for of the universal type.  The bed and pillows were very comfortable.  I was able to turn the air conditioning on and off, but couldn't seem to adjust the temperature.  Luckily it was adjusted to a temperature that wasn't too cold, but I did have to turn it off sometimes to be comfortable in the room.  Like most Thailand TV's, the choice of English stations is poor.  You if you like to keep up with the news, use the internet.
The location of this hotel is great.  It is right across the street from the beach.  The pool seemed great and always had a lot of people using it.  There were a lot of kids splashing around, but I never heard them from my room.  The hotel is very quiet at night.
Getting to other parts of Pattaya was easy.  Once you exit the hotel, you could always find a baht bus or taxi to take you wherever you wanted to go.  There was  tour desk on the properties to help you make travel arrangements.  They didn't seem to have a lot of brochures so I would suggest being a little prepared for what you want to do.
Sadly I never went to the hard rock bars.  I wish I had, but I do know they close by 1AM, and most other places in Pattaya close a lot later.  There were security guards and both entrances to the hotel which was nice.  My room rate did include breakfast and I ate there several times.  The place was full, but I was always able to get a table inside.  And there was always plenty of room outside.  The food was good and plentiful.  I always enjoyed what I ate.  But I doubt you would walk in off the street to eat breakfast here.
All in all a great hotel and I would definitely consider staying here again.

Overall very good service especially the reception, always smile and explained clearly. Swimming pool is also very good and a kid pool just stick together. Location is excellent. Buffet breakfast was provided and beverage was served. The only thing that the toilet shower was a bit week.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The location are quite convenience. The rooms are little bit old and no toothbrush provided, however, the staff are very nice. The food in restaurant are taste good and facilities are nice. We enjoy our holiday very much.

The swimming pool, after renovation, looks better with lights giving it a blue tint. The surrounding area near to the pool also looks new. During my stay, there was even a foam party near to the pool with lively music.

With all Amenities it's the Best in Class Hotel very Nice food very cozy and Cool Sea View rooms amazingly good location seaside very Clean pool and Nice Rock themed Lobby and rooms best for both Family and couples.

We are all travelers and the best we can find in our travels are honest friends. Here in Pattaya Hard Rock, we have not 1, but 3 honest life guards... Sax, Arm and Tedz. Lost my little zip lock, with receipts and ~9000 THB while playing in the pool with kids.
Once again, thanks guys... You guys Rockzzzzz!
Cheers and Good Health to Sax, Arm and Tedz !! 
David and Family --- Dec 10, 2013

A fantastic family hotel out of the really grotty bits of Pattaya but still easy access to everywhere. Straight across from the beach.
The pool is excellent and offers a relaxing & fun atmosphere. Staff were most friendly!
If you can, fork out for a Kings Club room as the snacks, pressing, drinks & happy hour can be a nice addition. I don't think the rooms were especially larger (35sq) though. Just be aware a double queen room is actually 2  double beds. We were accommodated extremely well however with a King and the day bed was made up perfectly to fit Master 5!
A negative on the place is that the food is average. Not bad - just boring. I've had better breakfast buffets but I have definitely had worse. Same goes for the actual Hard Rock Cafe. It ranks middling when it comes to HRC's. But there is a great open air restaurant close by around Soi 4 on the same strip!
We had a great time overall and the hotel provided a fun, family-friendly haven!

We spent one night at this hotel and it was a good experience.  At first we weren't sure if it would be suitable for our 2 young kids (ages 5 and 4) but as it turns out there are numerous activities to keep kids busy as well (painting, foam bath, kid's shows at night, etc).  However the rooms and bathrooms are too small, even though we stayed in what was classified as a suite on the upper floor.  This floor has it's own lounge where you could get all-day snacks and have breakfast.  Food was ok and if you get bored of the hotel food you can always drop by the Hard Rock cafe which is right beside the hotel.  Location is good, again the main walking street and beach are right in front of the hotel.

On the beautiful beach.  Got a room for $85 a night on Expedia.  The same room would retail for $300 in the US.  Price includes a $15 daily breakfast buffet with everything you can think of. Beautiful property and pool.  Kid friendly - lots of activities for them.  If you want the adult nightclubs, you can take the "Baht Bus" for 30 cents and 5 minutes to the nearby famous "Walking Street".  I'm going back in May !!!!

The children love the swimming pool.The waiter is very polite.The welcome drink is very good.My husband is very pleased, too.
My little daughter wants to go swimming again.I hope the food will be enriched.

I went to visit a friend to celebrate an early Xmas and decided that my girlfriend and I would stay at the HR Hotel just for one night.  Check in was simple and quick, quite a busy lobby though. The room was great and the bed was  comfortable 
Used the gym which is fully fitted with top equipment and was serviced by staff all day.
dont choose #238 as the view is the roof of the hotel
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Our best stay ever in Thailand. Had both my mother, 79 years, and youngest daughter 3 years with among my wife.
We Have (still 3 nights left) 2 Rock Royalty rooms and are very satisfied with service and amenities. 
Staff excellent and the location is great.
Only 2 minus. First the problem with the check-in and the disappointment with the bbq buffet which had meat that was like chewing gum and made almost everyone of us losing our teets. The service at the bbq could also improve. 
Anyway these minor faults will not take down my rating.
This is a high-class hotel, especially if you have kids.

It was the friendliness of all the staff that made the stay very enjoyable.
