The wifi infrastructure of the hotel is also superb. The selection of entertainment in the rooms was great. I would have wished for a few more titles of games for the PS4 for my kids but I see the PS4 console as an additional bonus already. Thumbs up to that. 
If I could recommend, it would be to have a Sound Recording Studio (Like Hard Rock Bali) which would fit the theme as well as provide guest with an opportunity for a memorable experience that they can bring home and and enjoy for ages.

Having stayed for New Year last year and was so impressed with the nye meal and entertainment in the gardens, we decided to book again. What a mistake the food was terrible dried out and so below standard. Served in the breakfast area with no atmosphere you felt rushed to get a seat outside. Will not be back.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: It is better to provide toothbrush, toothpaste and comb to the guest. As most hotel will provide basic toliet accessories. The swimming pool is excellent, provide 2 pools for the kids. It is better to provide life jacket to kids as well.

Had a very enjoyable stay at the Hard Rock. 
All the staff were very polite and helpful. Got into the hotel late and didn't fancy going from the room so we ordered room service which was very nice. The pool and the activities put on through the day are excellent.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Overall stay was good. A bit disappointed with room size despite of us taking the club suite. Normal rooms are quite tiny compared to other hotels. Service was good and staff is friendly. Hard rock cafe was excellent with great music and good food.

This was already our 4th stay at the Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya and, in addition, we have had a blast again!! This is the first time that we used the Royal Lounce, this time as an upgrade.. thank you Lucy @ Reception!! Next time it will be our new standard😎🎸🎸 Great facilities, swimming pool  and staff!! Rock ‘n Roll all night..and party everyday!! Thx , Peter Robert

Excellent hospitality, lovely staff , eager to help even at night due to we late check in.
Recommend for everyone.
The room us clean, and we can rent the guitar for free at the front. Also varieties of breakfast.
The staff are friendly and eager to help us thoughout our stays.

Staff was fantastic!!! Food was ok not that fantastic but good. Breakfast is amazing!!! Swimming pool activities are the best for kids and some for grown-ups as well. Location is perfect, quiet yet a few minutes walk from all the fuss.

Spending few days late November at this prestigious hotel, found that the sincerity and kind hearted for our lost and found things. A wallet and mobile phone was dropped by family member which are picked and returned to counter by staffs. Appreciate the fast response and prompt action to retrieve the valuable things. Great job guys!

We had a great time but expected to make us feel special on our Special day but hotel didn't take any effort. Request you to listen to the person when Checkin and make them feel special. Food was amazing thesaturday night pool. Party was a flop.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I never imagined that I would be staying at a Hard Rock Hotel, let alone one in notorious Pattaya, Thailand. Yet here I am, accompanying my boyfriend who is entertaining clients from out of town. And truth be told, I'm quite enjoying it.
The hotel delivers on the Hard Rock brand, with lots of music great clothing, guitars, and other memorabilia. The branding is everywhere and well-done. (The door tag says "Get My Stage Ready" on one side, and "Not Now, My Ego Need a Rest" on the other.) The rooms are elegant and comfortable. And most important, the bed is very comfy.
The hotel pizza restaurant has a nice selection of 'za and other treats, and the food is tasty. The breakfast buffet is decent but not super-extensive. Nothing spectacular, but nothing to complain about either.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Stay there 3 nights, the staff are helpful and friendly. The pool can enjoy sunshine through the day, I always spent 3-4 hours at the pool to enjoy the sunbath. The breakfast are nice and the BBQ dinner buffet are delicious and have many choices. Only not good was too many China tours took BBQ dinner there and their hygiene were poor.

We choose Hard Rock in view of security and safety concerns at Pattaya. The experience started the moment we stepped into the premises.. frontline staff Twin remembers our names, counter staff Boy explained to us clearly the facilities and benefits to enjoy during our stay. The room is clean, tidy and neat. The Hard Rock cafe is just nearby.  Cafe staff Joe and his team are really fantistic and fun loving, we enjoyed their company. Love the overall Hard Rock atmosphere and will go back again for our next trip.

Hotel lovely, expensive for bed and breakfast but made more expensive by the additional extras that are there to tempt you.. pool floats, t, shirts and other memorabilia in your room. Location not suitable for families, or respectable couples .. overall avoid the resort unless you are 60+ Male or single blokes wanting sex on a plate with  very young girls!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I think your hotel staff is very friendly and nice , and I am very happy that they will play with me in swimming pool . And they remember my name let me so warm like a friend. 
And the location is so good too .
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Nice swimming pool with artificial sand beach. My son and daughter really love it. But some facilities are old. Great location just right at the middle of beach road.  Pattaya beach just a road against to the hotel.

Probably the only reason that we use the Hard Rock nowadays is that it is in a good location. The rooms are getting tired, the breakfast is average. It has a great swimming pool and the staff are generally friendly.

Only one of the two rooms we booked was ready when we arrived despite the time being 2.30pm.
Clean room, nothing special, efficient staff as you would expect. 
Good location right on beach road for all of your Pattaya needs! 
There are better hotels for the same money.

Had a perfect stay at Hard rock and it was not like any other hotel we have been to before in Pattaya . We reserved our room from a nice lady at hard rock reservation,sorry can't remember her name but she was helpful and very kind .Stayed there for 4 nights and  wouldn't want to leave this amazing hotel.From the beginning the staff at front desk were helpful.The hotel was very clean and well decorated .our room had no balcony and this was the only negative point(Not all the rooms have balcony ) but was really clean and modern with a nice view of pattaya bay.The housekeeping were smiling all the time .Breakfast was good but a little bit crowded at the time .Although this hotel is right on the beach road and another door to the second road,there were no noise from the street.One of the best thing was the pool and the music,some pool games which made you have more fun .The staff were amazing,always ready to help and smiling,we did eat several times at the hotel and the food was fine.Our first experience at Hard Rock hotels and would definitively go back to this hotel and recommend this hotel to all.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Location and style very nice I like Hard Rock al over the world. I choose Deluxe city view high floor room from your page however, when I arrived you said there is no enough options with King bed and city view.The room is very small and there is no way to have a city view.

Really first class hotel . Central to everything. Staff are the best in world , hotel facilities are up to date every thing is pristine thanks hard rock . The pool has just been renovated and has enough sun beds for everyone

A little of disappointment, especially your restaurant.  
1. Food (Buffet) not finished in the lunch time, found served in the dinner.  Same dishes were served.  
2. BBQ buffet where dishes were only limited choice.
3. Coffee is not served in the lunch buffet.  We were told it is chargeable.  In other hotel restaurant, coffee is free flow .
4. Overall, food in the restaurant is just average.  Taste average, choices less (as an international buffet), and not really value for money.

We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights and the experience was fa-aa-antastic !!! The suite was excellent - 2 balconies , 2 Bathrooms , A living area and Full bedroom along with a small kids room . Very well designed , Neat and Clean .
Location of the Hotel is excellent - Walking distance to the Art in paradise ( Must visit in Pattaya ) ,Central Festival Mall , Ripleys etc. Songthews ( Local tuk-tuk ) available all the time right outside the Hotel .
The Kings  club level was super good . Breakfast from 7 am till 10pm + beer and cocktails between 6 pm to 8 pm .
The staff - SOM-O, CIARA & PATTY are Wonderful ,very Friendly,Helpful and truly Amazing - they added a lot of value & fun to our stay . We will miss them wherever we travel next . We hope to meet all three on our next trip to Hard Rock Pattaya .
The Foam Party was excellent ( Mind blowing experience ) , The pool , water slides , Tabu are all very good .
The only minor  down side was limited food options for us Vegetarians

Really nice hotel with very good value these days,good location nice professional staff,cool things,rooms are maybe little bit small for being almost a 5 star,had a sea view deluxe room
Ok, for a few night with good value like i had
But i asked for the highest floor and had 10 floor and
there was something on the roof topp starting vibrating 07:00-08:00 every morning and all day i guess machine, power room or generator, maybe they had washing station there,i told them but nothing happened
and thats not ok,
So dont ask for high floor whatever you do if you want to sleep good or have a nap in the day
So Beware for  topfloor

The Hard Rock hotel was located at a exceptional place along the beach and close by various attractions and shopping areas.  The service was very good and there is a Korean speaking staff which was a definite plus.

Great location between beach and second road, can enter from either road on foot or rear in vehicle.
Air con constantly running, room stat at 30 degrees , room at a chilly 19 or less so not comfortable at all!   Staff all pleasant. 
Too many Rude chinese people with very poor hygiene practices at breakfast for my liking.
Lovely rooms and pool area, rock cafe area music very loud and place very empty!
Nice place but probably overpriced for Pattaya..Tourist catchment i guess!

We asked for a triple room but on seeing the room there was no way you could walk around with the third bed - we had to take another room so basically we ended up with 3 rooms for 4 of us!!!  Again the terrace is minute, you can just get 2 chairs on - the bathroom cannot fit two people and you need to be a high jumper to get in and out of the bath tub.  The Club room upstairs was well worth the extra for breakfast and cocktails.  Pattaya is a dump and do not go with teenage daughters - they are letched over wherever you go and without exaggerating you cannot even let them walk down the street on their own without being accosted by a dirty old man.

Stayed over for a day here. This is a pretty swanky hotel and the inside decor is true to its name. Rooms are nice and big - and although we didn't get the beach view, the room still had a great view of Pattaya town. 
When we went, the pool was under renovation and hence there were no pool side parties (the hotel is famous for a foam party!). Hence the room rates were cheap also.

I and my wife spent New Year Eve in this hotel. It is a nice hotel and staff is great. However, I booked the hotel to spend our new year and it was so expensive, I thought it is because of the new year and that's obvious but usually, this hotel is very cheap. I would recommend everyone to not book this hotel near to new year, not value for money. 
Gala dinner was pathetic, we paid for it since it was compulsory. There was mostly seafood and that was smoked, not cooked properly. Next day breakfast was also not hot and tasty.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Great Hotel attention to detail was perfect, the rock royalty level well worth the upgrade price
They have done an amazing job from top to bottom. No detail has been overlooked. It is a testament to the fact that you can have a beautiful hotel in a beautiful location and still set yourself miles apart with an amazing staff and wonderful service. From the moment we arrived everyone had a smile on their face and did everything they could to make me feel welcome.
The rooms are comfortable and incredibly well designed. I stayed in rooms with great views of the ocean. Anything you need is a quick phone call away. Or you can just pop your head in the VIP lounge  and ask someone for help...there are no shortage of willing participants.
It is very nice quality of hotelThe sea view is very nice tooI like your bubble partyIf next time I to Pattaya again, I want to go back and join the bubble party againIt is very crazy and interesting

We stayed on the rock royalty level which included drinks and appetizers nightly from 6 to 730pm. The staff was very friendly. The large pool and jacuzzi were perfect. The beach was just across the street where you can rent chairs and umbrellas for  $  3 each. Good location and clean beach for swimming. The entertainment  district for nightlife was a 15 minute walk down the beach, excellent  overall vacation.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Besides getting to jam out with a guitar which we in 5 days kept forgetting to do the great thing is the customer service which can be hard to find in Asia . I loved how the staff made an effort to start up a conversation with you it was welcoming and in all of Asia so far I have only noticed this effort at hard rock. It was a lot of families due to it being cny. Which I guess were we relieved as we assumed it would be a lot of drunk frat boys. But Pattaya it self is not a good destination so we won’t be returning.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: My family loved it here. Plenty of activities for the kids and the pool is a constant source of fun. Rooms and facilities are modern. Staff are friendly. Gym is well stocked. Breakfast is decent. The kings club is good value.

fast check in, friendly staff at bfast. Variety of food at bfast. Room svc was fast. Swimming pool was fantastic. Entrance to Kids club is chargeable, which was disappointing. Been to many hotels worldwide, this is the first.
a terrific place to stay pool room food staff is great we will come back many times more

Very happy with my stay at the Hard Rock. The venue is clean and always meets a high standard.  There are always activities going on at the hotel to make your stay enjoyable.  I highly recommend their nightly buffet.

Thank you for an excellent stay at the Hard Rock. The staff is very warm and accommodating, and the rooms are always well cleaned. The pool is fun, and facilities are kept in good condition. I will surely recommend this hotel to all whom travel to Pattaya.

This is the 4th time we have stayed at HRH. Every time is better than before. The rooms are perfect, access to the beach, swimming pool area and of course the hard rock food is amazing. We enjoyed a lot at the cafe.

Very nice hotel...we were lucky to get the corner room , with the balcony facing the pool . 
The atmosphere was very relaxed and the staff well trained .The pool was nice & clean 
Though the hotel spa was average the buffet spread was good . 
A lot of shopping malls nearby . 
If you are the fun type , Do not miss the Hardrock Foam Party held every friday.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Hardrock is a nice "YOUNG " hotel. The ambience is excellent & so is the food.
The main attraction is FOAM DANCE which is not seen anywhere in Thailand. 
One must go & stay......Its AMAZING

Location is good and close to the beach. Room is clean and bed is comfortable. We like the activities at the pool which made our stay memorible and never get bored. However, there is some area where people can smoke at the pool, people can smell the smoke and it was worst that many kids were around. It would be great if it is a non smoking pool.

Fast and friendly check in. Staff all lovely. Room good size, clean , everything you need and comfortable beds. Breakfast good, very very busy with lots of men pushing and shoving all over ! Pool great, and food by pool also good. Drinking in hotel is not cheap. Had Thai massage, good and lovely room but not cheap either. 
Only down is that the wifi is very intermittent and limits number of devices etc.
Great staff throughout, I left very impressed in general. Good for young couple so in particular.

Good overall but the check out process was slow due to poor co-operation between reception staffs on the 9th floor and on the ground floor. I ended up having to wait another 20 minutes for the receipt just because the 9th floor staff said I can pick up the receipt anytime as they have already prepared it.

All are good. Location is Ok. The staff is helpful. the pool is good. This is a good hotel.The service is good, the location is not far from the eating place. I will recommend to all my staff to stay here.

Stayed here for a couple of nights. We and our friends got upgraded free of charge because we had to wait 2 hours for our room, and got rooms with amazing view from the balcony on the 8th floor. Really nice rooms with good bathrooms. Pretty expensive with drinks and food on the hotel area. Would definitely recommend for both families and couples!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Stayed at the hotel for eleven nights after we were supposed to stay at another hotel which we found unsatisfactory. Got on the phone to the Hard Rock were the reservations team were extremely helpful as we needed adjoining rooms as we have teenage daughters and this was accommodated immediately. On arrival reception was excellent as were all the staff from all departments we came into contact with. Rooms are very comfortable and clean as is the whole hotel. All in all if we had to stay at our original hotel it would definitely would have spoiled our holiday so thank you for coming to the rescue. Would recommend this hotel and maybe planning to go back in the future.

Good service. Nice reception. The place is convinince and beautiful place. The good zone for kid pool and kid zone. There are the separated zone for smoking area and non smoking area. Good tase for breakfast. Excellent !!! My son liked the swimming pool.

Staff is very nice and excellent service, nice hotel and not too far from Bangkok. Kids friendly, many activities to enjoy inside the hotel.  But if you want to walk to enjoy the beach, it might be inconvinence because of the road nearby the hotel is under construction.

this place is perfectly located . awesome food . the service is a bit slow and lousy . front desk staff is about average ! not that friendly ... foam party is very boring ... u might as well go some other club . 
pool service is awesome ... nice drinks ... overall good family hotel ... safe and sound

Almost every 12 years ago when my son gave birth. Our family came and rest at HardRock hotel pattaya at least 1 time per year. Every time have good memories with staffs and activities. However we will comeback again and again.

We think Hard Rock is very funky hotel. The facilities for children are great as we stayed here with our extended family. Our three year old niece loved it. The swimming pool is a highlight of this hotel as it has the "beach" bit. A bit disappointed with the rooms as they are small but still comforatble with a great view of the beach and the hotel beach pool from our balcony so it is forgivable. The bathtub is very small and a bit weird. Service was ok. Breakfast was also just ok as they weren't that many choices. Location is just spot on, beach is just across the road and it's only fifteen minutes walk to walking street.

I really like the in-room amenities, room design and deco. I feel energetic and have new experience. Entering the room, I like the picture of John Leon and a small room for children with kiddy deco. Teddy bears are provided as well as color pencils for children "s drawings. Getting to the bedroom, I really like quality bed and pillows. However, the hotel entrance is a bit inconvenient as the hotel cannot be entered from the beach. Anyone who would just like to spend a night with new feelings, new energetic ambience, come and check in.

Kids friendly , perfect for families or couples or anyone. Buffet Breakfast choices are too good. Very clean hotel .staff  is courteous and helpful. Highly recommend. Stayed for 3 nights , we are surely coming back again!

The hotel staff are really fun and polite. They try and do anything for you. In addition, the lifeguards and entertainers around the pool are really amazing and they put on great games all afternoon that me and my kids really enjoyed. Thanks for a great stay.

One of the highlights of our holiday is to stay at this hotel. Service was superb, good English speaking staffs, very friendly attendants at the restaurant. No judgemental looks here... We're pretty much at ease knowing the crews worked hard to uphold brand standards. Hardware & room nothing much to comment, a bit cramped but otherwise clean. We booked through Agoda but eventually pay directly to the hotel via email correspondence. Arrived early before usual check in time & got our room ready within 30 mins. Enjoyed the resident band very much. Worth to check them out, it would be a truly rocking experience (none of your typical top 40 stuff).

Excellent hotel for honemoons or anniversaries. Not very close but near the walking street. A lot of shopping malls nearby. Most of the staff, from reception to pool and room service are well trained and friendly. Cosy atmosphere and very relaxed in dress code. Hence conservative families should avoid or regret. Skimpy dressed ladies all around the resort and all types of bikini at pools creates a romantic atmosphere in resort. The foam party is superb. Breakfast is so great and we had a romantic dinner and it was so delicious.Pork is widely seen on restaurants and public display of affection that may irritate few, particularly muslim families. But it is Pattaya - for bad people (it says good people go to heaven and bad to Pattaya). it is true.
Room we stay was so good and clean. Mattress and amneties are ok. In short, can be recommeded for couples and open minded families. Worth for each penny.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I relay enjoyed my stay with Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya. The rooms were very clean and good. The over all experience was very good, I will recommend this Hotel to all my friends and family members. The staff was very good. The service over all was very good. Only would request to have some thing for veg and specially Asian veg.

We had a fantastic stay, the kids loved it and we all had a great time. The staff was very helpfull and sweet to the kids. Good activities all day long, so the kids had many things to do! We would love to come back another time!

Pro: Location, very convenient. Less than 10 minutes on foot to Central Festival and restaurants.  Just by the beach, even though not on the beach.
Swimming pool, very big and especially fun for kids.
Con: Shower area has no proper separation. The whole bathroom will get totally wet after shower.
Sauna and steam rooms: they have these facilities, but they keep a very low temperature (not hot at all) for both sauna and steam rooms which you won’t sweat even you stay inside for an hour. However, the hotel building itself is very cold. I stayed there in December and the weather was not hot at all, but the hotel had the air condition switched to like 16 degree Celsius and I almost got a cold. Very waste of oil energy.
Breakfast is just so so.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
The Hard Rock Hotel in Pattaya has a beautiful pool, stylish rooms and great location.  What it lacks is communication skills, intelligence and people skills. 
We booked our room for the weekend (Friday and Saturday night).  We are a family with 2 young kids, so the pool and kids club house were essential and part of our stay.  Our hotel package included a few hours of kids club.  The kids club never opened over the weekend.  The reason we were told was because it was Valentines Day on Friday and because of the concert that didn't start until the evening on Saturday.  Of course, this was never advertised when we book our rooms that stated we would have this.
The pool is great, but you are constantly harassed to buy food and drinks from the staff.  We had just arrived and our room wasn't ready, so we camped out at the pool.  We still had several of our things and several staff stared at us because we had the cooler with us that we used in the car.  My friends kid wasn't feeling good the next morning so he got her some waters from the seven eleven and he got a lecture from a staff member about not bringing in outside drinks.  Really?  The child wasn't feeling well.
The life guard all wear shoes and socks while on the life guard stand.  I've never known a life guard that thought shoes and socks made them better swimmers when rescuing children from drowning.  They have whistles and blow them across the pool to the people who mistakenly think that the rafts are for use for everyone.  It is humiliating and rude.  Put someone there to inform people, but don't blow a whistle at them.  Although, what were those people thinking.  Nothing is free at the Hard Rock.  
Big thumbs down.  I am going to write their headquarters also.

Hardrock Pattaya is an awesome place for families. The swimming pool, activities, and level of customer service is second to non. I have frequented this hotel many times for both family and business. Excellent! 5 stars!

Easy access to the beach across the road from the hotel.  The staff is very friendly (except for one rude egg cook haha) but overall a nice hotel that you can feel comfortable staying at.
I think the overall staff at this hotel is very well trained.  They were all friendly, and eager to assist.  The buffet for breakfast was pretty good too.  If I were to stay there again, I would include the breakfast option because of the convenience and it was comparable in quality/selections to the price I paid - so worth it if you just want an easy breakfast option.
Rooms can fill up fast during high travel periods, and we didn't get a room with a King or Queen bed, but they offered to make the two twin beds into one.  We opted not to do that, and the bed size for the twin wasn't that bad!  We ended up sleeping in one bed.  The only difference may have been a couch or something in the single bed room?  We would have liked that because we tend to be in the room more at certain periods of the day, and having a couch would have been nicer to relax on.
This was for a stay on their Rock Royalty floor level (there are two floors 9th and 10th) and I would recommend that because of the access to the lounge on the 9th floor.
If we can't find our usual hotel chain in the area, we would consider staying at this property again.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We stayed from 3rd January to 8th January, the foam party was amazing!Overall a comfortable and very memorable stay.The hotel’s location is excellent.The composer suite we had was perfect with a very nice view.

Pattaya is a mess but your hotel is great. 
I like the rooms, the pool, the breakfast und the guys working there. Don´t go out to Pattaya, 
it is a very dirty und hopeless area. Prostitutes & Ping-Pong inviter everywhere --> I hate it.
The beach is dirty, too.

Hi, first than all im a spanish speaker as a main language and the last thing that I was expecting was to found someone that speaks spanish in Thai. I dont remember the name of the guy at the front desk but  as soon as he noted my latin accent asked me where Im coming from and then all is history I felt very welcome. 
The pool was nice and big I just missed a Hot tube to relax with the bubbles and hot water and I think that they must have one but overall the grounds and pool area are nice. I didnt see prostitutes inside the property or a dating place as some other reviews stated the hotel it is an upscale property and is located in front the beach at the hart of pattaya. 
It is a hard rock hotel so some of the people dress like a rock star or with sexy clothes something that I love, I can remember one night a hot gal that was dressing on the night with a small top and a sheer white pant flashing her black thong... I think that she was european and she was to die for, definitive a highlight for my trip.

our company stayed at this hotel only for one night and we received a great service from hotel staffs which is nice and professional. The hotel location is nice and, near the beach. The view is very stunning. Each room is very hygiene especially the bathroom. We love the food, they are delicious. We are all have enjoyed the party at the drum room. We thank you from the bottom of our heart for creating the great event, we are really appreciated it.

We spent 5 weeks at Hard Rock Hotel and loved every minute of it.
We stayed in their Kids Suite and found the room extremely spacious and fantastic for the kids.
The Kings club staff were exceptional!
Special thanks to Paris, Caroline, Chanel and Ciara which made our stay pleasurable. Ann was also wonderful their Guest Services Manager.
We all had such a great stay and cannot wait to return in December for another visit.
"Keep Rockin"

Great place to stay, room amazing with views out to the sea, right on the beachfront, bit pricey but would recommend to all, from what I could see whether you're here to party or with young family, facilities superb for kids with lifeguards at the pool who definitely take their job seriously and don't stand for any messing about, with organised activities and live music GREAT place.

Very much recommended.  Best maintained. Breakfast is awesome. Right on the beach road. Near to almost all the prominent shows. Swimming pool is really fantastic. I think that is one of the biggest pools in pattayya.

We've been here since 14th of December 2017 and we'll back to Bkk tomorrow. We were here last year and we always think about Hardrock hotel when we have a chance to come here. All I can say is Wow!! How lucky you have them to be your team working here. All your staffs at Hardrock​ hotel. Espacially Takumi, Dofia at Star dinnerz. Me, family and all our beloved friends always think about Hardrock hotel when we have a chance to come to Pattaya. We'll back here as always. Thank you to you all once again for taking good care of us. You all never disappoint us. WE LOVE HARDROCK HOTEL. SEE YOU ALL SOON. Merry Christmas and Happy New Year in advance to you all ♥️ ♥️ ♥️

We are staying at The Hardrock and it is as amazing as always .Its our 3rd time at the hotel in 3 years. We always take the Rockstar suite and there is ample space - master bedroom, kids room, living lobby, 2 balconies and also the beds are very comfortable .
It is definitely one of the best hotels in Pattaya 
Excellent location 
Excellent service 
Ofcourse they have the best pool
Isra and Sumo make sure that we have a good time,

I held my department's meeting for about 40 pax here last September 2019 for 3 days (not including date of arrival and departure). Everything was excellent, from food, hotel rooms, meeting room (spectacular! with excellent view), service is faultless! I must recommend Khun Rusty for his outstanding service. He liaised with me months before the event, during the event and after the event. I couldn't think of any flaws through out our event. He assisted me for 40 pax transfer service (I had people coming from all parts of the world and the hotel was 2 hours from the airport), He recommended excellent restaurants for dinner to accommodate 40 people (He initially suggested hotel but I didn't want as we had spent the whole day in the hotel for the meeting (breakfast, tea breaks and lunch, nonetheless, all the food served at the hotel was marvelous!). We had a factory visit for a half day meeting for one of the meeting days which was one hour away from the hotel, and my boss insisted on a lunch box instead of having a quick lunch. Khun Rusty made it happen where we has an excellent lunch box (beautifully and deliciously pack for 40 people to eat on the bus). Khun Rusty ensure there was a person assisting with technical stuff through out the meeting. There were changes for transportation and other things (too many to list down) but he will always find a way to assist me through out the event. Our event and meeting was perfect, thank you to Khun Rusty, staffs at hard rock hotel and the management of the hotel.

Rooms are clean and the resort is fantastic but what happened the service and staff being happy. I found it very hard to see many staff smiling and greeting people. Not what I expected. The Hard Rock Cafe was the only place in the resort that seemed like the staff gave a stuff about guests

We stayed for 4 nights in a deluxe ocean view room, was a great location in Pattaya with friendly staff. Simon at concierge was fantastic, willing to help us with anything. Breakfast was lovely and they had a great variety. The only downside was the deluxe ocean view room was a deluxe ocean "glimpse" room.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Happy to go back for my 14th (or more) stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in February 2020. Guest Services Manager Wanrudee (aka Ann) was once again magnificent in making me feel welcome as were the countless staff I have known for so many years. It is truly my second home. Because it’s my second home I feel I can comment on changes. This time, for the first time, I cannot lie down on a lounger on the right-hand side of the pool (looking from the hotel). A huge part of the pool area was almost totally unused. On the other parts, people were increasingly crammed together like a 3-star hotel on the Costa del Sol.  Why .. why replace the loungers with white plastic tables .. ? Also, I was there for 9 days and not once did I see anyone use a cabana. There is something seriously wrong when a large part of your property goes unused like this. Hope these comments are helpful. I am not the only one who saw this.. another review from January 2020 said:
“Lots of space near the large pool taken up by cabanas, which no one uses therefore not enough sun beds for hotel guests. All sun beds occupied by 10.30am leaving guests wandering around with towels and nothing else.”
I am sure I will be back again despite the backward steps the hotel has recently taken because the staff are great.
A final note, I should say that my stay was during this unfortunate coronavirus outbreak and some visitors may find attitudes to personal hygiene hard to understand in people from other cultures. When a Chinese guest let loose an enormous sneeze across the breakfast buffet food with no attempt to cover it I really thought I should have stayed at home.

This was not the first time that we had stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel, Pattaya, and we returned because we had enjoyed the hotel and knew the pool.  The staff's attitude was...Hard Rock.  the facilities and the breakfast were good but the highlight was the pool.  With a main pool area, an activities area and a shallows / beach area with day beds and cabanas.  It was good for children although we had been expecting more pool activities which had been the case the previous visit.

Overall great Hotel to stay in. Room was spacious and cleans and hotel location is fantastic. Very close to great eating options and beach is across the street with several water sport activities. Highly recommended place to stay in Pataya if you like like to be in the centre of action.

Room at King Club. Location wise this is one of the best hotels in pattaya. Very close to center pattaya mall, Big C, Mike Mall. You can see the beach and sea from your room if booked sea facing room. In hotel sports activites are awesome. I will return this hotel again in future

We have enjoyed a lot in hotel, especially in pool and dining area. We surely recommended to Hard Rock Hotel to our near and dear, friends. I want to give you a suggestion that every evening you should arrange a little party in pool area for all guests.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The only hotel that compares is the Hilton, which is more than double the price. Staff is friendly and professional. Wide array of amenities and activities. Central location on beach road. Close to the action, but far away enough to be good for families. At this particular price point (~$100 USD/night) there is no better place to stay. I highly recommend!!

I would never recommend this motel.
I stayed there for about a week and had issues.  I asked to speak to a Manager for three days and not even the courtesy of coming to see me or talk to me about my complaint.
I booked through a trusted travel agent who recommended the hotel beacsue of its connection with Qantas Holidays.
I deliberately booked for 2 people.  Paid Qantas for 2 people yet they keeped charging 900 baht for a second person to be in the room.  This is what is regarded in Australia as misleading and deceptive conduct.  
I was told when booking in that there was a mistake and I had to go to a differtent room.  There was no warddrobe.  What a joke.
I have told my agent to never recommend this hotel ever again.
Mugford

Had a great time at the HRC hotel, loads of events organised through out the day.
Breakfast buffet was well stocked and a variety of foods available.
Staff were very helpful and friendly both at the Hotel and Cafe
Beach is 15mtr for the pool, mall / food court 5mins walk (below Hilton Hotel), bars / walking street 20mins walk. 
Only negative point was the interior of the hotel, which needs updating. Starting to look run down.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
My husband & I was really impressed with how "ALL" the staff were so polite & helpful to the guests. The reception staff were so helpful from check-in to check-out, all pool attendants (K.Boston) & F&B staff provides great service & HK staff were very nice.
The hotel facilities are really great. 
I just had a little problem with the bugs at the beach pool area but we will definitely recommend Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya to our family & friends.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
This was my first trip to Thailand and I stayed at the Hard Rock Pattaya based on a recommendation from a friend and I couldn't pass that recommendation on to you highly enough! The value for the quality of the property, the amenities, and service is absolutely outstanding. It's not a 5 star hotel but I certainly had a 5 star experience here. 
After I checked in and saw my room (it was a standard, decent 3 star hotel room...but one that I live in 30 weeks a year for my job) I decided I wanted something better and they offered me an upgrade to the King's Suite at a price I couldn't refuse. And the room was absolutely spectacular!
It had one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in, a huge bathroom with a separate shower and giant tub, a big couch, and two balconies overlooking the sea. Even if you don't get a suite, make sure you get a room on the south side of the building so you have a view of Pattay City and the bay. And not all rooms have balconies so request that if you like having one.
Being the premier room in the hotel, it obviously had access to the King's Club lounge, but they have many other rooms with these privileges, and I highly recommend the upgrade. It includes breakfast in the morning and hot food and cocktails in the evening. I felt like we ate and drank enough to otherwise pay for the upgrade itself. You also got what amounted to a private front desk and concierge service. The service the staff up there provided was outstanding.
The pool at the Hard Rock was absolutely amazing! It's massive, to begin with. It has a swim up bar, a sandy area, a basketball hoop, and plenty of covered, cushioned lounge chairs to relax in. The pool staff also gets involved and organizes games and activities such as volleyball, water polo, basketball and many other fun things you can participate in. I found myself spending most of my afternoons at the pool before going out to the crazy nightlife of Pattaya.
The staff at the Hard Rock are all very well trained and provide excellent service. I never had a bad experience with one of them. They were all very friendly and eager to help in any way you needed. They made you feel like you were at home.
The location of the hotel is also perfect. It's about a 15 minute walk or 5 minute tuk tuk ride to walking street, but far enough away from all of the noise. There's also plenty of food options and shopping right nearby on Beach St. and on 2nd Rd.
One other thing I like to mention about hotels in foreign countries is the wifi...it was flawless here. Super fast and immediate connections in all areas of the property. You logged in once and your device was good for the rest of your stay. You didn't have to log in every day or every time you moved to a different area. When you came back to the hotel after going out, it would automatically connect as soon as you stepped foot on the property. This was definitely the best wifi I encountered anywhere on my month-long trip to Asia.
I had such a good time here that I extended my room for a few more nights before heading over to Phuket. When I come back to Pattaya, I will definitely stay at the Hard Rock again.
One piece of advice though: don't exchange money in the hotel...their rates are TERRIBLE compared to what you get on the street.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: The hotel is located and strategic location and convenient. the beach is just across the road. The weekend stay was quite exciting as there was a pool party. The breakfast spread was very good and included a global selection.

Caring and helpful staff, family-liked environment, good facilities, especially the excellent swimming pool. 
They are quite considerate and free-upgrade our rooms; the staff named Green initiatively provided valuable sightseeing guidance and coordinate transport for us; what makes me feel warmhearted is they specially prepared birthday cake for me.

All staff have service mind and rapid response. We have smooth meeting. I can contact staff all the time, well management, good service. Our CEO and management team appreciated. They will be there again.

Even if we couldn't use the jacuzzi because it was out of service, the pools were really beautiful. About the hotel, everything was great, the music, the band, the rooms, the fact that we could use guitars.The place where is the hotel just in front of the sea. The food was also great, unfortunately we didn't got to the hotel restaurant but the breakfast was suprising with a good amont of various food...Moreover, the service provided by the hotel in order to reserve a taxi to visit all around the places, I would recommand it : for exemple, thanks to the album the woman in charge of this gave us because we saw many beautiful places and tha taxi are clean, comfortable and the driver are as nice as the hotel's crew.

I think its one of the best in Pattaya with value for money. We were staying on 10th floor  Rock Royalty Sea View room with many benefits like breakfast at the club, free drink during sunset, whole day snacks etc. But only one of the lady house keeping staff was very arrogant. Check in and check out exclusive on 9th floor was very fast.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Me and my family having a great time in the resort ... especially the facilities like kids club and the swimming .. it also have outdoor activity like rock climbing that my kids enjoy it and the kayaking too

Another memorable stay.  Never disappointed. Would stay again. Newly renovated pools is amazing for drinks or just lounging. Pool for kids with great slides. Great. Amazing breakfast selection. 
Rooms always clean.  Great attentive staff with smile on the face. Can't fault it...again:)
See you next year

We stayed in this hotel as part of our honeymoon trip in Thailand last year.
The hotel was in a great location, just across the street from the beach and walking distance to the "red district" part of Pattaya.
We stayed in other Hard Rock hotels previously and this one wasn't the best, but still very nice. We had a nice beach view from our room.
In general great hotel, but a bit overpriced for what it was compared to other Hard Rock hotels.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
This is the best property in Pattaya, especially for family with kids. So many facilities to keep your child entertained. Amazing staff. It has altogether a different vibe. The room size is big, bathroom size is decent. It is bang on the beach road, with Central Festival Mall, just 850mtr. You can easily get tuk tuk right from the outside & royal garden plaza, walking street etc. are just a short drive away. Each floor is beautifully decorated. The spread at the buffet breakfast is vast and food tasted amazing on all the 3 days. It has a huge pool with separate Jacuzzi section in between & a swim up bar too. It also has steam, sauna & gym facilities which are upto the mark. The best part is it kids pool which is one of the biggest kids pool I have ever seen. It has an artificial beach by the side with beach beds. Beautiful beach huts are available for a small rental where you can laze around for hours, seeing your children play, sipping your drink, taking a dip in the pool & relaxing on the lounge beds. There are various slides in the kids pool which adds to the fun. It has kids club too. This comes at a very reasonable rental. We had an appointment for Onsen bath & spa. It was treatment for 5hours. We left our 4yr son at the kids centre where he had so many options to play, even beds if he felt like dozing off & they also offered him a meal, all this at a very small price. At the end of it, when we came to take back our son, he was so indulged & happy that he wanted to stay back  for some more time. One more thing I would like to mention is that we used their baby sitting service as well. Initially I was a bit skeptical whether we should leave our 4yr son with baby sitter alone in the hotel. But we were assured that the baby sitter is not someone who comes from outside.Instead, she would be a senior inhouse staff from the hotel. That built our confidence more. We had to go for partying & had called the baby sitter at 11pm for 3hrs. We had thought that we will make our child sleep early so that the babysitter just has to supervise the sleeping baby. But unfortunately our son was fully awake when the baby sitter came. Within minutes the baby sitter made friends with our son & soon they were playing together with the toys. We had instructed her to make him sleep when it is 12:30at night and dim all the lights. When we came back at 2am, the lights were dim, our son was sleeping & the baby sitter was sitting right next to him. She informed us that he slept on time & was a very good child & told us what conversations he was doing with her. We were so satisfied & happy that our son was in very good hands. Her name was Nam, & I extend my special thanks to her for taking such good care of my son.
Overall it is one of the best properties I have stayed at with family. Highly recommended for travellers with family as there is so much to do inside the property itself for the kids. Whenever we come back to Pattaya, we will stay here for sure.

I'm a regular in Thailand and Pattaya is one of those areas that I need to visit because of my work. This property is in a good location, smack in the middle of the "happening" Pattaya, with beach just across the road.
Open air car park is free and safe with 24-hrs guard. Property is a little old & dated but rooms were updated with all the modern mod-con. I booked the Deluxe Sea View room with the 10th Anniversary package, that comes with free wifi and breakfast and unlimited on-demand pay movie.
Room size is OK, sound-proofing good, balcony has 2 deck chair and a small table as well as cloth-drying rack. My room is directly above the pool where I saw lots of programs throughout the 3 days I was there, both for adults & kids. Even though music and games were being played just below my window, I didn't hear any noise if I closed the balcony window. Block out curtain really block out sun if needed. Bathroom has no tub. Tooth paste & brush has to be requested. 
Housekeeping needs to improve their effort as I found unwashed mug in my room when I first arrive and the tiled area of the floor always felt sticky even after housekeeping was done. Bed quality was OK. Pillows were too soft for my liking and I requested for firmer ones, delivered fast upon request. Room service was fast and good. Breakfast with good selection.
What really upset me is the wifi connection. It's really bad......so bad I requested 7 passwords which they promised will be better than the previous ones, but sadly not. I ended up paying using my data roam and teether through my phone. The signal was non-existence in bathroom or balcony, even in room, you can probably read some mails without attachment It's hovering between 30kb/s so web-surfing is out of the question.
It's within walking to most F&B joint, bars & pubs, shopping mall etc. Location is great for first time visitor. 
The staff at HRP are great fun young people. Check-in staff were fast (the fastest check in experience I had), concierge helpful, breakfast wait staff were fantastic and remembered my preferred seating and drink by the second day which was really impressive and I see pool attendants organizing fun programs. 
I would stay in the hotel again even though I didn't give it an all-star rating. I hope the management gets to read this and improve on the weakness of their wifi and recognize their staff for the effort they have made to guest like me. If you must use fast internet, I would suggest buying a data card from airport or mobile shop and just bite the bullet and pay a little more and I believe you'll enjoy this hotel as much as I did. In fact, I have decided I will stay in this hotel again when I return in April for work.

Superb location. Love the 10 baht bus around town. We were staying in hard rock at least 6 years now. We will recommend to our friends. But  food not that great if I say about food I will give 5 out of 10.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Excellent stay
All the staff were very friendly
The front desk staff and the travel desk staff were very helpful to accommodate to our needs.
Rooms were clean
Location was good
No complains
Definitely will come back for another visit

I really enjoy staying in this hotel. Good staffs, efficient service, good food.. I will come back..definitely.  Thanx to booking manager, Mr Bell, Paris from reception, X from concierge as well as the hotel driver (can't remember his name) and also to all HR staffs for being so kind....
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We are a family of 3 with a 5 years old kid and stayed here during Christmas.  It is located near Central Festival (10min walk) and opposite of the beach.  The check in and check out was fast and smooth.  The room was small and had a weak shower. The breakfast was ok with a decent selection and almost no waiting time. The pool was big and nice but the problem is the Russian kids there were playing very rough and the pool staff allows them. Anyway, we had a very nice time.

Very good location nice direct on beach road so not far away from all important places in Pattaya. Unfortunately extremely busy in December and to many people going same time to breakfast.I come anyway again.

I have to admit I was skeptical about this choice of hotel. I thought it all might be a gimmick, with all the memorabilia and the rock 'n roll persona. But I was pleasantly surprised by the willingness of the staff to tend to your every need, and with the generally 'funky' feel about the place. My wife took advantage of the gym and she was very happy with the facility and instructor. We didn't use the Spa or some other amenities so I can't comment. We had free access to a business suite that I didn't actually use but it would have been ideal for meetings or small conferences etc. The pool was awesome and there's always something going on in that general area. The food choices are limited to the Hard Rock Cafe Burgers/Pizza etc and a few extra dishes but it's a bit light on for variety and I think it's just a little expensive for what it is. Room service was prompt and there's a good collection of free movies on demand in your room for when you want to chill or recover. The Hotel is ideally situated and provides easy access to Pattaya via Beach or Second Road. Overall, very good and I would stay there again without hesitation.

I can't say enough about the staff at the Hardrock in Pattaya! Their dedication, hard work, and entertainment skill are unmatched. It is a wonderful family oriented facility with awesome activities for both adults and kids. It's the STAFF that makes this place magic. Keep up the great work! See you again soon.

Nicely done up place... Good courteous staff... Had heard a lot about this property from friends and relatives...  Specially about their in-house activities... But unfortunately there didn't seem much of them around when I stayed here, except for the 'foam party' that's organized every Saturday... And this too seemed kind of dead coz of lack of participation.
I've had my share of embarrassment when a lady staff knocked once at my door and without cross checking opened the room door with her service key and stepped in for cleaning! Come on guys! This is not done! Have you heard of something called privacy!!!???!!!
The breakfast is elaborate, but being a pure vegetarian my choices were pretty limited. Considering the number of Indians putting up here, I think they need to tweak their menu. And guys please change the vegetarian menu! Its monotonous seeing the same stuff day after day!
The new year's eve gala dinner and party was compulsory and they charged a fortune for the same, but again very very limited vegetarian options and frankly the so called 'party' wasn't up to Hard Rock standards! It actually seems like a waste of money and time!
The program could have been much more interesting and better had they added guest participation and variety rather than the band of 3 artists performing and hopelessly trying to entertain the guests all night long!
A sheer waste of new years eve and money. Frankly, the price I paid for my stay and the gala dinner were exorbitant, I did have some expectations, but now they all seem a waste and I go back longing for more and feeling cheated! I still can't figure out why I paid so much to put up here!
The staff is no doubt good but considering the brand and the tariff I feel they need to roll in English speaking staff. Currently the room intercom is directed to an English speaking operator who tries to sort things for u, but at the end of it all, one has to deal with non English speaking staff! Is this hard rock standard?
My verdict: overly priced property, not worth the money. Some might not agree, but considering the new year's package one IS left longing for more. My experience wasn't too good. Neither the property nor the event was worth the price!

From September 17-20 we had a fantastic stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in Pattaya, we were a team of people of approx 30 from around the World. 
Must say that the Hard Rock Team was just great, friendly, goos and professional arrangements from facilities to the food. 
My favorite hotel in Pattaya, will come back again.
All the best
Kenth

We stayed here for 2 weeks in superior city view and we loved it the staff were really freindly with plenty of entertainment on for adults and children, dacor was a bit dated but didnt affect our stay in anyway overall good value for money
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Very good location, just only a few minutes to go to the beach.  Just only 10 mins to go to Central Festival.  The food is excellent - Thai Food & Dessert make me unforgettable.  Staff are very friendly.

This hotel is VERY nice compared to some of the "sketchy" hotels in Pattaya. The hotel is "guest" friendly for those that are staying there. The grounds are safe & secured by security at both entrances (which keeps pan handlers & street vendors out trying to sell you stuff). I would encourage you to book a room that has breakfast included. The breakfast is great & has a very wide selection. There is a Pizza Place on site that has a pizza oven. The pizza is ok, not the best that I have had. But all the employees/staff that I had contact with were very nice. Boston who worked the pool was a nice guy that provided plenty of information & answered any questions I had.
The location of this hotel is on Pattaya road. You can walk to the main area or take a 10baht truck to get pretty much anywhere you need to go. My room was nice. Very clean & no issues. I would stay here again. The pool is really nice too. Lots of room, plenty of chairs & lots to do.

we had new year at hardrock wife and two kids
hardrocks best asset is there staff ,all of them are fantasic thats what took us back there again
my only bad critasism of hardrock is compulsory gala dinner
and you cant get out of it they will charge you even if you dont go
new year event cost me $833 au wife and two kids and itsa rip off
food was good ,entertainment was okay, free beerand wine 6.30pm to 9.30 pm after that time you paid for your drinks but because it was newyears eve the price of drinks were higher than normal  nights. i think that sort cost  leaves a bad image of the hardrock. we love going to hardrock because the staff are fantasic but i think we may be going else where next time.
also many people from russia stay here now
garry
australia

Excellent choice to stay in Pattaya. We requested non-smoking room and got the nice room as requested. Also, the service is excellent since we reach to the hotel. Food is good as well. Big swimming pool near the beach. It is also close to the beach we can just walk to see the sunset.

The room is very small and there is noisy in the morning.. it was bit stressful 
Anyway its clean and nice
And the dinner buffet was terrible.....nothing to eat
Swiming pool is good but cavana need to be paid
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Loved the Kings Club lounge. Staff were polite and efficient. A special mention to "Anne" which made our stay wonderful and to "Toffee" which always made the perfect Cocktail! The pool is fabulous, huge and clean. We will definitely come back again!

Hard Rock Hotel is nice location at central pattaya with all the attractive at walking distance. Pools and water activities seem to be the embodiment of fun for all ages. All of staff nice and friendly.

The hotel was a bit distant from walking Street but right on the beach of Pattaya the rooms were very clean and we loved our stay at this hotel staff were very friendly I'd definitely suggest this hotel anyone visiting Pattaya

we feel like home when we come back to hard rock Pattaya, the best place to stay therelovely People working good Music and nice decoration, breakfast very tasty only the Rooms could be a Little more improved not the newest ones
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
The breakfast was tidy and the staff were very helpful.
The hotel you want to visit again.
The best hotel in Pattaya Beach Road. A hotel that satisfies a variety of customers, including lovers, families, and business.

The hotel is located within the proximity of all the lovely places you would want to visit in Pattaya. Very well maintained, and cosy rooms. The house staff is very amiable and they take a good care of the guests. The staff at the reception helped us arrange a local taxi for our 3 days stay at a very reasonable rate and also accommodated our late check-in & late check-out requests despite peak vacation time. Lovely place and & highly recommended for a safe and pleasurable stay, for couples family and friends. Thanks much Hard Rock. Will be my most preferred stay when i visit Pattaya.

We stayed at hard Rock on 4,5,6 & 7th January 2012...This is an excellent location and excellent hotel. Me and my wife stayed in this hotel for 4 days and found that it is excellent for Kids also. Througout the day there were activities around the pool and we used to pass our time seeing kids pay around the pool with hotel staff coordinating lots of activities...
The hotel room was clean and I strongly advise that you should look for room with a pool view and if possible with a terrace. The outside view is excellent...Hotel is strongly recommended and I would advise that in Pattaya this is the place to be for young couples and offcourse for couples with kids.....
One more thing...This place has a rocking Foam Party on every Saturday...so do try if you can stay here on saturday night for a special bonanzaaaaa....
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
We stayed here as a married couple over Christmas and had a very nice stay. The hotel is in a great spot to explore beach road and all of the many soi’s that lead off it and you can easily walk or jump on the baht bus to walking street.
Our room was supposedly city view but it was more overlooking the roof and the side of another hotel but luckily we didn’t spend a lot of time in the room or on the balcony during this part of our trip.
We were bed and breakfast which suited us fine, a word of caution the restaurant gets packed and it can be a bit of a fight for food so take a table outside near the pizzeria for a quieter experience.
Undoubtedly the main feature of the hotel is the pool which is great for all ages and the music and the staff only add to the excellent atmosphere. Also you can get draught or canned beers and the food menu if decent as well. We liked the fact that when joined by friends there were also tables and chairs poolside to sit at and play cards, drink and chat. If you need supplies head out through the lobby and the car park and there is a family mart and 7/11 right across the road so no need to walk down the busy beach road. Overall I would recommend for all types of visitors unless you are looking for somewhere really quiet but the if that’s the case why would you even be considering a Hard Rock?!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: This is our second stay in this property,and we really enjoyed it. This is the place for kids with the largest and undoubtedly the most happening Pool in Pattaya. We went for the new renovated Top Floor Rooms with the Ocean View. Geat service and well located between the beach road and the 2nd road. Lots of activities for the children throughout the day. Wonderful and well maintained Pool area. The kids in the family love this place and wants to visit this place again.

Hard rock hotel – one of our favorite “homes” in Pattaya. We have been staying here many times, I and my son, 9 years old.
The pool is large and looks like a seaside resort with palm trees! And some pool activities are fun for my son! They really take care of kids!
The renovated rooms were clean and nice. The seaview room without balcony is bigger. Fast cleaning service. Good communication with the lobby. If any problems, the staff will solve it! Very nice managers!  Thanks!
The location is perfect, close to everything. 
Improvements: Buffet breakfast is ok, just ok. It could be more dishes like pork, fish, chicken.  Some hotels give you 2−4 dishes.  Fruit selection could also be a little bit better − with more Thai fruits.  Same about the nice lounge upstairs: more Thai fruits (and no apples).
Well, free Internet at least at the lobby would be nice. However – if you book via their website you will get free Internet package. 
The staff here is really very nice! My son was very happy here! This is a perfect place for a family. Of course we will come back in near future. This is one of our “homes”!

A nice property with great facilities & staff.  The location is superb for your walk to all nearby locations.The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable.  Breakfast spread was excellent and the restaurant staff were very attentive.  My family and i had a great time staying in HardRock Pattaya.  Looking forward to come again.

We came as a group of 5 and stayed from the 25th to the 29th of December. The location of the hotel is fantastic and is ideally located near the strip and the beach. The pool was excellent and had wonderful games. The Hard rock cafe was the best place to hang out in the evenings and had a wonderful manager by the name of Joseph who made us feel as though we had known him for years!, he even helped us out by writing a sheet of paper as to what vegetarian thai food that we could eat at any thai restaurant. The room service was excellent and all the loose change that we had kept on the table were untouched but the entire table was clean! We stayed on the 8th floor facing the sea and it was wonderful, Breakfast spread was nice but not very vegetarian friendly although milk,cereals,fresh fruits and veggies were available but that is not something to complain about!

Not our first stay at this hotel but our first for a couple of years or so, and the first since it's refurbishment, we decided to stay there for our Christmas break.
We were welcomed as return guests by the very pleasant, and efficient, young lady at check-in and we were soon in our room. I have to say the refurbished rooms are very good, we were lucky enough to have a corner room with a very good sea view. Everything about the room was excellent, however housekeeping let them down slightly by failing to replace coffee, water and even toilet paper when they made up our room.
Breakfast was very good, they were very busy but everything was kept topped up by the staff. The restaurant doubles as Starz Diner, we eat there one night, and very nice it was to.
The pool area is very good, with the staff ensuring that the kids, of all ages, were kept entertained and drinks and snacks were readily available.
We really enjoyed our stay and will certainly return. We were hoping to extend our stay over the New Year and whilst there was plenty of availability, there was a compulsory charge of about $285 per person for their New Year "Gala Dinner", we have been before and it was ok, not worth the price though. There was no choice, if you stayed on NYE you had to attend the Gala Dinner, or at least pay for it, we stayed somewhere else.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I recently spent 2 nights at this hotel with a crowd of more than 30 friends celebrating a mutual buddy's 50th birthday. The facilities are superb and we spent time in the Kings Club where you can check in, have breakfast, use internet or just chill with a cup of coffee and a danish. The staff are extremely attentive and nothing is too much trouble. Early evening we had sundowner drinks in the Soul Lounge on the ground floor with a lovely ambiance, tasty snacks and staff to look after your every whim. I'm definitely going back soon.

Great looking Hotel, Nice pool however pool water a bit cold, considering how warm the sea water is, Staff do not understand English that well , so a lot of times there is a communication problem when you require something, The Hotel rate online are good however to eat and drink at the Hotel is very expensive. Breakfast very good at the Hotel, perfect position across the road from the beach and walking distance to shopping , child friendly hotel with a lot of activities for the kids.

check in 20th Dec 2018 - Check out 22nd Dec 2018 , front office was so help full + welcome drink was given , very smooth check in and follow as what we requested , i was given room 622 - smoking room , the view from my room was fantastic, room was super clean with all the amenities , breakfast was ok ...suggested to have more Halal Breakfast or Menu , what i can eat for breakfast is the fruits / bread & eggs , swimming pools was excellent + sauna & steam , over all this was my second stay in 2018 , the services was excellent , keep smiling & keep it up . Merry Christmas & Happy New Year

The hotel has unique style, good geographical location, considerate service, clean and sanitary room, many kinds of breakfast, impressive Christmas Eve dinner, interactive entertainment, large swimming pool, very suitable for vacation.I like the hotel very much, looking forward to staying again!

The staff are excellent that's what makes a hotel stay so memorable not the soap you use or the clout of the swimming pool or the size of the television it's people 
The staff including management would always greet you remember you and advice you nothing was to much to ask 
Thank you and I have no hesitation to recommend this hotel because I have stayed in many others and the personal touch is what matters

kindly, clean, beautiful, funny, good quality, cool, good location, service is very kindly and funny.
sea view at the high floor is very nice!
always smiled for me :) very thank you!!
next see you again!

everything was super...
i am enioy at most the kind friendly and  very obliging staff!!
The rooms have high standart,. the kings club lounge are great all day.
The best pool in town
and don´t for get the fantastic pool foam  parties . and the Hardock cafe with great live music.

Super fun time in the Hardrock Hotel! We were friend and family group we all had a great time in the swimming pool! we'll going back there for sure. Hotel breakfast was also delicious and variety of food.

Excellent stay, pool was great and food good. Rock Star lounge a little too crowded but it was NY so I guess the hotel was very full. Staff were excellent especially the lounge staff. I was worried that it may have been noisy but we all slept like logs. I would definitely stay again.

The staff at the Hard Rock Hotel, Pattaya were super friendly and helpful. I like that they always put  smile in their face and greet us at any time. The hotel was very clean, the overall surrounding was awesome, the room was good but perhaps can do better decor in the room to portray the rocking side of the hotel. I definitely will return to experience it again :)
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Back to one of my favorite Hotel in Pattaya, my last visit to this Hotel was few years ago.
Still excellent location and a very friendly service, good buffet breakfast and nice outdoor swimming pool with a bar.
Special thanks for the helpful service from the door boys organizing all requested services like car etc.
Th only missing point is that there is not more the information / service desk where you can book your golf or other tours.
In any case is remaining my favorite Hotel in Pattaya.

located in pattaya beach, near to the beach, pattaya night market and walking street, good place for relax, enjoying the beach sunrise, the room was too small for this rate place, but everything was good, good breakfast too
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Decided to go for New Year's Eve party expecting a Hard Rock experience and then spend 4 more nights there. The New Year's Eve party started off well with a great buffet but went pretty much downhill after that, the 'Red Balloons' band dominated the stage and to be frank was pretty bad (much better bands in the town), they played a lot of pop along with the rock and to my disappointment at one point were even playing that annoying Brazilian singalong pop song at which point we left and went into town. 
My view is that it is a hotel that tries to please everybody but as a result cannot legitimately call itself a Hard Rock hotel. It should be renamed the Pop Hotel. It's a more of a family / package tour hotel than a Rock Hotel. Although, maybe I misunderstand the brand or had too
high expectations.
We went for the cheapest room 'city view' was very average and with a total bill of around 1k
Euro for 5 days including party tickets there is much better value elsewhere even at New Year. Not possible to request a balcony when reserving only when checking in so when we arrived to have a balcony we had to take a twin vs double and it was a smoking room at one of the lowest floors with a view on the restaurant roof. The reception told us that they would notify us if a better room became available but nothing came available. Not a bad experience but not good enough to stay again.Good place to take a family I think.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Stayed here for 16 nights from 30th January, room was average 2 double bed city view balcony room on 7th floor.  SO little storage that we never totally unpacked, bedding and towels have seen better days, holes and fraying, shower water pressure was poor despite us reporting this.  TV entertainment in room were good. Pool area was ok as long as you are happy to chase the sun around throughout the day and be down early to reserve loungers.  Week-ends are busy and pool and breakfast becomes a bit chaotic, breakfast was ok through had to have tea pot replaced three times one morning when it was served cold.  Pancakes and French toast are pre-cooked meaning you never get them hot.  Staff sometimes are just doing the job and not really interested I asked reception about information on Kings Club as considered an upgrade she advised me to check the internet for what was included. A special mention to Peace who was a real Rock Star.  Would I return probably not  - this is my review of my experience
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We recently stayed here for 12nights and had a great time. All the staff were very welcoming and more than helpful with any matter. Very friendly and professional and always saying hello and smiling. Great service with the rooms and always well cleaned and staff always at hand to say hello and ask after you. If you stay with children the entertainment on offer by the pool is amazing and all the kids there loved it and were having a great time. Cannot fault any part of what they did for us and offered and the best customer service wherever I have stayed. Was my first time there and think it will not be the last.

Breakfast was excellent, loved the poolarea and the gym. It was a bit expensive to eat and drink at the hotel so we never did that. Instead we went outside the hotel to eat and drink. The staff was great

We got a reasonable deal for our stay here as it is  quite pricy for Pattaya.Excellent location on Beach Road 15 metres from the beach itself.
 However,who needs the beach when the pool is so cool!The obligatory poolside bar or if you choose not to leave your sun loungers, the cheerfull waiters will bring you your fruit shakes,beers and burgers!
The pool area is a great place to let your kids hang out too with a basketball hoop in the pool and games of water polo,a rock climbing wall all on hand to keep them entertained.
 My personal favourite was the health and fitness facilities.A decent gym session followed by a sauna,steam room and then the ice cold plunge pool, and I was feeling a little less guilty from all those mango shakes and fries.
As with all Hard Rock cafes/hotels there are plenty of cool rock memorabilia to check out.
Rooms are great with large beds and large and cool shower rooms.Staff are friendly and helpful.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Stayed from 29th january to february 1st. Had to say that this hotel never disappoints me. Been there for more than 6 times and what I recieve every time is the smile and services from the associates. 
From the moment i arrived at the hotel, the bellmans greeted and as always, very friendly and rock! At the front desk, me and boyfriend were lucky enough to have Gislene (if i saw her nametag correct) to help us with c/i. At first, she gave us the last room, but since i dont really like to be on the last room, i didnt even go in and decided to go down and once again she handled me. I got "upgraded" to the 10th floor. I know it's quite annoying to change this at that at the opera system cause i also worked in hotels before so i know how she would feel! Anyways, each time i passed by the front desk, she would smile and even talk to us again.. Hope she will be promoted soon cause she has lots of potential.. *credits to her*
Bbf was fine, it has quite big range of food to choose. Pool was good and associates even better. Location is good. i dont really have anything else to comment about cause i enjoyed my stay and will definitely be back soon and look for her again! 
I also requested a birthday cake cause it was my boyfriend's birthday on the 31st, and it didn't failed! Thanks Hard Rock! U guys rockkk~
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
A Wonderful Hotel to be in with Kids.  From Checkin to rooms to Ambienace,  all strikingly created to make one feel at hom.  Plenty to do for Kids, they would love to be in the Hotel and relax, if they have time from all the activities conducted there.
Food can be better but a place to discover and be confortably esconced in.  IF we do visit again it will be unmistakabely Hard Rock

Great place to stay with a friend. All of the staff were knowledgeable, efficient, and pleasant at every interaction - spanning from arrival through to departure. 
The gala dinner was a great place to chill for the early evening, with the laser party finishing 2017 with a bang! 
My friend and I stayed at another hotel for our first four nights in Pattaya (and booked Hard Rock last minute to try and save our New Years Eve after a really awful experience) and truly regret only being able to stay at Hard Rock for one evening. If I ever come back, this will be he only place for me. 
It’s close to the beach, shops, and everything else you need. Honestly, you could stay within the hotel for your entire holiday and not need anything else. 
Thank you again, Hard Rock, for saving our holiday!

This is our second stay in Hard Rock Pattaya! Best place for family with kids! O'strangers the Rock band was also great!! they made they made our stay more special!nWould definitely stay again here!!!

Great Hotel in a great location. The staff at the hotel are fantastic, the amenities are very good with a great swimming pool. Rooms are a good size and state,  with soft comfortable beds that have both firm and soft pillows. A bit more expensive than other hotels but worth it.

Room very clean, staff friendly not only hotel staff but hard rock shop and cafe staff. Food not so many choice especially for Muslim guests. Need more improvement. Pool okay for adult, but small area for kids.

Very nice staff, people around the hotel are friendly and funny. Pool activities are great and especially suitable for people with younger children. New rooms are nice as well, really looks like a 5* hotel.  Prices are good. Overall one of the best hotels I have been to and I have travelled a lot all over the world in 5* hotels.
