Guys around the pool will make your vacation smooth and relaxing. And if you like sports like basketball , volleyball or water polo- that is the place to look for.

We spent only 1 night over our weekend here which we think it is quite short stay but we experienced hotel's facilities i.e. pool and restaurant. The hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful. The foam party was awesome ! There are variety kind of activities which I'd like to join rather than spend my time out of the hotel. 
There are many kinds of food served here and really tasty. 
I really had an enjoyable stay and promise that I will be back there soon !
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: This hotel is very excellent. The location of the hotel is perfect as it's right in front of the beach and has several malls, restaurants, etc around it. The facilities are impeccable and very cleanly especially in the pools, saunas, gym, spa, etc.

Really enjoyed a 4 day break at the hotel. The staff were friendly and always there to help. Breakfast was great offering a wide range of choices. The Hard Rock Cafe was so good we ate there twice. Really great location and the pool area is amazing.

We visited for my birthday holiday , it is a great hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, the rooms are spacious and modern, wide choice of food on the breakfast buffet, loads of amenities... the only problem is alcohol a bit expensive for daytime drinking .
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: and staff friendly and service mind.The buffet is volume and good taste.Music hotel too.The swimming pool is so nice.The breakfast is ok.Not too much but it's ok.The room is good view,sea view.I appricate with hotel.

The location of this hotel is good. Rooms are ok, not as expected. The carpets in the rooms are dirty. House keeping needs improvement for cleaniness of the rooms. The swimming pool has been constructed very nicely, but again looking at the dirty water in the pool you shall have to think twice before taking a dip into it. Lot of activities in the hotel besides the swimiing pool and water games in the pool, but only if they maintain the pool neatly. If anyone visiting HARD ROCK PATTAYA, please ensure that you inform the reception atleast 30 to 40 minutes before your check out as the reception takes at least 30 minutes for your chekout. I was just amout to miss my SIC van to Bangkok as the reception took 35 minutes to settle my bill. If so I visit Pattaya again I would like to try another hotel for which you get your value for money.

We stayed at this hotel for a few nights, after spending a great few days in Bangkok. I must say that I liked this place… but there were a few points that does not allow me to give this a full 5 star rating… hence the 4 point rating of my review.
So, here it is:
POSITIVE POINTS:
+ As usual, the Hard Rock franchise give you the feel of being among the famous… and in Pattaya it does not disappoint. 
+ Staff (with the exception of a couple of people) are extremely friendly, helpful and simply very pleasant.
+ The hotel is clean in every area… so a huge thumbs up to the staff taking care of this.
+ Room with a view over the sea is fantastic... NICE sunset from the 8th Floor.
+ Pool area is pleasant, safe and well taken care of. Nice array of activity… despite not having so many guests due to COVID.
+ Hard Rock Café at the bottom end of the property is very pleasant… and I appreciate the fact that (even though it goes into the night) you cannot hear it in the room.
+ Central location… easy walking distance to many options of shopping / restaurants / entertainment / across the street from the beach… etc.
SO-SO POINTS:
+/- Room is rather small, yet still comfortable.
+/- I (personally) do not understand the need for a STEP UP to get into the bathroom. Almost tripped and fell late at night, when needing to use the toilet. This step into the bathroom makes no sense at all.
+/- Breakfast was JUST OK… I could not understand why there was NO cheese on none of the days that I was there. Juices… not fresh – something like the ones you buy at the supermarket.
NEGATIVE POINTS:
- WHY… WHY… WHY do certain employees give me the sensation that they are trying to make money on the side? I asked for a taxi to the local hospital (for COVID testing before my flight back). It took about 15 minutes for the taxi to arrive… and cost me 150 Bhat. It is literally 500 meters away… simply worth 35 Baht. SURELY some sort of “system” to favour their friends at a commission. 
- Asked for a taxi to the Airport… wanted me to pay 2500 Bhat??? I came from Bangkok, and paid 1500. When I argued with him that 2500 is not an option… he came down to 1500 – which was what I paid… but the sensation I got was that they run a scheme to get the most money out of tourists.
- Last point on the negative side… is the price for the night. I am sure that I paid too much, and despite liking the stay here, I felt that it is overpriced.
SUMMING UP:
Maybe next time, I will stay on the other beach... and not on this side. The negative points really left a bad taste in my mouth.

The overall experience was awesome, from the band members (Staff) to the buffet breakfast and the facilities too. The staff are friendly and they would assist in anything to the best of their abilities. What I like is also that if you ever need some recommendations on where is go to explore in Pattaya, they would be more that happy to suggest some of the famous places to visit.
Furthermore, you can also rent a guitar with a deposit of 10,000 baht.
Location wise, I would say it's conveniently located in an area with convenience stores (7-11 and FamilyMart) just 5 minutes away from the front entrance and malls and food located about 5 to 10 minutes walking distance away from the back exit of the hotel (Near the Café/ Pool). The back exit is also near a beach where one can chill or engage in water activities. If you intend to travel further down from the hotel, there is also a mode of transport called Song Thaew (which is a vehicle almost like a truck) acting like the buses. SongThaew would usually goes in a fixed route, charging 10 baht per person, so it's very reasonable.
The security measures taken were highly regarded to ensure the safety of the guests. The room I stayed in was their Deluxe City View Room and has all the basic amenities of a hotel room, with their Rock Spa bathroom amenities, which I appreciate alot. The bed is comfortable and allows one to have a good night's rest. On the down side, the website stated that from their Deluxe City View Room, they offer 'a balcony with views over the hotel gardens and the city'. But to my dismay, I was greeted with exhaust vents or viewing down on a concrete floor a level down.
I also opted for the extra add-on for their dinner buffet, the Great Charcoal BBQ Buffet. I only wished that there were more varieties of food to choose from. Other than that, all is good.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: This hotel is beautiful. Breakfast is good. Swimming pool is excellent. Perfect place to go with children. Very good localization. The Hotel has its own taxi cars. Water is free. Very well attended by staff.

My wife and I stayed at the Hard Rock Pataya in Nov 15. We have previously stayed at the Hard Rock in Penang Malaysia and enjoyed the stay there so decided to give this one a try. 
The Hard Rock Pattaya is centrally located being opposite the beach and the main shops are about 500 metres away. The room was nice with nice decor as is the rest of the resort. I can not speak more highly of the staff. They were always attentive, friendly and demostrated genuine enthusiasm when servicing and assisting us. Our room had a ocean view which overlooked the pool and beach. The dinning room was well serviced as was the bar room.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Everything was perfect. Stayed during new years eve and enjoyed the gala dinner that was prepared for guests :) Thanks for making my stay a pleasant and convenient one when the hotel is just along Beach Road.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: This is the first time for my stay at the Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya. The Hotel make me impress when I first step in the hotel area. Every staff has a service mind to answer my question. For the room is very clean and nice to stay. I like it so much. Hope I'll.go back to stay againreal soon.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I booked last minute, like the same day. 
The price I got was great I was very happy. 
From the moment I stepped into the hotel I was presently surprised. The staff were amazing, the hotel was fantastic. The value for money was fantastic. I will be back with friends.

The location in front of the pattaya beach,
The pool is good especially the jacuzzi.
The bed is really comfort..my son really like to stay in hardrock hotel...because there's activity for kid in the pool..
The staff also nice..
But a little disppointed when my husband swimsuit leaf behind in the room when we're check out.. but one day after that we come back to hardrock to stay again and when we asked about the swimsuit..the staff say there's nothing swimsuit in the lost and found locker..
I thought for a five-star hotel as hardrock items left behind may not be lost

5 lads stayed here two twin rooms and one superior double.
We decided that we fancied something abit special so decided to stay here. The hotel delivered but at a price. Rooms were very smart clean and had all the mod cons however wifi is at a charge unlike cheaper hotels. Location is great close enough to everything but also far enough away not to be disturbed.
Check in was effortless and straight up to your room.
Food at hotel was nice but can get cheaper and same quality elsewhere.
Drink little overpriced also.
However breakfast is worth getting up for even with a hangover.
A family hotel for sure and kids entertained by pool, can be annoying if you have hangover but it's not that sort of hotel.
Was disappointed that the hotel shop did not do the traditional hard rock t-shirt as it would have been cool to get one, they do have many other fancy options but no traditional ones, shame.
Would not stay here again as its not for me but can see the appeal especially for families.

If you can afford to stay here, do it! You wont be disappointed.
Location is great, pool is amazing! Everything you could want is here. I was upgraded without having to ask for it and the room was perfect.

Hard Rock hotel is a party hotel and great for the children. The room is smallish but has recently been refurbished and updated from our last stay 2 yrs ago. The addition of new sofa and LCD TV and repaint has really increased the comfort of the room and is good to see that management recognise that rooms have to be looked after. The bathroom remains small, but is fully functionally, but only comes with a shower. The views from deluxe rooms over Pattaya bay are amazing. The pool is possibly the biggest selling point of this hotel, but the activities are bit over zealous. By the pool there is constant rock music played - noisy but not overpowering and to be expected at the HardRock and actually makes drinks at the pool bar a bit more fun, but the kids and adult activities never give you a break to relax. The constant games and game co-ordinator with his microphone shouting ecouragement for all to hear slowly wear you down. The children running around shouting and screaming is one thing but the microphone drowns out their noise, then along comes pool volleyball with a comentary , then comes dancing and sign alongs, then more childrens games, and so on and so on. You never get a chance to relax and just read your book and with the activities always taking place in the pool , if you want to go for a relaxing swim you can't in large areas due to the games taking place. The Hard Rock is meant to be a fun hotel, but I think they need to find a happy compromise between those who want to play all day and those who want to relax - maybe a couple of hours in the early afternoon and then finish?? Due to this constant disturbance I will look at staying in a different hotel when I return to Pattaya which is a shame because the pool is great, the location is great and the views are fantastic - but they just will not leave you alone during the day to enjoy the sun.

What an awesome place for a relaxing enjoyable holiday....we went for the first time in 2009, went back in 2010 & are now planning to return in mid 2011.  Wouldn't want to go anywhere else.....i have travelled to the US & Europe, but this is like the best holiday ever...highly recommend it to anyone you wont be disappointed =)  Let the Rock Agents rock your world like they did ours.....the staff are now our family and the most friendly wonderful people you will meet & the hard rock is our home away from home.....We love it & we love the guys there.....See ya all soon
Gina & Bethany xoxo

We had a dinner buffet at Hard Rock Hotel Charcoal Grill on a weekday.  The buffet itself had a good spread of seafood and grilled meat.  The grilled pork ribs were great, so were the grilled river prawns.  The surprise was the "teppanyaki" ice-cream.  Yum...At about B$788++, it was steal.  What impressed us more was the waiting staff at the buffet restaurant.  They came by to chat with us in English, bringing us the freshly grilled meat and even giving us recommendations on where to buy fresh fruits at the local market. After dinner, the staff helped us make reservations at the Main Stage downstairs to listen to Live Music. Great food and great service.  Highly recommended.

This property is right on the beach, has a large pool, and has nice rooms with good views. There is a spa on the property where you can get a massage or manicure. Only drawbacks are that there isn't a free hot tub and the breakfast food was mediocre. Laundry service was fast but more expensive than it should have been.

best stay of my life so far!!! loved the cleanlness , food , atmosphere and above all the pool! with the sand pool with all the stones and slides, there was no need to be at the polluted pattaya beach but just stay here!!! me and husband were on our second honey moon celebrating our 10th anniversary and are now planning to go back with our daughters as soon as we can!!!! if you are in pattaya this is where you have GOT TO STAY! 
ps: DO NOT MISS THE SATURDAY FOAM PARTY :)
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Property is quite old although it has recently been renovated.  Hot shower would sometimes get cold.  Air con was very cold and still was after turned off.  Staffs were not friendly and not helpful.  I was sick and requested for pain relief.  They offered none.  I shortened my stay but they told me to pay full length.  I paid and staff still looked unhappy.

Good stay on Christmas Eve, book room in royalty club with gives access to the lounge which was plesent, nice staff clean room. 
Pools are good and son loved kids club however this is 100thb per hour for access.

I paid for the ocean view room. But ocean view rooms only have half ocean. Disappointed.
The lighting in front of the mirror is not appropriate for Make-up. 
It’s good to have the lounge for complimentary food all the day.
The staff in lounge only serves the white people and ignore the Asian.

At greeting part and how to keep relationship to custOmer, because we can see that their face and eyes expression show out impolite ,this is very important , people can see and feel it.and they also need the skill to ask customer question , some times they are very causal .
That's y in some of part I gave lower marks , that means need to improve in future

Very good and clean hotel.the location is good and not too far from everything.the only things which can make the place is if they bring in new towels and if the gym has some weights.the stuff are good and helpful.

Location is great, room is big for family of 3. Hotel rate on high side. Within walking distance to Central Festive mall. Hop onto the bus and pay 10 baht per pax, alight anywhere you like along the long stretch of road, a way to explore Pattaya beach and surroundings. Overall good stay.

The hard rock hotel is an experience not to be missed. It has everything your looking for in a hotel. A pool with crystal blue water that is sensational and a credit to the hotel.
The highlight that stood out for me is the friendly rock agent staff they make your stay 10 x better then anything else you will experience in pattaya. They entertain the guests all day long with great activities such as ping pong competitions, water polo, water volleyball and much more they encourage you to get involved and make your stay very memorable. You feel like you are at home the minute you arrive with greetings like '' welcome home'' 
Not to forget about the food, which is magnificent. The pool bar is great when you are relaxing by the pool. I recommend the club sandwich which is amazing, i bought this everyday. The food and beverage stuff really make you enjoy everything about the hard rock. Once you go to the hard rock you will meet TukTuk one of the main boys that works by the pool he makes you smile no matter what mood your in and helps you with all your needs, which really is a credit to himself and the hotel.
All in all this place really does rock!!!!!

The hotel is in a very good location. Near of everything.The staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious and clean. Check in and check out was smoothly. On the check in the worker explained everything very clear. At breakfast although full of people the staff was very patient and friendly.

After a few nights at HR Pattaya, you forget your´re abroad. The location is fantastic but nothing compared to the excellent and exquisite staff. Congratulations Mr. Smith, muito obrigado, because you have "handpicked the best berries". Thanks a lot to the wonderful staff that work so hard where and when  we the guests are having fun and for the guests having fun. Ms. Eve, Super - Fluke, "Always there and smiling Tattoo Queen" Natasha, Aiwa, Kung, Saysy,Gloria, Jubl, Pookie, Emi, Chakrit, Frankie...etc. etc...Just to mention a few of them.  ขอบคุณจากใจ.  If you "Rock" so much in these times, imagine when the Covid is away...  JJ

We stayed for 2 nights. Even my last minute non refundable online booking failed than also they confirmed my booking. ..wonderful. ..
  Sparkling new hotel with awesome pool (very cold water indeed).
Vegetarians can skip breakfast as very less vegan options..lot of Indian restaurant near central mall. 
Needs to improve reception lobby. The whole impression of the hotel fades as you reach reception. 
Will definitely recommend for all...
Hard Rock Cafe vibrant as usual.

I booked the Hard Rock following plumbing issues at my condo, so it was a spur of the moment booking.
Upon arrival I found the hotel staff to be pleasant, helpful with a good knowledge of English.
Our room was top class. Comfortable bed, awesome shower and luxurious.
There are a number of bars and restaurants but we chose the cafe which not only provided excellent food but the band, who were from Jakarta, were top drawer.
Give it a go. You can get special offers most of the year so savings can be made too. We saved 8000 baht on our room. 

Next time I may stay longer and enjoy the many facilities available.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I had stayed here for 5 nights for vacation, I find it very uncomfortable for the noise level coming from walk ways, Is the music auto play by hotel, it gets so noisy as early as 6am. 
The toilet is very small, for ladies, we don't get a proper space to makeup. 
After shower, the mirror in the toilet is already blurred with steam.
Room is dark as well.
The pool downstairs having a bubble bath party is so noisy till 1 plus am.  Noise is travelling up to all rooms facing the pool. 
I felt I had no door or window at times.
Breakfast varieties are pretty good.
Would stay other hotel for next visit.

We often come to Pattaya for holidays and tried many hotels. first time I tried this hotel. So far our best stay with many activities for kids. Will definitely come back to this hotel next time. Breakfast was good but not excellent. Could be better and no toothbrush in rooms which was surprising for a hotel.

The Hard Rock Hotel certainly is a fun family place away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Pattaya. It's centrally located and a very sharp looking hotel. Staff speak good English and are very attentive. Eve was my check in officer and was very helpful. The hotel was doing some repair works to the pool which caused some disruption to the normal range of activities but the hotel was happy to make up for this with my family.

Nice hotel with rock music as theme, with simple and minimalistic decor.

It's a beach facing property with good location.

It has a very large pool, with separate kids zone with small water slides, it also has a artificial beach on one side of pool.

It has decent breakfast buffet.

Overall a nice hotel.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Your staff ingnorance is a cancer in this hotel, which gets worse with every visit. The only plus I can give this hotel is the pool area staff, who always deliver a great service. Your executive lounge staff and the duty manager are an absolute disgrace.. especially the person who was on check in on the evening of the 25th December and her duty manager who thought it was ok to call me a lier..

The hotel is really beautiful with all new big pool. There is a very large and good buffet for breakfast (english, french, asian...), the room was really quiet with a very good bed and the personal was efficient and nice. Totally perfect !
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Great hotel, comfortable clean cool rooms, within walking distance to shops, bars, beach and all amenities. Fantastic pool with lots of games, nice food, very helpful friendly staff.I would highly recommend this hotel as the price was a bit high but you get what you pay for.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I stayed at the HRH in early nov.04.the place is great,the staff super friendly,and cool.this is a great honeymoon or couple retreat.(single guy's might not like it)
the backyard(pool area)is top notch.if you book the superior room you get a free bungelow rental,and other cool freebies(internet,etc).the resturants are good,but the gormet dinner buffet is a must do.
as far as the HR club scene,watch out,no watered down drinks here,and plenty of good music and dancing.
the property is a little far from walking street and jonteim beach,but the baht bus is just out the door.and pattaya beach is across the street.
For the single guys' i recommend the diamond beach hotel,alot cheaper,and right off walking street.

Very good hotel ,food,the pool excellent 
The room very good
The stuff who work in hotel like to help with smile.
This was my 6 time in this hotel
I am sure i come agin i feel ilke home.
I travel alot i know when i am in evan

I came from the beach in late afternoon and heard the announcement regarding the pool bar happy hours promotion.. So I went in to have some cocktails by the pool. The promotion was buy 1 get 1 which is very good. I ordered 2 margaritas at first. Then I went to ask for a towel at the counter as I am still wet from the beach. The staff at the counter looked down upon me and said it’s 500 THB to have 1 towel which is ridiculous to me, so I did not take it. I understand that it’s a policy against walk-in guest, so never mind. When i was having my first cocktail, one pool guard came to tell me that I cannot sit by the pool. He said this area reserved for in-house guests only !! which is 30 seats empty and I am the only guest sitting there at that time in the middle area of the pool.
I planned to relax by the pool and have some drinks for a few hours..but this turn me into uncomfortable situation and I left after my first drink. However, the staffs at the small hut at the pool were very nice and asked me to stay for more drinks but I don’t feel welcome anymore. So next time if u don’t want to welcome walk-in guest, please put a sign at front gate that for in-house only.

I recently stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya from 1 to 4 December
the location of the hotel is very good with the hotel on Second Road and on beach road.
The hotel has a beautiful swimming pool and on saturday evening a pool party is given with foam.
security at night is very good and i like the old security guard at the elevator.
I love the free movie selection in the room.
The breakfast buffet is fine for Asian and English guests, but for a more western breakfast the choice is moderate with mostly little sandwich and not much to pot on your sandwich like ham or cheese. 
The cleaning of the rooms can be better and especially the light switches the phone and the remote control of the television are very dirty. This is something you see worldwide in hotels. 
what really bothered me was the high deposit of 2000 baht a night that is asked.
especially if you stay several nights the deposit is high. a limit should be set up to a maximum of 5000 baht for example. 
for this I stay at Novotel Ploenchit Bangkok and the doposit was 3000 for three nights.
Novotel is part of the Accor group. The largest hotel company in the world.
but overall I love to stay at the Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya and I will be back at my next visit to Pattaya

I have used this hotel fairly regularly over the past  4 years primarily because you know what you get, the staff are focused on making your stay as enjoyable as possible, the rooms are clean and spacious and whilst it is not the cheapest hotel for food the quality that is served is excellent, highly recommeneded

The beds are big enough to sleep with my kids. The room is clean. At Christmas day, there is a little cake gift. I think it is quite considerate. However, it will be better if the breakfast of the kids can be free.

Property was Amazing with excellent Location. The staff was very Courteous. Breakfast had lot of variety. Foam pool party on Saturday was which we were looking forward for. We had a great time. We experienced  Royal Lounge which had complimentary tea / coffee and snacks from 6 AM to 10 PM.Also unlimited cocktails were also complimentary in evening. We had a lot of fun and enjoyed a lot. It has lot of activities for kids also. Swimming pool was excellent. There is Bar near pool and enjoying drink sitting on Rocks is again an amazing.

Stayed Deluxe City view room for 2 nights during the Christmas festive period. 

Pros-
1. Friendly front desk staff with a personal touch. Able to converse with good English. Arrived early and was accomodated with early check in than the usual 3pm as the room was ready. Request for late Check out at 1pm was also accomodated at no extra charges.
2. Room was comfortable and modern. We love the bath room.
3. We booked the room with the breakfast buffet and it was of a decent spread with a mix of local and international options. 
4. Fitness Centre was well equipped.
5. Very good service in general.
6. Location was good, located in central Pattaya and walking distance to malls and beach.'

Tips- 
1. Deluxe City Room does not come with a bath tub.
2. Pool was popular and can get a bit crowded during the late morning with familys and kids.
3. You can access the beach right in front of the hotel. You can also find speedboats services to Coral island nearby.
4. 5min walk to Central festive mall, 15min walk to Terminal 21, 15min to Lets Relax Spa.

A memorable Hard Rock experience for us and definitely one of our better Hotel we have stayed so far in Thailand.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Good spot, right off the beach. Close to Walking Street if thats your thing. Decent restaraunt and pool. Pool parties every saturday. Staff is really nice and everyone seems happy to be there. Nice spot for the price
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: the hotel itself was very nice but the strong point of the property is the staff. they were incredible. super friendly and nice. always spoke to me ad greeted me like i was a long stay guest. i will def be back. thanks so much
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
The only reason for us to visit Pattaya is to stay at another Hard Rock Hotel, so we're looking forward for this.  But due to family crisis, spouse had to fly out just before coming to Pattaya - leaving me with 2 kids in tow to take care of (and entertain) - so expecting a fun-filled Asian HR hotel as the one in Bali that will keep them occupied.  

Check-in was done pretty quick, and was given a room that overlooks the beach.  Room is very small compared to other HR hotels.  However it is properly equipped with LCD TV and CD player.  There is a small balcony with some plastic chairs and also towel hanger outside - very helpful if you want to dry out those swimsuits! 

The bathroom has a small, Japanese-type bathtub (I believe they call it "Onsen"???) cum shower with a very deep walls.  I don't understand the decision to have this facility installed.  Is it because they have more Japanese tourists here? Or to be able to have a "bathtub" or something like that in such a tight space? 
First, it's not very easy for children to climb in and out of it, and it has its own danger of slipping on the hard tile - Second, it takes forever if you ever want to fill it up for a bath! 

Breakfast - average, not too many choices available, so it was a disappointment, added by the attitude of the surly people who works there in the gloomy lighted restaurant.  The waiters/waitresses there clearly resent their work, since they all work with mechanical-like efficiency but with hardly a smile or cheerful disposition, so unlike the HR Bali with the bright open air restaurant, broad breakfast choices and cheerful staff. 

Not all staff are surly and gloomy - the Pool staff turns out to be lots of fun.  They really entertain the children staying at the hotel, providing lots of games and have nightly Wii games set up on large projector screen for them to play.  They are very quick to respond to your requests, whether it is for additional towels or for the menu when you require something from the restaurant or bar. 

The pool at HR Pattaya is quite nice, with some sandy beach portion and a floating trampoline - but the layout cannot beat the one in Bali which must have been more carefully planned to support the activities around the pool.  

The HR Cafe next door is a great place to dine, and they have friendly staff abound who will help you out with recommending things on the menu and explaining the items in Kid's menu to your children.  They are a great help when you have to feed 2 kids properly on your own!  

We're planning on early check out to catch a morning flight from Bangkok, so we asked for breakfast boxes, and the staff at the front desk happily helped us with the request. 

It takes some time to check out since the only person that can check me out was not available in the morning, and I have to wait for quite some time. 

Hard Rock Pattaya is quite nice - but the facility and disposition of (some of) the staff makes me prefer HR Bali!

From the moment you drive through the Front gate you enter another world. Hard Rock is the only place I stay when I visit Pattaya. Its Clean, Safe and the Staff are Amazing.The new pool area is fantastic. Loved the Band in the Hard Rock Cafe..they were unbelievably fantastic.

This hotel is brilliant if you are just laid back...Want to relax..It has an amazingly big swimming pool very newly done with lots of beds to relax around..Their pool bar is well equipped..their rooms are brilliant with balconies...The location is like a 5-7 min walk from the walking street... We enjoyed the hotel more as we were just there for one day...It has a lot of bars n restaurant s nearby
..Loved the resort feel they give.
 Thank you hard rock for making my wife n my stay memorable..Kudos to the staff for the lovely hospitality and quick room service !!!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Cozy rooms, great pools, family friendly hotel, great varieties for breakfast, best location and excellent services by staff. Tips: go for Rock Royalty Room with sea view. Check in and out was a little slow, which can be improvised. Family Foam Party on Saturdays is great and fun but it could be better if the party time is extended longer to around 2 hours. As for Rock Royalty Program snacks and drinks time should be given at least 2hours instead of 1 and a half coz it's a little rush for parents with little ones. Room light is a little dim and deco in the Roxstar Family Suite esp living and parent room area should be improved with more vibrant color.

Nice hotel, very confortable with excellent cooking (breakfast is excellent!).
 Staff very nice and helpful.
Good location in the city centre but very calm.
Spacious rooms very clean and confortable.
we recommend
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We were at HRH over the Xmas period...We signed up for the Kids wanna rock package which entitled us to 2hr free use of the kids club daily...howver, everytime we signed in for our kids, they will say we have to PAY...it gets very tiring when you have to keep going to the reception to have them verify your account! Also with this package, we were entitled to Free kids dining with every paying adult...but the restaurant was CLOSED on Xmas even for lunch! Everything requires extra money from the floats to the Cabanas! As for the rooms, nothing to SHOUT about unfortunately...

The Hard Rock hotel in pattaya is truly a splendid place to stay at. The facade of the building gives an extremely vibrant look, which's quite a rare sight at most places. The rooms are totally amazing and very comfortable; and with retro interiors and pictures of famous rock stars on the walls, it undoubtedly should be the foremost choice for all die-hard rock fans.
The Hard rock cafe serves highly delectable food, and with awesome music in the background, it makes for an indescribable experience.
Pattaya is surely a wonderful place to visit, and the Hard Rock hotel makes it even more worth it.

I think the location is very good, the service and service providers is also polite and helpful, but the sea view room not very clearly to view sea and room facility is obsolete, especially the toilet have a little bit bad smell from drainage.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Friendly staff and lots of activities for kids.  Room is ok and clean, but don't expect much from "seaview".  There are bunch of activities to do outside of the room, though, so clean bathroom and clean bed are good for me.  My only recommendation is there should be exhaust fan in the bathroom so it won't be a steam box every time we shower.

Fantastic property with very courteous staff right from the reception to the concierge and security staff. Easier to converse with as they all spoke fluent English which is quite difficult to find in Thailand. Considering this is my second time here in 3 years would love to stay here more often!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: We often go to hard rock cafes around the world and so thought we would try the hotel out. It was a nice experience thanks. Staff are very attentive and efficient, the place is clean and tidy and the room was nice and comfy.

It's a,hard rock cafe and if you travel and visit them then you will have to visit here for a beer and a burger to tick one off your list, for me it makes about 12 different hard rocks and 6 or 7 different countries.

Extremely disappointed with how the hotel and Expedia managed my booking. .I have made the booking through Expedia 2 weeks earlier, and I called and email multiples to reschedule to both Expedia and the hotel and they confirmed it. however, it turned out that no rescheduling was done.

It's probably my fault because my expectations were so high.  This is by no means a bad hotel, the pool is great and the staff is predictably Hard Rock young and friendly.  As you might expect, the restaurant/bar is solid and there's plenty of memorabilia around to catch your eye.

Unfortunately it's very obvious that this joint is an old hotel done over, clearly on the cheap.  If your expectations are low this could be a fun and unusual place to stay.  But for me, the commodification of classic rock is more disappointing than inspiring, and should I return to Pattaya, I will definitely pick another joint that doesn't depress me.

Hard Rock Hotel is convenient on beach road. Room is clean. Air condition is cold enough. Good for family trip and have activities for kids. Central festival shopping mall is very close about 5 minutes walking distance

This was our first time ever in a Hard Rock hotel and we have seen lots and lots of hotels in the world. The beds were so comfy. The room was just beautiful. The staff were so friendly. The Hard Rock Cafe and the Indonesian band Unlimited really rock. We will definitely book another holiday soon in this hotel and other Hard Rock hotels in the world. Thumbs up for this hotel!!!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: this hotel not meet my expectation, compare with other hardrock. not many choice for breakfast, i just hit an animal drop in the sand. and i not feel like a rock star when staying there. this hardrock hotel like a 3 star hotel and i can get even more cheaper price with food quality in 3 star hotel..
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
We stayed here three nights during the Thai New Year, Songkran and had a decent stay. The hotel was just overwhelmed by the amount of guests during the New Year.  We could not get a sun lounger; the pool was crowded and full of obnoxious people; the pool was dirty and the guest relations desk was all queued up. 

The hotel itself was fun, clean and up to Hard Rock standards.  We stayed on the Club level and the club hosts, buffet and happy hour were all fantastic and a nice relief from the Songkran madness below.  The room however had an awful view of an alley, roof and another hotel.  We would recommend staying ocean side.  The room also was an apparent former smoking room and reeked like cigarettes. (The floor was all non smoking but probably a recent change). The room needs a deep cleaning.  We would rate this hotel higher but the cigarette smell was just overpowering for non smokers like us.

Staying for the whole of our trip at this place in Pattaya.  Strategically located within the 10-Baht taxi's route.  Easily accessed to various malls, mini attractions and night walking street.  Hotel facilities include a nice pool, bar, children's activity center, a gym, a restaurant offering nice buffet breakfast, the ever famous HR cafe and Rock Shops.  Rock Shops are located both at the hotel lobby and near the HR Cafe.  Designs of limited edition t-shirts might be a bit different if anyone is interested.  Rock spa facility is a little bit outdated in terms of interior design on room and reception area.  We didn't consider visiting again after our 1st try on the message.  Friendly hotel staffs from transportation, check-in reception, restaurant, housekeeping, rock shops, spa, tour desk and the Cafe.  If you are in for a relax trip, stay here as it is a 4-star hotel with good facilities/amenities and near the beach as well.  One side note on departure, try to get to Utapao Airport early to avoid delay as the check-in hall is small and warm.  We encountered 2 blackouts with internet down on the day of departure, which was scary.  Reaching the airport at around 1:00pm but only managed to check in at around 3:45pm due to all these glitches at the airport.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Great hotel in great location. Overall such a great deal. So much fun for ifs at the pool. Staff organizes activities for them throughout of the day. Only complain we had would be about kids beds( bunk) in family room. They are tiny and the mattress are so hard. But when we asked they brought us rollaway beds for them which were OK.

Good location, only 10-15 mins walk to the Festival Mall! (Everything is in the mall) So many food outlets & money exchanger nearby! Excellent hospitality! All the staff are very friendly & helpful in the hotel!

Nice location, nice room, nice facilities.This is the second time I stayed at this hotel.There were two things I love the most: 1)Foam Party by the pool on Saturday with nice music for dancing. 2) Awesome dinner at Hard Rock Cafe

Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya 28th Dec 2008

We travel to Thailand every year at this time as this is our main holiday.

Every hotel we have ever stayed in, has had good and bad points. more good than bad and I have never felt the need to write a review.

This hotel spoiled our holiday, surly staff, odd rules , ie you need to sign a credit card slip before you spend any money??  found this very odd.

We broke a glass accidentaly on the balcony, because of the limited space and wobbly plastic table ,  we were charged 200TBT around £4.00p uk , we were told if anything is broken or abused we must pay for it.

You may think we are young party animals,afraid not we have grown up children.

The Gala dinner is outragously expensive and not worth the money the groups can be heard everynight for free in the hard rock cafe, the gala dinner was a :Latin Fiesta:  not one latin thing going on.
Avoid this hotel like the plague we were in the executive suite so who knows what the other rooms had to put up with
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
We stayed for 3 days, for New Year's Eve. Really good hotel.
There were party every night but I could sleep well in my room.

The only thing I don't like is that it was far from the pier. But it's ok.

ThanX for everything...

We joined the Team Building Class at Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya on 18 Jan 2019, your recreation staff Rusty very professional and helpful organizing a great event for us.  As well as the event team (two man with a lady) give us a wonderful & funny afternoon.  Good location and the activities prize is reasonable, also the drinks and foods you provided yummy.

It can be recommended to our friends.

本人參加了一月十八日之團隊訓練活動，員工Rusty及Event員工非常專業及幫忙，令我們享受一個難忘下午，另外地點方便及價錢合理，食物亦相當有質素，會推薦給朋友。

Sylvia Chow

I find this hotel so amazing. 
Awsome Pool together with a professional and a caring staff, makes this the ultimate package for an unforgettable holiday.
The room was so clean and always housekeeping checked it twice a day.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Thumbs up 1: When I first approach the reception, they have already done all my check-in passes ready just pending my "autograph", passport and credit card details. Hence, the check-in process only takes a short 10mins and we can just proceed to our Deluxe Seaview with Balcony.

Thumbs up 2: We have the unlimited Wifi package for 2 devices and the hotel staff readily provide us with the additional hourly passwords for our ipad and laptops as we have registered the unlimited passwords for our mobiles..

Thumbs up 3: Though the Rock Spa is on the high side for massage, but they really give exclusive good service. Worth a try at the very least for the experience.

Thumbs up 4: The breakfast spread ROCKS! I ate so much and full till i can skip the lunch.. 

Thumbs up 5: The staff helps us to call the song thew for us to go to outlet mall and the night market!

Thumbs up 6: This place is also great for family with kids as they organised pool activities for the kids when adults can have their sun-tanning time...
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Booked two rooms with two other friends 6 months in advance. I had emailed hotel a few times to confirm that we would like to book one room with two single beds and the other room with one king size bed. Upon check in, the front desk staff verified these details and allocated our rooms. When I entered my room I was surprised to find two single beds (which are the size of double beds each!!) and not the king size I had communicated only 5 minutes earlier and which I was supposedly allocated by the front desk staff. My friends' room was as requested. I called and asked for room with king size bed and they obliged, however, I had to wait a further hour while a room was prepared. Although only a minor complaint, thankfully the rest of our stay was fantastic!

I must admit, though, that the king size bed room was much smaller than my friends' room with the two double beds- their room was huge, though my room did have a small balcony. The beds and pillows are super corfortable, lots of entertainment value using TV (you have to pay more for more of an extensive range), internet is expensive at BAHT400 per 24 hour period. Minibar, laundry, spa treatments and onsite restaurants all rather expensive too which was expected.

Gym was well equiped, pool area was huge but not too deep, staff were quirky but still friendly and helpful, breakfast was fantastic with vast selection to choose from, beach just across the road.

Location wise, it is about 10-15 minute walk to most of the popular big shopping centres and about 20 minute walk to Walking Street- that is for most fit and able people walking at a good pace. Probably add another 10 minutes if you prefer to slow walk. However, I think many people just chose to take a shared taxi or metered taxi as it is a decent distance away. We preferred to walk everywhere and take all the craziness of Pattaya in. Just to mention, there is no shortage of restaurant offerings!!!

The hotel does have many kids staying here, but I still do recommend to singles and couples too as they did not affect our stay at all!! The hotel does have a "happening vibe" about it!

Spent 4 nights at The Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya what a great hotel. We had a deluxe room on the 4th floor with a view of the pool and sea front. A really good breakfast selection covering Thai, Chinese, Russian,India & obviously British. The staff were very helpful and friendly nothing too much trouble. Good security. Will stay again.

Where should I start from :

I was in Hard Rock on 20th and 21st of Nov 2015 and what a stay I had . It was totally memorable and I took a bunch of memories with me since the day I checked in. The pool is more than awesome , Water is soft and very clean . 

The view from the room was Pool View and Sea View - a super view one can have .

Pros :
Clean and Beautiful Room
Staff - BIG FIVE STAR - Very Warm , the guy at reception and specially the guy who assisted us in breakfast , Just Super and Rocking guys
Just in front of Jomtien Beach, Malls, Walking Street ,Indian Restaurants 
Most of it - these people understood ENGLISH very well and did not have any question marks on their faces whilst asking something 
Currency Exchange as well is in front of the hotel which offers good exchange rates .

Cons:
1.Very Small Webs in the corner were there in my room's balcony  - I felt it should be taken care seriously - not a good thing for a such a nice property
2.Men's washroom near the pool side was not  very clean - Please take care 
3.Lastly - Foam Party - It was a biggest attraction for me to stay in Hard Rock - As there were Stags every where with no security (Bouncers) around. I went with my wife and came out real quick as the crowd was bad and finally we opted for pool rather than going into the foam party . 

The hotel is very good and a great property to visit , just few pointers I felt Hard Rock must consider .
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: My company organizes the event meeting and year anniversary party here. It is a very good memory that we spend time together in the hotel. The hotel provides activities for us. Especially the foam party, which made us get to know each other very well.

Everything was perfect.  The room was clean and spacious.  Very good price.  Everyone in the hotel spoke fluent English and treated the family professionally and courteous.  Food and amenities were beyond expectations.

Hard Rock Pattaya Thailand was AWESOME!  The room, the service, food, pool, gym, steam room, everything was absolutely excellent!! thank you so much for making our stay with you wonderful and memorable!!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Wonderful stay at HRHP, the staff and service provided was simply memorable. The room was clean every time you return, the friendly and warm staff, makes you feel welcome. Definitely will recommend and will return for holiday here with family and friends.

Very good experience as I’ve stayed there many times already and will continue to return every time I come to visit Pattaya whether holidays or any other reasons for staying in hotels. Congratulations to mr Jorge Smith for establishing a wonderful team who have shaped the reputation of this amazing hotel.

Everything is OK. It's very nice and fun to stay here. Big Pool and many facility & activities. It's near to the beach and shopping mall. Staffs are very goods service to us. They will do the best for customer.

We stayed at the Hard rock cafe for 2 days in may 2009 on our trip to Pattaya. I was with my wife and kid and liked the location of the hotel as it was right in middle of city with beach on one side and main road on other side. The pool was really good, so was staff service. The concepot of hard rock hotels is unique and great for music lovers. Also, lot of activities available for kids as well as adults. 
Drwabacks were mainly food was not that great. The room sizes were especially very small. With 2 beds in each room, it was difficult to walk around, though baclony view was great, so wa sthye unique tb in tthe room (squqre and deep instead of noraml tubs).

It si a landmark hotel with adjoining hard rock cafe and the shop where they sell food. Pool side massage parlours were good.

Overall an enjoyable stay.

I've been there 3 times. I am really safisfied with their kindness and service. 
Especially, all of service crews are very kind and smily. It's a impressed to me. 
If I have a chance to visiting in Pattaya, I would like to stay again.
Hard Rock hotel is rocks!!!!
Located on the beach... so easy accessibility to the water sports. Good Ambience!!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
cleanliness of the room was normal.
 Staff service was very good. 
The pool is nice.
Breakfast is SOSO~
It was impressive hotel.
It was right in front of Pattaya beach. 
Very good location
 I want to visit again later.

Great Hotel & great location. We had deluxe room, sea view on 8th floor & looked out over the water. Buffet breakfast was very good with a huge variety to choose from. Plenty of beds around pool, which had been recently renovated.

Hard Rock Pattaya has the worst front desk staff that I have experienced! I have stayed in much cheaper hotels and stayed in hostels who have better trained courteous staff who are happy to help and understand service standard is key to the whole experience. The front desk are rude, no greeting,  impolite and just look impatient all the time.  Led by a man with thin face spiky hair in black shirt so i assume he is supervisor level.  Guest services is fine and the staff at the pool are great but just severely let down by front desk.  The general manager should be ashamed of himself and the front desk should not be in a people facing role.  Will not stay at hard rock again.  Now in Courtyard Marriot. Bangkok where we are pleasantly greeted
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Love this hotel whenever we're off to Thailand for family getaway.....

Going again soon with our baby who's now 3yo...(the prev time she followed us was when 8mo)
We had the Composer Suite (access to Kings Club Lounge) & the interior was awesome and service was impeccable.....friendly staff greets us every day we are there!

So exciting....!!! Cant wait for our next visit soon...

Excellent hotel with good location. The hotel is mostly used by families with children. Lots of space for children, swimming pools, activities, etc... they also have space for (Smokers). I am smoker, but no smoking rooms. No problem at all.
One recommendation for the Hotel Management (as I am a retired Hotel Manager): I noticed their dinner buffet is excellent but not much people using it. They had to wrap the food every night. They might think of a special offer for (Half Board) to use the food instead of taking it back away to the fridges for (Re-use)...

I have stayed here twice and can tell you for the money and compared to other hotels in the area it’s worth it. The cafe rest. Is the best. The food is always prepped perfectly. The one hostess I think Indian descent has an attitude and is worthless. Everyone else is great. Each room has an. Air filter which is usually black and clogged. And disgusting. I have had 4 rooms and all were not maintenanced  in at least 6 months. Bfast Buffett is great. Pool is great. 
Tvs need to be updated to at least a 60” led. But most importantly they need more channels. The have Russian Chinese Thai and bbc news all what we deem fake news in my country. You need to get the leading news of America which is Fox News. 
And you should have a large movie selection option that you can pay for like other hard rocks in America.
We had a very nice stay at Hrh Pattaya.Nice breakfast buffet and drinks, very comfortable room and the most enjoyable pool for all ages.The room cleaning could be better.We can’t wait to come back.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
This was the most dissapointing place ive ever bin.. the smell. The food. No service. Sink was plugged. They pretend to be something they are not.. would never return.. they tried to charge me double for a taxi to airport. 

Food was over priced
Beer was double anywhere in the city. 
Avoid this place

We had a great relaxing few days...

Hotel is well located, not far from central, close to the beach, safe and in a quiet neighborhood great hotel for Families ...

We knew that the hotel is aged but we could see that it as been very well maintained and managed ... and more renovation are on the way 
The pool is outstanding always active with a lot of activities  and party on week ends

No one can contest that their strength is in the staffs (everywhere and in all department) ....  they are unbelievably  great and constantly leave by what Hospitality business stand for ...Offering great professional care to customers !

We had a great stay !!! We will be back !!

I came for Christmas Eve and had a funny night with plenty of delicious food. A nice swimming pool with mini concert. Thank you for very impressive hotel. I love Hard Rock and I will come again soon. See you..
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Everything is good such as services, suite, swimming pool and activites at pool / drinks at lounge are great. Kids love foam party beside swimming pool very much. I really like and really want to come back to the hotel again.

The temperature of the pool was reasonable and there were many sunbeds. The staff were kind.My family enjoyed the game in the swimming pool. The room is clean and thete was a noise in the hall like any other hotel.

Hard Rock Pattaya can be seen as a leading man among Pattaya’s hotels. The property is awash in glamorous decor featuring memorabilia and pinups of rock icons, and features two restaurants (Hard Rock Cafe and Stars Diner), two bars (the Shack and the Soul Lounge) and an amazing spa, However, the true star of this act, is the pool which is the Eatern Seaboard’s largest free form pool, complete with a deck in the shape of a guitar. The pool features a swim up bar and private cabanas (with a minibar and massage services), plus a full menu of food items. The Saturday pool parties are an absolute must! You’ll end your day with some of the best sleep you’ll get outside of your own bed, in the extremely posh and comfortable rooms. Despite the jacuzzi downstairs, I sill missed having a bathtub in the room. However, the cozy bed and relaxing balcony more than made up for it. From the pool, to the lush decor of the rooms, to the blissful spa services, Hard Rock is a symphony of well delivered services...or rather a rock star!
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: All are very good, like the music and the decoration. the swimming pool is very good. And I felt so good when there were musician played live music besides. and the location is very good too, it's very convenient to go anywhere.

Very good service at all times of the day. 
Nice location with sea view.
Every day you'll wake up with a smile on your face.
The room is clean and every day felt like it was my first day in the room because of the great cleaning team.

On Saturday we had the pool party and The Hard Rock Team Rocked it!

See you soon..

The staff of reception were a bit miserable and couldn't really unstand me. A woman reception - from Eastern Europe - had really poor English.
The staff at breakfast, the cleaning ladies and the bell boys were all top.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Great hotel,  the refurbished pool is fantastic 
Excellent breakfast 
Great view from balcony room 
Drinks very expensive compared to surrounding bars 
Excellent express laundry
Easy access to beach Road 
Friendly staff
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I love Pattaya!  It's one of the most entertaining places in the world.  However, you often need a place to retreat to when you're in need of peace and quiet.  The Hard Rock Hotel offers quiet rooms, an awesome pool, a great gym, and an all around comfortable environment.  The entire staff was friendly and accommodating.   I'd highly recommend this hotel and I look forward to returning soon!

Very well run hotel with excellent service through out in great location. Was upgraded from city view to sea view room. Room was comfortable and adequate for long stay. Room maids friendly and efficient. Only issue with room was the badly stained carpet. Really enjoyed breakfast each morning with lots to choose from. Friendly, hard working staff who took us straight to a table and knew our room after a couple of days. Great pool/beach run by fun bunch of pool boys/girls. Lots of laughs every day. Very busy on Saturdays with childrens  parties. No happy hour at Shack Bar. Enjoyed the food at the Pizzeria with plenty of choice and again with a great bunch of staff. Went to Soul Lounge once to watch football but seemed to lack atmosphere. Café has a good rock band at night. Felt to old to go to foam party on Saturday nights. Music was just a noise to us. Would have liked to have drank and eaten more in hotel/café but as usual prices out side are a lot cheaper. Thanks to the staff we had a great time and will be returning in March. See you all soon. B & J [ 509 ].
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
Worst Hard Rock Hotel I’ve ever stayed in.
1) Staff is not friendly
2) Roxity Club is not part of the package. 100B per entry. Ridiculous.
3) Front desk staff need to be changed as they raised their voices to customer.
4) movies in the television are outdated and no live tv show from hard rock cafe performance.

Staffs are very nice and helpful.  Hotel is nearby Central Festival Mall and the location is good for me  to go anywhere.  I will join your hotel again in next trip when I stay at Pattaya, Thailand.  Thank you for your service.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Well finally touch HRH Pattaya, is not pretty as Bali but I think is a recommended hotel to stay. Located front of the beach, and many attractions walking distance.  As many facilities as HR hotels, standard. The cafe just front of the hotel beside the pool and next to Rock shop.

This hotel charges joiner fees of one thousand five hundred Thai baht if you are looking to bring a lady to your room. This is ridiculous 99% of the hotels in pattaya don't charge this...even the Hilton....find another place...if your looking to enjoy pattaya

Perfection & a nice place to relax & Staff always one step ahead to help & eager to do as requested. The pools are always changing with activities if your game. So many staff to attend at a whim I enjoyed putting my feet up for a quiet holiday.

The saving grace having selected Pattaya as a destination was this hotel. What a feel. Just wonderful. The foam party was just brilliant. Rooms are brand new and with so much to do right inside, you dont have to worry about whats outside. The pool bar, the done up of the rooms, the view, the lavish spread of breakfast, the restaurant choices, all perfect. Wonderful time with friends.

Small room 
But hotel has a lot of rooms.
 
Terrible extra bed , very short and don’t strong 

The breakfast room does not have enough tables for guests.

ห้องพักเล็กมาก
เตียงเสริมแย่มาก เตียงสั้นมาก นอนแล้วขาเลยเตียง
นอนแล้วปวดหลังมาก

Nice hotel and room. Lots of rooms don't have a balcony. Not much space for hanging clothes, only 8 hangers. Although rooms are none smoking, plenty of smokers around the pool.
Service is excellent. Breakfasts are good. Food and drink to purchase is expensive compared with just out and about. Not much rocking going on. Place very quiet after 9pm except for Saturday night foam party
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: I've first time stayed at this hotel and it made me felt like I was back to 14 years old again. The buffet on Saturday night was such varieties of choice, room clean and the atmosphere of this hotel is totally chic. all reception staffs were friendly and helpful during my stayed. I'm definitely back to enjoy my next long holiday vacation here. Thank you for serving me at this time guys.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
I've enjoyed adding my reviews to the Trip Advisor community over the years, and it's rare that I feel a property is truly excellent.  This Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya epitomizes the word!

We checked in on a Friday night and had a friendly, informational front desk agent.  It was almost as if he anticipated my questions, and was extremely thorough, all the while providing helpful information.

Our room was great.  We were celebrating my son's birthday, and the hotel had a cake waiting for him in the room.  Delicious, and it really got the weekend off to a perfect start!

We had a drizzly Saturday morning, but our spirits were lifted by the friendly smiles at the breakfast buffet.  Flawless!   Our table was bused regularly, and we enjoyed the wide-ranging choices of food (bacon!)  Delicious pastries, hot waffles, French toast, and pancakes, made-to-order eggs, fruit, yogurt, Asian cuisine, and much, much more were available.

From there it was off to the pool.  There were regular activities, well-spaced.  Especially noteworthy was the OUTSTANDING staff.  Ultra friendly, so cheerful, and extremely personable.  Sax and his team provided the perfect balance of both kid- and adult-friendly activities.  They called us and other guests by name, creating such a comfortable atmosphere.  Poolside food and beverage service was great, too!

My kids loved the foam party Saturday evening at 5 p.m.  What a unique, fun experience.  They made some wonderful memories!

Used the fitness center the next morning, and the equipment was well-maintained.  The buffet breakfast was not a complete repeat of the morning before (which was refreshing) but included many of the favorites I was hoping to see.  Another fabulous morning with the pool staff, which included rock climbing and "walking on water".  Pool floats are available to rent, and there's pool basketball always available, too - not to mention the kids' waterslides in a separate, sandy pool area.

My son loved having (free!) access to a wide-range of family and action movies in the room.  We all loved the personal attention and positive, fun-loving vibe we got from everyone working on the property.

I'm really not sure how they do it, but they have really found a fantastic combination of personalities that lead to an exceptional experience for the guests at Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya!!!!!

BEST place to be must visit. We have had a great experience . Do not walk into  unknown streets and talk to local agents guides you might fall into scam.Please follow Google map for new places to search.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3:
We booked a Kids' suite with seaview for 2 nites. From the moment we were ushered to our 9th floor for check in , I was impressed. The staff spoke perfect English and made us feel really comfortable. The King's club is well appointed and equiped. My kids went crazy with the food and drinks. The room came with a double bed and bunk-beds for the kids. They even had bath robes for the kids! The Xbox was a nice touch although only one game disc was available. Service was both prompt and polite. Only gripe was the wifi. It would be great if the wifi was better and more stable.

On the 2nd night, we ordered room service so that we can sit in our room to watch the fireworks on the bay in front of the hotel. We had the best seats on the house from our balcony. We were also very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food from the room service.  We had pizza, a rib-eye steak , fried rice and green curry chicken. Every dish was good. 

All in all, we had a great stay and will definitely be back next year!

I'm always touched your thoughtfulness~~~!
I will go back to you.
At that time, Meet again,smiling~~~
Specially, you changed my booking date. So I had very good time in your hotel.
If I go to pattaya, I will choose your hotel.

I and my son, 7 years old, stay at this hotel for around 2 weeks in December.
First check in: welcome drink.
Second check in ( 1-2 weeks later) : no welcome drink. But with a smile:"welcome back"
King size bed room: all rooms have connections doors. Can be very noisy. So we changed to a room with 2 beds - and got some privacy. I don't like to have "people in my room".  I mean, it could sound like that with a noisy family next door.!
Go for a twin deluxe room ( seaview) and choose the sunny side, towards Montien/Hilton. Other side: no sunshine at all!
Room quality: rather hard beds. Not comfortable funitures. Terrible chairs!
A little bit run down, everything,
The pool is perfect for a family. Many activities and so on. And the staff is great!
Perfect place!
Breakfast is ok, but below avarage when it comes to brunch style, beef, fish ...
Even a cheaper hotel can offer more! However - normal breakfast with
 good bread and fruit selections.
My son loves this hotel - and the staff. They were great!
  So we will come back one day.

Really appreciate staff in Hard Rock Hotel, they are all cheerful and helpful.  My stay is a comfortable one.  The room price, restaurants or pool side bar, the charge is reasonable.  Only thing is it was a bit noisy at night time.  There was a outdoor concert place nearby and they practice until mid night.

I have been in this hotel three times and it is always a blast! The rooms are always very clean and very hard rock style! The breaksfast is great and the hard rock restaurant in front in great! The lounge bar in the lobby is usually empty but is amazing! I will be back many times!

Second to none hospitality and service, accommodation comfort, and dining quality.

We checked in a kid's suite which really was wonderful. The two-deck locker bed was too small for our kids but that never was a problem. The kids ended up sleeping on the sofa where they spent most of the nights playing the Xbox past midnight anyway. I and my wife particularly liked the bed in master bedroom. It was very comfortable and made us feel like sleeping at home. The bathrooms also were very nice and roomy. Everything we got in that suite was worth the money we paid for.

Breakfast was enchanting, probably the best in Pattaya area, with handful choices of some exceptional dish to choose from. The dinner we had at the hotel's restaurant surprisingly turned one of our most favorite meals ever!! Food was so splendid whilst the cost so low!! Highly recommend for red meat and seafood lovers worldwide!!

And make sure your kids (and you) do not miss the foam party by the hotel's swimming pool on every Saturday's late afternoon!!

What ever you do DO NOT use your room phone we used ours to book our hotel in Bangkok which cost us dearly but after much debate over the charge we did receive a discount.
The hot water in the shower has a mind of its own so be very careful with children as they could get a nasty burn.
We used the hotel transport from Bangkok to Pattaya I must say that the gentleman who drove us is the best driver I have had in Asia who goes by the name of “Lucky.”
The hotel staff were lovely and very accommodating but don’t go for the water activity tours there is no personal touch what’s so ever we felt like cattle in a herd getting shipped of to the abattoir mass tourism at its worst.
The outdoor area looked great for kids but
just remember this is a gimmick hotel personally I think we could have got something better for the same price.
We had a lot of fun in Pattaya!

We stayed here for 4 nights for the beginning of a 3 week trip. 

When we arrived we  were taken straight to the 9th floor as we had booked an upgrade to Rock Royalty. Check-in was fast and we were shown to our room. 
Everything about the room was excellent, fresh and clean. Previous review mentioned the rooms being tired but I definitely did not find this. We paid a bit extra for a sea view room and so glad we did as waking up to that view every morning was well worth it.
Every night we got a turn down service with a little cakes and a newspaper deliver every morning which was a nice touch.
It was also my husbands birthday whilst we were there and they left a cake and a birthday card in our room which was lovely.
The pool was lovely serving excellent drinks (strawberry margaritas were amazing)and food.
We also had a full body message from the spa and it's possibly the best message we've ever had.

Our first night at the hotel we went out the front entrance (at the beach) and headed to  the left (heading to walking Street)... this was a big mistake as it gave us a really bad first impression of Pattaya (really quite sleazy, and couldn't find a bar to drink in) however after this we found some lovely places and once you figure the place out with the tuck tuck there are lots of nice places to eat and drink.

From the back (main) entrance, end of the street go left and about 10 minute walk up there's a McDonald's and jst past that is Tandoori House - jst a wee hut with a few plastic chairs outside really small menu but OMG... the tastiest indian food ever - with a garlic nan. Definitely worth a visilt!! 
One final thing whilst travelling Asia/Thailand you can see lots and lots of temples however Sanctuary of Truth is a must if you are in Pattaya.
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Friendly and helpful staff. Wonderful breakfast and if you have lounge access, delicious cocktails and light bites. The kids had fun with the pool and slides. Movies and Xbox in your room, it's a hop away from the Pattaya beach front and 10 minutes stroll away from the mall. What more can you ask for?

staff are all nice and good service...place is good and clean.  Hard rock cafe always a fun night to be...every time that coming to Hard Rock hotel always get a good hospitality form the staff.  new renovated poor also nice to be in...

We stayed four nights in hard rock pattaya hotel.  Very Friendly n helpful staff  and excellent guest services,  The moment we stepped into the property  from   Hotel concierge, security, reception, waitress bartender  housekeeping ,Music band  ... all give you a warm welcome and greetings
column8: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

column3: Although Hard Rock perhaps should concentrate on brightening up their rooms (too much black tile and dark colors) and not playing music in the corridors at night, I had a great and memorable stay. This is a fun and down-to earth hotel in an ideal location. Unforgettable.
